When we sat down, we asked our server what drinks were they serving for their happy hour special. She told us they've never had a happy hour special and asked me to show her what I found online. I showed her and she brought her manager over and he said those aren't official happy hours by their company, it's just posts by random people that think they have happy hour. I thanked him for clarifying that and a few minutes later he ended up coming back with two zombie shots for us and told us "here, we believe that every hour is happy hour" and offered us complimentary shots. That was unexpected and sweet of him to do! The zombie shot was delicious! It was super sweet but also strong enough to give you a little buzz.
I ordered the top many chiefs drink because it had strawberries in it and I was craving some strawberries haha. The drink was tasty. You would think that it's light but after finishing it in 20 mins, I felt tipsy. My husband had then cobra's fang. On the menu, it indicated that his drink was on the stronger side and it sure was! It takes a lot for my husband to get drunk and he felt a buzz after just one drink. Both of our drinks were well crafted, strong and delicious. Pricey to say the least but they are generous with the alcohol portion and know how to make one hell of a drink.
If you're like me and you love anything tropical themed, you should definitely check out this place.

I am not a fan of this place. I came here on a Tuesday around 10 pm and it wasn't crazy packed (that was a good thing). It can be a little tricky to find the place because there is not a big sign or anything. Decoration wise the place is very cute.

**First DRINK we had was the Zombie, it was extremely strong and all I tasted was rum, we couldn't drink it. If you want to get wasted and love the taste of cheap rum this is definitely the drink for you. My favorite drink was the Wiki Wiki, it was very refreshing. My boyfriend had the Strip and go naked (his favorite) and Serpiente.
**FOOD wise we had: coco's coconut shrimp (it was amazing we both loved it), hanau spring rolls, yuca frites, and the tuna poke (don't recommend the tuna because there was not much of a flavor).

PROS: the waitress we had was very nice and tried to make our experience better. Big thank you to the managers for understanding that we didn't like the Zombie and gave us the credit to get other drinks.
CONS: the menu was very limited, there was no variety.

Overall this was not the place for us. But if you like strong/not great rum and want to eat certain appetizers then you should try this place. I personally don't recommend it.

pics.caption: Strip and go naked (left) and Wiki Wiki (right)

review.des:
I love coming here. The service is always amazing. The drinks are some of the best cocktails in Chicagoland.
I want to highlight and give a shout out to the host who assisted me and my folks who were visiting from California for their first time in Chicago.

Sharu went above and beyond. I made reservations on open table several days before our visit and when we checked in with Sharu shortly after my name couldn't be found for our reservation. I was confused and searched my email to find my confirmation. When I finally found it and showed it to Sharu she immediately noticed that the date was for another day of the week. I was shocked and disappointed that I didn't notice the error. Without even asking right away if it were possible to get a table, Sharu had already been thinking ahead and searching for an open table. Sharu not only found a table within a few moments, Sharu also gave us enough time for my parents and I to enjoy several cocktails before we needed to release the table to the next party.

Thank you Sharu!! you didn't have to accommodate us for my mistake but you did it anyways. You gave my parents who were excited to experience three dots and a dash the opportunity to. Thank you for the great customer service and positive outlook in a situation that could have ruined the evening for us.
Cool speak easy, crazy drinks, good place to take a date or a group to see something new.

This was another great find in Chicago via Yelp. It's walking distance from the hotel I stayed at, Hotel Felix, about 5 blocks away. However, the actual entrance of this bar was not easy to find because it's in a dark alley. Luckily, I saw some velvet ropes in front of a closed black door so I assumed it was the entrance and I was right. I really could've just called my friend who was already waiting inside but what's the fun in that?

This hidden tiki bar / lounge is actually underground which is accessed via staircase surrounded by skulls. Downstairs, half is a bar / lounge and the other is a full service dining room and the entire place is dimly lit. Got here at 6:00pm on a Sunday and the place was packed, so if you are dining, reservations are a must but we came here just to have cocktails. And as my friend mentioned prior, the cocktails were indeed well presented and strong.

I tried the 151 Swizzle (151 Proof Demerara Rum, Lime, Cane Sugar, Bitters, Nutmeg, Absinthe) and the Jet Pilot (Aged Jamaican Rum, Overproof Rum, Cinnamon, Falernum, Grapfruit, Lime, Bitters, Absinthe). I was very impressed with both but the Jet Pilot was extra delicious and lethal...lol :)  My friend got the Pandan Pain Killer (Jamaican Pot Still Rum, Barbados Rum, Coconut Tangerine, Pineapple, Pandan). I had sip and it was dam good too.  FYI, they also offer shareable drinks for up to 8 people served in beautiful bowls or creative contraptions.

Three Dots and a Dash is definitely a must stop while visiting Chicago. It's probably the classiest Tiki bar I've ever been too so prices were a little steep. Single cocktails are $14-$18 and shareable drinks start at $28 and go up to $385 depending on your preferred poison of the night.

pics.caption: Left 151 Swizzle, right Pandan Pain Killer

review.des:
It's cool. Not too excited one way or the other.

Not really a rum drinker so I can go or not.  The food was just ok. Atmosphere just ok as well. I had fun with friends there but I don't have to go back. Very hot in the building last night. As we left the music got better. Service was good as well.

If you like rum and very big and obnoxious drinks this is the place for you!

True story: I went to Three Dots and a Dash with boo one night, and the next day I woke up so content that I was half-wondering whether our visit to tiki bar paradise was a dream.

In these days of minimalist designs, I appreciated the detailed information on the menu at Three Dots and a Dash, including sketches of the drinks so that you know what type of badass mug it comes in, a list of ingredients so you know what profile to expect, and even a skull symbol to warn you of which drinks are stronger.

I was enticed by the 151 Swizzel ($14) because it was the strongest drink on the menu, featuring 151 proof Demerara rum and absinthe. The rum was much more refined than what I remember for Bacardi 151 during my college days. It was well balanced with the incorporation of lime, cane sugar, bitters, and nutmeg in a complex composition that could take some thought to wrap your head around. Although it didn't taste too overwhelming, it was nice and strong.

The boo got the Basic Batida ($14). Yes, it's pumpkin flavored (with pumpkin Overproof rum), yes it comes in a pumpkin-shaped mug that looks basic, and yes I teased boo for being basic. While the drink was interesting, crafty, and strong, I found it too sweet with the Boston Buol Madeira, the dulce de leche, and the coffee armagnac.

The presentation is stellar, with aesthetic flairs like fresh orchids and whole cinnamon sticks. Equally memorable is the ambiance, which surpasses any of my tiki bar experiences in SF. The soothing green lighting, faux dried grass roofs, wooden totem poles, and centerpieces of sand and seashells seem excessive when you think about it, but they all add to the magic of this tropical oasis.

Fun facts:
- (Important conversation-starter fact): The name is the morse code for V, symbolizing victory. Their namesake drink was created by a WWII veteran, and their vision is to create a space to celebrate life's victories.
- The menu includes bowl drinks for larger groups and a selection of southeast Asian-inspired bar bites like coconut shrimp.
- For the drunchies, Firecakes around the corner has amazing donuts and is open until midnight Thursdays through Saturday.
- If you are a true fan, you can purchase the cup to bring home. A little pricey at ~$30-40 (drink included), but a great souvenir.

If you don't want to wait forever or be in a crowded bar I recommend coming earlier in the day when they first open. The drinks are delicious and very strong (you might not need more than 2 depending on your tolerance). It does get really crowded at night and I think it is more enjoyable during the afternoon. Great Chicago staple.

Located in an alley. Look for some torches and tiki posts and some fire. Once you go inside, you head downstairs. It feels like I'm about to go on the Indiana Jones ride at Disneyland!

Wait time - 5-10 minutes on a Wednesday night 10PM.

Zombie (Aged Jamaican rum, lime, grapefruit, cinnamon, pomegranate, bitters) - Stronger, a little more bitter.

Never Say Die (Aged Jamaican rum, Panamarrian Rum, lime, tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, honey, bitters) - Sweeter drink in a fun, creepy looking cup.

Service - Great. Had no issues.

Hard to find location... would have been nice to have more signage for us out of towners to find it but shout out to the hostess at Bub City for giving us directions.
(Walk around the corner, left at the alley then look for the blue lights and tiki torches)

Drinks were strong and yummy; we had the Aloha Felicia #3 and the Painkiller. Both were really good but at $14 a piece, we stopped at 1.

We decided on the Pu Pu platter and all of it was good with the exception of the yuca frites; they were nothing special. Coconut shrimp and King crab Rangoon were standouts.

Novelty wore off after about an hour.

All I have to say is wow!!! I love this place. Hands down incredible drinks and presentation. I love the ambiance. Service was great. We had Mary as our server. Only down fall was the fact that drinks were pretty over priced in my opinion but they were like nothing I have ever seen before.

FIRST, you MUST(no exceptions) have reservations to sit at a table or you can try and find open seating at the bar(which my girlfriend and I were lucky enough to find). Walked inn on a Wednesday night at 6:30. At about 7/7:15 it was pretty packed.

Secondly, the entrance is in the alley behind firecakes(follow the tiki torches).

Now to talk about the amazing drinks! My girlfriend had the bourbon special which she loved and she is not a bourbon drinker. I had the three dots and a dash, which I loved. The drinks were tasty and well dressed to impress. We sat at the bar admiring all the other cocktails come out in all types of different glasses.  They also have group drinks you can order which look great with added fire, smoke and lights.  The service was great the lady at the bar was energetic and friendly and knew when to check up on us.   We tried the crab Rangoon which was AMAZING! Probably the best I've had so far.   We definitely will be returning with reservations to try the entrees.

pics.caption: Cobras fang. One of their strongest drinks.

review.des:
I can't believe I hadn't reviewed this place!
Hands down amongst the top bars in the US! Be sure to make reservations if going later at night because the place gets extremely busy and you won't like waiting outside in an alley in the Chicago winter.
The place is literally underground in an alley, just follow the tiki torches!
Inside you encounter a long stairway down and a blue wall of sculls, then you hear reggae playing. As you follow steps down you feel like you're in one of the Caribbean islands during a nice summer night enjoying the perfect party.
The drink menu is perfect. Has enough of everything and with pictures! They have the best cups for drinks. All are Instagram worthy and you can actually purchase most of them.
Drinks for two to share or even 10! They have it all. If you're in Chicago... THIS PLACE IS A MUST
One of the coolest bars Chicago has to offer! Love the speakeasy essence to it and mystery of walking down to this hidden Tiki bar. The drinks are good and strong. Pain killer has to be my favorite!

Tiki Bars are always a lot of fun.

Three Dots and Dash (not to be confused with Colon Two Dots and a Colon) is conveniently located in the heart of Chicago and hidden in a secret spot you would never find without Google Maps, in the back of a fat building.

Once you spot the velvet ropes, just head down to the dungeon where you can hear whips and chains clanging against the wall.
Don't worry, the sound effects won't bite!
Get ready to meet plenty of Ghouls & Guys down there sippin' away those delicious island cocktails.

My favorite drink here is undoubtedly the 'Dead Reckoning'
mmmmm.................It's like Butterscotch yo!
Definitely one of a kind experience. Great drinks and atmosphere. Nothing like it. A little pricey but worth it for the experience. A little hard to find but you'll get there!

I found this place online, looked very interesting so decided to check it out. It was hard to find, the entrance is in an alley way, I had to call them for directions but it was well worth it. The place is in the basement, felt very secretive. The decorations are very Hawaiian luau, but not in a cheap way. Everything looked very classy. The drinks are so beautiful, very single drink is picture worthy. They don't have a big food menu, but what the have is pretty good. We got the platter, it was a good snack. This is a good place to go before or after dinner for drinks, not ideal for a dinner date.

So I love the ambiance of this place but everything is just so dang expensive.  The decorations really go along with the tiki bar atmosphere, the drinks, and the cups that go along with the drinks are great.

If you're willing to spend some money and be in a crowd of people, then you have come to the right spot.  If you're not but still want to experience what Three Dots and a Dash has to offer, then bring a few friends and share one of those giant mugs of smoking, colorful and alcoholic drinks for about $85.  

Make sure you come earlier vs later as the wait here sometimes takes forever.  And once you get in, its really crowded and you're  lucky if you get a seat.  Luckily for us, we were here with a large group of people and had reservations at 11pm.  We had the large section to the right once you come down the stairs.  Pretty purple foliage canopy on the ceiling and vibrant pink lights.

The appetizers are really good.  We got the Pupu Platter which consisted of eggrolls, crab rangoon, chicken tenders, and coconut shrimp.  Love that they served food here as I was starving.  

I dont remember the music though.  Not sure if that was because the place where they sat us was not really "inside" the bar itself and it had no music or it was really soft and i couldnt hear it?  Idk but whatever they had playing, it wasnt memorable.  

Anywho, like I said, I love all the decor and the hawaiian themed drinks, but its so expensive that I would only come here like once or twice a year for a special occasion.  There are other tiki bars around the city that I still need to try and compare.

Aesthetic and $$$. This place was a bit difficult to find (down the alleyway next to Firecakes, there will be a row of tiki sticks and a bouncer outside). Once we entered, it led us down a set of stairs to the entrance. We were lucky enough to get a table, since there was a no-show reservation (that being said, it's nearly impossible to get a table without a reservation, so I'd suggest reserving).

The cocktails were $14/15 each, but honestly aesthetic af. I got the Never Say Die; you could somewhat taste the rum. My friend got the Too Many Chiefs; which had a low ABV, so it tasted like a normal fruity drink. I would definitely go here again. The vibe of the place was super chill and the drinks were nicely made, the only downside being the price and not getting a table if you don't reserve ahead of time.

With dim lighting, palm trees, and a hint of pirate, Three dots and a Dash is the perfect bar to go to enjoy fun drinks with friends and coworkers alike.

I had a party of 15 and we were all able to be seated on nice big sectional sofas that was located in a dark room with jungle decor. Lit up skulls and palm leaves decorated the room and we had a blast. I ordered the skull and porch light drinks which were a bit expensive but you pay for the ambiance. They were both had a good amount of liquor in them which made them pretty tasty.

I am definitely a late bloomer when it comes to this place, but I rarely check out hyped up bars or clubs. When I had a visitor, however, and we had just come off a cruise ship, I was really craving a pina colada and thought, hey, I know about this one tiki bar, let's go there. Finding it is an adventure in itself and an opportunist of a homeless man told us where to look and then asked for a dollar. He earned his dollar and I readily gave him one as we apprehensively walked down a dark alley. The tiki torch lighting led the way and we found ourselves walking down a dark hallway and came upon a wall of skulls. I was loving this.

It is a small place and we did not have reservations, so the seating was first come first serve and it was crowded with no seating available. There are plenty of little ledges to rest your drink on, however, so we were fine standing. The drinks are large and come in amazing cups for plenty of fun selfie material. Sweet and tropical is usually not my thing, but the cruise ship memories came rushing back as I drank my fancier-than-a-pina-colada. The drinks are large, and sweet, and expensive, however, so while this was great as an appetizer beverage, I am not sure I would spend an entire evening here. Otherwise it would be a helluva hangover on your body and your wallet.

The best bars are hard to find...literally...turn left, go down the alley and knock just right and you'll find a faint electric blue light, bouncer, and velvet ropes in an alley, which tips you off that you're in the right place. Perhaps the name, Three Dots and a Dash is a morse code reference, a nod to being "top secret" in location. When you enter, you descend down a dark stair case with a wall adorned completely in skulls. The bar is dim lit with big round booths and the decor is very much tiki/beach themed with tiki lights, bamboo, tropical plants, palm grass, nautical rope, and ukuleles and tiki masks on the wall. The servers are all dressed in floral print dresses and Hawaiian shirts. The atmosphere is super fun/cool, fun theme, dark lit, moody and upscale vibe. Fun place for a birthday or group outing. The music started off very much Beach Blanket Bingo (60s beach movie), and then was music from Tarantino's Pulp Fiction (still kinda beachy, think Big Kahuna) but then veered away from beachy to Outkast's Miss Jackson, and Chance the Rapper. Still fun, but the dj couldn't make up his mind what genre he was in.

We made a reservation on Open Table for two and we arrived a little bit early but the hostess was able to seat us immediately. We mentioned that two other friends also might join and she said, no problem, that our table accommodated four. We were seated at a high top table. Glad we made a reservation, as it got very busy, especially at the bar area. Even if you're only planning on ordering drinks, and no food, I'd highly suggest making a reservation. Later on when our friends showed up, one was standing for a second before he sat down, and a server rushed over to ask if we had a reservation, and that she would have to ask her manager, even though we had a reservation and we'd been sitting there for over an hour, enjoying drinks. So that was sort of strange/off-putting. Despite this, the drinks were very tasty and have fun/festive presentation. They offer several fun themed tiki drinks, about $14-$16. The potency of alcohol level is marked by skulls. No skulls probably isn't too boozy, while one skull is moderately boozy, and two skulls would be denoted as deadly. All of the drinks have fun names like Aloha Felecia and My Anaconda Don't Want None served in coconuts and Tiki God mugs. They also offer group drinks that serve four to five that cost $65. One group drink on the menu, Rock Out with your Conch Out was $125 so it can get pricey. The group drinks are extremely festive and have awesome presentation though, so you get some bang for your buck. The table next to us ordered the Bali Bali, a passionfruit, pineapple, orange rum drink served in a large goblet where octopus tentacles reach up from a glowing pond of bubbling smoke.  
We ordered individual drinks. I had the Strip and Go Naked, which the server had recommended and said was fruitier and had flavors of passionfruit, tangerine, and gin. It was served in a large tiki god mug with a tropical flower, and seahorse pick souvenir that has the bar's name on it. It was pretty tasty. My friend ordered the mai tai, which was very good and was probably the best tasting cocktail of the ones I tried, although a little less festive presentation. I also had the Jet Pilot, which had rum, lime, grapefruit, cinnamon, and absinthe and it was also very good. Another friend ordered the Anaconda Don't Want None and it was also good and had nice presentation. All of the cocktails on the menu have a picture next to them so you can see what kind of mug that they are served in. They also had a page on their menu of classic cocktails such as caipirinha and Cuba libre, which were a little bit less expensive. They also serve food like pu pu platters and burgers and shrimp. Service was a bit slow but it was busy. Overall, Three Dots and a Dash has a really festive atmosphere, fun tasty tiki drinks albeit a little pricey, but this is a definite must-stop-in location when you visit Chicago. Definitely a lot of fun, great atmosphere and drinks and I would return.

When we walked up to Three Dots and a Dash, I had no idea what to expect. Without any signage, any advertising, or really any indication that there was anything there at all, we walked through a door, down some dark steps (the skull wall was a nice touch) into the basement and were really impressed with what we saw down there. The decor all fit the theme perfectly, and the bartender serving us that afternoon was friendly and knowledgeable, while being just the right amount of chatty.

Pros: This place was cool. Like you walk in and forget you're in Chicago. They do a great job of making you feel like you're in some sort of cave in on a tropical island. The drinks are tasty, and the staff are great.

Cons: The cocktails can be a little pricey. My specialty old-fashioned ran $18, which is basically the cost of a higher-end burger and fries, even in Chicago.

I will say this though. Even though it's a bit pricier, you do get what you pay for. They don't skimp on the alcohol, and my drink was incredibly smooth.

Verdict? I would definitely come back again if I lived in the city, because the drinks are good and the ambiance is so dang cool. But I probably couldn't come back regularly if I wanted to be responsible with my $$.

This is a cute and fun place to get drinks in Chicago! My high school girlfriends and I came here on our first night in Chicago after we hit up Portrillo's for some food, and ordered drinks here to catch up! It's a little hard to find b/c their entrance is in an alleyway with a pretty indiscrete door sign. The only way I knew that we were at the bar was because of the bouncers that were standing outside.

Once you're inside, you immediately get the Tiki bar vibe - the flowers, skulls, blue lights, etc. Their drinks are pricey...as most cocktail drinks are, so don't be surprised. But they have some creative drinks on their menu that are a lot of fun!

I ordered their three dots and a dash drink; beware, it is STRONGGGG. like all the rum they put in it definitely is prominent. I think I got through 75% of my drink. (Thankfully, I had food just before, so I didn't really feel too much of the alcohol, but don't take this drink lightly!)
One of my friends ordered their Pandan pain killer, which was nice and sweet.

They also have options to get group drinks where they come in huge creative containers (like skulls or fish bowls, etc.)

We were able to thankfully get a table for 4 girls, despite not having a reservation. Considering how busy this place gets though, I don't think it would hurt to have one on hand. Overall, I think it's a great place for a stop on a bar crawl or a girl's night out. It's not a very casual bar, so I would come dressed up a little bit. It definitely errs on the side of trendy and fun.

pics.caption: Three dots and a dash drink

review.des:
Came to Three Dots and a Dash on Christmas eve. This place to say the very least is interesting. if you are looking to do something different, and literally off the beaten path (the place is in a back ally), then this is the place for you.

Once you find the place, it is actually really cool. You walk downstairs and it is a tropical Hawaiian themed lounge for drinks that are all more interesting and cool than the last.

There are individual drinks, and drinks that can be shared between a group. Kind of like fish bowls. It is hard to recommend any one drink, as my girl friend and I tried a few, so i would come here with an open mind and just try whatever you feel like you are in the mood for, and defiantly get at least one drink that can be shared.

I will say that at a place like this, it is easy for the place to skimp on booz, and this place definitely did not do that. the drinks are extremely strong so be warned.

I wouldn't order the food honestly, I would come here just for drinks and find another spot for food in the area. the menu for food is small, and i saw people order a few things and nothing looked amazing or at least worth it.

Not a tiki bar. They don't care if you're actaually interested in tiki culture and an authentic tiki experience. Now a a douchebag bar for douchebags that want to listen to Rhianna and Justin Beiber and nothing else extraordinary - they pretend to be busy and form to make you think people actually want in, when in fact it's empty. Not real tiki drinks and the bartender's don't know and don't care. Don't waste your time!

This is a Chicago staple for a night out. There are always delicious strong drinks with a wide variety of patrons. I really enjoyed the Painkiller if you're looking for rum, or the cask old fashioned if you're more of a bourbon fan. Prices are higher than most cocktails, but they're strong, so it evens out. Service is usually a little slow because the cocktails take time, but the staff works pretty hard.

Definitely check it out if you've never been.

Nice interesting place. Worth checking out.
Didn't like the fact that we lined up for so long only to get in and find the place mostly empty. Drinks were okay, nothing special. It was nice but wouldn't que up again for it.

Basically: expensive, but worth a visit. For me personally I come here only for special occasions or when a visitor from out of town comes. The entrance is a little tricky to find since its hidden in the alley way behind Bub city. The bar itself is decorated tiki style with the fake tiki hut around the bar. The tables are all reserved so the only sitting room is at the bar. The drinks may be a little bit pricy, but for me I only need one. They're strong and delicious! They clearly put a lot of thought and love into the drinks. I had the bourbon special and it was delicious not too sweet. The drinks I also tried from the others in my party was the Mai Tai, Never Say Die, and Intro into Agricole. They vary with sweetness so if you're not into sweet fruity cocktails make sure you read the description. Definitely a fan!

Absolutely LOVED this place!! The decor and atmosphere is excellent!! The drinks are very fresh, good and strong plus the cups they come in are amazing. The service was excellent even when they got busy and the music was good without being too loud. We loved it so much we came back a second time on our 4 day trip. Make reservations ahead of time because they do get busy!! It's located in an alleyway that the drivers had trouble locating but its closest to Firecakes. The crab rangoons were the only thing we weren't overly impressed with (small portion for the price) but we loved the different sauces that it came with. *the drinks with skulls next to them indicate strong drinks**

Here's a thought: if the place is so crowded that there is literally nowhere to stand, don't let customers in.

Maybe the drinks here are great, but after waiting in line on a Saturday night to get in, only to be told it's standing room only at the bar (but of course there isn't any standing room because it's a solid, impassable throng, six-deep), and then being told by another employee that anywhere we tried standing needed to be kept clear...meh, no thanks.

This place is more hot spot, 20-somethings club than cocktail bar.

From the minute you walk in and see the glowing wall of skulls and tropical music playing, you quickly realize this place is going to be awesome! Drinks have a wonderful presentation (lit on fire, smoke etc.) and taste great! Make a reservation.

Wasn't expecting much, but this ended up being one of my favorite bars during my visit to Chicago! The whole experience was so cool. The entrance was in an alley, and once you enter you get speakeasy/lounge vibes. I was definitely "wow'd" while walking in. Once you get to the bar area downstairs, it feels like you've traveled to Hawaii to a cute tiki bar.

Our server was nice and recommended her favorite drinks. Definitely gram worthy. I knocked off a star because my drink was pretty weak for being $15. Expensive, but worth the visit. If I lived here, this would be a one time visit or somewhere I would go to bring out of town friends.

This place is always busy! I recommend making a reservation because it's a very small space here.

I love going out for tiki drinks because they look pretty and are also always good in my opinion. Fun spot to go when visiting Chicago or for a special occasion!

This place is one of the hidden a gem in Chicago, it's located in a alley but don't let that scare you lol. We have been here a few times and each time have had a blast.

The drinks are very strong and tasty. They are a little pricy, usually about $15-18 for each drink. They also have group drinks which start around $35 to $80 and serve around 3-5 people. If you wanna ball on budget order a group drink and you will have a great time.

The place itself is decorated very tropical and the staff are quick to bring the drinks. This place is similar to lost lake in Chicago.

pics.caption: Come check it for yourself, you won't be disappointed!!!

review.des:
Three Dots and a Dash is probably the least secret of Chicago's "secret bars," but it's well-known for a reason. Located in the back alley of Firecakes in River North, Three Dots is a Polynesian speakeasy that is always popping, especially in the summertime when all you want is a little tiki something. I can't even count the number of times I've been here - the menu is expansive, and changes enough times that you're never bored with what you choose to get.

The last time I came here, I brought two girlfriends and we got individual drinks: the Saturn + Negroni ($15), Cobra's Fang ($15) and Vicious Virgin ($14). The single serve cocktails are really generous portions and range from $14-$15, and honestly, given the size of the drink and the very instagram-friendly presentation, the pricing is a steal. The pricing is in line with smaller, more boring wells drinks in River North.

Notwithstanding the highly appealing economy of the single serve,  the shareable drinks are more fun and truly where Three Dots shines - the presentation only gets more complex, invoking light elements, flora, and smoking dry ice, the larger the shareable. Bring a friend - hell, bring six friends - and go wild.

Oh - and make a reservation in advance if you want a table. More often than not, I've come to Three Dots and stood at the bar, along with the other unfortunate souls who, for the umpteenth time, thought they could just walk in and get a seat at Chicago's worst-kept secret. So reserve -- and enjoy!

pics.caption: From L to R: the Saturn + Negroni ($15), Cobra's Fang ($15) and Vicious Virgin ($14).

review.des:
This place gets crowded and I can understand why --- they make exceptional drinks that are both delicious and aesthetically appealing. However, it is kind of difficult to find: you have to walk down the alleyway and two tiki posts will signal where the entrance is. Once you get in, you'll see loads of people sipping on tiki skulls and exotic drinks.

It was so difficult to choose which drink to try. It all looked so beautiful. They have a ton of fruity options, which is perfect if you're a fruity cocktail lover like me. I ordered the Wiki Wiki, which had bits of kiwi in it. My boyfriend ordered the Chief Lapu Lapu. That drink came with this foam (to mimic a way), which was surprisingly were sweet and delicious. Everything comes in a cool jar or cup and topped with decor. The party next to us ordered the Bali Bali and it was huge. They add dry ice to it to create a smokey effect. They offered us a sip on these ridiculously long straws. The drink is strong but oh so delicious. The next time I'm in Chicago, I am definitely coming back here.

Updating review again. I reached out to Lettuce Entertain you regarding this place and our experience. I was contacted by Josh and spoke with him about what happened to our party. He was sympathetic and understanding that the drama we encountered ruined our experience. Josh asked if he could contact me today after speaking with the manager on duty and the security guards about the events that transpired. This was obviously no problem for me as I was glad it was going to be addressed with those who were on duty this past Saturday. After speaking with Josh again today he apologized for our experience and offered a partial refund which was much appreciated. He also offered the opportunity for us to go back to Three Dots to have a better experience. I thanked him for the offer but said no thank you. I know those in my party don't really have a desire to give this place a second chance.

The 2 stars strictly pertains to Three Dots and not to Josh or Lettuce Entertain You. I hope in the future Three Dots security and managers treat customers more like their at a Tiki Bar instead of Roadhouse.

I'm really excited about the whole resurgence of 'Tiki culture' coming back and Tiki bars are always a must-see for me to check out in other cities when I travel so thought I'd check out Three Dots and a Dash while in Chicago.

OK. First thing's first is the bar is in an alley so don't be fooled by the street address (it will lead you to a "roadhouse blues-style" BBQ place called Bub City). That was the first indicator that I was going to be-ultra confused about this place. Next I turned into the alleyway and there was a doorman and line-up of 15 people waiting to go in (this was only 10pm on a Thursday night). My immediate reaction was WTF?!  The line reminded me of a nightclub which is very foreign to me (I'm in my mid-30s) so seeing this was confusing and strange.

Going in my first impressions were the lighting and decor was amazing (your general fare of bamboo-esque accoutrements and velvet paintings). However, this was all forgotten due to the shitty, loud, and obnoxious music they were playing... it's a Tiki bar yet they decided to play awful dance/club music. I was not here for a 'Vegas' club experience so I was immediately turned off.

I'm from Vancouver, BC and we have an amazing Tiki bar back home so we're a little spoiled and inadvertently have high-standards when it comes to Tiki cocktails. I ordered the Royal Hawaiian cocktail and my husband ordered the Painkiller - both were just OK and somewhat forgettable...and regrettable considering drink were $15 USD each and add the hurtin' Canadian exchange (.77 CAD to 1 USD).

All in all, this place had so much potential but it's not for folks like me. I did see a group of other parties sharing one of the group drinks with all the dry ice and flair you can expect so I do see it's a good place for groups and a date night if : a) you've never been to a Tiki bar before and b) you like loud/generic music blasting in your ears.
Also, don't forget to make reservations or you'll be waiting around in a dark, cold, alley for a while.

Ambiance: 2/5 - Music brought this way down
Drinks: 2/5 - Nice try
Overall: 2/5

Really cool place. Very fun chill place to have drinks with friends or co-workers. Drinks are pricy but well worth it. Drinks on the menu are very creative, strong, fun to look at, and strong
The staff is good with very knowledgeable and friendly bartenders.
Great place to bring friends from out of town.

Bottom Line: this is a great place for tourists. I also wouldn't fault you for wanting to go once with friends to just see what this place is like. Otherwise, I say save your money and go someplace else.

I can only comment about the drinks because my husband and I didn't get food. We had a reservation at Sunda that we certainly couldn't miss! The drinks were tasty, but WAYYY overpriced! We paid $14 for each drink and it was most definitely not worth it. My husband's drink was really small - even for normal standards. I was super bummed that they didn't serve frozen pina coladas - this is a tiki bar for goodness sake! I got the only frozen drink they offered and it was tasty and pretty, but no way was it $14 tasty!

The place has a neat ambience and you definitely don't feel like you are in Chicago. As I said, it would be a great place to go once and check it out or a place for tourists.

The table next to us got some kind of appetizer sampler that looked delicious. I was definitely a little jealous of them! So I suggest you try that if you plan on coming here.

Cocktails: 5/5 Ambience: 5/5 Service: 5/5

What a cool concept. You basically walk down into a tropical paradise! It was super packed on a Friday night around 8:30pm. So go early/at an off hour or make a food reservation if you want a table!

I was expecting the drinks to be cheap slushies. However, all the cocktails seemed expertly crafted and more of the sophisticated side!

The place was super packed and we didn't find a seat at the bar but we were fine standing around and the bartenders did a great job of making sure everyone got their drinks!

Overall a super fun unique bar with high quality cocktails. A great place for a fun date or to go with friends.

Tip: it's definitely a dark dimly lit bar!

This ain't your parents tiki bar - and, like your old man on an out-of-town business trip, you'll be reaching for your empty wallet in the morning as you massage your throbbing noggin'.

Amazingly strong (and expensive) exotic cocktails served by some of the most knowledgable booze slingers in the city, all in a kitschy bar located "'round back, just past the Dumpsters...".

Order up your drinks and a couple of apps to counteract those hootch-filled drinks - the Coco's Coconut Shrimp (ridiculously overpriced at $14) and the Fried Yucca Frittes ($9) are both good starting points. But if you're getting liquored up and lacquered down with a group of friends, try Captain Dino's Pu Pu Platter for $38!

Arrive early, because this place gets packed, even on a school night. Just remember to save me a seat at the bar and do NOT forget to try the "Tropical Itch" - the best $16 bourbon and rum drink you'll never remember!

pics.caption: The Coco's Coconut Shrimp (ridiculously overpriced at $14) and the Fried Yucca Frittes ($9) - perfect for soaking up the booze!
The "Tropical Itch" - the best $16 bourbon and rum drink you'll never remember!

review.des: Went with 3 friends for drinks. It is a Tiki bar and very themey. Had the Bali Bali drink $85. The description said serves 4-5 people. More like 2-3 people. It came with lights and dry ice smoke! It was a punch like drink and very good. It was very pretty and festive. We did feel there was a lot of ice which lessened the amount of drink. They also had a big drink served in a Treasure Chest with dry ice, lights and fire $385. The drinks can be strong and are pricey, but totally fun. Would be back.

Huge FAN. I wish they had their mugs for sale, all they had were lame man tai tumblers, which were in abundance because they were lame so obviously they have enough stock to sell. I know I sound salty, but I really am. The bartender was a bit rude about it too.

It's a more upscale tiki bar. They have food as well. Probably should make a reservation, again, lucked out and got bar seats. Love their drinks and their take on good ol' tiki classics. Hands down my favorite is their Pandan Painkiller, currently having dreams about it.

The bartender that night said his favorite drink to make is the Missionary's Downfall, which has smoke d/t the dry ice used to ice the glass, and the presentation is nice, but it was just "meh" for me. Definitely a great tiki bar and must try if you like tiki and tiki cocktails.

Great experience overall and definitely coming back. The bartender was great and answer all of our questions about the drink menu. Love the environment it gets very busy after 9 but overall very chill place with great music taste.

Love this place. Always a fun place to be at! Reservations reservations reservations! A must!

I know they have the "Walk-ins are welcome" sign and that's a true statement but be prepared to wait for a bit. Works best if you reserve in advance n get to your table right away.

It's a speakeasy styled restaurant which I first visited last year with my girl pals. They are located in an alley so look out for that, but they have someone checking your ID at the entrance so spotting that guy is the trick. The actual restaurant is underground so after you enter you go through a small set of darkly lit stairs and passage (decorated with skulls). Although we didn't know we had to do a reservation and did a walk in, we were lucky enough to get a table because one of the reserved table parties were coming in late. The second time around I had a reservation and there was no wait time.

Me and my friends had a great time enjoying the cocktails. Since they are a tikibar-pirate-rum based lounge, most of their drinks specialize in Rum but you will also find a few tequila, mezcal, whiskey drinks as well. Their serving glasses are gorgeous and one of the best parts of the experience.

They have a decent selection for food; finger foods mostly. So don't expect a huge dinner menu but otherwise food eats. A few years ago they had a shrimp entree which they would light on fire before serving you which was part of the show but this time I learnt that discontinued it! The new menu is quite delicious as well.

It's a great place to be and is always full, so make sure you plan this visit!

Loved the atmosphere - enjoyed the darker lighting, decorations, and layout.

Drink menu was awesome, but definitely for people who are willing to try new flavors. Everyone in our group enjoyed but all are fairly adventurous!

Would recommend planning ahead and getting a reservation.

This spot normally has reservations so if you are eager to go, you might want to start looking at times asap. I went to the bar with my girlfriend and the atmosphere is really nice with the Tiki bar theme. We decided to get the Head Hunter which was very good drink with the tropical fruit flavors and the carribean rum. Definitely would suggest it if you go. We had the pu pu platter but dont let the name deter you. It was decent for the time but normally this place is really known for its drinks. I will definitely be back to try out the other drinks.

Gah this place. We waited until we were 3-4 weeks away from moving the area to come to this place. We went on a Monday evening with a reservation because I'm not all about that waiting in line life. We were seated immediately and our waitress was very friendly. She approached the drinks and food as you would expect for a fancy restaurant. For a bar, we have had places that just throw a menu down and never return but this is way on the other side of the spectrum. She was super friendly and very informative.

The ambiance is amazing, defini9tely a very cool vibe. I would like to hang out here every weekend. Maybe that would get excessive but I would still like it. I ordered the "tropical itch" which very much lives up to it's "double skull" rating. Very strong, but still pretty tasty. It came with a back scratcher which was quite amusing. My husband got the Jet Pilot and honestly I did not enjoy it at all, nor did he. Not sweet, mostly just tastes like pure alcohol. Still, came in a cute glass with beautiful decorations. My friend got the pain killer and that was so delicious! I could drink those all night! But, alas. We have a budget. We also got the platter and every bit of it was tasty. A bit steep at $38 for a platter, but when in Rome..

Anyway, definitely come on a Monday with a reservation (ours was made a week in advance) if the crowds aren't for you. If time allowed, we would definitely return!

pics.caption: My drink came with a back scratcher!

review.des:
I love everything about this tiki bar. The theme is on point. Even though we visited this bar during the last snow storm, the aesthetic was definitely worth it.

My friends and I shared two group drinks. The first one we started off with was the Chief Lapu Lapu. It was beautiful, but not the best. The drink wasn't strong, but it was sweet and refreshing.

The second drink we got was the Zombie. It came out in bright red in a skull bowl with smoke everywhere. The drink was cinnamon-y, but super strong. Definitely my favorite.

We also got a few painkillers which were definitely strong and delicious.

Overall, this place is great. There were many drink options, the people were nice, and the bar was super cute. I'd definitely come back again when I am in town!

This place is pretty fun! Always a great spot to take out of town guests too because it's a little piece of paradise inside downtown Chicago. The snacks are good too but definitely a drinks place not a dinner spot. They have fun with what they're doing -go check it out!
This place really crushes the tiki bar vibe. The drinks are strong and delicious. Hidden gem tucked away in an alley and worth the visit.

Came here on a Friday night at 1030 and there was a long line outside to get in. Waited about 20-25 minutes and when we got in, it was super packed at the bar with all the tables booked. The drinks here are very strong so be well aware of that when ordering. The theme of the bar is absolutely A1 fitting the "tiki" theme. Definitely would recommend coming here a bit earlier if you want to avoid waiting in line

My small town mind had a hard time finding Three Dots and a Dash but I was glad when I did. The entrance is in the alley behind Bub City.

The vibe of a Tiki Bar is self explainable. The staff was nice but the place was crowded and loud. The drinks are sugar bombs for a guy like me who usually drinks straight whiskey or a beer.

Overall I would come back here only if I wanted to party with some cool drinks and a wild vibe. Otherwise I would be more likely to hit up a chill bar without a single "woo" girl.

This was my second time at Three Dots and I'll just keeping coming back. Definitely make sure that you have a reservation beforehand if you want a comfy spot---especially with parties over 2 people. The staff is so nice, extremely helpful when needing help with choosing a cocktail. The drinks are always delicious, and gorgeous, atmosphere is unlike any other bar I've been to and it's definitely worth a trip when you find yourself in Chicago!

pics.caption: Zombie. One of my favorite drinks ever!! Two of these and you're good to go for the night!

review.des: Good spot, pretty busy on Saturday night but it was worth it to fall in line make sure to get the Bali Bali. A little bit pricey but for tiki bar it's really good

Very strong drinks!! Came here for the mixed tiki style drinks and was not disappointed. Had two back to back and the rest of the night was a disaster. I don't remember which one it was obviously. The drinks are strong. You have been warned. While it was still early on my first drink, I saw two people walk in and get rum and cokes (or some other generic drink): don't be that person. Get their special mixed drinks or just go somewhere else.
Fun atmosphere and delicious drinks. Pricey but worth it! Would recommend and would come back!

Really disappointed with this place! Ordered the lupa lupa and topical itch. The lupa lupa is not worth it at all. For $28 you would think there will be a lot of alc in there but it was juice really. They make the lupa lupa in the back as well so you can't see the alc being poured in. I recommend the topical itch, for that price and the amount of alc, it was so worth it. The vibe itself is really nice too! Overall, I'm really disappointed with the lupa lupa, even though it looked cool, was a major disappointment. Side note, the drinks looked cool and the service is amazing!

pics.caption: Lupa lupa (I was really disappointed with the amount of alcohol in this drink, basically there wasn't any alcohol)

review.des: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! Strong strong drinks, as in don't go to work the next day. Delicious drinks. Amazing staff- hilarious polite and great service. Did I mention amazing drinks? Such a fun atmosphere and on weeknights it's not too crowded so it's great to kick back with buddies. Weekends it's busy but what isn't in the loop? I love this place. Also - decor is so fun.

We had a really wonderful experience here! We went at about 4:30 pm on a Saturday and all the tables were full already. However I went up to the hostesses stand and they said that didn't have a reservation coming in until 5:30 for one the clean tables and they would let us sit there and have drinks for an hour until the reservation arrived.  

I was so happy about this and it allowed us to sit down and enjoy our drinks. We later had to leave the table, but we just stood by the bar and all was well! The drinks are amazing and they are truly over the top and fun to see when the arrive to your table.

I really appreciate the staff here and the entire location is awesome. Don't miss this place when you're in Chicago and be sure to make an early reservation if you want a table!

last stop on my visit in Chicago!
What a cool little place!
secret entrance in a dark alley which not gonna lie threw me off hard lol
but ounce inside your are guided to a cool little restaurant/bar basement area which is so neatly decorated.
Me and my friend shared a pirate ship drink which mind you was VERY STRONG! lol he couldn't handle it as I had to finish it myself.
Overall cool place just wish they tables weren't so cramped together

The decor and attention to detail at Three Dots is amazing. All of the drinks I had were quality and were served in cool tiki mugs (which many places no longer do).

My only suggestion would be to avoid going on Friday or Saturday nights (or at least go before 7pm) if you are looking for a traditional tiki bar atmosphere. The River North bachelorette parties and frat boys show up around 9pm and the place feels more like a night club. The second time I went was on a Tuesday night and the atmosphere was much better.

SUPER FUN NIGHT! Great place to hang out with a group of friends. They specialize in their cocktails, but also have beer options. Great atmosphere, and highly recommend for all visitors!

It's located in the alley, so it can be tricky to find, just look for the tikki torches!

Thanks to Yelp, I found this unique place. We followed the directions down the alley and were loving the tikis torch entry, wall o'skulls and Polynesian motif.  We went on a Thursday evening after some deep dish pizza (hmm, daring, yes) and ordered potent, highly decorated and very worth the price drinks! It seemed like a fun place to see and be seen. Don't miss the art work either

pics.caption: The drink on the right has absinthe in it, beware!

review.des:
My partner and I were debating going to the Signature Room for drinks when she discovered this place online on a list of the "50 best bars" or something like that. However, aside from my beloved Beer Trappe in Kentucky, this is near #1.

I'm not one of those yuppie types who gets all excited about "mixology" and "craft sliced bread" and all of that but I'll be damned if this place didn't get me going a step in that direction.

"Tiki drinks? Sounds wimpy." Wrong. This place will knock you on your rear with dark, cool ambiance, a respectful and diverse crowd, and strong, strong, STRONG drinks. Not just strong, but drinks that are made with love beyond anything I've ever seen. You can ask "what's this think on the stick?" in your Jet Pilot and they'll not only tell you how they made it (as many ingredients are in house), they may pour you a small tasting of that particular house-made falernum. They'll talk to you about their process, their style, and share their thoughts on the different notes of the drinks in a manner that is unpretentious and welcoming to even the most boring "uh-I'll-have-a-rum-and-coke" type (me, usually).

This staff, this bar - they're on to something special. I can't recommend this enough as a place to get tipsy on amazing drinks with your favorite people, talk drinks and life, and just enjoy a great night. 5 out of 5 stars!

Excellent little find down and alley.  Beautifully crafted and tasting drinks.  The bar is small and the night we were there it wasn't very social if that's what your looking for.  But if you want that IG pic this is defiantly the place for you. If you want to eat the reservations are a must.

This place is always packed during weekend nights, and it takes at least 15-30mins of standing in line outside before you get to get in. But the drinks and ambience is definitely worth the wait. The drinks are fancy, huge and sweet but potent! Don't get fooled by the sugar hiding the potency of the drinks!

pics.caption: Their Thai fried chicken, pretty good! Those peppers were hot!

review.des:
What a time to be alive during this tiki renaissance!

From coast to coast, places are cropping up, reviving the once destined 'lost art' of the rum soaked concoctions originating from the South Pacific.

Three Dots, a heavy contender in the space, left me extremely impressed. Great space, tucked away on an alleyway off Hubbard, and a welcome respite from the unrelenting bustle of River North. The basement locale is always lively (even on a Monday evening when we were there). Expect long lines on the weekends. Neons color the beach themed accents all around the bar.

As any proper tiki bar should, you'll find each drink served in festive ceramic mugs. But not just any mugs. These puppies are custom made for the house! Three Dots and a Dash branded tiki mugs. That kind of detail sets this place apart from many others in my book.

Kicked my set off with an "Aloha Felicia". Phenomenal name and equally phenomenal taste. The Thai basil was a great spin. Round 2: the rum barrel. Mysteriously delicious. I needed a hand for my next drink and the "Tropical Itch" had just the thing. And for the grand finale, the Chief Lapu Lapu for two. There was dry ice and it was glorious.

The pupu platter was a great compliment to our drinks as we were hungry. Highly recommend it if you're planning to marathon some tiki.

pics.caption: Chief Lapu Lapu for two. Not pictured: the smoke that was coming off the dry ice.

review.des: A little loud if you are trying to have a conversation but the drinks are really fun and interesting!

This place was such a wonderful find. I actually enjoyed the hidden alley entrance. Was totally speakeasy themed. The decor all around was extremely tiki. This place got packed on a Monday night, so you know it's good. We got the tuna tartar which was good. The vibe was very nice also, not too loud. I had the strip and go naked cocktail, it was delicious!! So, it's gin, passion fruit, pineapple. Definitely one of my highlights in Chicago!

This place is really popular! We tried to go on a Thursday and Saturday night, but it was packed and unable to get in. But they do take reservations from Monday to Thursday, no reservations available for Friday to Sunday. If you wanna have a table, make sure to make reservations first.

We had the Aloha Felicia and Three Dots and a Dash, and the appetizer sampler. Food and drink was both fast. A little disappointed that the Aloha Felicia is not in a real coconut shell. It was more of a milky drink, not strong at all. And the sampler is decent size, taste is average. Overall a great place for a friends gathering and some drinks after work.

Super cute and fun atmosphere with beach vibes. I got the painkiller and it was pretty good, super sweet drink though. I made a reservation and that was super nice, we were seated right away at a corner table. The waitress gave us space but still checked up regularly. This is definitely a special occasion place as my drink was $14 without tip or tax, and that was definitely one of the cheapest drinks. Would come back for the fun atmosphere and to try some food!

I love bringing out of town visitors here, it's so much fun! The atmosphere is great, and the drinks are amazing. Yes, you'll shell out quite a bit for each drink but nothing too outrageous. Plus they are poooteennttt... you get a lot of bang for your buck!

The Pain Killer cocktail is probably the best one I've ever had. It's sweet but not overwhelmingly so, and there's a flavor (is it the pandan??) that makes it really unique and delicious. Highly recommend!

Place is called BUB City and was closed for a private event. When I booked a reservation it didn't say that t was closed for a private event. Plus this place is no longer Asian fusion tiki bar.
So
Actually
You gotta go to the alley and find the door.
It's in the back.

The place is kinda hard to find
Great environment and drinks
We came on Monday there weren't that many people
Jet Pilot $14 kinda strong
Strip And Go Naked $14 pretty fruity and sweet
Go customer service
Highly recommend!

Came here while visiting Chicago for a couple of days, and had a great time! Loved the ambiance and the vibe. Even on a Wednesday this place was packed, and dare I say that the drinks were also packed (). We got this tiki drink, and I couldn't finish it but I definitely got a bang for my buck!!

This place gets so packed it's hard to even find a place to stand let alone order a drink but it is worth the wait. Be patient with the bartender he gets three orders and makes them all at once. You can see him make six drinks in less than 5 minutes, which is pretty impressive. You get a great drink and a show.

Love love love this place!  It's a cute little spot to have a drink or two.  They serve all their drinks in fun and different glasses, great for the gram if you ask me.  It is definitely a little pricey, but that's typical for the area.  It's an awesome spot if you want to relax and try something new without the hour long waits and music so loud you can't even hear yourself speak.

Beautiful & fun, but overpriced. I came here for the first time with a large group for my birthday. We got the elusive treasure chest because I have wanted that drink for years. It was very cool and instagram worthy, but NO where near $400. I know it comes with a bottle of Dom--which is $200 on its own. But what does the other $200 account for? A very tiny serving of alcohol honestly. It says it could serve 6-8. Honestly more like 3-5. I thought it was going to be a much larger serving of booze and juice but it just wasn't enough. The atmosphere was fun and staff were attentive, I plan on coming back for regular drinks. I just feel very cheated by the tiny amount of booze in the treasure chest and wanted to warn others that it's truly not enough.

Cool tiki speakeasy. We came in after dinner for some cocktails/nightcap. Booked for the night but we got lucky a table opened up.
Hubby and I each got a cocktail. Forgot the name but I remember mine being really strong and good!
Definitely a good spot to grab cocktails. They have food too!

A bar in the alley that goes below ground!!! All signs lead to get here fast and get in before it gets packed. Must say if you have a bigger group then you will enjoy the massive drinks that are served here.

We were lucky to go on a Monday and we got in right away and after leaving we kept talking about coming back for more.

The special drinks that can serve as many as 3 all the way up to I believe 8 people are the ones for sure to try to get a great presentation of the drink. We ordered the Bali Bali and it can in a huge bowl two long straws and smoke coming out the bottom all lighted up.  Our jaws dropped when we seen it coming to the table. It received its 15 minutes of fame since people from other tables were coming over to take a picture of it

Every drink here has this awesome presentation or the glasses are very tiki like depending on the drink you order the glassware will change and you can see in all these pictures posted.  

You should eat before going or snack here because you will be drinking lol. Enjoy and cheers

We had a reservation for 9:00 - arrived promptly with my group and was met by a frazzled and frustrated hostess who kept exclaiming to another hostess, "I have no idea what is going on".  

When we informed the other hostess who was less-frazzled but still looking like we came in the door from kicking her cat and mugging elderly people (as though our showing up on time for our reservation was the worst thing we could have done) that we had the reservation but had a couple more people and were prepared to stand around the table or at the bar, she said that we just had to go to the bar and motioned for us to go in.

Confused but figuring someone else would show us to our table, we walked in and then was greeted by a guy who immediately told us we needed to clear the area.  Unfortunately, since this place is as small as a tuna can and you're crammed in with 646 strangers, there is no way to keep an area clear. So as we are trying to explain the situation and find a way to make ourselves smaller and less of an inconvenience to every-fucking-person who works here, the guy cuts my friend off and directs her back to the hostess stand.

After another person told us we needed to sit at the bar and we explained that the additional guests would, but we would like our reserved table, we got a roll of the eyes and were shown to the table.

A word to the wise for anyone considering coming to this festering tiki bar under the stairs, make sure you like what you're drinking. With $14 to $24 a drink, the cocktails aren't too overpriced by Chicago standards; however, when the small novelty glasses are crammed with so much ice and decoration that you're really only going to be getting a small amount of the cocktail, it's not worth it.

If you're looking to come here to cross the spot of your Chicago Bucket List, and you're a party of 4 or less, great, have a mediocre time. But if you're coming for a night out with a larger group of people, avoid this place like the plague.

Honestly, there are a ton of other bars in the area where you can get better service and much better cocktails.

The drinks were really strong yet really good. Service was on point. The Thai chicken wings were delicious. Our favorite drink was the painkiller. This place was priced very fairly as well (this place was so good that we came twice in our 1 week visit).
Only issue was that the google map location of this place did not seem accurate. It was hard to find. Had to ask around

Cool concept. As a budding cocktail aficionado Tiki has had a resurgence the past few years. I even like the somewhat secluded entrance in an alley. The decor is neat and I appreciate how they encourage the servers,bartenders, hosts and hostesses to don floral, tropical attire. My drink was cold and strong. Multiple flavor profiles. As it should be the drink had good balance wasn't over saccharine. You could tell foresight and planning went into the beverage menu as well as bottles behind the bar. I came with 2 friends one ordered a beer and the other ordered a vodka tonic. For some people the menu is intimidating and a handful of ingredients appear esoteric. Everyone has heard of rum but rhum agrichole, orgeat etc folks that aren't familiar with cocktails are clueless.

Anyways because the size of the place, location in the city they get busy quickly.
I realize multiple factors go into cost of drinks: glassware, ice program, syrups, alcohol, city norm and expectations, general inflation.

That being said I found the price for a single tiki drink to be steep. It's a noteworthy experience. There's a similar bar in Avondale that does tiki called Lost Lake. I personally find it more approachable because it's smaller you get more information from bar staff. Also because Lost Lake is in residential neighborhood there are substantially less tourists.

At the end of the day I guess it comes down to what you value in bars/ drinks. It proposes an interesting dichotomies around bar size, location of business, and how organizations/ownership execute very similar but distinct beverage programs.

Sure it's pricey, but at least they deliver on the specialty drinks. Strong and tasty. Really nice ambiance. For being crowded we were surprisingly able to order drinks w/out much of a hassle. Not sure how you reserve a table, but the people that did looked the most comfortable.  The entrance is in a side alley, but just look for the tiki torches.

As frequent visitors (and fans) of the OG of Chicagoland Tiki bars--Hala Kahiki, I couldn't wait to check out TDaaD, especially with my BFF and HK fan with me.

Thanks to the reviews who mentioned where the entrance was to this place.  "Hidden" entrances are just fun and does give a bit of a sense of adventure.  What will really give you a sense of adventure is the steep staircase leading down to the lounge--yikes!  Folks in heels, be careful!

We arrived about 630pm on a Friday night. The hostess looked perplexed but I told her were were just here for a pre-dinner drink and the bar area is fine--she said that was probably the best bet for tonight.  And when we entered, I saw that every table was taken as well as every seat at the bar but there was quite a bit of standing room left.  So it was pretty easy to order at the bar.  An hour later though, it was pretty packed.

We tried the Missionary's Downfall and the Pandan Pain Killer.  Both fruity delicious and artfully made. Missionary is made with liquid nitrogen to ice it and it was fun to watch the bar get that magical mist.

TIP: there are hooks under the bar and under the make-shift counter/mid room posts, so you can hang your purses while you lean.

There is a coat check, but we were only staying for one pre-dinner drink.
Our time there was just enough to enjoy the scenery--very tiki and fun.

If you want to stay for longer than one drink, especially during prime hours, best to reserve a table. Downtown prices as expected.
Went there on a spontaneous adventure with some friends from out of town. The atmosphere was amazing. I enjoyed the look of the drinks more than the actual taste. It was a bit pricey but fun!

This place is very hard to find. It's located down an alley that looks so tricky (especially keeping in mind that's Chicago).
The restaurant was packed with people, a lady who was supposed to call us to let us know that a table is available never did! We were waiting for an hour at the bar, when we just decided to order food there as well... it's upsetting that we saw table becoming available but were not offered to take a seat.
The cocktails are hands down delicious! We had a great throwback to our Hawaii trips and it feels authentic! The cups in which everything is served add points to the atmosphere! You can even purchase a cup like that for your home

The food selection is not big and everything looks like snacks more than a meal! We ordered a poke bowl with chips and it was good, but again just a started. We didn't find anything on the menu that would at least remind us of a big filling meal!

Definitely will come back since overall is has a great atmosphere and drinks, works great for people to grab a drink and relax!

Ps. It's kinda pricey

My coworkers and I were looking for a fun place to have drinks and we landed here.  My local coworker goes here often and loves it.  We got there right at 5pm so they had just opened. The place is in the basement and is a bit dark and mysterious. We had a booth in the bar area.

They focus on heavy alcohol tropical drinks.  I had the Pandan Pain Killer: Jamaican Pot Still Rum, Barbados Rum, Coconut, Tangerine, Pineapple, Pandan.  It was very tasty.  Good rum flavor but not too strong.  Everyone else liked their drinks too.  

We also had a pu pu platter.  It was a variety of Hawaiian style snacks - fried shrimp, egg roles, skewers, etc.  This was tasty but was something like $38 and it had barely anything on it.  Not sure what food they have on their regular menu but the pu pu platter was not worth it.  Just have drinks.

So a fun place when you want a tropical drink.  Its hidden in an alley with a small sign so you have to look for it.

This is a highly popular bar that you should definitely make a reservation for if you want a table. I took my visiting friends here and the drinks are all super creative! We got the Port Light, the Violet Revolver, the Cheap Lei, and the Painkiller. Everything was really well-designed and super appealing. We saw some of our neighbors get the Zombie and the Bali Bali as well--so cool!

I do think their drinks are all towards the sweet, fruity side so if you're not a fan of very sweet cocktails, this may not be the place for you. It's a great vibe though! I didn't get to try their appetizers/snacks but heard they were pretty good too. Definitely will be coming back to taste more of their drinks and their food!
Good food and fun drinks! Funky place that is a bit weird - tropical theme in a basement entered via alley through me off a bit...but then i found my peace with it:)

If I could only go to one Midwestern bar for the rest of my life, I'd be hard-pressed to pick anything other than Three Dots and a Dash. It's the next best thing to actually being on a Polynesian island.

This is the benchmark standard for tiki: the glassware, the bamboo, the rum! I went solo, so I had the chance to have a conversation with one of the bartenders. Suffice to say, he was fluent in tiki and made some outstanding recommendations. Whether you're a seasoned tiki aficionado or a newbie, you can't go wrong with their rum barrel. It's a traditional tiki drink, but each tiki bar has its own blend of rums and spices. They won't say exactly what is in it, but it doesn't matter...it's delicious!

So short of booking the next flight to Maui, when I need quick vacation, I'm heading to Three Dots and a Dash.

Visiting this place was a last minute decision on St. Patty's day. We were lucky to be able to quickly grab a table for 5 people. I don't remember the food that much, but the ambiance was fun, party like atmosphere, great DJ. Not sure if that's normal, but it was perfect for what we were looking for that day.
The drinks were strong. They have themed group drinks that are fun, pretty expensive for what really is just a glass of mixed drink. So don't open the theme drink, it will ruin the fun!

Super cool experience. You will absolutely want a reservation for groups, otherwise standing room only + a few stools. Individual drinks start around $14 and group drinks go up to $400. Unique for sure!!

Fun Bar with creative drinks and good vibe. The presentation is unmatched to anywhere I have been, and I would think most people go just for the photos. Perfect for a group outing, but make a reservation! It gets very packed! Also, There's nowhere to dance, this is just a bar.
Not my absolute favorite tiki bar, but high on my list. Given that I've been quite literally been to hundreds of tiki bars across the nation, that's still very high praise!

SOOOO COOL. This place is so cute and a must in Chicago for a unique tiki experience. The decor is so cool and the drink menu is so cool and comes in super cool glasses. Great atmosphere I even saw a bachelorette party at a table lol. I will be back!!!

I felt like I was in Hawaii every time when I go there. The tropical feel got me every time. Love the atmosphere, the lights and the Decor.

I mostly, go there for drinks. The cocktails are so different than everywhere else, I love all the cool mugs & glasses that they use. My top 2 favorite drinks are the Jet Pilot and Three dots and a dash. Please try!

Went to this hidden gem in Chicago with friends on a Friday night. The bar is located in an small alley, very easy to miss, but you definitely won't miss the long waiting line outside of it! We didn't have reservation so had to wait about 20min to get in. It was pretty fast in our opinions. We ordered Never Say Die, Three Dots and a Dash, and Caribbean Punch- all delicious and worth the price, with fruity, tikki flavors! The only downside is that it's a but crowded and loud in the bar. If you want a quieter place to talk then better reserve a table ahead!

A friend of mine had a birthday party here last weekend and I was amazed by how efficient and professional the service was. We were a party of at least 30 people on an extremely busy Saturday night (we had a reservation). The wait at the door was very minimal, and upon arrival our table was ready and our orders were taken immediately. The drinks were on point and the presentation was even better. The atmosphere was very crowded and loud, so you don't really get to hear too much of the music in the background nor the person next to you to be honest. This isn't your typical chill bar nor dance club, however, the entire set up and service is what makes Three Dots and a Dash always a great place to throw a party!

Definitely the place to be! Great vibes with well made and strong drinks. The price is also very reasonable. The drinks are all so unique and made with attention to detail every time. Food selection can be better but the appetizers go well with the drinks.

First off, let me start by saying I'm not a huge fan of alcohol.

The drinks here absolutely instagram - worthy the but taste, not so much :(! In my opinion, the drinks aren't worth the price but the ambiance is great!

They also have appetizers but they're all very pricey...

For people looking to go here, my advice would be to get there early or make reservations. It gets busy really quick. Also, the entrance does not have a sign, so know that you have to walk to the alley to find the entrance.

It's a cool experience to visit at least once. The atmosphere is super cool and the drinks are cute. BUT this place is insanely over priced. $14 for a drink that was half ice, half decor. We got some spring rolls and chips and guac that were good, but seriously not worth the bill.

I enjoyed the drinks.  Those drinks are so strong, one was enough for me.  My favorite was three dots and a dash was my fav.  The only thing I didn't like was that I had to wait outside in line for 30mns to get in the place.  It was cold and rainy.

Beautiful tropical cocktails, both taste and presentation.
Could be somewhat crowded though

Look these drinks are way overpriced, the crowd here just got out of their Ubers from the suburbs, and it's absolutely overcrowded.

That being said, the drinks are very tasty and potent, and the (albeit very kitschy) tiki atmosphere is kinda fun. Not really a place you should go frequently, but in the middle of winter it can be nice to pretend you're somewhere warm for a bit.

I consider Three Dots and a Dash to be one of those type of bars that everyone should visit at least once.  Both the tropical decor and well made drinks make this place worth checking out.  The entrance to the bar is located in the middle of an alley, so it might be a little hard to find your first time.  Once you enter the bar, you walk down a dark set of stairs that leads you to the host stand.  Like others have mentioned, this bar does get very very busy, so you have to make an effort to come early (probably before 8pm) if you want to sit comfortably at a table.  The majority of times I've been here, service has been excellent.  A couple of times, the service was just so-so.

The tiki drink menu is fairly large, and offers several different promising options if you like rum based drinks.  My two current favorites are the "Jet Pilot" and "Tropical Itch".  Both are a little bit more "boozy" than some of the other tiki drinks on the menu, but not in a bad way.  For visitors that aren't into the tiki drinks, there are some beers and standard cocktails that you can request instead.
Super cute and fun place to go out with group of friends. Drinks are pretty overpriced but hey, you get the total experience.

I was visiting Chicago for the weekend and decided to give this place a try. At first it was a little hard to find, but once we realized it was down an alley we saw the tiki torches and knew we were in the right place. The overall theme of the place is really cool and the customer service was friendly and quick. I went in the early afternoon so there weren't many people around, but I knew that at night this kind of place would be packed. The drinks were tasty and in our opinion strong. My brother ordered the poke and he said it was fresh, and that's coming from someone who eats a lot of raw fish. Not 5 stars only for the prices which can be on the high side. At this kind of place I feel your paying for the experience.

This is one of my favorite bar in Chicago!  I've been a few too many times over the years.
They have amazing unique and often strong drinks and yummy appetizers in a fun environment.  Nights there can turn a little fuzzy after a few drinks, but I always remember having a blast.  Definitely a recommendation for locals and those visiting the city.  

It's a little hard to find given its location in the alleyway.  On the weekends, there is usually a line so it's harder to miss.  I went a few days ago during a week night (Monday), and there wasn't a line as expected.  When I got inside, I was surprised to see the place pretty filled up for a Monday.  

I recently has their wiki wiki and violet revolver.  Both were great drinks even though my friend thought they were too sour.  I ended up getting a second wiki wiki since I was such as fan.

I think I've tried all their apps during a work outing.  They were good but nothing stands out from memory.  This bar/lounge is more known for its drinks, not food.  

They also are known for group drinks in fun containers like a glass skull, treasure chest, etc.  They're great if people aren't germaphobes haha
Great place to hang out for a girls night or griup events. This is definitely not for couples in a date. The drinks and apps are very good...

Cool bar and the it's always packed and busy!
