They have a great collection of cocktails. The only thing is that It was really tricky to find the entrance! I almost gave up and went home..
u have walk across the street and through an alley. so don't get discouraged just ask someone if u get lost cause I definitely did lol

This place has a fun theme. It is a cool place for groups and not necessarily an intimate place for a date. The drink menu offers rum drinks but not much beyond that. Service is pretty hard to come by and there is always a line of people at the bar.

This place is amazing. Everything that you've heard about this joint is true. From the super cool and crafty cocktails to the long wait for tables. But, once you're seated the experience is something you won't forget. Please try the fried chicken appetizer. It's amazing!! And be careful as you will definitely be drunk on all that damn rum they put in the drinks lol

Loved the vibe here! I loved everything about this place. As busy as they were, the service was still on point, and the drinks were delicious and strong.  This is the perfect place to go when you want to celebrate a birthday or anything else with friends.
Great spot for drinks with friends! It is a nice spot to bring people out of town for fun drinks. There is a lot of different options and it has a Hawaiian theme!

I love tiki bars and I love speakeasies. Three Dots and a Dash is a combination of both and if I lived in Chicago, I'd likely be obsessed.

A bunch of us stopped by right when they opened for happy hour one day after work. I do feel like this place would be best enjoyed late at night, but as a second visit revealed, as the night goes on, it gets super crowded and that's definitely *not* my scene, so I am pretty glad we were able to grab a booth at HH.

The back alley entry is somewhat intriguing though truth be told, I'd be less charmed by this in the midnight hour as it goes against my every instinct to enter a dark alleyway alone. I think they will ID everyone (I mean, I walked in right after 4 giggling, suspiciously jubilant girls who surely made me look like I was their mom or something) so bring it. Then... then you enter the dark lair and prepare to worship at the alter of the tiki gods. I like. I like mucho.

The room is just as you would want it to be in a tiki bar. Cavernous. Dark. Tropical. I'm going to go ahead and say it: Chicago's Enchanted Tiki Room beckons (I know, I know. When your introduction to all things Tiki is formed by Walt Disney, you just can't help it).

Both times I've been here, I've very much enjoyed the atmosphere and Tiki libations, expertly crafted (although one of my friends found a squeeable bottle top in their drink) and garnished (those mermaid drink stirrers!!). Both times, though, I have to admit, service was a bit lax and not very friendly (for example, when we pointed out the bottle top in the drink, our server barely seemed to care and just took it away and brought another drink with a toneless, "sorry about that.") I can get past all of this, though because I do love this place otherwise.

I don't know why people are so over the moon about this place. It's kitchy and kind of fun, but literally nothing special. And I guess if weak, expensive, overly sweet drinks are your thing then go fo it, but I would rather drink my bourbon on the rocks from a rocks glass in a quieter atmosphere.

This place was awesome! It's right off of Hubbard, you have to follow the blue light in he wall to the entrance. The drinks here are really good and they don't hold back on the liquor. Me and a group of 5 of my besties had the Bali Bali shared drink that came out in a cool glass container with straws for all of us. Great decor and it felt like a tiki bar in Hawaii, I will definitely be back.

What's not to like about tiki? Though this spot has been around for a while, it's still quite popular so your experience may vary wildly depending on what day/time you go. I've only gone while in town for work, which means earlyish evening drinks on weeknights. In other words, dead time. For that reason my experience has always been just fine - no line out the door, no wait for a table, drinks arriving right away.

As for the ambiance, it feels very Disneyland to me. They have the theme down pat with cute tiki related details everywhere and dim, moody lighting, but it definitely feels somewhat manufactured. But again, I'm a sucker for tiki so I was pretty into it.

As for their drinks, they go from classic to more creative versions of tiki cocktails. One of my faves is the Aloha Felicia, and not just because of the amazing name or the pineapple/skull cup it comes in (which I believe is available for purchase at a very high price!) If you're there with a group, why not splurge for a shareable drink like the Zombie or the Treasure Chest and make it a party!

As for the food, I've had nibbles and honestly I'd rather go elsewhere in this area for a meal. This place is all about drinks and decor!

The ultimate tiki lounge! Loved the style and decor... very unique. Drinks were refreshing and served in themed glassware or bowls. Limited food menu but surprisingly delicious. Great atmosphere for intimate or group gathering.

What a perfect underground getaway from the bipolar Chicago weather! Everything about Three Dots and a Dash has such a positive vibe, from the colorful decor to the friendly bartenders clad in Hawaiian shirts. The drinks and the food are not only delicious but incredibly photogenic as well.

I got the Aloha Felicia drink which seems unassuming at first but certainly packs a punch. I'd say that it's a spin on the traditional piña colada. If you're more daring, opt for the drinks with the skulls next to them! I tried a sip of the Polynesian Itch and it sent a shiver down my spine. Yes, the drinks are a little more on the expensive side, but they're super strong and most of them are the size of two drinks that you would get in a regular bar. So I'd say it's totally worth it!

As far as food goes, they only have appetizers but the tuna poke was probably the best I've ever had. It comes with avocado on fried seaweed chips and the flavors are absolutely out of this world. Definitely a must if you're in Chicago!

Two challenges with Three Dots and a Dash- 1. finding the door, and 2. picking which drink to try first! I was in my first trimester when I went to Three Dots and a Dash, and was so pleased to find out that they can make almost all of their drinks non-alcoholic! You still get the fun glassware and flavors without the alcohol. I was very impressed by how accommodating the waitstaff was.

If you can make a reservation, it's an awesome place for a group. It does get crowded as the night goes on, even on weeknights.

Legit, I hate this place.

People that work there  are mean, rude, delusional and just out of touch.

Patrons are rather racist I am sorry to say. :(
The atmosphere isn't all it's cracked up to be, and it kind of smells bad.

But most importantly the drinks are DREADFUL! and EXPENSIVE AF. I don't mind paying $20 for a drink and I don't mind buying a $120 round for me and my friends, however when the drinks taste like a mix of Clorox and cough syrup then I have a legit issue.

I spoke to my cocktail server about it and she literally laughed it off. WTF?!
I will never go again

This place is AMAZING but so strict!  Make a reservation and arrive early! They gave away our table because we were just a few minutes late. If you don't make a res you don't get a table- at all. There is very limited space around the bar and you have to be within a roped area and can't be standing etc etc etc it's a whole thing but it's worth it so just make the res. Be early. And have a great time! Drinks are beautiful and strong and I look forward to trying the food menu next time!

Wow, this place is outstanding and is hidden behind bub city barbecue. It's dark and has this really cool Modern tropical vibe to it. The drinks come in these really cool cups. The cup I got was inspired by the angler fish, but they have many others. The place was really professional, clean, and organized. The overall service seems a little on the slow side, but it's understandable because the place was packed within five minutes of being opened.

The only thing I really wish they had was a fire spinner or glow spinner of some kind to add to the experience.
I wasn't crazy about the food although I do like all the sauces they provide.

Speakeasy Tiki Place
1) Tried to go a couple of times there was always a line
2) Was there at 3pm o Saturday no line , but it was packed inside
3) Lucky to get a sit at the bar
4) If it has a skull or two on the side of the drinks name it is as strong as it says
5) Love the Vibe
6) Love how fancy drinks are/ looks great for social media if you like this kind of pictures
7) Do make reservations if you really do want to get a sit and enjoy OR COME SUPER EARLY LIKE US!

The alley sucks and it smells, hard to find.  Girls are all very nice and the drinks are delicious: Food greasy, good and extremely flavorful.  

Love it don't like it, Class A spot for you and Gwyneth!

This may be a faux tiki bar with an entrance in an alley and a speak-easy vibe, but somehow the FUN is REAL. It was semi-crowded on a Thursday evening -- close quarters meant making new friends. I suggest reserving a table if your party wants to be seated. It took us an hour to get seated without one.

The thing about the over-priced sweet and fruity drinks served here is this--you don't have to order one. The friendly bartenders can make anything, including all the classic cocktails. My Manhattans were superb -- they chilled the glass with liquid nitrogen -- and a friend's IPA from Hawaii was clever. Other friends who ordered the Polynnesian drinks were happy too. I hope this place stays a secret known only to a few -- haha.

One of my favorite bars in the city. Delicious yet strong drinks and an incredible atmosphere.

It can be difficult to find, as it is tucked away in an alley, but you'll see tiki torches outside.

The Thai fried chicken was 5/5 amazing. Quite small portions, though. The drinks are expensive, but so so worth it. I highly recommended trying this place at least once.

I love Hawaii and I love Tiki. This place is perfect. Hidden in an alley, walk to the basement, great art work and decor. They have the coolest drinks and Kona beer!!! The food was awesome - shockingly good for a bar. Bar staff was super friendly. Get here early - it is not huge and does get crowded. Should be on any Tiki fan's bucket list.

Super cute place and friendly staff! This bar is located in an alley through a hidden door and down stairs, very speakeasy type. Once inside, the setting is very tropical and dark. The music is different but fits the mood appropriately.

Now for the drinks..... w o w. All I have to say is STRONG! I shared with my bf and we were both feeling it LOL, although on the menu It tells you if the drink is strong or not, I still wasn't expecting It to be that strong. Still delicious and Im happy to see the price is worth it.

Only downgraded this place from a 5 to a 4 for 2 reasons: I don't like alley entrances (the ground is uneven and I always wear heels so it's not fun getting inside, but whatever it's a trendy thing in Chicago), and it can get just wayyyyy too crowded in here sometimes so maybe a good place to come with coworkers or friends on the weekend but definitely if you come with family or for dinner come early for some extra wiggle room lol.

The drinks are delicious and served in unique glasses, and there are fun group drink options as well with dry ice. The bartenders are always on theme and the staff always friendly and accommodating. Definitely a spot you want to bring your friends or family that are in town for the weekend and looking for a unique experience to really wow them!

Amazing drinks... loved the decor & presentation... definitely one of the most well presented cocktails ever... good ambience... meticulous bartenders :)

1 star less because no estimated time for the table was given... provided that it wasn't too crowded when we can  in...

Absolutely love this spot. It's dark and swanky. Okay cool music, has bomb food, and drinks! I love the pain killer and the shareable drinks. There so entertaining. Our server was on top of her stuff. He had such a blast.

I do love the drinks and the wait staff is very attentive and gracious.  The problem is the front staff and the "security".  We had a party of 4 and then asked if it would be ok for 5 people.  They responded by giving us 3 different stories on if we could have another chair.
Host: you all can have people stand and it will be fine.
Security: your table is a fire hazard and you need anyone over 4 people to go sit at the bar
Manager: you can have people stand but only in this certain area.

They told us to ask for re-accommodation , which we did, however, the host, looked at us like we were causing her the greatest distress in her life and said, "that's going to be really hard." And never actually put us in for a larger table.

Probably get new management that has undergone customer service training.  We spent $500 and I would rather just thrown $500 in the river than be talked down upon by their front staff again.

This is where I met some of our best friends in Chicago.

The drinks are delicious. I would try to give this place a try for a group date or with a few of your friends. I don't know if i would go on a first date since it is so packed. It wouldn't be conducive to a private and intimate conversation.

It is at a great location. I would always make a reservation if you want a table or booth.

When going out in River North during the weekend, it's hard to find a place with no lines and a relaxed atmosphere. The first time I tried going to Three Dots, I could not find the entrance. I decided to try once more and was successful the second time around. The entrance to the bar is on Hubbard down what seems to look like the back of a bar or an alley.

Three dots has a bar area that is sectioned off but the area was inconveniently packed and it made more sense for my friends and I to grab a table. Our server gave us a menu and we were surprised by the variety of drinks and RUM selection (there are a ton of options).

Our night went well but the experience could have been better for it's location. There was no dancing or much mingling and got the impression that the bar is just a great place to get a few cool drinks and sit around with friends.

Everyone needs a little tiki bar in their life. Excellent ambience/esthetic (skull entryway included); tasteful array of (delicious) artful tiki classics; and a beautiful attention to details (stir sticks, mugs, etc.). Solid service. Highly recommended.

I called to make a reservation but it was difficult to communicate because it was very loud there. It'd be easier to book online. The bar is not easy to find. It is actually located in the alley behind a restaurant. Drinks have fun presentation but the cool looking ones come in larger portions. We only had 2 people, so we tried the smallest one, which was Lapu Lapu. Came with lots of smoke. The drink itself was refreshing.

Finally made it into this wildly talked about place, from the hidden entrance, to the unique decor, all the way to the staff and the very strong drinks..was not disappointed, only that we hadn't come here sooner!

Amazing service at the bar, stellar cocktail list, intimate ambiance, great crowd, and beautiful decor. Their signature Three dots and a dash cocktail was my favorite but my girlfriend was in love with their Zombie cocktail. Despite being busier than usual, the bartenders were quick to take orders and craft these high quality cocktails with beautiful over-the-top tiki garnishes and presentation.

I didn't eat anything here, and I wasn't here for long enough by any means. But man, I'm in love with this place.

Everything from the back alley location, to the warm, friendly bartenders, to the lighting, to the decor of your drink, to the taste of the drink, to the velour painting, to the skulls, to the etc. left me loving the kitsch. Call me a sucker, but I love me a good tiki bar. I will absolutely come back here when I'm in Chicago next.

Absolutely love this place! The whole vide of the building, the lobations, and the staff are unforgettable.

Some friends and I were visiting Chicago last June and learned about this place from Instagram. We were so glad we went. We sat at the bar and had a great time with the bartender.

We started by splitting the chief lapu lapu which is this sweet and strong drink with rum and passion fruit served on a giant clam shell. Absolutely loved it-totally Instagram worthy next we each got the jet pilot which has rum, cinnamon, and grapefruit. Again amazing and the presentation was perfect. Finally I got the banana daiquiri which was the perfect sweet and frosty drink-served with a banana dolphin. Not sure if this specific one is on the menu anymore.

I wanted to take a piece of this place back to Detroit with me so I bought one of their coconut cups. This was packaged up adorably. It came in a Tiffany blue bag with leis and stir sticks thrown in.

Next time we're back in town, we'll definitely be stopping back in!
Super fun vibe!  Great place to take friends visiting from out of town.  The drinks are a little pricey but served with such flair it's worth it.
Great food great service will definitely recommend them to everyone I know the music was goo also and chairs are very comfortable to eat

This is our favorite niche bar to take out-of town guests! What a great little oasis from the bustling city... It's always nice to feel like you're on an island, especially in Chicago winter when the inside of your nose freezes when you breathe.

Awesome drinks! A bit pricey, but worth it. Not pretentious at all. You might even spot a celebrity there!

Fair warning.... the drinks with double skulls ARE actually strong. You will get f***ed up if you drink two.

pics.caption: Good drinks! Double skull drinks will get you DRUNK!

review.des: My husband and I stopped in for a quick drink before heading to Navy Pier for fireworks on the 4th of July. I ordered the Three Dots and A Dash cocktail (delish) and strongly suggested my husband get the Cobra's Fang (** extra alcohol) - we are new parents on our first trip away from baby so I was making sure Dad was going to let his hair down a bit, too. Sure, we also got the Thai fried chicken (amazing) and poke with chips (good). Needless to say, we left appropriately full and after my husband's drink... the fireworks weren't the only thing LIT this 4th of July. Which was exactly what Uncle Sam would have wanted! We will be back.

I went here with some friends and we got in within 2 minutes to be greeted by so many people that you couldn't even walk. I waited in line foreverrrr only to pay $14-18 for a pretty drink. It was literally the worst drink I've ever had although decorated beautifully. Me and my friend both got one and we both hated them so much we gave them to our boyfriends to drink for us. Then they both set the drinks down and couldn't finish it. The flavor was horrible. When I pay that much for a drink I want to get tipsy and enjoy getting tipsy. Nope. Not here.

I will say the place itself is dope. The lighting and music were beautiful. Tropical vibe.

But yeah I'll never go here again.

Could someone please teach these people how to use a thermostat. Holy cow, it's 40 degrees out and these folks keep the place about 75 degrees.  

The drinks are also sticky sweet to overpower the taste of bad rum.

For my first visit to Three Dots and a Dash it was a bit crowded but a fun tiki experience. The music and people made the visit pretty awesome. My drink was three dots and a dash, next time we will be getting a group drink. The Pu Pu platter has a variety of meats and enough for 4 people. Planning another visit soon, our last dinner of the summer!!

This is one of my favorite spots to take out my out of town friends. I would recommend this spot to anyone who wants to check out a fancy unique tiki bar in Chicago, and it's memorable. I would highly suggest to make reservations if you don't like to wait outside an alley, especially with Chicago weather!

The food, drinks, environment, and service was great. This a cute place to meet up with friends or for a date.

My friends and I had such a great time at this place. This was my second time at this venue, first time for a birthday party. At first my table was given away because we showed up a little late. They did this because they do have a 15 minute window for you to make your reservation.  However I talked to the manager because I actually called ahead of time to let them know that my party and I were going to be late because of a slow Uber driver and they made it up to us very quickly for giving away the table: The manager greeted us at the table after we were seated and he offered us a complimentry group drink for our wait. ( It was $65 for that!) I did have a group of 8 but they have tables that can seat up to 40 guests comfortably. Plan ahead of time because tables do get reserved frequently!
 We started off with a giant conch that serves 6 to 8 people, over $100 for this group drink.  It was delicious ! They serve these group drinks with giant straws for every person in your group. We ordered the Poopoo platter as well. It is a mixture of all of the appetizers that they have at the place. All the food was very good, my guess were super entertained.
I also had a special request for them to place my birthday cake into the fridge until I was ready for them to bring it out. When they brought it out they even attached a flame lit lime and began singing happy birthday! It was unexpected and shocking ! I loved it!
If you are planning to go to any upscale spot that has amazing drinks and a small food selection this is the place to go! I will always tell my friends about this place and I will be back again!

This is one of those places you have to bring friends/family when they're visiting from out of town. Especially if they like to drink. Great selection of drinks from huge creative "wtf there's smoke" to your everyday go to drinks done just right. There's a drink for everyone. Kinda expensive but that's expected. Entrance is like a speak easy so that's cool too.

This is one of the coolest lounges and bars in Chicago. Why you ask?

Drinks: Extensive menu to choose from and they come in unique and fun tiki glasses.

Ambiance: Great decorations, lighting, and seating. It's got an exotic tropical feel.

Popularity: Be sure to make reservations for a Saturday night! You'll bypass the line and be guaranteed a seat.

Location: It's in an ally. We had to ask people where it was the first time we tried finding it.

Prices: Above average but the drinks are above average quality and strong too :)
This place is hard to find but so worth it. The drinks are pricey but so tasty and come in the cutest cups! Make sure to have a reservation if you're coming on the weekend.

I always feel like I'm being rushed out of here every time I come on a weekend night. The drinks are really great and they are strong, but there is hardly any room unless you are okay standing elbow to elbow? It's probably best to avoid this place unless you have a reservation. They recently changed the menu and a lot of my favs are now gone! I used to love the Painkiller with passionfruit and the banana daiquiri, but alas, they are no longer on the menu. Go to Lost Lake in Logan Square instead! But Three Dots and a Dash is conveniently located in the grimy heart of Hubbard, if you just wanted to stop by.

favs:
-strong and yummy drinks

mehs:
-no room, super dark
-snacks aren't tasty - skip them

This subterranean tiki bar has a very cool vibe from the tiki torch entry through the alley (don't worry it is safe and clean) to the fun beverage glass and stoneware. I enjoyed my Three Dots and a Dash signature drink. Cocktail connoisseurs should remember this is a tiki bar and they specialize in sweet mostly rum based drinks. Presentation here is about everything and they do not disappoint on this mark. It's a fun joint. I'll return with friends for the fun of the place but move on after one drink as it's too sweet for a true mixologist.  my three star rating is because the drinks while fantastical, lack in taste. They are super sweet. On ambience alone it is worth going and returning and on that I'd give it 4 Stars. You need both to get a 5 from me.

pics.caption: Alley grand entrance. There is a bouncer at door not checking IDs so I'm sure just to keep it safe when it gets dark out.
Spooky entry as your eyes adjust.
Their version of chips and guacamole. Very good. Enough for at least four people BTW.

review.des: This is a fun place and a good date spot in the area. Drinks are definitely pricey but the menu is huge and the options are great. I had the caipirinha and it was delicious (and dangerously strong). The entrance reminded me of a speakeasy, and the decor inside was fun. It's clear that a lot of thought has been put into this place. The wait staff were very helpful and knowledgeable.

I actually feel bad giving this place three stars.
The ambience was really freaking cool and the bartenders were knowledgeable and kind.
The only problem was that the drinks weren't any good at all. Both my girlfriend and I tried two different drinks each and were not impressed with any of them.
Will most likely not be returning.

First time back since they completely revamped their menu. This time I went on a Tuesday night with a couple coworkers and it was pleasantly full but not crowded. We were able to get a booth to ourselves. I would highly suggest hitting up Three Dots on a week night if you don't like long waits or making reservations far in advance!

First round I went with the Jet Pilot: rum based, not overly strong with a giant cinnamon stick and a toy airplane on top. (You can bet I kept the toy airplane). Second round I got the Tropical Itch: bourbon based and boy, can you feel the alcohol in this one. I really enjoyed both! Plenty of creativity and total alcohol in each drink to justify the prices ($14-16).

Service was just okay during my previous visit but this time our server was really friendly and gave some great suggestions for drinks. It was really a great night at Three Dots through and through!
Dark and moody atmosphere. Not too much light which gives it a romantic appeal. I had a drink and an appetizer. They were both good! I definitely have to return to try out some more drinks.

This place is super cute!  My job held our annual Christmas party here (funny right? a tikki bar...) and we had a blast!  We rented out a section of the bar and the drinks just kept coming.  I love that they have themed drinks to match the tikki atmosphere of the bar, and they were actually super yummy.  

Although we had a rented section of the bar, it was super packed at 8pm on Friday night.

side note **THE ENTRANCE IS LOCATED IN AN ALLEY** it is super easy to miss. I had almost passed it up and wouldn't have known if I didn't ask a worker that had happened to be walking that way.

Anyway, the ambiance is great, people are friendly, workers are nice and an overall fun time!  The decorations are great and definitely in line with the tikki theme they aim for.

I would definitely come back to this bar and recommend it for those visiting the city or those just looking for a fun bar!  I def wouldn't say this is my favorite bar, however it is just too fun not to experience.

My friend and I discovered this place by chance as we kept seeing the flickering of tiki torches when we crossed the alleyway. We took a chance and were pleasantly surprised.

We did not have reservations but were fortunate to get seated within 10 minutes. The interior was dark but had enough lighting to see the menu. Another plus is that it was quiet enough to hold a conversation. The ambiance was very pleasant, with most patrons dressed for a night out.

The drinks were pricey but are meant to be shared and tasted excellent. We got the Zombie, which is meant for 3-4 people, and it came (on fire!) in a nifty skull cup.

This place is funnnnnnnnnnnnnnn. :)

It's a super cool vibe but gets crowded! You can stand around as well. The drinks are around $14. We got the mai tai and BOY was it strong but delicious! It was beautifully presented as well with flowers and in a cute cup.

I had a nice time here with friends and the drinks were so beautiful and delicious. I would probably try their signature drink next time around. It's located in River North and is nearby to other nice bars as well if you want to bar hop around but this place is super fun to stay at and just lounge!

Eh.  I love tiki bars.  I mean I loooooooooooove them.  While the drinks are good here, the atmosphere is not.  They definitely pack them in like it's a club.  Complete with clubby music sometimes.  I prefer my tiki bars to be a little more than that.  An oasis, if you will.  Also, despite it not saying anything about a dress code on the website we were denied entry at a quarter to 5 in the afternoon because my friend visiting from SF was wearing sporty sweat pants.  Apparently sweat pants are a no go.  Maybe they need to list that on their website.  As my friend said the song isn't, "do you like pina coladas and wearing nice pants".

If you are looking for bullet points:

Good drinks
Shitty club music
Packed bar
Dressed code without posting a dress code

Hours posted until 2am. I caught an Uber here around 1am and was literally standing in the bar at 1:25 when the bartender told me that last call had been at 1 AM and ASKED HOW I GOT IN. She called the manager over. I was baffled. He ushered me towards the door and with the same voice I use to escort people who have vomited or started fights in my bar, "apologized" for my inconvenience and told me they were done serving for the night. I never want to be the customer ordering some complicated bullshit as a bar is about to close; I'm super sensitive to that. But 1am? Damn, bish! Yo dranks aint that complicated. If you become Rude Cinderella after 1am, probably a good idea that you post 1am as your closing time and not 2.

This place may not be too everyone's taste, with its kitschy tiki theme, but we had a great evening here.  

It has a speakeasy-like entrance. (If you go the address, walk around the block and down the alley to find the front door.) Also, note that the place accepts reservations on Open Table.

As you'd expect, it offers a wide selection of tropical drinks, most with rum. We all enjoyed our drinks, which were served in an appropriately garish set of glassware with wild, oversized garnish.

Our server could've been a little more attentive, but otherwise we felt this was an interesting and delicious place to enjoy a tiki drink.

This place treats there customers like crap!! Hostess staff was definitely discriminating. My friend and I walked in and they told us there was going to be over a two hour wait. Than right after us 2 Caucasian women walk up and they tell them it's about a 40 minute wait.
The bar tenders were kind. No where to sit! I will not recommend this place to anyone!

LOVED this Tiki Bar!!!! #1- Aloha Felicia, #2 Basic Batita!
Now onto deets.....The experience is so unique; especially during a Chicago winter. We had reservations for 11pm on Wed before Thanksgiving, got there early (around 10:15pm) and had no issues getting our table for 4. The cocktail page is so much goodness to look at. Decisions, decisions..... Our group tried 5 different cocktails and all were good with 2 favs above. The DJ was killin it. And the décor is just outstanding. Take me here any day!

I usually expect tiki themed bars to be a little kitschy and sometimes grody but Three Dots and a Dash keeps it classy. The entrance is in a back alley with no signs, just a bouncer and blue light letting you know you're about to be transported somewhere secret and underground. You descend a flight of stairs, walk through a narrow corridor, before you see the hostess' tableau and are greeted by the spacious underground bar.

We came around 6pm on a Thursday night and snagged the last two no-reservation/bar seats (that do not have backs, so you don't get too comfortable). The bar filled up pretty quickly after that, so definitely come early if you wanna get seats.

All the drinks come in customized kitschy ceramic cups - what looks like a cored pineapple shell was actually sculpted with little skulls, and the coconut husk is a glazed and moulded ceramic piece. The drinks are denoted by little skull icons to denote how strong they are. I got the pandan pain killer and I thought the drink was way too sweet. The rum barrel (with one skull icon) was more suitable for me (my go-to drink tends to be an old fashioned). Still, both drinks were delicious and I would highly recommend coming here.

Great place for drinks but be sure to reserve a table on weekends, go early or go on week nights. The bar area is small so it gets really crowded, making it hard to get drinks. Kudo to the bartenders for their quick service.

I love Three Dots and a Dash.

I learned about it from a co-worker and it sounded like a lot of fun. I have since been back several times, including this past Friday for my birthday. It was a blast.

Our server, Gabrielle, was very helpful, attentive, and kind. She moved my party from a booth (we were squeezed in pretty tight) to an area slightly sectioned off so we could have more room.

The cocktails aren't cheap, but they are reasonably priced for the area (downtown Chicago) and quality. All the cocktails are handcrafted. You can really tell that a great amount of care is put into each drink.

They have group drinks too that you can share amongst your friends. This past week we tried the Head Hunter and it was really yummy.

They have small plates that are very tasty. Four of my friends got the Thai chicken wings, but my personal favorite are the Hanali spring rolls.

I highly recommend this place for anyone, whether you live in Chicago or are just visiting. It's a really fun place. Please do note that you'll need to make a reservation at least a week in advance if you want a table Thursday-Saturday, because it's in high demand. Walking in on a weeknight and you'll probably have some luck getting a spot. You can always walk in if you don't mind bar space.

I was trying to find a fun bar to go to on a Friday night and Three Dots and a Dash came up in several places.  It was only a 1/2 mile from our hotel so we decided to give it a try. We arrived around 8:00 pm and it was super packed around the bar, but the tables for dinner were about half full.  I imagine with a lighter crowd it could be a pretty fun bar but it was far too packed to be fun. All seats at the bar were taken and there was already a crowd standing behind them.  Bartenders were far to overwhelmed to offer any type of interaction other than what do you want and then hand you your drink.

I ordered the Pandan Pain Killer and it was very large. I was however very disappointed that it was a frozen/blended drink and it didn't indicate that anywhere on the menu.  We ended up standing awkwardly between two tables of people having dinner trying to down the drink and not get brain freeze(which is did 4 times exactly). It was super awkward to stand there with no where to set down my massive drink and have to juggle hands as the glass is also freezing.  I saw several other couples with the same issue.  I probably should have just left when I saw the bar was so busy. I would maybe come back to try their food, but I wouldn't return for the bar scene.

This is a super fun place to come and hang out and have a few drinks.
I came here with a few friends and we were planning to have dinner. Did not realize that they were more of an appetizer and drinks kind of place. No matter, we ordered some appetizers and some drinks. The food was not anything special, but the drinks were so yummy and were so cute. My drink was delivered in a coconut. I would definitely come back for drinks!

Drinks average about $16 each. They are mostly filled with ice and the place needs to bump up the AC. I was expecting much more and wasn't very impressed with the experience. I'd skip this one next time.

This is where kids who went to Rainforest for dinner go now that they can have a drink. You get the thunder clash with a pirate chuckle at some point, the drinks a tiki themed and strong, menu is limited(but does the trick for drinking side), and the location is really really small. No music was playing just 50ish people sitting having cocktails in a basement with some tiki decor. Worth a stop but not a 45 minute wait to stand around. So go with reservation or pass.

This spot is a really cool tiki bar that somehow manages to be a modern speakeasy too. Although we did order a few snacks, this is the spot to come to drink!

It's located in a back alley and only marked by a neon blue light and a bouncer. Once you enter and go down the stairs you're introduced to the tiki ambiance and the fun begins. Lot of different seating options, most of which you can reserve. We went in without reservations so found a few open stools at the bar.

Both drinks I ordered were pretty boozy, but had excellent flavor. My favorite of the two was definitely The Missionary's Downfall. It spoke to me because of it's name and the inclusion of Panamanian rum. (Spoiler: I'm Panamanian myself). It also has peach, mint, and lime. Every drink is served in a cool tiki style glass or mug, which I'm sure people steal by the handfuls. I'm telling you, I could have had 10 of those. Granted, I would not have been able to walk out of there, but damn these go down easy.

This is a great place to start your night, as we did, but something tells me it would be way more fun to end the night here!

This place is cool because it's a hidden bar but the drinks were just okay. The bartenders were really friendly but the wait was not worth it. There are a lot of obnoxiously drunk people who seem to frequent this bar so not my scene but if you like that, you'd probably enjoy this. It definitely has a unique vibe though.

Entrance is located off an alley way, we drove around thinking there was no way, it's hidden. But once you walk down to the bar you're blown away by the decor in this hidden gem. Place was crowded, and rightfully so, the creativeness of their cocktails and presentation are impressive. Every cocktail created that is being served catches your attention, you don't what to order. They have large portion drinks that are shareable as well. I was not aware they accepted reservations, but luckily a couple was leaving when we first arrived and were able to occupy the seats at the bar. Would definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time. Atmosphere is fun, they have a DJ playing music, surprisingly not loud enough you can't hear the conversation you're having, which is nice.

This tiki bar was so fun! We showed up at about 5pm on a Saturday night and there was no line/wait so that was ideal. The entrance in the alley with the torches was cool and I thought it was a good way to get you excited about going downstairs to the bar. The drinks and apps were yummy but be aware that they are pricy! Our server was really sweet. We really enjoyed our experience and would definitely return next time we're in Chicago!

ok if you are coming here - ur coming to drink.  so when you order food, dont complain its a little skimpy - cause this is a tiki bar... almost like a speakeasy... the ones in SD dont even serve food.

the drinks are amazing!  i started off with a tropical itch and its enough to really slap you!  so unless ur tolerance is pretty high - dont... or if you are looking for a way to get your night started this is it!  

make reservations cause this place gets nuts! there was a HUGE line outside when we left.

If you make a reservation before it's fairly easy to get a table. I took an uber pool that made a lot of stops so we got to 3 dots almost 30 minutes past our reservation, but they were still able to find us a table asap. Normally they only hold the table 15 minutes after your reservation time.

Even walking downstairs is an experience, with skulls lined along the walls. The decor is a lot of fun and it's cool you can purchase souvenirs to take home. Their waitresses wear Hawaiian dresses and are always so sweet and helpful. The drinks come in crazy mugs or glasses, sometimes with a lit fire or dry ice smoke. It's always fun and presentable making 3 dots a great spot for bringing friends from out of town.

We ordered the PuPu Platter which is an assortment of finger foods. We split it between 4 people because the menu said it was for3-4 people, but I'd say it's more for 3 because most of the items came in 3s (3 egg rolls, 3 sliders).

We also shared the Bali Bali which came in a big metal octopus themed bowl with blinking lights and dry ice fog. We got it because we knew it was one of the more fun/photographable drinks.

Also it's a Lettuce Entertain You restaurant so they accept gift cards and give rewards points.

pics.caption: Bali Bali!! Great presentation.. lights and dry ice fog

review.des:
The bartenders are a little too sassy for my liking but I guess I would be the same way if I constantly had a bunch of entitled downtown patrons yelling drink orders at me.

The drinks are amazingly delicious though so just be patient and try not to come off as a d*ck.

Fun fact, it takes the bartenders about a month to memorize all the niche drink recipes & garnishes. I asked lol.

It's cool. Pricey (granted location). Service was meh - seemed like it was only one waitress working the entire floor, so it took a while for us to grab the bill.

DEFINITELY go when they open/early afternoon, otherwise not sure if this place is worth it if you're having to awkwardly stand around with your pineapple drink. However, I did like this bar better then the Logan Square one (Lost Lake) - larger, with cooler decor.

The chicken appetizer was very good. The drinks are beautifully presented. Knocked off a couple of stars because of the wait time (had to call in and still experienced an hour wait for a table) and service of the waitresses (kind of rude).

Pretty cool venue, but the drinks are pricey.  I'm admittedly kind of a cheap skate but it'd be nice if the menu had a handful of craft beers if you don't feel like ordering a fancy cocktail.  Still, the venue itself is worth checking out, even if you are a beer loyalist like myself.

Sticky floor, overpriced drinks, waited for over half hour to get in with nowhere to sit.
Whenever a table cleared a reserved sign went on it.
Totally too crowed and not worth the "roped" wait outside.

Ok so I came twice. I came, I saw, I conquered! We only had drinks both occasions. The 1st time the kitchen was closed and the 2nd time we weren't interested in their selections. The drinks are just ok and they're expensive! If you come on the wknd I highly suggest reservations. I saw the line on a Friday night looking like ppl were trying to enter a night club, NOT THAT SERIOUS PPL!!!!! Would I go back? Maybe if I was with a group, but I wouldn't suggest the place for a date again. I'm over it.

This is such a unique bar! I love coming here for special occasions and it's good for a big group of people. I find that it's on the pricier side but the drinks are strong and very fun with the Hawaiian concept. Service here is great as well which is always a bonus. The door is a little hard to find if you've never been here before since it's located in the alley way but once you find it it's a fun experience to go through the back - adds to the ambiance of the venue. The inside is spacious but dark, but the decor is amazing. They really run with the tiki-bar theme not only from the wall decor and drinks but also to the cups they serve the cups in. They also have little plates that you can share and they're good for what they are and they're decent portions as well which makes it great to share.
Come here for sure and you'll have a great time.

Amazing drink variety. Fantastic staff and really fun bartenders. Ask them to tell you history of rums and talk to them about the beautiful drinks they make! The food is fine, but overpriced and not a lot of options. So eat first and come here just for drinks.

Tiki bar with a speakeasy vibe. Have taken friends visiting to this place a few times and everyone has loved it!  As other reviews has mentioned, the entrance of this place is in an alley-- so don't be alarmed.

The decor of the place is on point, you'll be transported into the tropics as you enter those doors. The drinks are good,  pretty big, and  comes in cool cups and has a very nice visual presentation. Their drinks can get pretty strong depending on what you get. I got the strip and go naked last time, which wasn't too strong and pretty sweet. I haven't actually had any of their food except a few appetizers which was pretty good and good portion size.
Sneaky place to find. I think you have to be super nice and attractive to work here. Drinks were sweet and strong. In sober around 4, left buzzed at 5.

Came here once for my birthday and this place just wasn't for me. I like that it's hidden away and has a cool vibe bc of its alley location, but that's it for me. Way too loud in there, can't hear the person sitting next to you at the table. And the drinks were ok strong to the point of tasting awful - though the presentation is pretty. It may be your style but wasn't it for me.

This tropical tiki bar is soooooo fun! I'm visiting one of my besties and she knows I love craft cocktail bars. The ambiance is so tropical- it's like you're at a luau. The drinks come in these amazing tiki cups! I wanted to buy one of them butttt the cups are a little expensive. Their drinks are so good. Very strong and fruity. Their food menu is pretty good. My friend and I got the yuca frites and the king crab rangoons- both were delicious. I will definitely be coming back to this place whenever I'm in town visiting my friend! Highly recommend coming here- it's sooooo worth it!

A really fun tiki bar hidden right in the loop. The entrance is in a back alley and the line can get long, but inside the atmosphere is fun and the drinks are well thought out and STRONG, if a bit on the pricey side. A solid selection of appetizers rounds it all out and if you snag a table, you can do some real damage here!
Enter by alley means fun! Great environment and awesome drinks from Hawaii. Friendly bartenders and service was over the top. Peace later ...

Always a fun place to go get drinks and socialize before or after bar hoping! I've gone for a dinner and the food was decent they have lots of Hawaiian style dishes such as shrimp, fish and chicken. Their drinks are always very yummy and they tend to have events through the week so it's nice to go on a weeknight or weekend for either dinner or drinks.

The drinks are delicious and the presentation is beautiful. If this review was just based on the drinks, I would give it 5 stars. However, the obnoxiously arrogant and rude bus boys outshined the delicious tropical drinks. The bar is surrounded by tables that must be reserved ahead of time. If you miss the reserve-a-table memo, you're stuck standing in a kitchen sized space smushed like sardines. And when you happen to stand to the side of that space because you're taking a break from feeling like a sardine, you will be rudely yelled at and treated like an unwelcome pest.

Extremely unfortunate that the staff can't be as inviting as the drinks they serve.

Had a great a first time experience. We flew in from out of town and this was our first stop. After coming down the stairs we were suddenly teleported from a Chicago alley to a secret Island destination tiki bar. The drinks were great! I would say that the appetizers were great, we ordered several in order to fill ourselves.

It took us a few minutes to figure out this place was in the alley but when we did we were pleasantly surprised. It's the nicest tiki bar we've ever been in. Bartender Brian was super cool and very knowledgeable when it came to falernum. Next time we come we'll try the food

pics.caption: Great bathrooms to do coke it :)

review.des: Cutest drinks!! Every drink comes in a different tiki cup. They were about $14-$17 each. They were pretty strong, one drink almost equals 2 but that's also subjective. They play good music there too. Good first stop, gets you ready to party some more next door at the club!

This place is super cute and fun! Definitely go for the drinks with the skulls! Get your bang for your buck. I had the Crocodile Tuesday and my hubs had the Rum Barrel and we finished the night we a Lapu Lapu. We had the special of the night which was a spicy tuna sushi roll covered in fried tempura.

We came on an off night and hence didn't have to wait in a line in an alley with a laughable velvet rope and a small man with a clipboard. Hilarious pretentions, 3DaaD. From the reviews here and the slight attitude we got from the hostess stand, I would say that's not going to change.Which is like, the opposite of what a real tiki bar should be.

Since I'm a simple gal that loves a simple mixed drink, I started with the Idle Hands with banana rum simple sugar and lime. Yummers! My better half tried the Mai Tai and it was so good I ordered it for my 2nd drink. He had the "Aloha, Felicia" because he's all about the jokes, sometimes. I don't remember if he liked it because at that point we were feeling it. Between a 3-4 star and bumping it up because we felt no pain on our way home.
Found this gem! We came here for drinks and got lucky to be seated without reservations. We got there around 5pm so maybe that's why. It's 21 and up and a small place. It has that Hawaiian feel.

Been here a number of times already and I've consistently found it to be enjoyable. Who doesn't love a good tiki bar with strong drinks? After 2-3 of these tropical creations, you'll get where you need to be. Don't let those pretty flower garnishes fool you!

The bartenders here are awesome. All of them are incredibly friendly and attentive. It's super fun to watch them make the drinks and you can really tell how carefully each one is crafted. Makes it well worth the $14 per drink. If I had to choose, I'd say that the Missionary's downfall and painkiller are my two favorites cocktails. It's a bit more on the sweeter side.

It does get crowded fast and there's usually a long line on the weekends, so be sure to make reservation. This is the place to take your friends from out of town. It can be a bit difficult to find, since it's located in a dark alley (in between Clark and Dearborn), but you won't regret it once you get in. It's like entering a tropical escape in the middle of the city.

Wowzer! Firstly, it's tucked away at an alleyway but marked by the lit tiki torches and a bouncer that ID checks you upon entry. Upon entering, you're led down a stairs with skulls decorating the walls .. it felt like you were lead down a treasure hunt. We walked in on a Sunday evening without reservations, and was seated relatively quickly. Waitstaff was very attentive and explained the menu. We ordered the Lapu Lapu and it tasted as great as it looked! Very tropical.. I think many of us assume tropical drinks to be saccharine but Three Dots And a Dash does a great job balancing that and reinterpreting it with exotic flavors featuring unexpected ingredients. For example, falernum is commonly featured in the menu, and it's typically composed of almond, ginger, lime, vanilla, cloves, etc which truly grounds an otherwise "fruity" drink. We also ordered the namesake Three Dots and A Dash, and the Cobra's Fang. Both drinks were phenomenal but with the Cobra's Fang, you could not taste the absinthe at all! It was remarkable how they disguised an otherwise bitter undertone! The food was also great - initially started with the spring rolls and tuna poke before tacking on the Thai chicken wings and crab rangoon. The spring rolls were lightly skinned and actually had vermicelli in it! The tuna poke was just delightful, fresh, and light. I prob wouldn't order the Thai chicken and crab rangoon again .. largely because, while they were good, they weren't memorable. Overall, would I return? If I am ever in Chicago again, you bet! Glad we stopped by and I would gladly recommend this cocktail lounge to anyone! Make sure you include it in your trip!

pics.caption: The Cobra's Fang .. You couldn't taste the absinthe at all!
The tuna poke to the left and spring to the right .. the best food dishes we ordered that night!
Lapu Lapu! Quite a delicious tropical drink!

review.des: Tiki cocktails!? Hell yeah. I gotta warn you, these are packed. So one cocktail can go a long way. Watch for the the little skulls on the menu to see how powerful each cocktail is. I advice you to go for the strong ones! Aside from that, I really like how they present the drinks. I think it's a must visit!

Very dark. Not exactly what I was expecting, which was a bright and fun atmosphere. The crab rangoon was really good. I had the signature Three Dots and a Dash drink. Definitely had a kick but didn't love it.

We actually came here with high expectations at the referral of our friend.

We ordered there fantastic drinks, and by an inopportune circumstance the bartender miscalculated our order and messed up our drink order.

In a douschebag manner, this server (this Asian guy John with a ponytail) came to our table and said "I hope your drink got instagram likes on your profile" and the walked off w passive aggressiveness. And then proceeeded to slam the bill on our table.

As someone who understands customer service, this does not represent proper social etiquette. I am very disappointed at this response to an error caused by the establishment.

I will never return to this place. And will never recommend this place to anyone.

The bartender, John, made our experience at three dots and a dash so much more enjoyable. He was kind, attentive, and very amenable. Thank you, John, for making our drinks extra special and making sure we were cared for!

-Alexa & Nicole

Three Dots is the best tiki bar I've been to yet. Coming from Vegas, and having a number of good options, it was a great experience. The tiki was delicious, the mugs were unique, and the atmosphere was dark and fun. I would recommend making a reservation--there are times where you'll have to push through crowds to get to your table. Their mugs are also pretty exclusive and expensive; you'll pay $45-$60 if you want to take one home (which I did). With that being said, if a full, fun environment doesn't bother you, you'll have a great time.

Awesome spot. A little hard to find as the entrance is tucked in a side alley. But we thought that added to the ambience. Great crowd. We went for drinks. Bar can get a little crowded, but everyone is friendly so it's not bad. Drinks were great! Service was great.

This is a nice restaurant. It's located in a back alley and so you may pass it. I passed it a few times. You come down a stairwell not sure if they have an elevator. I loved the decor it made you feel that you were actually in Hawaii. The staff were friendly and attentive. They have a variety of delicious tropical drinks. They have shareable drinks as well. The drinks were good were presented well and looked great. The food was delicious and coated the stomach well when your drink. I. The drinks were a bit pricey but it's the whole experience your paying for. I don't know if I will return, but I'm glad I got to experience it.

pics.caption: Long walk on a short pier

review.des:
I can't get enough of this place! From the drinks, to the food, service and ambiance everything is just perfect.

The drinks are all delicious, and everything that I have tried has tasted like a vacation in a cup. I'll take that! I always look around and stare at what others are drinking, as the cups are so exciting, and the presentation overall is just so inviting. I have a hard time choosing!

We went this week and I ordered the painkiller. So good! Coconut and booze, sign me up!

Tuna poke and the fried chicken are my favorite! I honestly now crave that chicken!

The place itself looks like a tiki lounge, that's underground. The waitstaff look like they are ready to go to a luau.

Everyone is always welcoming, and I can't wait to come back and try their group drinks! Who doesn't want a cocktail from a treasure chest???

pics.caption: Three dots and a dash & painkiller instagram: @chefnatasha

review.des:
Three Dots and a Dash was definitely a highlight of my time in Chicago this weekend. I absolutely love tiki bars but they are unfortunately few and far between across the country. We came here after our dinner around 8pm and we were seated instantly without reservations. The drink menu isn't too extensive and has drinks for everyone. The waiting staff was fantastic and enthusiastic and the drinks were even better. We got Trader Vic's Mai Tai and the Aloha Felicia. The Mai Tai was strong and delicious and the Aloha Felicia was one of the best pina colada-type drinks I've had.

For either a large group or a date, for the price and the atmosphere you will be hard pressed to find a better bar experience

Went to this place two nights ago well hidden behind Frontera Grill, once you enter you start feeling the Hawaiian vibe. We opted to seat at the bar and Brenda and Adam were amazing and very attentive.

We tried several drinks and some of the appetizers including the tuna and crab Rangoon and they were just delicious.

The atmosphere is just on point and a nice place to hang out with your friends.

Overall good experience and will definitely go back.

The epitome of Tiki Bars..thank goodness our friend knew where she was going as you enter down a long dark alley with no signage..once inside, prepare to be transported away.. our waitress made several suggestions and as they say "It's all about the presentation" and 3 D&D does not disappoint.  While the offerings may seem expensive, they are all meant to share and contain a ton of alcohol.  Pace yourself!  Tip-they do take reservation so do yourself a favor and get a table.  Most drinks are large and you need the space...can't wait to return!

Our experience with Three Dots was STELLAR. We were originally trying to get pizza, but the line was like 2 hours so we found this place on Yelp! We wandered over, not knowing what to expect! It was a busy Friday night around 8, and when we asked the hostess what the wait was, she said about an hour. Then moments later she said "WAIT! A table for 2 just opened up, as long as you can be out by 9:30!" My mom and I looked at each other and nodded excitedly! We were ushered through the door, and an island paradise unfolded around us! Tropical music, fun drinks, servers wearing brightly patterned clothing, it was all so meticulously created. We immediately ordered two appetizers, the coconut shrimp and the crispy rice bowl. The food came out in a timely manner, and was AMAZINGLY fresh! The rice bowl was my favorite, it was unique and spicy and full of wonderful flavors! We didn't get any fancy drinks (since we were on a schedule) and just opted for Hawaiian beer instead, which was delicious as well! All in all everything was wonderful, it was such a fun and unexpected experience, we would definitely go back in a heartbeat!

Brought a friend out of town here to experience a tiki bar. This place is always full at night and on weekends. It is expensive but you do pay for an experience. Ordered the tuna poke and luau chips. I don't recommend getting food here as the portions are small and it is expensive for the size. Drinks were delicious. All in all, a tourist trap that is overpriced but can still be a fun experience in a group of visitors.

Such a fun place to go to on a weekend night, but if you want a table make sure you reserve one before you go or you have to stand at the bar or around it. There happened to be an open table and I grabbed it before they put a reserved sign up. One section of the bar was closed for the evening, I'm not sure why? We ordered the Zombie ($65) which is a huge skull drink with Jamaican and Overproof rum that serves 3-4 people. There is lime, grapefruit, cinnamon and pomegranate in the drink too, the one thing that I did not like about the drink was the cinnamon. It was strong too, of course they had less expensive drinks you could order to but my friends and I had to go big or go home. They do have individual drinks that are $11-& up. It has a cool fun tiki bar vibe and it is confusing to get to. It's located in an alley behind where Google maps takes you. They also have complimentary coat check which was nice.

Since I was in town over the weekend, I decided to check out this speakeasy bar after hearing about it from social media. However, I don't entirely know how I feel about this place.

It's located in an alley way with security guarding the entrance to check for ID. There, you'll enter the door that leads you downstairs to the actual bar. The entire getup of the place is Hawaiian tiki themed, which was pretty cool.

Major downside was the crazy wait that lasted over 2 hours long! I had called earlier to make reservations yet they mentioned it was best to come in person later, and so we did just that. When we arrived I provided them with my number and was notified that when our table was ready I would receive a text. So after we ventured off for dinner, we came back to wait at the crowded bar area. During this point, I received a text during that point stating my table was ready, only to find out they had a "tech issue" and that there was actually no table ready for us even though there were available ones around the room. After some delays and confusion they finally seated us. The service was very uncoordinated.

Plus side, the drinks were good and had nice presentation.

Overall, one time visit was good enough...

Yasssss!!!! First of all, we walked RIGHT by this place. We were walking along, looking for this place when we saw a large alley that had some lights halfway in. It looked super cool but we were determined to try out Three Dots and a Dash...so we walked right by it....only to  double back once we realized that's  a the place! The ambiance is wicked...you go in, walk down some dimly lit stairs adorned with skulls, then through a serene reception and into a bumpin bar! By the time we got there (8pm on a Saturday) there was standing room only but within 10 minutes we got seats at the bar. Our bartender was super skilled and friendly...and not just fake friendly. He told us about how he wants to open a bar, the stories behind his tattoos, etc.

Drinks : we got the tropical itch and the Saturn. I looooved the Saturn and my SO loved his Tropical Itch but it was a bit strong for me! I wish we could have tried more but we were pretty tipsy and the drinks can set you back!

I know there are some party sized drinks so this would be an excellent place for a group ... Just get reservations!

We also tried the Thai chicken bites which were flavourful and a great accompaniment to the drinks. LOVED this place. Highly recommend!
Amazing drinks and strong. I would recommend anyone visiting Chicago or who haven't been there to check it out. Love this place!!!

Their drinks are phenomenal- much care has gone into providing fun presentation and a big dose of liquor per drink. As a tiki bar, their offerings are largely rum-based, and for someone who identifies as a mezcal-tequila person this was a palate-widening experience. Their namesake drink is my favourite. The tuna poke and yucca fries are the perfect accompaniment. But I HAVE to come back with a large group and a reservation so I can sample their share plates and extravagant multi-person drinks! The music is also a plus- we spent part of our time Shazam-ing and adding songs to our Spotify playlists.

I used to come here all the time with my (ex) boyfriend. We would come every weekend for the thai fried chicken ! It is sooooo good and addicting. The sauce on it I could literally drink it is so yummy ! The chicken itself is juicy but my only issue is the portion size :( It is more of an appetizer size and we always ordered two because one order would only work for one us. Next I had big erns poke which was a regular poke on a chip, nothing to special there. Lastly I had the hanali spring rolls which were great to me because I enjoy rolls of all kinds ! I think 6 came in this portion and the dipping sauces are all spot on for what it inside the roll itself.

Drinks: We would always get the chief lapu lapu because it was in a bigger holder and meant for multiple people. The restaurant has now changed that to a single person drink. It is very strong and though I do not enjoy the taste of it very much (I hate passionfruit), it gets me where I need to be ! I have tried a multitude of drinks here and all of them are poured heavy (which I looove).

It is very chill and relaxed here, but there is for sure always a crowd. Best tiki bar around ! Great for small parties and intimate occasions.

You're paying for the atmosphere and the decadently crafted drinks. Vibe is boho Hawaiian, and the drinks are jaw dropping. Natural organic juices with a surprisingly hefty serving of alcohol.  10/10 on presentation, overall atmosphere, and discrete yet lively bar scene. I'd say it's overpriced, but again, you're paying for the locale itself. Service wasn't the best; slightly unorganized as we had a larger party and were missing seats. Nothing in Chicago can compete in terms of marketing a tropical, luau scene with an exquisite drink menu

Here we are walking around with Google maps down a River North alley trying to find Three Dots and - with a backdoor, no signs, ambient blue neons, a bouncer, and crowd control poles. wtf right? Who in the right mind chooses a tiki bar setting going down dark stairs to this like neon lit full bar and literally "basement". It's a weird sensation, like you're on an exotic vacay. Vegas-like, artificial palms, Bloody Mary candles lit in front of wall mirrors. I'm really digging it.

The hostesses? standing at the podium pointed us to the bar. Okay? Now what? The bar was full and there's a few counters facing a mirrored post with tealight candles and reserved tables. Where the hell is the drink menu? Ever walk in and feel like your the loser left out at a party, yep that's how I felt until we scooted into a vacant space at the bar. Once we sat at the bar, it was like a whole different clique that we've joined - the hipster, cool party kids. The bartender - she was a m a z i n g, friendly, and chatty like all bartenders should be. She handed us the drink menu (so that's where it was!) This whole process of getting there and ordering drinks was so mysterious to me. We ordered 3 drinks made with fresh cold pressed juices, in house syrups, and strong premium alcohol. For $14, you'll get your tropical cocktail in a tiki mug decorated the sh*t out with pineapple wedges, pineapple leaves, mint and thai basil sprigs, pirate coins, umbrellas, swanky swizzle sticks, banana chips, cherries...you name it. There's nothing on the drink list that isn't good. I enjoyed the Cheap Lei. If you plan to go for just drinks, go pre-dinner before the crowd picks up. That place is busy everyday, including the weekdays. Definitely have to come back and try other tiki concoctions!

LOVELOVELOVELOVELOVE.

I mean i love tiki bars, but this place is unique and so much fun! I was smart enough to get a late reservation to meet up with my friend in Chicago. The entrance is in an alley way right behind N. Clark so that was a little troublesome, but after that it was smooth sailing.

I would say the cocktails are around $14.

It is loud inside and if you don't have a reservation the bar is a good area to hang out. I went on a Thursday night and it was pretty packed. The drinks are flavorful, come in elaborate cups and designs. The bartenders do a great job here making the experience a 10 out of 10 for every customer.

If you come with a larger group you can get a fishbowl to share among the group.

We definitely left happy and got to try different types of drinks. I would highly recommend this bar and this venue. Our waitress was extremely kind and helpful and provided a wonderful experience!
15 minutes to make a subpar drink that I could've had at trader Todd's for half the price? NO THANKS

I'm in Chicago for a work training and flew in on Monday 9/11, which happens to also be my 30th birthday. Aka, I'm all alone, no big celebration with family and friends, and I'm starving from my 6 hour trip to my hotel. The nearest restaurant that was open near my hotel was this spot. So naturally, I come here, since I'm scared shitless to walk around this foreign neighborhood all alone at night.

I go in asking if I can order to-go. Everyone takes the question by surprise, which I didn't realize was an abnormal question to ask, but I accept realizing this must be more of a drink spot than a food spot, as indicated by the crowd at the bar and the weird hour (10:30pm). Nonetheless, I get some much needed help from the manager who graciously puts in my order and recommends their more popular items, i.e. Cocktails. I want to, cos it's my birthday and I feel like birthday drinks are in order, but decline cos it would only feel more miserable drinking and eating alone in a room where socializing with friends was what brought people there in the first place.

I get my food in less than 5 minutes, even though the manager said it'd be 10-15 minutes. I didn't think much, in fact couldn't wait to get back to my hotel room and munch on the one good meal I'd have in Chicago for my birthday. To my surprise, I get cold noodles that look like rubber band with some veggies and peanut sauce sprinkled on top.

So sad. I was really looking forward to a yummy hot meal. This will be one memorable birthday dinner, too bad it's not one I'll associate well with.

Service: the host was a little impatient. Our waitress at first didn't tend to us in a timely manner but once we expressed our worry she started to come a bit more often.

Food/drinks: the wings were okay. The sauce on the wings is different from what you'd typically expect. It was kind of like the Asian zing for BWW. The drinks are GREAT! Nice, strong and pretty tasty

Location: it's a little tricky to find (since the entry way is in an alley) but once you find it you can be certain you're in the right place because of the lit tiki torches. The music on here says background but it's definitely elevator music. I wish it was something better but I suppose elevator music is the only way to accommodate everyone's taste/not offend anyone.

Ambiance: came on a Wednesday night so it wasn't too busy. My friends and I stayed in the bamboo room and took lots of pics. The candles really set the mood.

I will definitely visit again for drinks with friends.

It was our last night in Chicago and we wanted to go to a place for drinks and dinner. We came across Three Dots and a Dash and I must say I am so happy we went!

It's a hidden spot in an alley that might look like a small joint but honestly the place inside is humongous! It's like stepping into Hawaii without having to fly there! Upon arriving the hostess told us if we didn't have reservations we might not even be seated but we're welcomed to sit at the bar (which normally I hate doing but we were already there and decided to just sit there) Honestly, It has to had been the best bar experience I've had.

The employees are dressed to the theme and so was the whole restaurant and bar. The way they pay attention to detail here is insane.
The food and drinks are almost too pretty to eat/drink! We tried about 4 cocktails (2 of them had sculls which meant extra strong) and the captain Dino's pupu platter. (delicious)
**this isn't one of those places where you come on a budget, everything is so detailed oriented and delicious you will literally get what you pay for** still worth it!
MUST TRY!!

How could I have forgotten to review Three Dots and a Dash?! Perhaps it was the fruity boozy dranks in cute ceramic TIKI ware, or getting the bum's rush from our table by staff, or maybe the Skull wall at the entrance was cursed like the idol in that Brady Bunch episode with Vincent Price...or maybe I just wasn't as impressed by them as they are of themselves.

Make a reservation, or you'll have to stand behind a velvet rope in an alleyway! I loved the skull wall as you walk down the stairs to check in with the Hostess who didn't give two ishes about our reservation.

We were given a warning for our 7:15 reservation that we had to be up and out by 9:00. What? Who does that? Doesn't a dollar equal a dollar, no matter who's paying? We kept those rounds a-coming! The table of two romantics next to us was reminded that their "time" was almost up, at one point.

I liked the decor- the thatched roof bar, where the River North types held court. And our table decor was lovely, and the place appropriately dark. I enjoyed the Jet Pilot, the Painkiller No. 3. We had some appetizers, and they were just okay. Eat beforehand, for sure.

A must go to for a drink.
We went very late.
It's tucked away in a Ally.
Fortunately, they squeezed us in.
One of the best new bars I've been to.
Don't miss it.

I've had a few of their appetizers, and they're all okay - nothing to write home about. The place is always busy which is good, but they always seem understaffed, because it takes way too long to get things. They've been rude to me from time to time. However, the ambiance is super fun and a must-go in chicago. There are a bunch of shareable drink options to order from, makes for a fun night with friends. Everything si slightly pricey, so just know what you're getting into.

Super trendy! We are in our early 40's and felt way above the age curve! We had two drinks, the Painkiller and the Zombie...$35. Drinks were great; atmosphere was unique and fun. Reservations are a must if you want to sit down.

If you can find it you hit the jackpot. It's hidden in an alleyway and very discreet until you stumble upon the tiki torches. You then go down some stairs to come into a Polynesian oasis full of heavily dosed libations that are totally tubular. I enjoyed the pain killer one of my favs as well fan favorite according to our server.

I absolutely love this tiki hideaway! The decor was very mysterious and dark, just like a tiki place should be. The drinks were to die for and the service was excellent. The alleyway atmosphere made it feel like you were going to a secret place. Will be back again the next time. Get the Zombie you won't be sorry, and their signature three dots and a dash !

I love Tiki bars, and this sort of place in general, verily, I could myself a devotee of all things Tiki. When I lived in LA, my neighborhood bar was the source . . . Tiki Ti.

However, I was not that big a fan of 3 ...-  It's a Lettuce outfit, which doesn't doom it by any stretch, it just makes it a little . . .  less interesting. It was pretty touristy - duh, this area. The service is SLOW. Slow. Have I mentioned it gets hella crowded with tourists, so you're going to wait a bit for your drink. Maybe I'll like it a bit better when it gets less popular, but for now it's a bit overwhelming to enjoy your beverage while getting jostled by a buncha people.

This review is not for the food. I wasn't up for waiting the rest of my life for a table.

The drink prices were fine. Expected to be in this range, because these drinks are traditionally BOOZEH. They were good, and had the desired effect, but they were a little too crammed with stuff, fruit, plastic toys . . . yeah, no.

Check out Lost Lake instead for a way more Real Tiki (yeah, I just invented that) experience by a bartender that KNOWS HIS TIKI and has every detail crossed off.

This is the best tiki bar in Chicago! The drinks are huge, beautiful to look at, and strong. It can be very hard to get a seat so I wouldn't go with a big group. You will have to make a reservation weeks ahead of time. But if you go with one friend or significant other, you can wait a little and eventually get a seat at the bar. Can be dance-y later on the evening, which is really fun. Got a hot date after one night out at this place with a friend!

Lovely place with a very nice atmosphere and personnel. The cocktails are exceptional. Some of them are a bit too strong but that's the point, right! I always recommend this place to visitors of the city and like to visit it myself whenever I got a chance

Such a fun place for a quick drink. Didn't have a reservation, but they were able to get us a table for 4 for about an hour which was perfect. Hard to find when you've never been there- it is in a alley behind the listed address, so another restaurant pointed us in the right direction.

Biggest disappointment of my entire trip to Chicago.

Our visit was on Sunday night, about 1.5 hours before stated closing time (2am). We had tried to visit on Saturday but it was too busy & I had to work at 7:30am on Sunday. We were told this establishments was a "must do" by our fellow tiki-loving friends.

We went to the host stand and said "hi, it's our first time here, what do we do?" he handed us a menu & sent us inside. A group of four people before us did the same thing, walked around, saw all the bar seats were full + the open tables were reserved, then left.

My BF went to the bathroom & I found a recently cleaned table, so I sat down. A kind waiter came over to tell me all tables were reserved. I explained that I talked to the host & what was said, then his response was "oh he misunderstood and thought you wanted to join us at our bar" - which had no seats - then was told I had to put my name in.

We went back to the host, had to give my name & number. We couldn't just be seated. I was willing to give it 10 minutes and thankfully got texted in about 3 minutes.

There were about 8 or 10 open tables upon our arrival, more became open as we were there. I only observed ONE table be sat in the entire hour we were there. We left about 30 min before closing. Still more open seats than filled seats & people standing.

I asked the waitress for a recommendation, she said they didn't do that. Referred me back to the menu. We mentioned we were from Atlanta, home of Trader Vic's, so I decided to try their version of their mai tai. I forget what my boyfriend got, but really, both our drinks were meh.

After one sip was decided to cash out so we could head out at our leisure since we were already experiencing such bad service. The waitress NEVER checked on us again. They took our water without refilling it.

The bouncer chased me out thinking I was stealing a mug (we were only given plain glasses & we LOVE tiki mugs) when it was the water bottle I came in with. He apologized, but that was just the icing on a bitter cake.

Why did the host not ask us "would you like the bar or would you like to put your name in for a table?" When someone says they are new, help them. We just came from the Violet Hour, were dressed dapper AF, and the experiences were on opposite from each other. It was a terrible end to what was other a wonderful night.

pics.caption: Can't you tell it's standing room only at 12:30 on a Sunday night?

review.des: Their drinks are AMAZING.
