The place is a little hard to find and the wait can be long (the first time I went there, I thought it was super shady to be walking down an alley by myself only to see a line of people waiting down the other side of the alley). The vibe inside is very laid back and the bartenders are very friendly. It can be hard to order a drink sometimes as the bar is tiny and gets crowded quickly. It can be overwhelming to pick a drink because they all look good (if you can't decide, look at what the bartenders are making- not only is it entertaining to watch them, you can see the fresh ingredients going into the drinks and that might just sway you into getting that drink). BTW the drinks are strong.

Great service and a fun tourist-y area. I will admit it was difficult to find at first via car, but it's like that for a reason! :) The drinks are pretty strong, which for the price, you don't want it watered down lol.
If you come, I HIGHLY RECOMMEND booking a table ahead of time because even on a Thursday night it can get crowded and busy, and sometimes large parties get in the way of single people getting a drink. Otherwise, fortunately I had no problem getting a drink on a Friday evening. It's nice to find a classier establishment downtown so that was excellent.

I brought a group of friends visiting from LA and we had a blast!

The drinks are pricey, but good. They go all out with the presentation of the drinks!

This place will always be a bit special since it was the second date for the gf and I. But our recent return engagement was disappointing.

You're still going to wait a while, and it's still going to be a zoo inside. I inquired about the Boogie Board from my previous review since it was no longer on the menu and nothing else was speaking to me. Figured it couldn't hurt to ask since sometimes places still have the ingredients and will make stuff. The bartender was a super dick about it though. All I received was a curt "stick to the menu, guys" --- not even an I'm sorry, we don't have that anymore, or a suggestion for something that tastes similar.

We left after our one drink, and definitely aren't in a hurry to come back.
Great place for a fun night out, especially for a group. Boozy drinks and good serving size. The glasses are super cute. Just beware, two drinks here will do you good.

This place is awesome! Definitely a must see if you're in the area. You can walk right by the place and not even notice it, so look for the alley with tiki torches. The bartenders are so talented and friendly. The drinks all come decorated in the coolest mugs too!

This place is a must if you are in the Chicago area. Technically its a speakeasy, and is a little hard to find, but if you look for the subtle clues you will be set! Everything about this place is fun, the decor, food, staff and amazing cocktails. You might call in advance to make a reservation, as this place fills up quickly, and make sure to bring cash for the bathroom attendants.
We ended up going here multiple times mainly because there are so many fun and unique things on the menu that we had to try them all, or get as close to doing that as possible. You wont be disappointed!
What a fun atmosphere! We went here with friends after seeing Hamilton. Tucked away in an alley, it is kind of hard to find.  We had a reservation and were seated pretty quickly after arriving.

Finally got to this place after several years of trying but never having the time. This is not your typical come as you are tiki bar. There is a little bit of a dress code and you don't get that same electric loud laughter filled excitement of a place shelling out ample amounts of rum. As a place for a date night, quick bite and drink or a full night out with friends it is more than successful. Be warned though, the drinks, while delicious, are not cheap. You will spend at least $15 for each. The drinks for the groups to share are even more, one being $300. I was a little disappointed that a shared drink was still the same size as an individual one. The layout of the place, decor and the fun entrance make it worth a visit to enjoy, but I would for sure start or end the night there. Allows you the chance to have a few drinks before or after that may break the bank a little less.

It's different than other places in the River North.  The ambiance is great, you walk down creepy stairs with skulls, to enter a dark lite, Tikki like bar.  The drinks are strong, lots of options, or you can create your own.  Prices are decent.  It gets crowded in the evenings, so sometimes difficult to find a table if you want to sit.

My favorite bar in the city. Three Dots might not be for everyone, as it is in a dimly let (yet nicely decorated) basement of sorts with their entrance being located in an alley.  So it takes some work to get there, but it is so worth it.

They primarily serve expertly crafted tropical drinks. Being there really reminded me of my time in Hawai'i. Don't let the tiny umbrella or flower on the side of your glass fool you...these drinks pack a punch.  (The drink's strength is indicated by a skull image on the menu). All of them are delicious in their own way though.

Here is the breakdown:
0 skulls = tame, I just want to chill with my beverage
1 skull = that chubby girl is starting to look good
2 skulls = call a cab

There is a food menu, and everything we tried was good. It seems to be a popular place, reservations are recommended if you want to grab a table. Don't be dissuaded by the alley/basement location...there are tiki torches to light your way and it is well worth the journey!

Protip: Ask for Danny at the bar. He's awesome and will take very good care of you.

Three Dots and a Dash...a name I've heard countless times as of late. A restaurant many people placed on a high and mighty pedestal, which fed my curiosity to no end. Last night I was finally able to experience what all the hype surrounding this joint was about, and between you and me...the hype was well meant.

Talk about exclusive when the entrance to Three Dots is located in an alley that leads to a below ground floor full of neon lights and a wall of skull heads. I can imagine this place gets pretty busy on the weekends or even late night, but thankfully on a Tuesday evening, there was room where we can sit and enjoy our drinks at a moderate pace.

God, the interior was magnificent. Loved the tiki-bar style they were going to, and the music was at just the right amount of volume where I can actually socialize without straining my vocal chords.

The drinks on the menu all looked lovely. Filled in these great looking cups and mugs (some you can buy, by the way), for the price you're paying it's not all that bad. I had the Long Walk on a Short Pier, which was mainly a tequila based drink, but it had everything that was great about a cocktail: a perfect balance of juice and alcohol mixed into one that tastes like something you've never had before at any bar. Love it. Can't wait to try the rest of their drinks.

They also have these crazy group drinks that can serve up to 8 people. (That treasure chest drink is almost $400...!!! Jesus Christ..)

Food looks okay, but I didn't have any. This place is all about the drinks in my eyes. Great, attentive service who will help you out if you're having trouble on choosing what to drink or even navigating their menu.

Overall, Three Dots and a Dash is perfect for a hang out, a date, a party, whatever. This is really turning to become a Chicago favorite, and I can see why!

This place can be hard to find. I actually save up locating this place when I first tried years ago. I tried again with a friend recently on a Friday night and found the secret door that leads you in. It's in basement and the place is fairly crowded.

My friend and I sat on bars and ordered a few appetizers and drinks. I don't remember the drinks but all of their signature drinks looked interesting, creative, and well presented.

Most of people here were young professionals (since it's in the loop) who looked like they just got off work and looked like they came with coworkers. That said, this is not dancing floor or a place for heavy drinking in case anyone is wondering :)
Dude, awesomeness if you're trying the tropical drinks. The Bali Bali is great for two or three. This is a really good date spot.

One of my favorite spots for tiki drinks in Chicago. The drinks are always tasty and strong.
The pain killers is one of my favorites, Mai tai is very good also.

I would recommend coming right when they open, otherwise the lines can get long or it's super packed inside. Best to get an reservation for a table though if you want a guaranteed seat and no wait , as it is almost impossible to have a place to stand on weekends.

The entrance is in an alley way between illinois and Hubbard north south and Clark and Dearborn east and west. It's discreet location reminds me of High five ramen( being underground and hard to find )

If you like tiki drinks that are well made and strong, Lost lake is the sister bar of this establishment and makes great drinks too.

Three Dots is a great bucket list item if your a Chicago local or someone from out of town looking for a kitschy bar for a fun/casual night. Drinks are  pricey, you pay for the ambiance.  The food items are good as well, but also overpriced.  Definitely go if you don't have to wait long.  My experience was, we had reservations, and STILL waited over an hour to get a seat.

That being said, their service is unparalleled.  To make up for the insane wait, they gave us all our food items for free and even included one free drink.  Would definitely go back if I didn't have to wait forever to get in.

I came here just to check the ambiance it is very nice but when I came it was basically empty.  I will come back next time but I will come on public transportation to enjoy all of the wonderful drinks.
Awesome place, great ambience, a spectacular grand dame of tiki bars.  Truly a must see!!!!  Service was great. Everybody was really polite and nice. It was just great!

Such a cool bar hidden in a River North alley.  You have to go around the corner and look for a little blue and pink light in the alley which will lead you down a dark set of stairs to the restaurant.  Sounds creepy but I swear it's worth the adventure!

The drinks are phenomenal and creative.  With the tiki bar theme there are all kinds of fun cocktails.  You can even get a giant drink bowl to share with other people.  I was on a bachelorette party with about 12 people and we shared the Bali Bali and The Zombie.  Also known as fire and ice.  The Bali Bali consisted of dry ice so it was smoking.  The flavor was pretty sweet.  The waitress lit the Zombie on fire so it was burning as we were drinking it.  This one tasted similar to fireball so more spicy but still delicious.

Didn't get a chance to try the food but the dark underground atmosphere is totally worth coming back for.

I don't even leave bad yelp reviews anymore as a personal moral choice.  However the behavior and attitudes on the staff here on a Thursday at 9 pm are beyond my level of tolerance.  Dan the dude in charge of "policing the tables" and hostess shruti vacillated between rude, vacant and straight bad at their job.  

I'm a fan and supporter of lettuce entertain you restaurants and bars.  I was just telling my friend during dinner at ema how lettuce is known for service first and foremost.  Since it's inception, 3 dots has been an exception to this rule.

My hubby and I were in Chicago for only 1 day/night. Three Dots and a Dash was a *must* on our list. I heard about it on Yelp (of course) and knew that this tiki bar would be right up our alley. We've been to Tonga Room in San Fran and other tiki bars all over the Hawaiian Islands, so I was curious to see how Chitown throws down in the tiki bar department... and man, they delivered!

The ambiance, decor, and drinks were amazing! The prices are pretty spot on, too (average $12-14 per drink). Shout out to Scott for being friendly and personable! I had the Aloha Felicia (YAS), Banana Daiquiri, and Painkiller. Honestly, I wanted to try every drink on the menu, but I had a deep dish calling my name down the street. Next time, V... next time!
Great cocktails, a little pricey but the atmosphere really makes you think you are at a tiki bar in an island somewhere else.
Soooo fun and an amazing atmosphere!! Didn't have much standing room at the bar so make sure to arrive early or secure a table first!

Super cool tiki bar hidden in the middle of Chicago. Love bringing people here but personally think the drinks are a bit too sweet for me. Even the ones they describe as not sweet, end up giving me a headache by the end of the night. Fun place to hang out with friend though!!

For a tiki bar, this place is in the more modern tiki genre. Well lit, more modern music and not as much of the flotsam-jetsam decor you see in other tiki bars.
The drinks are well made and there should be an expectation that good drinks take time to make. However, the service can be kind of slow here.

Who doesn't love getting really drunk on beautiful, strong, tiki drinks?!?

Even if you're not a big drinker, this bar is very whimsical and fun. There is a drink for everyone on this menu.

Be prepared: this is a Chicago Hot Spot, and can be crowded with Bachelorette parties, big birthday tables and tourists having fun. Be nice, be patient... the drinks are totally worth it!

Super instagramable. You'll love it!

This place doesn't Match the hype. There isn't a food menu not even for snacks while you drink your liver away. Some carbs would be helpful. The drinks are exotic looking but for people that enjoy tasting the alcohol, this place is not for you. Definitely a good chill spot for a group of girls After they ate dinner and are ready to experiment with drinks.

The drinks are fun. Be careful though, they are pretty strong and before you know it, blam, you might end up face down on the floor.

The group sized drinks look fun but ya gotta get everyone to agree to a flavor which can be hard.

Definitely a fun spot.

Be sure to go around to the ally to enter. There are tiki torches by the entrance.

I love this cocktail bar!! They are reasonably-priced and are massive portions. They also come in cute decorative mugs. Each cocktail looks like a piece of art and tastes delicious! The skulls on the menu are there for a reason--those cocktails are STRONG! I had a Bourbon Special and it was not for the faint of heart! The ambience is fun and the decor is adorable. The only issue I had was that the floor was pretty sticky, but most bars have sticky floors so it's not the biggest deal in the world.

The wait staff was very friendly, same with the hostesses. If you go after 8pm, though be sure to call ahead and make a reservation because it gets very crowded. I didn't get one of the shared drinks, but they seem fun for larger groups!

I really like this place. It's trendy, fun, and has great cocktails. Be sure to remember that it's in the alley behind Firecakes donuts! We almost didn't go because we couldn't find it. Good thing we called and asked for directions!

Maybe I went in with too high of expectations, but the drinks here were god awful. Yeah, they look pretty - but even getting a drink that boasts watermelon and peach...it still tasted like the one with the absinthe and 151 proof rum...in other words, like gasoline. The DJ was good. The seating situation was stupid. Felt like a tourist trap.

I haven't been since they re-did their menu, but I went here a few times before that and the drinks and food were all delicious. You also can't beat the atmosphere (it's all underground) and the "secret" entrance off the Main Street. It's a great place to take out-of-town visitors to show them something unique to the city.

Overpriced. That's what this place is. I liked it for what it was but I would never come back.

The entrance is a little hard to find but I think that was on purpose. Entrance is in an alley way, so it can be a little tricky to find. Once you enter you walk downstairs and are greeted by blue-lit skulls. Very cool entrance! Then you enter in a dimly lit tropical paradise and a host seats you. You're given a menu. Food here is stupid expensive. Eat beforehand, that's my advice. But let's be real, no one comes here for food. It's all about the drinks.

Drink menu is extensive. So hard to choose only one drink. The cups and the concoctions are beautiful. Caution, all drinks are strong AS FUUUUH. Really strong. Drinks are not for the faint-hearted.

Overall I enjoyed my experience and it was everything I imagined it to be. Definitely worth checking out this place if you're into cool cocktails.

THREE DOTS AND A DASH IS INCREDIBLE. I would frequent this bar if I lived in Chicago. The drinks are unique and the atmosphere was so fun. I highly suggest to anyone looking for a fun date or wanting to try a new bar. You might have to wait in the alley beforehand because this bar is always packed!
Fun spot to get away from the norm. Love how they decorate the cups! Makes me want to run away to Hawaii!

Fun and freaky, traditional tiki at its FINEST! I've been an avid follower of these guys on Instagram and after years of obsessing, decided to make the trip from Atlanta to check it out! Let me just tell you folks, Three Dots and a Dash did NOT disappoint! Every dreamy drink I put to my lips was better than the last, the poke- pretty perfect and the heartfelt service by bartender Chris... intuitive and impeccable! We went fairly early on a rainy Monday, had no wait and found two seats at a very occupied by bar which we heard was rare! The ambiance sweeps you away to a 70's-esque South Seas escape with bamboo accents, up-lit tiki masks and pops of Polynesian kitsch around every corner. I see people commenting on drink prices but these are authentic tiki drinks, hand-crafted with premium ingredients and I actually thought they were UNDER priced for what they were. They are not just drinks- they are experiences! From the custom tiki mugs they are crafted in, to interactive elements such as fire and dry ice, to the gobs of garnish and swizzle sticks each drink is topped with, $14 bucks is a steal! If you are a Rum head, this is your spot! Literally, hundreds of beautiful rums to choose from! We also can't say enough about custom cocktail crafter, Chris! Watching him create cocktails, interact with his guests and gleefully taking our picture requests for Instagram for about a thousand times was a joy! He appreciated how much we were enjoying our experience and as a former service industry professional, that truly touched me! Please pass my compliments on! Thank you Three Dots and a Dash for making my instadreams turn into a tiki studded reality- I am craving your clamshell cocktail now just writing this review! Can't wait to get back to you guys and keep up the awesome work!

I love a good tiki bar and I've been to quite a few. Three Dots and a Dash in comparison to others is just alright. The tiki motif is great, its a cool space and the staff is awesome (I give them 5 stars)! Is it worth waiting in line all night to sip on $15 drinks in a jam packed place? No.
There are tiki bars elsewhere with better tiki drinks at lower prices that you can actually sip slow, relax and enjoy. I've been here once, I'd go again but I'm not dying to get back there.

I love this place. I enjoy the drinks, I like the atmosphere, & I like the service here as well.
The bar/lounge is Tiki themed and even the drinks are too, so you cant help but want to take pictures of everything. The prices for the drinks are a little high like $15+ , but totally worth it because the taste and presentation is just so cool. Three Dots is just such a nice little chill spot for drinks with friends, or a nice place for a first date. I will continue to come here & I could recommend this place to others as well.

This is one of Chicago's hidden gems. You literally have to follow colored lighting and flaming tiki torches down a dark back alley to get to the entrance. The dimly lit stairwell is decorated with a wall of skulls, but when you get downstairs to the bar you are transported to a vintage Polynesian hideaway. The drinks are STRONG and Hawaiian shirts are encouraged.

Still can't bring myself to re-visit this place even after years of being there with a group of friends. A friend of mine visited it recently with a date and still said it was sub-par.

We still agree after years of friendship that Hala Kahiki is still the way to go.... Sorry.

So to start with I LOVE tiki drinks that are properly done so this is a bit biased I suppose.  The drinks were awesome, the food was good (appetizers only and fried for the most part), service was great and ambiance perfect for a tiki bar.  We had a couple of drinks to share and moved on to individual drinks.  We had reservations at another restaurant but were enjoying ourselves so much that we cancelled that and ordered appetizers.  Fun place to go.  I hope to be back again!

The week before going to Chicago I was flipping through the Television channels and came across an episode on America's best speakeasy bars. Three Dots and a Dash was one of the speakeasy bars featured in the program and I instantly bookmarked the location for my upcoming trip.

Tip: if you are coming here on a Saturday night make sure to make a reservation, if you don't you will have to stand by the mounts of people by the bar and if you're lucky you'll hopefully get to the front of the bar to order a drink. You also get to skip the long line with your reservation.

You will find Three Dots and a Dash through an alley and when you spot the blue neon light and the bodyguard you are in the right place. Once you go through the doors you will go down the hallway, down the stairs and then another hallway, very hidden, dark and mysterious like all speakeasy bars.

I forgot to make a reservation but the line moved rather quickly, once inside we asked for a table and they said tables are only for reservations. We headed to the bar and after 10 minutes waiting to get a drink we decided to just leave, I was disappointed I really wanted to try their tiki drinks. As I was leaving I approached the hostess and said if I can make a reservation for the next day since we wanted to sit down to enjoy our drinks. Luckily for the boyfriend and I; the manager was there and said to the hostess to sit us down by the back end of the restaurant, WINNING.
We ordered 2 rounds of drinks to share: 'Chief Lapu Lapu' that consisted of aged rum, dark rum, passion fruit, lime and tangerine. It comes with crushed iced with a pineapple filled with dry ice. Very cool and tasted really tropical. We also got the coconut shrimp that came with 4 different sauces.
The décor is outstanding; with anything tiki all over the walls, intimate setting and all around great music. They even give you a luau if it's your first time there. We didn't get it but we saw the people next to us get it.

I highly recommend it to anyone visiting in town, great food, drinks, atmosphere and outstanding hospitality.

pics.caption: Sauces for the Coco's Coconut Shrimp

review.des: Great drink spot. Gets really crowded on the wkends is the only downside. Hard to go wrong with anything on the menu for drinks. Never actually ate here so no clue what the food is like.

I love the atmosphere of this place, as long as I have a booth along the wall; make reservations FAR in advance. The bar area is usually very congested and people can be a bit pushy for space due to the poor setup.

The food is unique and the cocktails are very original. Certainly recommend the shared cocktails with dry ice, and a flare for presentation.

Great booze.
Difficult to find, not really a speakeasy, just a hard to find, down the alley entrance.

Fun experience, expensive over-priced hipster drinks. Definitely don't come here to eat. But a late night drunken experience is apropos.
Delicious drinks and fun atmosphere! Get's very crowded, and took a while to order drinks, but loved watching the bartenders in action. Love that it's hidden and somewhat mysterious.

Super cool basement tiki bar! We had reservations at 11PM on a Friday night and I'm definitely glad we did -- otherwise it's standing room only. Absolutely loved how unique the drink menu was. I would say the drinks are overall overpriced but about what one should expect in downtown Chicago. Great atmosphere and great DJ. We'll definitely be back!

I hope you like rum!!! Because that's all they serve here. This bar has a ton of different types of rum and they offer them in both sweet and savory, super strong and slightly less strong, drinks. My friends and I had little difficultly getting a seat on a Wednesday night and it didn't feel overcrowded at all. I got the Three Dots and a Dash ($14) to drink and my friend got the Demerara Dry Float ($14). I'm not gonna lie, I'm not too big a fan of rum and didn't realize this was a rum-only bar, but my drink was pretty enjoyable--however, a bit overpriced. I feel like I'm being charged extra for the container, which is a bit lame. Overall a great atmosphere and fun spot for a couple of drinks if you're feeling "spend-y."

pics.caption: Three Dots and a Dash ($14) Good if rum isn't typically your first pick for spirits.
Skull wall at the entrance and blue lighting is fantastic
Three Dots and a Dash ($14) Good if rum isn't typically your first pick for spirits.

review.des: Went here on a whim with my boyfriend after work. It was so cool going through the secret entrance. The vibe was so nice and laid back. We had a really cool shareable drink that remained on fire the whole time. Our waitress was super knowledgeable and really nice. We will definitely be coming back and recommending this place to all of our friends.

Hard to find this place the very first time. But worth the search. Love their fancy drinks! The atmosphere is pretty awesome too. You can be casual or dressy. Difficult to find a table it's usually busy. Just once out of so many visits have I got a table without reservation.
Overrated drinks & too crowded at the bar area as people start to cut over to the table area where people reserved for.

My friend and I were visiting from Minneapolis on a whim. We had never done bar life in Chicago, but Three Dots and a Dash was recommended to us.

At first it was hard to find because the entrance is in an alley way with blue torches lighting the door. It's underground in a dark room with awesome tiki vibes.

We had an AMAZING time! The bartenders are all super cool, especially Alex. He was probably the best bartender I've ever had - super funny, fast, and amusing.

Drinks are a bit expensive, but definitely worth the experience. I highly recommend Missionary's Downfall. It's super tasty! The Three Dots and a Dash was a bit too heavy (in alcohol) for me. Banana Daiquiri was a favorite! They put half a banana in your drink and shape it into a dolphin. The poblano escobar was great! The spice hits you like a wave. It's not for everyone, but if you like spice and trying new things - definitely try this out!

We will be coming back every. single. time. we visit!

Such a fun place! For being underground, it's a big, open bar that doesn't make you feel claustrophobic at all. The tiki theme is fun and is carried out well.

Great drink choices with individual options all the way through shareable group options. We got the Bali Bali and the Zombie, both delicious with perfect presentation.

This is a go to place if you've never been. I would recommend a reservation so you can have a table and a place to rest the large drinks.

Favorite tropical themed bar ever! The service is always great, the location is fantastic and somewhat hidden which makes it an even better bar. Great for groups, dates etc. Cocktails are crazy good and the cups are amazing, it is definitely an experience I would recommend to everyone living in Chicago or visiting. Food is great also!
I felt like I was in an SNL sketch about people trying to be really cool even and pretending to look comfortable even though they're crammed together at tiny mouse tables.

This place was nightmarishly crowded. I came here for my birthday and there were so many people standing at the bar that I just wasn't getting served anytime soon. Though I didn't get a chance to try anything here, it looked like a fun place. However, it was extremely dark and the menus were sticky and gross. Maybe another time.

Been drinking heavily for years, slam any kind of liquor and not feel a damn thing and I drink my shit straight. Had one cobras fang and I had a slight buzz as I left the bar which progressively got better as time went on. 5 fucking stars and congratulations on making an outstanding fucking drink

Cute fun place! Drinks are instagram worthy... if the lighting wasn't so dark! But very presentable.

My waitress was very nice and informed about the drinks and described the taste also.

Love how you can purchase their mugs that they made. I actually purchased one for myself hehe.

It is pricey here and it's hidden.

Entrance is in the ally way

My very first tiki bar experience, and I had such a great time here!

We came on a Saturday night and I was super excited to try the "secret entrance" lmao. As soon as I walked inside, I was really impressed by the decor, music, and ambiance. I also loved that all the staff were in tropical attire too! It's always so fun when the whole bar has that atmosphere.

The drinks were great too! I forgot the name but I got the one in the coconut bottle. Their drinks are all definitely on the sweet side but this one was a little too bitter, so I tried the one in the skull bottle with the foam coming out. That one was excellent. I also loved that they had fruit as their decor LOL.

It was pretty busy so we kind of had to fight to get to the front haha but it was worth it once we got our drinks. There was also a little area to dance on the side which was awesome cause I love bars with dance space.

Overall, I had a great experience here.

Walking in you truly feel like you're in Hawaii which is very hard to imagine since we're in Chicago! They have the perfect background music that makes it very pleasant to be there. Our server was very nice and knew the drinks like the back of her hand. The presentation is beautiful and the drinks are deliciously strong it's should be illegal!!! After my 3rd one I was feeling way too good ;) All in all if I were to find myself in Chicago again this would definitely be a place I'd love to visit again.

pics.caption: "Aloha Felicia" & "strip and go naked" were my drinks

review.des: Great place for drinks and decent food! The drinks are very pricey, and fairly sugary, but that's probably to be expected from a place like this. Overall, lots of fun, love the ambiance.

This place is fun for a drink with a group of people. Not the place to go to solo like a "typical" speakeasy.
Whenever friends come to town I take them here because the entrance and esthetic of the whole place is just neat.

Loved this place! The theme is super fun and I love that all of their drinks come in cool cups too (Just like what the menu looks like). Some tables got massive shared drinks, mostly in fish bowls with really long bendy straws, but there was one table that had a treasure chest! A TREASURE CHEST FULL OF ALCOHOL! And the waitress even poured an additional bottle of Dom Perignon in it! It was madness and hella fun.

Can't remember what drink I got but it was so delicious with notes of mango and pineapple. I tried some of the other drinks but think I liked mine the best. Wish we stayed longer because the DJ was spinning some cool tunes, but it seemed like it was going to be forever until we got a table despite it being super early like 8 or 9. I think the drinks were also on the pricier side, about 15-20$ each (hence the deducted star), but maybe that's average in Chicago.
If you're all about tiki bars then this is the place for you. The food is pretty decent but it is more about the ambiance and sharing the crazy drinks. Definitely a fun spot to go with friends!

Somewhat crammed on weekends and the bar was difficult to reach. Drinks were good, but as with most tiki drinks, even if requesting light on the sweet, it still come out syrup heavy. Otherwise, cool place to say you've tried, but not a place I will be going back to anytime soon. So many speakeasy options it's hard to settle for average experience. #cheers

This place is so popular and always packed. A hidden gem that's been on my list to visit for a while. Love the ambiance (dark & cozy) and its laid back. It was hard to locate due to the entry being in a alley.

We stumbled upon this place after eating at The Gilt Bar.
It sort of has a speakeasy vibe to it since the entrance is from a side alley and there are stairs going down.

The entrance is covered in skulls (not real lol), and after a small hallway we walked into this tiki bar that was full of great Hawaiian decorations and drinks. We decided to go straight to the bar and order our drinks there instead of sitting in a booth or table. Plus, we figured we'd get a better vibe and know more about the bar that way.
The bartenders were very nice, polite and quick in taking orders. Our friends were recommended to get the Aloha Felicia and Three Dots And A Dash. Our bartender suggested we get a "pitcher" like drink where we can share. So we agreed. A few minutes later we see this giant sea shell like bowl coming our way with smoke dripping out of it and all sorts of different decorations on and around it. The whole bar turned towards us imminently, and as always, flashes went off! It was such a unique and fancy drink. The bartenders told us the name of the drink is Chief Lapu Lapu, and it contains aged Demerara Rum, Dark Jamaican Rum, Passion Fruit, Lime and Tangerine. It was absolutely delicious!! It was so refreshing and so unique tasting. I had never drank anything like it before..taste and look wise.

The DJ was great. He was playing a lot of old school jams and the crowd was loving it!
Over all our experience at Three Dots and a Dash was great! We danced, we laughed, we had awesome drinks... what more can you ask for? :)

People here are racists, especially the guy with beard standing outside. Despite of having a valid Indian Passport, this stupid uneducated Brut didn't let my wife into the bar. He was asking for a Credit card with her name on it. This sounds ridiculous. I have been to many bars but haven't experienced this kind of nasty behavior. When we ask for a reason, the racisit dum ass started shouting at us.

Note: That one beard guy is degarding this bar. This is not the way you behave. I request the bar management to first teach your employees some manners.

It's a tiki bar with an alleyway entrance. They take reservations which if you aren't just stopping by you should probably make one. Food is ok, but their cocktails are actually hit or miss. I tried a couple of them and what I find is that they are actually inconsistently making them. If you are a rum person they have plenty of them.

All in all it's a lot of work in creating a nice atmosphere but everything else is wanting for outstanding implementation.

Extremely busy on weekends. I was not prepared to stand , and hold my cold drink in my hand. While it's not the end of the world it's also not what I pictured.

The drinks, however, were really good. I'm a light weight so maybe I'm not the best person to ask, but I thought  the drinks were strong. As they should be considering the price.

I'm glad I tried this place out, and would probably only go back if I had family coming in from out of town. The ambience is super cute with drinks to match. Definitely memorable.

The best. 5-stars all the way.  Had the Saturn cocktail and pu pu plater thing. Everything was so awesome and the place looked like something out of Disney it was decorated and lighted so well.  The Wait staff super nice.  Be back soon!

I love this kitschy little spot in River North.
The skulls you see lining up the wall as you walk down the stairs I think pretty much sums up what you're in store for.
Very strong drinks!! I def underestimated the strength of these concoctions so will warn others to eat while drinking. The food here is good but definitely more of a bar than anything else. I recommend it to visitors looking to get away from the traditional steak and scotch of down town Chicago.

We really enjoyed this place.  I was not sure what we were getting into when we walked down the alley and stairs.  

It is a great modern Tiki space.  It is not done in a classic style, but more a homage.  There is a lot of space which was nice.

The drinks were great.  It took us back to the Islands; fresh fruit, rum, and the mix of herbs and flowers.  Our bartender seemed very knowledgable about the Tiki culture and was very friendly.

We did not eat anything, but the food did look good.

Three Dots & a Dash is my first tiki bar, and I loved it! Everything from the decor to the drinks to the glassware is well thought out and fits perfectly with the theme. You really do feel like you've been transported to an island in the Caribbean.

My friends and I came here when it was busy, so we did not have to wait. However, I can definitely see this place as another Chicago hot spot with a long wait, so make reservations if you can! There also seems to be a strict dress code, so make sure to dress appropriately.

Now, let's move on the drinks. The drinks here are about $12+, which is a little pricey but appropriate given the presentation and place. Our server did a great job of breaking down the menu for us. There's going to be a little bit of everything for everyone. There's sweet / fruity and strong / robust and everything in between. There's even these crazy group drinks that are in the hundreds and supposedly super popular.

Favorite? Missionary's Downfall. This drink is light, slightly sweet and overall, super refreshing and easy to drink.

I also tried the Painkiller, Aloha Felicia and Dead Reckoning which were all good. The Painkiller is sweet and also has a slightly strong alcohol taste. The Aloha Felicia has coconut creme which isn't as heavy as it sounds but will still be creamy - overall an interesting drink which might not be for everyone!

pics.caption: Left to right: Aloha Felicia, Painkiller, Missionary's Downfall, Dead Reckoning

review.des:
I love this place. Very nice place with an interesting variety of cocktails! Unusual "tropical" style serving and design in general!
Better to reserve a table beforehand, even bars are usually overcrowded! We waited for at least an hour to get the table on Saturday.
Btw, music is relatively loud, no dance-pole.
Highly recommend!!!

A completely unexpected place in hidden basement in downtown Chicago.
It was a sunday night, on 4th of July weekend, and there was a ~1h line to get inside!
Once you are in it is a huge surprise! The decor is all themed in a tropical style!
Drinks are pricy but super good and large. The cups are super cool! I wish I could bring them home!

YALLLLLLL! This place is crazy awesome. I HIGHLY suggest you make a reservation as the line outside can get really long. Even with our reservation we had to wait a bit because people were lingering. HOWEVER! It was great. The drinks are delicious and strong and the wait staff was on top of it.

The group I was with wanted to go here and I tagged along never having had the chance to check it out. There was no wait, which was nice (was a bit rainy out). We only got drinks and stood at the bar. With how many of us we covered pretty much the whole menu so I got to try a wide variety. They were all so so sweet and if guess what I should have expected maybe? For the prices I won't go back again but I'm glad to see they've changed the menu since I went.

Innovative cocktails, great service and beautiful decor!
Not many food options. To bypass the long queue, we went during late afternoon.

I take friends here every time they visit Chicago!! It's a fun, back alley bar with amazing drinks! It's super crowded in not a large space which sucks - I wish they wouldn't have so many tables up because it makes everyone crowd the bar and then it's difficult to get drinks. As an experience, however, it's perfect for first timers to a big city!
It's off in the cut. Looks a little sketchy but a great place for these brutal Chicago winters. MAKE A RESERVATION! I can't stress that enough. Also don't exceed two drinks...they'll sneak up on you.

The entrance is in the ally behind North Clark Street.

Grabbed a drink over at Three Dots and a Dash recently with a friend. The place has a very cool look to it, and is not your normal Tiki bar. My normal Tiki bar has a very relaxed feel -- this place has a very upbeat and almost rocker Tiki feel. The atmosphere is also dark, has a huge wall of skulls on the way in. Pretty solid.

The drinks are priced like cocktails in a city, but you're getting some bang for your buck. Not only do they come in awesome themed cups/jars/glasses, they are potent. Very potent. Very worth it. If you like rum, you'll like it here. I did not partake in the food menu, but it looked good.

Seating is a bit harder to come by but if you're willing to throw some elbows, you'll be good.

This place is literally terrible. I came for a friend's party last night. The drinks are overpriced and the staff is extremely rude. As a Chicagoan of over 12 years and a former bartender at a successful Lincoln Park establishment, I know the restaurant and hospitality scene well and I just find Three Dots a waste of time especially for a Lettuce establishment! I am a big fan of Beatrix and I am shocked about how wrong they went with Three Dots. Never again!

Hole in an alley; upscale bar. This place offers assuring and almost Hawaiian ambiance. Everyone is dressed like a tiki and their drinks come in fruit shaped glass.

Drinks are top notch and priced at rape. They categorize their cocktails by skulls. More skulls meaning more alcohol content.
Being the alcoholic that I am, I opted for the double skull. I ended up chugging the whole thing but before I indulged, the savor was unique and honestly not too bad. You can 100% taste the alcohol, but somehow they were able to find a good balance between the "yuck-face" and "hey, its not so bad"

I believe I got a drink called Tropical Tiki for those wanting to try. I do personally like the moscow mule which they didnt offer but I did see items with ginger flavor. If I ever end up back here, i'll definitely shoot down one of those.

P.S. The crowd seems like everyone is just talking about the next corporate news/secret/wedding/fancy-schmancy. We were there thinking how to get railed. NOT THE PLACE TO BE TRASHY.

Incredible, we have been to many tiki bars and this place was amazing. The devils hands is one of the best drinks I have ever had, hands down! It uses a centrifuge to make it! You can't get that many places. We bought a Fiji mermaid glass. It is awesome. Any of the glasses that don't have the bars name on it though can be bought from online retailers for 6$ we spent 30 for a pilot glass that we later found was online. But the Fiji was worth it. The nicest staff, sat us though they were full, and were nothing but nice and professional.

Go! You won't regret it. Worth the 4 hour drive just for them.

This is really not my type of bar.  If you like sugary drinks then go here.  The cocktails remind me of the daily special mixed drink at a shitty all inclusive Mexico resort that you found on Groupon.  The luau schtick is lame.  Go here for Instagram pictures not good cocktails.  People actually wait in line to get in here, no place is ever worth that, sad.

First trip here in Chicago, where we had great food at Nando's, more fun at Navy Pier and Harry Cary's.
We pushed our luck with this place, should have gone elsewhere!
Running
It is in an alley, so it seems cool, speakeasy-ish, but you get inside and it feels like Kon Tiki.  Super crowded on Friday at 9:15, but tiki our party of 8 was seated  in 10 minutes...so far pretty good!

We had gotten our fun looking drinks at the bar ($14-16/each), so we sat down and looked at a menu full of group drinks, some over $80, but only about 13 food choices (including appetizers!!!!).   I should have looked at the menu.  

Do NOT come here to eat!  Caribbean cocktails are nice to look at but not really good.  Strong but not great.  

A member of our party had a shellfish allergy and we asked if there were shrimp in the egg rolls so she could have one of ours.  "No, but they are cooked in same fryer as shrimp, I will get you some not cooked like that!" Sound liken she was being nice, even when our friend said no thank you, she insisted (only to charge us later for the extra order).

It took over an hour to get the food and we had to ask for water constantly .  Our main order took forever and the temperature inside was way hotter than out, which made the slow service seem even slower.

We asked for split checksdr and were told they don't do that.  Well, that was a MESS!  Then they said we were short $11.00, that was the extra spring roll order we did not order.

I would give it a one, but the food wasn't bad and the set up was cool. Just be prepared to pony up for a drink($14 plus 11% tax and tip was more...making one cocktail about $18 or so)!!

Save your money, you will burn up in there! Poor service, very limited menu for food, overcharged and called out as short paying when they delivered something we didn't ask for.

meh. drinks were fine, I didn't think they were that strong, just more on the sugary and sweet side (for this I gave a star because while it's not my thing, I think for most people it would be a hit because they were generally tasty and well balanced in flavor for cocktails). hella crowded- I wasn't even waiting for a table but the group of people standing next to us were wondering why it was taking so long to get one; and it was annoying standing around with so little space and the people working kept trying to push everyone towards the center of the room (minus 1.5 stars). my friends and I got the "Intro to Agricole," "Never Say Die," and "Caribbean Punch." I feel the drinks were on the pricey side ($12-$16) for not really that much drink in the mugs (minus half a star). I have to say though, the mugs they keep the drinks in are pretty cool looking and the garnish they put in them are A++, making them look even nicer (plus one star). Chill vibe, nicely decorated and designed tiki bar (plus one star). It's not going to be my go-to place, but I would go back on (rare) occasion if my friends really wanted to go.

pics.caption: Never Say Die in all of its skull glory
Never Say Die, Intro to Agricole, and Caribbean Punch- really cool mugs and nice garnish

review.des:
That's my personal way to visit Hawaii without leave Chicago.
I'd describe this experience as an a magic experience. It's a little bit of "Harry Potter" with "Big trouble in Little China".
You are in the middle of the madness Downtown Chicago and decide to get away from the crowd, so you find yourself in a alley just like in "little China". You start to get into the "Harry Potter" mood once you see that doors with two torches on the sides. You get into the building and face right away a skull wall bringing you downstairs making you feel that you're going to be drag to the hell and this is when the magic happens: you are ar Hawaii! Aloha!
The place is magical, full of life, people, surrounded by great Hawaiian music and lots of amazing appetizers and drinks.
You choose from hot to cold, from fire to ice. The atmosphere is just amazing and relaxing and makes you leave all your problems behind.
This was my second time here and I can't wait to come back.
The customer service is also a blast!
I highly recommend one of the drinks that serves up to four people.
A place that you'd never forget!

A favorite amongst my friends, we often start the night in this hip, tiki themed bar. The vibe is cool and the drinks are fresh.
The first time I went here was the first bar I went to when I turned 21! That's how badly I wanted to try it out. The line was long and it was December, but it took us less than 20 mins to get in. I got the banana daiquiri and it was super yummy!
I've been here at least two more times. One of those times I got the mai tai. I usually don't order this drink but..loved it!
Drinks are at least $12+ which is a bit of a splurge, but worth it! I usually only buy one here and then go off somewhere else.

Will definitely recommend this place to other friends or out-of-towners.

pics.caption: Mai tai - one of the stronger drinks

review.des: Drinks taste like what you'd find in a college dorm room - but priced like a 5-star bar. Only thing that saves this place from a 1-star is its location (which is only kind of cool?)

The cocktails are whimsically presented and TOTALLY delicious. Garnished with wit and served in unique fancy glasses. They're usually fairly boozy too. The service is totally fantastic; friendly without being overbearing. The food ain't bad either. I mean... don't come for the food... but if you're here for the drinks... getting some food here is not a mistake.

The ambiance is terrific. The lighting is dark and moody in a way that can be sexy, romantic, hip, or spooky... depending on the company you're with. Now. There is a little bit of an issue. It's ALWAYS SO CROWDED. They do a pretty good job managing the crowds BUT... it sort of kills the ambiance. Like. I don't know what they could do about this... but... it's hard to feel sexy, romantic, hip, or spooky if Mackenzie keeps brushing up against your table because nobody in her crew thought to make a reservation.

Make a reservation and be prepped for a crowd. It's worth it, tho, cuz them drinks are so darned good.

Lovin' the vibe and cocktails in this bar! I was craving a pina colada and the Aloha Felicia was the closest drink. It consisted of venezuelan rum, dark jamaican rum, coconut, pineapple, and thai basil. $14 for a cocktail but it was strong, decorative, and delicious!

Popular bar located in the river north area of Chicago, you definitely either need a reservation, or get here early. There was already a line to get in around 8:30PM on a Friday, and it quickly grew once we started waiting. Also, the entrance is located off an alley, look for the Tiki torches, but it's accurately placed on google maps.

The bar is underground with appropriate low mood lighting. The place is fairly packed so don't expect a table to sit on, but you'll have a good chance at a counter or a bar seat if you keep an eye out for people leaving. The bartenders are very friendly, and make a great show of making cocktails. I will say that it takes more time to garnish the cocktail then it takes to make the drink, but it all works well for the presentation. They also have the most amazing cups / delivery mechanisms for the drinks. The drinks themselves are fairly strong and very tropical. I got the Jet pilot and tropical itch, the Jet pilot was good balance of flavor and alcohol, the tropical itch was meh (maybe too sour?). Trader Vic's Mai Tai was decent, but I'll probably stay with the Jet Pilot next time.

One of the best tiki bars I've ever been to, and partially a speakeasy too? The entrance was down a dark alley and down a dim stairway. But wow, this place is 100% tiki. On Halloween, they brought in the spooky disco theme too. Perfection. Complete with disco ball, music, and a comic book look menu. The boo felicia was simply delicious. It was packed with coconut flavor and pineapple mint, which meant creamy and refreshing. The basic batida was smooth and creamy too, but had a dark rich nutty flavor. The ingredients in the poltergeist painkiller seemed like too much, but it was amazingly good like a smoothie. It came with a strawberry puree in a syringe too. Dead reckoning was tasty, but I didn't really taste the maple. Overall, excellent, inspired menu. The pu pu platter was also delicious. The coconut shrimp, yuca fries, fried egg rolls were all crispy. The pork skewers and fried chicken had a sweet glaze. The meatballs were good too. Great service. Top notch atmosphere.

pics.caption: boo felicia, basic batida, dead reckon, poltergeist painkiller

review.des:
Love this place. Of the tiki bars in the city, I prefer Three Dots and a Dash's ambiance. The cocktails are awesome and fun - my favorite being the Painkiller. Their chips and guac are pretty good too, although be prepared for a little bit different kind of chip than you may be used to!

If you get there right when they open, there shouldn't be much of a wait. They took take reservations, though!

Tiki bars yes.

I don't normally have much to say when it comes to reviewing bars, but this bar was a fun place to check out. Around 9pm on a Saturday night, we waited in line for about 20 minutes before entering. Entrance to the bar is down an alleyway (sounds good to me). This place is seriously packed. I overheard that getting a table would take about 2 hours, like it's that popular. Packed crowds by the bar too, but that didn't really bother my friends and I that much. We couldn't really relax anywhere but could only enjoy their creatively themed drinks. Bartending service was really attentive to all their customers, and the decor/lighting was appropriate.

I really enjoyed this place overall.

This is a 4-5 star review - if you are going for a really fun and good night out. We had a group of 17 sitting in our own 'island' and it was fun from start to
Finish. Maggie took great care of us. The big sharing drinks were fun, Smokey, tasty - and who ever gets to share a drink with 8 straws for 8 friends! ( we had 3). The food was more easy finger food than a traditional dinner but it was good. Everyone enjoyed what they had.  This is not the place for a quiet dinner with customers but it is perfect for when you are out for a good time. Even getting in the restaurant was fun -  around the corner, down the alley, down the stairs and under the heads of those who did not pay!, no sign but the blue glow and the tiki lights said Polynesian speakeasy. Go - you'll love Three Dots.

I was really excited to try Three Dots and a Dash on a recent trip. We tried to make reservations, but they were already booked up so we decided to try our luck and wander over after dinner. We only waited in line maybe twenty minutes before being able to go inside. We were told there was standing room only for the bar. We were fine with this, but first made our way to the bathroom. This was the first problem, the sinks did not work at all. Luckily I was told this by an unfortunate patron that had a hand full of soap who had discovered that all the sinks were broken too late. The establishments solution to this was to place a bottle of hand sanitizer out on the sink. Still, we carried on and went to the bar, which was packed with people so much so that you could barely move and had to inch your way up to the bar and then wait to find a sliver of space to order your drink.
The bartenders are fun to watch as they prepare your drinks. My friend ordered the Missionary's Downfall, which was cool to see being prepared with the dry ice. We also had the Aloha Felicia, our bartender was also kind enough to make a virgin version of the Aloha Felicia for our pregnant friend, along with a Long Walk off a Short Pier. To be considerate of the other patrons who are trying to get up to the bar to order their drinks, we politely moved away from the bar.  Unfortunately, this was a mistake. Their bar area is super small which means you are smashed in between people with barley enough room to turn around. We tried to move to the edge of the bar but were yelled at by some worker guy who stared us down the entire time we were there. None of my party and I enjoyed our time here at all. Unless you have a table, you are expected to gulp you drink down and go. We would have liked to have tried several more cocktails, but there was no way we were going to spend another dime here.

pics.caption: Long Walk on a Short Pier
From top left: Missonary's Downfall, Long Walk on a Short Pier, Aloha Felicia, and another Long Walk on a Short Pier

review.des: So I came here because my friend is the Tiki Queen and highly recommended. I ordered two drinks and a small bite meal. The coconut shrimp was fantastic and the drinks were delicious! But this place wins because the bartender, John, was ultra friendly. New to the area and he gave recommendations for things to do - all while making sure everyone else at the bar was tended to! Cool vibe, bit busy for an introvert, but overall no regrets!

Hands down my favorite place I visited on my trip to Chicago. Being from Florida we have no lack of tropical/tiki type places but this was a whole new kind of fun in spot like this! I was sold the second I walked through the door- the ambiance is so great. My entire table ordered random drinks, having tested each one I can say all were pretty tasty. We were just coming from dinner so we didn't get any food but based on the next table over's food it looked delicious. I can't wait for my next trip to Chicago so I can make this my first stop!

Loved the place cz my bae with me...nice place to hangout...scary theme but it's all good...nice options of drinks...make sure to reserve a take before you go...this place is always packed or reserved...nice expensive overall

pics.caption: Love the ambience and my bae

review.des: They seem confused and not understanding when you show up to your reservation. Make you wait in line almost argue over just to be seated. Depressing vibe staff all look miserable and rude. Manager themselves have a Attitude problem.

This spot is pretty good. I'd like to give five stars but I'm kinda eh about it.

First of all, this place is hard to find. We had no idea it was in an alley way, and we had to ask a waiter from the restaurant around the corner. Ok no big deal.

Along with that, it's very dark inside. The decor definitely had no expense spared on attention to detail. I just wish I could've seen more of it.

The drinks are very hit or miss. There weren't many options for me. The drinks that my friends got were okay, but they didn't seem blown away by them.

They have a few good food options, though! The thai fried chicken, chips and guacamole, and yuka frites were all delicious.

Overall, good spot. But I probably won't come back unless it's something someone else wants to do.
A Chicago classic. We love this tiki bar and all the drinks. The Three Dots and a Dash and the Mai Tai are among our classic favorites!

I love this tiki bar. It's a great for a girls night or a date. It's huge but the tables at usually booked ahead of time so I have to stay at the bar. My only suggestion would to make the bar area bigger due to the fact that everyone has to stand. I have had many of their drinks and my favorite is the Pago Pago!!! Always worth the drive to the city to come! An the alley entry is always really cute. Gives it more of an intimate feel!
The bar was cool and the drinks were great. There was no room to sit, everything was reserved and no free seating. It was also very hot. But it was a fun experience

It's a cute tiki bar that pretty hidden. If it wasn't for the reviews I wouldn't have been able to find it. I also was expecting these drinks to be fruity tropical drink that are similar to ones you will find at a resort. However, these drinks are very intense.

The spring rolls and Thai chicken are pretty good.

Still have PTSD from this place after too much  rum which was later followed  by tequila shots every 10min (ok, that was my fault) People in our group were a little out control and were sitting in other people's booths and drinking from their sharable drinks with extra straw's. Thankfully this place is full of super cool people and they just laughed and took photos of my crew whom was stressed like Wall Streeter bankers but partied like the Michigan State University alums they are. Top spot in the city for a fun time with cool people and unique drinks any day of the week. Looking forward to coming back!

If you're looking for a spot with delicious strong drinks, this is your place. Their drinks are dangerously good.

The bartenders were entertaining and friendly. My favorite part about the whole experience was the decorations of the drinks. They were appealing to the eye and fun to have as souvenirs.

We went here after the Ali Wong comedy show. The bar was very busy with a line out the door but the wait was not long. The experience was well worth the wait.

Drinks were amazing, decor was amazing, atmosphere was ok. The bar is located down a side alley, there we're tiki torches to light the way. You walk in and down a stair case with a scull wall, past a seating area and into the main bar. There are tables, a VIP section and a nice size bar. The drinks were wonderful , some of the best. The bar tenders were knowledgeable and amazing to watch, they worked so fast! The only downside was it was way to loud and the music was not what we expected in a tiki bar. They had a DJ, which is great, but he kept increasing the volume to where you couldn't hear a thing. We're also used to tiki bars that play.. tiki music. It doesn't have to be all instrumental surf or Polynesian music but this place is more of a club than tiki bar. I'd like to go back earlier in the night and see what it's like

Overcharged the Chicago 10.25 % tax. Check bill carefully.
Less tiki then hala kahiki but more tiki then lost lake.
Half lounge and half tiki bar.

Loveeeee it!
Went on a Wednesday night after a very lacking sushi dinner. Didn't realize a reservation would have been helpful until we got there. MAKE A RESERVATION if you don't want to possibly spend your entire time standing around the bar. The bar is limited with seats, and though there are a lot of tables, most of them are already reserved. Luckily for my friend and I, two seats opened up at the bar soon after we entered. I think the drinks are priced fairly since you're also paying for the drinks decor. I suggest the strip and go naked for someone that doesn't want anything too strong. They also have giant group drinks that are presented very nicely.

Super fun drinks, very tasty, they do have a dress code there ( no tank tops) but the bouncer let me in anyways which was very cool, got a seat at the bar and amazed at the quality/ creativeness of the drinks

I had an interesting time when I went here. I was drunkenly dragged here one of my first nights out at bars because I had just turned 21. The aesthetic was welcoming and comfortable. However the prices seemed a bit outrageous. The drinks were good but it seemed like the place was expensive for  the sake of being expensive.

Although we were told by multiple people to go to Three Dots and a Dash, we were sorely disappointed.  It has an allure because you enter through a back alley and walk down steps into a Polynesian themed bar.

The drinks were more ice than liquid.  Don't waste your money on the specialty drinks that are more decoration and dry ice than liquor and I have to say the food was awful.  The Pu Pu platter was expensive and worse than the worst food you would find at a Chinese take out in an airport.  The service was slow and the drinks were not only all ice, but also very weak.

I would recommend whatever bar is upstairs on the street.  Looked to actually be a real bar and not a tourist trap.

If the food, service, and drink remain in their present state then I don't expect this place to be open much longer.

Awesome place to go, entrance in an alley and down the basement. They do an excellent job of taking you into their world. Vibe  feels more like HAWAII than actual Hawaii hahaha. Creative drinks and great service!

What a fun place. I am not writing about the food, although it looked very good. We were waiting for a pizza reso so we came here to do a few drinks. I don't even remember what we ordered but man it was good and the place was super fun.

If you can go here for a drink do it. If you want to have dinner do that too.  Very cool place.

Great! Nice atmosphere and service great!
I would recommend to anyone for unique experience.

I believe this place is known for their mixed drinks with a tropical island feel. It's definitely good for coming out on a date & gives you the chance to try something new. Food options were pretty limited which can present a problem if the rum starts to hit you a little hard..  Overall it was a fun experience, something you should try at least once.

MAKE RESERVATIONS!

Don't wear hats or athletic clothes. Not sure on the jeans policy.

Go to Firecakes on Hubbard and go north up the alley next to it. You'll see a neon blue light and a guy outside. Their might be a line of people lined up across the alley from him. It goes by fast. But if you have reservations you don't have to wait.

Large sitting area after you walk downstairs. Small tables but lots of places to sit and drink but you can eat there too.

Drinks are crazy fun. And large and actually taste pretty heavy on the booze. The menu is small but it's more bar and restaurant. Dark and loud.

Will be back again.

That's all I have to say about that.
Jackée

Great dramatic entrance,brilliant cocktails,cute tiki boys and most importantly...-amazing signature mugs and drinks-you're not going home without lightening your wallet but this place lives up to its reputation and if you're a tikiphile,its a no-brainer.Tikimazong!

You know that I love me some alcohol! This is a perfect place to go for a cute first date or a good place to start on a girl's night out. The entire bar is decked out in pirate/sea/tiki-ness decor. For a second in your drunken haze, you can actually imagine yourself in the Maldives somewhere. The vibe is super cool and adventurous. The service is top-notch and the bartenders/waitresses are always super accommodating.

I've come here multiple times - sometimes at 8 or at 11/12 and when you come earlier, you might get a table, but when you come later, it's poppin' but not too busy and crowded yafeel. I think they do a really good job at crowd control. As for drinks though..... beware of the drinks that have one or two skulls. They're super strong yet super sugaryyyyyy, I'm talking about you, Mai Tai & the Tropical Itch. The Tropical Itch was s-t-r-o-n-g, yet over-sweetened, I felt kinda sick afterwards. Mai Tai didn't have much of a cocktail taste to it, it was kinda just straight alcohol, which I wasn't looking for. I would say pay attention to the ones without skulls, unless you wanna die.

Overall, would always come back to try more drinks and get my pre-dance moves on!!

My favorite bar in Chicago!!!  I'm sure there are trendier, cooler places to hang out, but this one is my fave:

The drinks are fruity and delicious.  They change up the menu seasonally but keep the traditional favorites.  

I love a tiki bar!!!!  The decor and atmosphere is so much fun.  It's like going on a mini-vacation!

The service is fantastic.  Never had a bad experience!!!

The appetizers are really good too!

Make a reservation...this place is super popular

Great drinks...crowd a little on the young side, but low key with good vibes all around. If in the Chi, I will be sure to grab a drink! The bartenders have great recommendations as well. Overall its a great Tiki Bar!

We came on a Sunday night for a night cap and tried a number of their drinks. The atmosphere and presentation was amazing. We enjoyed all of our cocktails, particularly the aloha Felicia and the pain killer. My husband loved the jet pilot. It appeared that all of their drinks were solid. Definitely recommend!
Went here 2 nights in a row with my fiancé! We absolutely love this place! The Cobra Fang is strong and worth every penny! The drinks are very good for the price (lots of alcohol)

One of my favorite spots in the city.

You definitely get your money's worth, so watch out if you get more than two drinks because they'll hit you out of nowhere. The bartenders are great - so helpful and knowledgeable and make the experience a great one.

This place is great with private parties and keeps the food and drinks (and then water) flowing.

I'd highly recommend going all out here at least once in your life, the treasure chest and Dom is an experience to be had! The food is great, but the drinks are the star of the show.

If you're going on a weekend night, get there early if you don't have a reservation. There's a line for a reason.  If you do decide to go last minute and find a wait, you can still get the full experience sitting at the bar.  I actually prefer it if it's just two of us.

Awesome venue , great ambience and just overall cool vibe . Great place to take visitors from out of town . Drinks are fun , mostly for the look, the taste is generic and definitely hang-over material . I recommend coming here for a Pre-drink before finishing the night elsewhere .

I don't get what's the hype !!!!
You need to walk into an alley and then go down a flight of stairs into a dark , filthy , tiny catacomb .......

Very very crowded !!! In fact we had to wait in line for 10 minutes in order to get in.
It was extremely funny because the guy at the door felt like a Las Vegas bouncer on a power trip !!!!!

Didn't feel like a speakeasy at all ...... rather more like a filthy after hours club

Drinks were creative but filled with syrup
Felt like I was at a spring break convention in Cabo
Drinks are good, the one I had was pretty sweet (sugar sweet).  Lighting was dark, so difficult to see/read the menu.  Staff was friendly and great with recommendations.
Always pretty busy and sometimes a wait but very tasty tiki drinks. Bartenders are talented

My group made a late night visit to Three Dots and a Dash. It was a Wednesday night so we had no trouble getting a table.

I found it very odd for a speakeasy. The fancy cocktails were normal, but the tiki decor just didn't seem very speakeasy to me. Plus, they didn't seem to mind photo taking.

In any case, I enjoyed my super strong Tally Me Banana. I couldn't taste much pineapple or banana, but it did the trick to get the buzz going. It wasn't served in a fun glass which was a bummer.

We also ordered the luau chips for the table and that was a nice snack.

I did like that it wasn't overly loud so we could hear ourselves chat.

I'm torn between a 3 and a 4. The scenery was kind of gimmicky but the drinks were good. Let's go with a 3.5. How about three periods and a hashtag?

Difficult to find. But once you hit the dark alley, you are nearby.

Over-priced drinks, but fun when served!

Not easily accessible... deep down under the city, but an interesting descend.

Seemingly popular as it was at capacity, but if you like Tiki Bars, you'll love this spot.

Decent food variety, but you go for the beverages not the food.

I'll likely give it another try when next in Chicago, no real rush though.

pics.caption: A Flaming Cocktail...one of many incredibly expensive but fun drinks!

review.des: Probably the most cool unique bar I've ever been to. you go to a back alley and enter a door that does underground to the bar area. They have their own unique drinks and tiki cups. The drinks were good too.

I don't think I've ever had a bad night at Three Dots and it's fun whether you're 21 or 60 (as my  aunt was when I brought her in last year and she adored it). The place can get packed, and whenever I'm there past 8pm, every single table is filled or reserved so it's standing room only. I highly recommend you make a reservation if you want a table.

On to the fun stuff; the drinks. Every drink is so detailed--from the actual flavor of the cocktails to the fun umbrellas, fruit, and flowers that decorate every drink. Since everything is so intricate, it can take quite awhile to get your drink, but it's worth it. My favorites are the Aloha Felicia, Chief Lapu Lapu and the Tropical Itch. Word of advice--only order the group drinks if you actually have a table. Otherwise someone is stuck holding a giant drink as everyone drinks out of it--it's awkward, just don't do it.

I've never tried the food and I don't know anyone who has ever had a meal there. This is a cocktail bar, and if you want a delicious, different drink, this is the place to go!
Great drinks, but a little bit on the expensive side. The food is surprisingly very good.

Fun bar with great craft cocktails. Limited food menu, but what I ordered was delicious. As others have said, tricky to find - just look for the tiki torches. It was packed so it seems to be a very popular place.

Three Dots is a great bucket list item if your a Chicago local or someone from out of town looking for a kitschy bar for a fun/casual night. Drinks are a little pricey, but, as is often the case with themed bars, "you pay for the ambiance".

That aside, the drinks are well crafted and the selection vast, so there's sure to be something for everyone in your group. Each single cocktail is lovingly crafted, garnished, and decorated with accouterments and nick-knacks sure to please the palate. If nobody is too picky (or too lush), their volume cocktails really stand out, some serving a dozen people or more if you're all willing to pitch in. And these batch cocktails aren't your run if the mill, bathtub rum, punch bowls - they are crafted with premium liquors and mixers served in a veritable set piece: your taste of paradise will be served in skulls, lamps, treasure chests and every tropical trope in between.

We stayed around for a round or two, but it was a fun time and the service was spectacular. Arrange a work happy hour. Round up some friends and five it a visit. Three Dots is definitely one if the best tiki bar experiences in River North. Outside of downtown? Check out Lost Lake or Sparrow for similar vibes better suited for smaller groups

Came here after dinner on my last night in Chicago. The place is little hidden so beware when Google maps tells you you're there, but you have to go around to the back. LOVE LOVE LOVE the decor here and each drink is so unique!

What we ordered: Dead Reckoning, Jet Pilot, and Western Sour. All were pretty good, but of the three, I liked Dead Reckoning the most. I don't usually like overly sweet drinks and I felt these drinks were too sweet for me. But these drinks were so cute, who can resist?

If you go with a big group of people, order from their Group Excursions! Those drinks looked so amazing. Next time in town, I'm definitely going to try the Zombie...even if we don't have enough people. ;)
This place is crowded on weekends. All the drinks are beautifully designed and accessorized. It's a great place to hang out with friends if you manage to get a reservation on the booths.
Make a reservation, enjoy a sugary cocktail, and feel like you are hidden away on a Hawaiian island. It's worth the experience at least once

So happy I was able to check out Three Dots and a Dash while I was in Chicago. It was a little hard to find at first as it is located down an alley but we made it. It was a Friday night and the place was PACKED! We waited at the bar four rows deep and it took us about 20 minutes to order. Twenty minutes may seem lengthy but when you consider how much goes into crafting these cocktails, it was reasonable, plus the bartenders put on a great show! I ordered the Aloha Felicia {Venezuelan rum | Dark Jamaican rum | coconut | pineapple | Thai basil} and was impressed with how good it was! I also loved the coconut glass it was served in. The ambience is dark and while in the middle of a big city I felt like I was on a secluded island. I would highly recommend Three Dots and a Dash to anyone visiting Chicago!
drinks taste great, but the vibe is super pretentious (including the servers), and the prices are absurd.

This place has a cool vibe to go to once or twice, but it is definitely not a go to spot. It is insanely crowded and the drinks although delicious are way too sweet and strong (and expensive)! It is definitely a cool place to take someone if they are in town visiting you
Super expensive drinks are not as strong as they are warned to be. BUT you somehow feel like Beyonce entering the building. The atmosphere makes the $16 fake strong drink worth it.

Want a break from the corporate world? Easy. Grab a tiki drink in the heart of downtown. Instant gratification. ;)

Decor.
Channeling the ambience of the Caribbeans, this bar is great for those who want an evening getaway. Absolutely love the straw house bar, wooden figurines and coconuts dispersed throughout the lounge.

Drinks.
Banana Daiquiri. "Sit back, relax and allow the sumptuous flavors of rum, lime, coconut and banana dampen your sensibilities." Haha! Sign me up. It's actually quite a light refreshing drink for novices like myself. Recommended. :)

Aloha Felicia. "Straight out of Thailand with Caribbean rums, coconut cream, pineapple, lime and Thai Basil. Break yo self." The stronger drink among the two. Coconut cream foams on top of the drink with bits of coconut meat inside the drink. Light cold cocktail in a coconut shaped ceramic jug. Excellent choice.

Reservations.
Reserved on OpenTable the only time slot left thinking the bar would be a full house. Walked into a relatively quiet and open lounge. I'm thinking they only set aside a couple tables for online reservation and the rest to first come first serve service.

pics.caption: Aloha Felicia. "Straight out of Thailand with Caribbean rums, coconut cream, pineapple, lime, and Thai basil. Embrace yourself."
Banana Daiquiri. "Sumptuous flavors of rum, lime, coconut, and banana dampen your sensibilities"

review.des:
Was in Chicago for one night so I decided to check out Three Dots and a Dash.  Arrived at about 9:30 or 10pm on a Wednesday night.  Good sized crowd.  Was by myself so I decided to belly up to the bar.

Bartender was attentive and asked me within a few minutes what I thought I would like.  I asked for his opinion on a couple of drinks (Three Dots and a dash or a Jet Pilot) he gave great descriptions on the two drinks and I decided to go with the Three Dots.  The drink came quickly with great presentation in the skull wall mug.  The drink was delicious and I knew I was only staying for one drink, so I nursed it.  The atmosphere is fantastic!

I'll be stopping by here for a libation on my next trip to the Windy City!

pics.caption: Three Dots and a Dash drink in appropriate mug

review.des: Hidden gem! The entrance is in the alley but don't worry you'll typically see security or a line if it's past 8pm on the weekend. This is a cute little spot to get tiki drinks with the girls! You pay for the experience...drinks start at 13 bucks.

The drinks are amazing! Such cute presentations and mugs! I purchased the skull mug lol I get that the drinks are the specialty but I wish the food menu was expanded... don't show up hungry because the menu is limited!

The wait is crazy on a Saturday night. We got to this bar around 9:15pm and waited about 30 minutes. When you first enter the bar, you are greeted with hundreds of skulls. Once we were inside, we wrote our name down for a table.

The presentations of the drinks, the decor, the bartenders are on point! Although getting our drinks took a while, I loved how much effort is put in to make one drink. Just look at all of the pictures of the drinks. They are amazing. They are work of art. We each ordered Three Dots and a Dash, Western Sour, Daquiri Au natural, and Chief Lapu Lapu.
