We got the table after 1.5 hours of wait and we sat down for Zombie and tequila shots. I highly recommend getting the Zombie. i think it was worth the price for 4-5 people. Tequila shots..not so much. It was too expensive but one of my friends is head over heels with tequilas so we had to get it.

I will definitely come back. I recommend making a reservation for a table before coming. Disclaimer: if you're single ready to mingle, I do not recommend this place. This is more of come with your friends and have fun kind of a bar.

This place was so fun! The decor definitely makes this place a stand out. Although it's a tiki theme, the bar felt upscale still. The drink I had was super good! Almost all the drinks contain rum and although I'm not always a big rum person, these drinks hit the spot. I give this place 4 stars instead of 5 because of the drink prices, but I was expecting high priced drinks at this place before I came. Not a place you will spend a lot of time due to the prices, but great experience! If you are visiting, you should go!

pics.caption: Can't remember the name but great taste!

review.des: Felt like in Hawaii. The glasses were so cool. Drinks were very good. Good service. Great experience.

We were here a week ago with some friends where we had a small informal marriage ceremony! The drinks were great and the waitress we had was super nice and gladly went over the drink menu with us, so that we knew what we would be getting if we ordered certain drinks. I got the Jet Pilot and my husband got some other drink. We all tried everyone's drink at the table and they were all good.

Since it was our wedding they brought us a zombie as a wedding present, which was really nice. The Zombie was amazing and had a really great amount of rum to it.

We will definitely be back.

I came here with a 10 person group last night for my birthday and I am so glad I chose to celebrate here!! the drinks were amazing and all came in really cool cups and the group drinks even had dry ice to make them smoke up. the king crab rangoon and shrimp were both hits. would definitely come back again. note that the entrance is in an alley because I passed it about 3 times at first!!

Three Dots and a Dash has a fantastic underground location with a cool ambiance and very good drinks. Although it isn't the cheapest bar I've been to, you get what you pay for in terms of drink strength and presentation. The cocktails are not at all weak and are presented in really neat glasses with no shortage of garnishes. My favourite drink was the Missionary's Downfall, which was perfect for someone who doesn't love the taste of alcohol. It was deliciously fruity, but not at all lacking in alcohol content! My party of 3 also split the Pu Pu Platter, which had a good variety of food and well-worth the price ($38).

Overall, this is a great bar to go to if you're visiting the city for the first time or looking to take a group of friends for a good time.

pics.caption: Three Dots and a Dash ($14) + Missionary's Downfall ($14) + Jet Pilot ($14)

review.des: Great atmosphere. Hidden treasure. A little difficult to find. Walk down the alley. I'd recommend the aloha Felicia!

Drinks are ok. A little too sweet for my liking. I usually just go and order beer. I will say it's a fun experience, but after one or 2 drinks I have to call it quits. The alcohol also creeps up on you. Also a great date spot!

I've been coming here since I turned 21. Love the atmosphere and the drinks! No matter when you go there's always people there so I would recommend making a reservation ESPECIALLY if you are going on the weekend. The reason I'm giving 4/5 stars is because the food was extremely mediocre. I know they're more of a cocktail place but I was kind of bummed by the food this time around. They give you a HUGE bowl of crispy chips and a super small soy sauce dish of guacamole (which isn't that good.) I also ordered their tuna poke which wasn't impressive at all.. Had too much lime juice in it and wasn't chunks of tuna but more of a pale paste versus the ruby red picture on the menu. For the food I would give 2 stars but since I do love coming here I'll keep it at a 4.

pics.caption: Tuna poke. (Chips that came with the guacamole are in back and the guacamole isn't pictured unfortunately)

review.des: So. Much. Fun.  This was a stop on a Chicago bar crawl designed by my husband and it was such a neat place.  They are THE tiki bar in the Midwest as far as I'm concerned.  As you go down the stairwell of skulls, you feel like you're a Goonie until you turn the corner and there's a bright pop of color, lights and rum-based drinks.

A friend of a friend wrote a list of all the "must-see" bars in Chicago. The comment for Three Dots and a Dash was COOL, COOL, COOL DRINKS. After happy hour at the Virgin we were pumped up to try these.

If you're in the know on the San Francisco bar scene, this place is basically the equivalent of a stand alone Tonga Room (not inside a hotel) minus the swimming pool and live music. So, tiki-styled with pricey pricey tropical drinks served in fun ceramic ware. We shared a $35 passion fruit drink that hit the novelty spot. The bartender was friendly, and had no issue with my friend and I splitting the bill. The drink was SWEET. I'm assuming most drinks run on the acute sugary side. Just not my thing, but it was not half bad and enjoyed all the fresh fruit in the bowl.

Some additional info:
* No line outside on Friday around 9:30pm but all tables taken and and bar was crowded
* People hang around the bar after ordering drinks, and it makes sense. Some are served in large ceramic bowls to share ranging in between 2 or 5 people, not convenient to tote around
* Bouncer said name was Morse code for the letter V (for victory)

Such a fun atmosphere! The drinks are VERY STRONG. Me and a group of friends came here for cocktails. I couldn't even finish half of my drink because it was too strong, but all of my friends loved their drinks.
The decor and location are super cool and I highly recommend this place for young adults!

The place is very pretty. The hostess was nice and we were seated fast at a crowded time. We were given water and menus as soon as we sat down.
Our waitress Gabby introduces herself and two seconds later spills water all over us. Our socks were drenched my pants and shirt were soaked. She cleans the top of the table, gets us new water, and says "I'll get you something special for that".
We got nothing "special", no compensation, not even an apology by gabby or the manager. Ruined the rest of the night because we had to go back to the hotel to change our outfits. Walking around the Windy City In drenched clothing is not fun...

Cool place, hard to find.  I liked the atmosphere and the drinks (I had the aloha Felicia, it could have had less greenery in the glass)  the spring rolls were just ok.  
The food runner was friendly and fast.  Some drinks cost up to $500.00.  The music could have been more Hawaiian to keep with the theme.
My complaint... our cocktail waitress had a snooty attitude that was so not aloha and when we wanted our check it felt like it took half an hour before she acknowledged us.
Three no's and an exclamation point.

Not that this place needs another review...but here we are. I've only been twice, once recently with my boo and another for my company's holiday party couple of years ago.

While I did not eat this time around, I recall back then that all the shared bites were quite tasty.

My boo had never been here before so it was to my delight to lead him down the alley. We swung by 8:30pm Friday and luckily there was no line, although of course there were no tables available - reserve much ahead! We did luck out and got a seat at a ledge at one of the beams near the bar, so we at least got to put our drinks down. It also had coat hooks underneath - score! The place was super busy but if you got the attention of one the bartenders - you'd be serviced promptly... Another tip - go with a tall person!

I got the Aloha Felicia - absolutely adored the pineapple skull mug. We later shared the Port Light (for 2). The fog and light were definitely cool to experience but at $40, likely will not be getting it again as the drink itself was nothing mind-blowing. Also note that you can request to purchase any of their awesome tiki mugs! It would have been nice if these areas were regularly tended to as there were already quite a few mugs left by previous customers at this ledge we occupied.

Overall, this is definitely a fun place to go and especially to show visitors. Also, since this is a destination for many, it does create a fun diverse crowd. I even conversed with nearby out of towners (which is uncharacteristic of me), bonding over our awe of some other customer's drinks. For personal preference, idk if it's somewhere I would frequent, but definitely would be a place to return to every now and then. Also a plus that it's LEYE.

This is one of my favorite bars. I've never been here and had a bad time. Service is great drinks are great and the atmosphere is second to none.

I've never had the food here personally I've heard it is what youd expect for basic pub grub and you'll pay a bit extra because the surroundings.

Anyway go to there. It's amazing.

I loved this place. Some people say touristy or kitschy. Yeah, it's crowded. So people like it... There must be a reason for that right? The cocktails are good, no great. They're great. Smooth and well-balanced and oh-so-tasty. I went with the man friend. He doesn't really like alcohol (what?!) and he was still able to find something to love. I loved it too. I think it was the Aloha Felicia. It tasted like boozy chocolate milk. Mine was fruity, delicious, and served up. Also, I'm a sucker for a themed place that just goes all out on the theme and this place did not disappoint. I am not a tourist. I would still make multiple trips here. For something less touristy, try Lost Lake up in Logan Square. The cocktails there are also tiki themed and amazing. Plus, it's all seated so you won't have to fight anyone for room at the bar, but you may have to wait for a table. I believe both of these places came from the same origins. Anyway, before this becomes a review for a second tiki bar, stop by if kitsch is your thing. You won't regret it.

pics.caption: Best tiki cocktails ever. So well balanced. Smooth. Great great atmosphere.

review.des:
Came here spontaneously after a quick dinner at Shake Shack. I've always wanted to come here cause it's looked super cool and there were a bunch of reviews about it. It is definitely not as hidden as it's made out to be. Once you get into the alley, you'll see tiki torches and a bouncer checking IDs.

We got in and the host explained that there's a reservation in 1.5 hours so we could sit down but we would have to get out of there by then. That was super nice of them! 6 of us fit perfectly in a booth. They gave us menus and some time for us to look at the menu, then came back and explain the menu to us. If you want a drink and aren't sure about what's in it, make sure to ask since not all of the description are good.

I ordered the Missionarys Downfall, which was super fruity and I didn't taste the alcohol at all.  If you're feeling something more alcohol-y order from the high octane part of the menu! All of the drinks come in super cute cups or with cute decorations. I loved the orchids! I wasn't extra impressed with the drinks(would give 3 stars), but the ambiance was nice and the service was excellent.

Aloha my fellow barflys, the surf's up in Chicago town, here at Three Dots and a Dash.  You want a tiki bar, well you've got one - the best one - at this elusive underground watering hole, so to speak.  Three Dots and a Dash really is the modern day watering hole for all those people getting off work and desperately needing some alcoholic fun in their lives.  I happily include myself into this category as I am always down with getting a noteworthy buzz on.  The drinks are so strong that it's impossible not to feel a little somethin' somethin' after having just one of these fancy concoctions.  Unlike so many other bars, Three Dots and a Dash is not stingy with the amount of alcohol they are pouring up, though thus out to be the case since you're paying quite a lot for them.

Yes, it's pricey here (on average a drink is about $14) but you're going to feel mighty fine halfway through your drink because of the fact that the drink probably consists of 75-85% alcohol.  I would have loved to more drinks, but there's always next time.  When I did go however, I ordered the Dead Reckoning and my fiancé ordered the Jet Pilot.  Both drinks were amazing, but the Jet Pilot may have been my preference because of the cinnamon in it - thay was quite a twist and I loved it. Like I said, though, both were awesome and it was hard to choose when every other drink looked just as sinfully good.

I'm obsessed with the mugs/glasses the drinks came in, and had I been drunk enough I probably would have splurged and bought one.  Yes, you can buy the mugs that the drinks come in, but for about $30.  They're super awesome, though!  Speaking of awesome, can we just talk about the actual atmosphere itself?  The lighting is very dimmed which sets the mood for a relaxing get together with friends; there's a bunch of lounges amongst the regular tables and the tiki bar itself dazzles with brilliance as it displays all of it's rum.  It's fairly big inside, but from what I hear this doesn't suffice most of the time due to hw buy it gets.  When I went on a weeknight it wasn't overly crowded and we got a table right away.  Obviously, the weeknights allow for easier access than do the weekends, but isn't that the case anywhere?  

Okay, so we have established that drinks are the bomb and the atmosphere is legit - well what about the food?  I didn't eat much, and there's really not much to choose from (because it's primarily a lounge, duhhh), but we got the Thai fried chicken.  This was spectacular and I would highly recommend that you get it if and when you make your way to Three Dot and a Dash.  

P.s. to actually get into Three Dots and a Dash you have to find the alleyway.  Here are some clues for finding it: there's a blue light that illuminates the entry way, there's a big old bouncer standing outside and there are most likely people wandering around the same alleyway, aimlessly looking around.  You have to be 21 to get in, so if you're not then I guess you're S.O.L.  Once you're in, though, you are golden and you're about to get tipsy!  ("Everybody in the club get tipsy!")

Although all the drinks have multiple components to them, the bartender(s) are efficient in making them, but the serving staff does a good job of making sure all the patrons are getting what they need and in a timely fashion.  Overall, this is a great establishment and I'm excited to come back for more drinks.  Aloha for now!

One of the coolest bars I've ever been to! You want to find A concept spot with strong drinks? Try the spot. Now, I will say, the drinks are not priced friendly, but you pay for the atmosphere. It's like walking into Indiana Jones and the Temple of doom. Love it!
Awesome place came in last minute and sat at the bar the drinks were awesome and the king crab Rangoon's  were great as well!

So to get into three dots you have to wait in an alley line. Once inside it takes about 20-30 mins of waiting at the bar to get a drink. The drinks look great and are exquisitely made but they take some time as well. Seating is limited so be prepared to stand. Overall Cocktails are good but the wait is quite a drag.

Fun place in a dark alley. Drinks are fanciful, strong, and pretty to look at. With all of the extras, the prices maybe reasonable, but do not come here if you like to have more than 2 or 3 drinks at a sitting as your wallet will hurt.

Fun for a date and or to show off to people from out of town.  

I have not tried their food, so cannot comment on that.
Amazing drinks and ambiance.  A must see whenever in Chicago!  The drinks they create are not only delicious, but are also artistic at heart.

Always have a fun time coming to this place. They updated the menu with new drinks and even more food options as well. And we were told the menu is going to be changing again soon (hopefully some more food!)
Hands down, this place always delivers, and I've been coming here since it opened. Consistently some of the best drinks I have had, and service is always spot on.
If you're planning to come on a weekend night, make a reservation for a table, this place can get packed and the wait can be more than an hour for a table.

Fantastic!!!!
Drinks are so fun.  They come is all types of tiki mugs and dragons and crazy stuff.  

Delicious and strong!!!

You walk down a quiet hall open the door and it's a loud and awesome bar.  We didn't eat food but the menu looked good too.

Be prepared for a long line both to get in and at the bar. Reservations would be ideal - fastest and most comfortable as this place gets packed and there isn't a ton of room to do the standing room thing.

Logistics aside, the drink menu is creative and the presentation as I've experienced at other Polynesian bars is over the top. Watching the drinks get made is part of the fun and makes the wait not seem too bad. The garnishes that go into some of the drinks are very cool. My banana daiquiri got a real banana stuffed in it that happened to be carved like a dolphin. The drink was good, though do note that a batch of it is sitting pre-made since it is a popular order and to save on time.

pics.caption: Banana Daiquiri - rum, lime, coconut & banana (literally). $13.

review.des:
Such a cool place with a very modern tiki vibe. Everything about this place... from the half-hidden entryway in a seedy alley, to the wall of skulls that greets you when you enter, to the myriad of drink choices to choose from (some of them quite epic) ... all of these make this place truly a bar worth visiting.

Warning: The drinks are STRONG ... my cousin called it jet fuel, but they'll definitely get you where you need to be.

The food was also quite good ... the app sampler and a few sides should be good for a decent sized group.

My drink of choice was the Mai Tai ... not sweet like i'm used to... almost sour with citrus and alcohol. No more than two of those if you still want to enjoy your night :x

Overall a really cool spot that I would highly recommend.

Stay Cheerful ;)

Very dark and moody, great if you like intimacy, but expect to pull out your flash light to order. My girlfriend and I each had the zombie. Had good flavor and was very stiff, we are not light weights and felt it after one drink each and had to take a water break after we left. Cant comment on the food or any other drinks, but a good place downtown for a fun drink in a cute atmosphere. Straight out of Maui!

Not much to say that hasn't already been written about Three Dots and a Dash. What a little gem in the city!

If you can't find the location, check for the blue neon lights in the alley and then you'll see the tiki torches.

Drinks were strong and serious. Each one seems to be a little work of art with the different glasses/vessels and more garnishes than I could have even imagined - included a long plastic back scratcher! Cannot imagine how the bartenders remember each drink and its ingredients while they're simultaneously making drinks for three or four other people.

I was here with a friend late night on a Thursday and while reservations weren't available, we had no problem finding room at the bar to order and finding a place to stand. If we were to go back, I would try earlier to get a reservation - the big group drinks the tables were drinking looked so fun!

Always a fun spot to visit with guests who have never been to Chicago or here.  I prefer trader Vic's but there aren't too many around.  The food here is ok.  The drinks are fun and strong.  The entrance off the alley and stairs make it feel exclusive. People often have a hard time finding it. It is a little on the pricey side.

pics.caption: Don't be scared off by the skulls

review.des: Awesome spot! It's below street level and behind a building, so it might be easy to miss the first time around. Ordered the Tropical Itch, which contains Bourbon, Rum, Passionfruit, Lemon and Falernum. This drink is 1/2 of the strongest drinks on the Classics cocktail menu. This place can get cramped pretty quickly and pretty early, so the biggest issue I had was securing a seat. The vibe is great and so are the bartenders.

pics.caption: A portion of the cocktail menu as of December 22, 2017

review.des:
If you have friends visiting from out of town and you want to look super cool- take them here.

The wait on the weekends can be a little crazy (you also have to wait in an alley next to garbage, which is not ideal), but once you're inside you'll realize what all the hype is about.

The drinks are insanely delicious, and have about 20 ingredients each. I would not recommend this place if you're trying to sit down, or have a deep conversation.

Try the rotating drinks! They're always a knockout.

I've only been here for drinks on a weekend - this place gets overcrowded and it's a big reason why I didn't give them 5 stars. They overpack the bar to the point where it's multiple people deep and it's hard to find a place to stand and put your drink down, yet alone a seat.

Despite this, I've always had a good time here. It has a fun atmosphere and they make some delicious, strong fishbowls that are great for a group. I always take friends from out of town here to start off our night because the fishbowls are such a hit. Also, the decor is spot-on, with the feeling of a tiki bar crossed with an underground lair of sorts.

Let me preface this review by stating I have been trying to try this place out for 3 years and I've never wanted to go by myself. So when it came time to actually go, I was super excited as I had been stalking the place.

I feel like it was an over priced experience. Honestly, won't be going back and not even on anybody elses dime.

I had the painkiller, which is one of the more popular drinks. Yes it was strong and yummy!

The appetizers left something to be desired. The chips served with the gauc were AWFUL. Although, the thai chicken was pretty decent, the crab rangoon which is super simple to make was under cooked. The food didn't even come to our table hot :( I left this place hungry, a little buzzed and underwhelmed.

We were celebrating a birthday ( had the birthday balloons at the table to prove it!) and the server just gave off the energy/vibes that she did not want to be there or tried to ensure we had a pleasant experience. At one point someone in my party sent back a drink because it wasn't what was expected and she paused and had an attitude about it, although she did give them a chance to order another one.

I don't have a problem with paying a couple more dollars for a cocktail due to it's real estate but, I do have a problem when it isn't worth it! Sorry, but I will not be back here. It looks like I'm on the excursion to try the other tiki bars that I came across while I was saving myself for Three Dots.

Overall: Expect a really cool and different ambiance, strong drinks, and great service.

Ambiance: I like their entrance, which is in the back. It's not a speakeasy place, but some may call it that. There is a long line after 10pm on the weekends.

Drinks: Well presented, and strong. I like their drink names, ingredients, umbrellas and other items they use to decorate their drinks. Priced fairly well too for Chicago downtown.

The drinks are on the expensive side but what I liked about them was all the flavors it has in them plus they're strong. They only really sell appetizers so I would say eat before you come here & the music is a very chill feel.

Wow...It's been a very long time since I've been treated that rudely. I arrived with my friend at 7:30 on Saturday evening. We were coming from an event that we attended in River North just before arriving. I was surprised to see how busy the bar was at 7:30 given that it was so early but I have been here a couple of times (mildly similar experiences but not to this extent) and I know the drinks are good so we stayed. When we asked about a table, the short blonde hostess said it would be about an hour maybe up to an hour and a half.  I put my name on the list and she took my cell number.  Even though it was busy, there were several empty tables.  My friend and I went to the bar and ordered a drink.  We stood and chatted since all the bar stools were taken.  At 9pm (90 min after arrival) I approached the hostess and asked where we were on the list.  It seemed like a huge hassle for her to look and she counted names until she got to #6 which was us.  I said ok and rejoined my friend standing at the bar.  At 10pm (2 1/2 hours after arrival time) I went back because I thought there had to be a problem since it was only supposed to take 1-1/2 hours to be seated.  Hostess said we were next but she couldn't guarantee that we would be seated.  I told her I didn't understand why because we had been waiting for 2 1/2 hours.  She said they had other tables to seat.  I told her again I didn't quite understand why they would not honor our name on the list.  She just repeated what she said previously.  

Interestingly enough, others walking in this whole time were being seated.  She was rude, selective with who she was seating, and extremely unprofessional.  Yes this is a popular place and I highly doubt that management will even look twice at my review but I'm hopeful that others with a similar experience (I am certain I'm not the only one to be treated this way) will write a review and Three Dots and a Dash will have a higher standard for how they treat customers and really look at employee professionalism.

I gave it 2 stars because the bartender we had was great and makes a fantastic pain killer.  Other than that, I'd give it zero.  It's got a fun vibe with great drinks but to be treated like that??  What a huge disappointment.  Go somewhere else.
Strong drinks, delicious appetizers. Awkwardly located and small inside but if you're looking to bar hop, it's located in River North...the heart of downtowns action!

Absolutely awesome! The cocktails were as good as we've had anywhere, they were served in very unique glasses, mugs, fruits, etc., and the presentation was perfect! Plus the ambiance was one of the best we've ever experienced. What a great vibe! And it was Sunday night. The music was cool, they had an eclectic mix of chill people and whoever designed and decorated this place is a genius!

The staff was super friendly too. Our only regret was going after dinner and not being hungry enough to try the food. That and they closed before we could try the zombie drink in the skull mug. Next time!

pics.caption: Holy st this one was amazing. Show your server this picture and enjoy. I think it was the mind eraser. Mission accomplished!
Forget the names of these bad boys and you will too. The one on the left is their award-winning mai thai.
Corner booth on a Sunday night with my girl and the best view in the place. So romantic!

review.des: I've recently fallen in love with the tiki bar again thanks to new bars in cities and the Disney resorts. Three Dots is a fantastic location with delicious food and well made cocktails. We had several drinks and the PuPu platter and loved everything we got. Staff was fantastic and helpful with the menu. Will be going back.
Excellent drinks and atmosphere. Service was on point, Joni was stunning and amazing, made our night!
This place is a bit overhyped and very expensive - it is not worth it. Is is called a "speakeasy" but everyone knows about it. I wouldn't recommend wasting money here.

Perfect place for a girls night! I came here for drinks on my 21st birthday before dinner with my friend. Our bartender was super nice and recommended a drink based on my tastes. He also gave us a nicely decorated birthday shots on the house! This place was packed on a Thursday, so I'd recommend making reservations if you want a table to sit at for drinks/eat. We did have to stand the whole time we were there except the last 5 minutes before we left. I'd definitely come back here with a big group of girls.

The drinks are super fun and tasty! Enjoy it for what it is a place that serves fun drinks in crazy vessels. I would say the place is overpriced, but in Chicago that's not to be unexpected. The staff could be more friendly that's 100% for sure. You should know coming in that you are coming here not just for drinks but for an experience. I enjoyed my time and loved my drink. Got some fun mermaid stirs for a souvenir. I love coconuts so it was fun for a quick drink before dinner. They seemed annoyed that not everyone at our table wanted a cocktail but whatever they will get over it I'm sure.

pics.caption: CocoNUTS! Love the mint inside- very refreshing and delicious.

review.des: I love this place. Their drinks are great and amazing ambience, however I hate that lately they don't allow people to sit, creating a big packed crowd around the bar area while you can see multiple table open! They need to manage table situation better! Really sad!

What a cool/odd little place. It's like a speakeasy and a tiki bar had a love child. I was in town for work and some local colleagues took us here. I wasn't sure what to expect when we walked down a semi-dark alley to get here and then down some stairs with a row of skulls on top, but I was pleasantly surprised.

We were a larger group and they accommodated us very nicely. The place is dark and lit up with cool tiki-style decorations everywhere and some chill music playing in the background.

I can't comment on the food just the drinks and service. The drink variety and rum selection are almost staggering. They had one shareable drink that was $385, had dry ice and Dom Perigon...I think I'll pass. We ordered a couple Zombie drinks for the table. They came out on fire and in skulls, don't get any better than that. They were pretty strong surprisingly but super sweet. If you like sweet drinks you'll be in luck.

Service was also outstanding, they checked in to see how we were doing and were all around very friendly. I'd come back here just solely because it's a cool and unique concept with great service.

Cute small bar located in the back alley. It was so hard for us to find this place and we were able to find it by asking around.

This place is so small inside, it's definitely recommended to sit in and order food so that you can have a seat there. If you don't it's so hard to move around there.

Drinks are so tasty and crafty! They are definitely worth trying.
So much fun. The bartenders were very nice. And the drinks were basically a vacation in a fun vesicle.

First of I want to say that Shru was a great nice and thoughtful. Jeff, which is a security was giving us attitude and not letting us get a table, when we were already told we could sit, he was saying we weren't aloud to.. And then we order an 85$ drink and we're called a "cheap fuck" for not tipping on one drink when we had ordered over 8 drinks and tipped a good amount. This is ridiculous. We spoke to the manager and all he should do is apologize however that doesn't change the shity experience we had with both Jeff and Chad the Asian bartender. DO NOT GO HERE unless you want rude people who don't understand what customer service is!

Such a cool spot for a drink, especially for a girls night. Prices are pretty on par for Chicago,  but will likely seem a bit much for out of towners. Amazing ambience, decent food. Definitely recommend making a stop here, but can't say I would make it a regular place due to how crowded and difficult to get a table it can be.

Yay, 3 dots and a dash!!! My parents were in town for St. Patty's Day weekend, and we were looking for someplace upbeat but away from the young bar going crowds wanting to get trashed. Three Dots and a Dash was perfect. Everyone enjoyed all of their drinks. Below is a video of Chief Lapu-Lapu for two, complete with dry ice! We also enjoyed many small bites: crab rangoon, coconut shrimp and the star of the show - tuna poke!!! I didn't expect it to be so wonderfully prepared (I had literally had Aloha poke earlier in the day and this 2as WAY better). , It stole the show for everyone who tried it! Thanks for making our evening wonderful!

This place is super cute and trendy for fun cocktails and a great IG post. But the food was sub-par. I think the drinks are too sugary for my taste. It is a fun place to bring a group as they have some party rooms available.

Great atmosphere and the signature cocktails were delicious and I'm not usually fond of those types of fruity island drinks. Quite excellent. The decor and music were awesome too. Love how hidden and unassuming the entry was. Set the right tone for a great early evening get together.

Bartenders are very kind! Even with a long wait, if you're nice and patient with them they are super sweet back. The menu has a few changes seasonally, and includes such a great core of strong tropical drinks you can't find anywhere else! It's usually darker than most restaurants during the day, and pretty dark at night. So great for first dates if you're afraid you're dating out of your league! The line on Friday and Saturdays can be long, but usually not more than 30 min. I prefer Three Dots to any other tiki bar.

What a fun bar!! Don't let the back alley location keep you from checking out this cool spot! The very dim lighting gives the place an intimate feel.
My friend and I didn't dine here but the food looked great!
We each ordered a fun cocktail, I had a classic daquri and she opted for a mai tai. The drinks are strong! The fun and colorful menus make it easy to order, each fruity cocktail has a great description and a photo of the drink (presentation is always important). Drinks come in a unique glass with a colorful straw, flowers and fruit garnish. I seriously don't think I've seen another bar with so much fruit!
While the bar area was pretty crowded the servers were very friendly and attentive.
This is a great spot for a fun girls night!

pics.caption: Mai tai on the left, daquri on the right. Both were delicious!

review.des: I've been at Three Dots many times and have had a variety of experiences. The first two experiences were soon after it opened (one Wednesday and one Saturday night), and I was thrilled at the vibe, the cool cups and drink presentation, and the drinks themselves. My most recent visit this spring on a Monday night at 10:30pm with a party of 4 was disappointing. There were at least 6 large tables that were empty with "reserved" signs. I asked a waitress if we could sit down, and she directed me to the hostess stand. The hostess told me it would be a 30 - 45 minute wait for a table. I walked back inside to tell my guests, one of which had already grabbed a menu and was settling in at a smaller table. I barely got back to the group to explain that we weren't allowed to sit anywhere when the hostess rushed to the table and sternly told us the table was reserved. My friend questioned whether all of the tables were actually reserved, and the hostess said they were. My group walked back to the bar area, where all of the seats were taken. We didn't feel welcome. We started putting on our coats to leave, and the waitress who originally told us to talk to the hostess came back and told us we could sit at one of her empty tables (which was 'reserved'). After we were seated, the service and drinks were great. However, the venue needs to think carefully about how they are treating their customers. I suggested the venue to my out of town guests because I had fond memories of the unique drinks; however, after my latest experience, I likely won't coordinate any future group outings to Three Dots and a Dash.

Great late night vibe. The dj spinning house beats really added to the whole experience even tho it was a tiki bar. Only confusing thing is their system for getting seated. I showed up at 12:30 am and was told no tables were available but when I looked around there were many. It felt like I was brushed off. So I sat down anyway and ordered from the waitress. If you guys read this please try to be a lil more helpful to your customers. Especially first timers.

Don't worry, you 'should not' get stabbed on the way into Three Dots and a Dash.

Just like everyone says, the entrance looks sketchy! Make sure you make a reservation unlike myself. They let you go right in to find seating at the bar but we were shizz-outta-luck. Waitress estimated a 40 minute wait since there was a few parties ahead of us on reservation. Luckily! someone cancelled their reservation and were seated 10 minutes after our arrival.

The vibe here underneath Chicago was very live! It was obvious that this bar/restaurant/lounge was a common hangout for locals. If you want a quiet ambience, this is Not the place to be.

Their drinks were very unique and cool for pictures. We ordered a couple worth about $15 each which came out great but didn't hit us well enough for seconds.

Food is limited to about 10 items. Starving from all the walking, we decided on the Pu Pu Platter which came out very delicious besides the eggrolls that had a awkward taste that I never encountered before.

Overall, the service was very fast and friendly, but felt as if they we're using their reputation more to take advantage on prices (supply and demand, right?).

..._ or V does indeed stand for Victory. This place was a major find. Although if you use Yelp and are in Chicago, it's pretty obvious that people love Three Dots and a Dash. My husband and I frequent tiki bars. I love the vintage Mid-Century feeling and pretending I'm on some island in the middle of nowhere without a care in the world. This bar provided that exact feeling. I didn't have a care in the world here. Everything was perfect.

When we arrived it was PACKED. Can't blame them for being really good at what they do. We put our name in with the hostess and they told us they would text when they had a seat for us. I figured we would end up standing the whole night, but that was not the case. We stood by the bar and watched the bartender work his tropical tiki madness. Grabbed our drinks and *bling* text message. We could sit down. Perfect timing.

The place was beautifully adorned in tiki lounge craze madness. Although, it wasn't stuffy and dusty. You were truly transported to another place and time. The servers were attentive and friendly. You were never waiting around to order another drink.

SPEAKING of drinks. I've never seen a bartender so passionate and delicately build a drink the way this place does. From precisely measuring the ingredients to shaving fresh coconut and  adorning your cocktail with fruit and flowers, this place cared about every step of every cocktail they made. And for how much detail went into each drink, you weren't waiting very long at all. Either that, or the entertainment of watching the bartender distracted you from the time. I think it was a combo of the two.

If you live in Chicago, live near Chicago, are visiting Chicago, or live nowhere near Chicago, this place is worth it. Go, go, GO.

pics.caption: Reserve a large party for this seating

review.des: Really interesting underground tiki bar. Make a reservation if you're going with a large party so that you can be seated and get the group drinks!

Such a cool place! Feels like a speakeasy because it's hard to find the entrance, hidden down an alleyway.  Tropical vibe, fruity/strong drinks, and fun atmosphere. Recommended for locals and tourists, especially in the middle of our cold Chicago winters!

Haven't been there in a while, but I really enjoyed my two visits. The drinks are delicious, the food is delicious.

However, at least on my visits, it's just way too crowded for my tastes. There's a chance that has gotten better since I went, but it was the only thing keeping me from going more!

The atmosphere here is amazing. I felt very welcomed and comfortable coming here. Met some cool people and had some nice coconut shrimp. Also.... Brenda is AMAZING. She's so sweet, kind, and very personable. She made me two delicious fruity drinks that were honestly the best drinks I've ever had. I also loved the decor that came with them.... pineapple, cherries on one, a juicy watermelon piece on the other and not to mention the cute tiki cups. I couldn't even taste the alcohol! I'm not much of a run girl so Brenda substituted my drinks with vodka. Very very impressed. I'm glad I came on a weekday because the weekends are insane. This was more my crowd. Nice amount of people but still laid back. Thanks Brenda!

Fun, underground tiki bar for the novelty.  I've been here four times: twice with co-workers, once for a party and another time with a friend.  I'd say it's a great place to take someone from out of town if they like cocktails with a neon tiki atmosphere.  It's some big bucks for cocktails and small plates but it's nonetheless a unique place.

FUN FUN FUN... all the drinks were amazing... WE WENT FOR A FRIENDS BDAY... all preordered for us... NOT ONE COMPLAINT.... not cheap though... come with intentions of spending min of 50-70 per person... minimum....

I have wanted to come here for ages and thanks to a spur of the moment adventure, my friend and I finally did. I don't usually come to cocktail bars seeing as I don't really drink nor wanna ever drop more than 5 bucks on a beverage. However I remembered I had a lettuce entertain you gift card and alas the stars alined.  

I knew the entrance was in an alley but even with that tip the door was super hard to find; thanks to the guy tossing out some garbage who noticed my friend and I's confusion who had to then point out the door. No sign, not really lit so good luck when you come here for the first time.

I made a reservation for 9:30 and we were seated 20 mins later which was understandable since the place was pretty packed for a rainy Thursday.

While we were waiting we had plenty of time to look over their menu, which was pretty small in my opinion. I thought they would have a sea of fruity cocktails but none the less a pretty fun selection. I went with the Dead Reckoning and my friend got the Jet Pilot. I absolutely LOVE the cups your drinks come in and wish I could've taken mine. We went with two drinks that had side notes warning they pack a punch because we could only afford one drink each anyways, haha. We were both very happy with our drink selections.

The highlight of my experience was the fact Pau Gasol, a Chicago Bulls player I love, walked in. Overall I had a great experience and are glad I treated my friend and I to a nice drink.

Oh and the staff was really nice. I recommend making a reservation since it gets busy.

We came in after dinner for drinks on a Saturday night around 11PM. This place was PACKED! Under many difficulties we finally squeezed our butt to the bar and we each ordered our own drink. The drinks were strong and nice. On the plus side they probably forgot to charge our tap.
We went in to check out the live music, and left after a couple of drinks - because music starts only after 10 pm.
If you have a little extra to spend, this is the place. Great atmosphere and delicious drinks. My friends and i never leave unhappy or sober.

Tourist trap, long line to get in on weekends, and slightly over-priced. But, the drinks and fun, and it is a good place to bring people who are visiting from out of town. but don't expect a seat. Wait for a table is usually over an hour, and the bar is legitimately like a zoo.

But, if you got money to blow, get that smoking drink I have a picture of here. So fun do to with friends! 5-6 people and you're barely gonna get three gulps in. But, it's fun and for the experience right?
Overpriced trendy place. Service is mediocre. Not sure why people like this place. Very expensive drinks in a basement tiki bar.

A tiki lounge hidden in River North - you would need to go through an alley that is lit with tiki torches.  The bar gets packed at the start of the night which may require wait time outside.  The inside of the bar as if you are transported to a Polynesian island.  The drinks are pretty strong, tasty and decorative.  A little pricey.  Overall, good experience with fun drinks for a good start to a night out.

A good place to check out!  Hard to find at first.  It gets packed quickly so there may be a wait time that you'll be outside of the bar until a table opens up.

This is one of my favorite cocktail bars in Chicago. The Polynesian decor, themed drinks and lighting create an exotic atmosphere that takes you away from the urban streets of Chicago and puts you in a tropical oasis. The drinks are delicious but a bit on the expensive side, however that is to be expected. I've always had a fun time here, the only downside is that this place gets very crowded, very quickly.

I've been there a couple of time and every time it has been wonderful.  The staff did an amazing job in our private area and kept the drinks flowing.   Great place for a private party or for just meeting friends.

Awesome place! After reading an article naming Three Dots and a Dash one of the "best Tiki bars in America", I knew I had to try this place on my next visit to Chicago! Because the food menu is light, the boyfriend and I decided to come here for pre-dinner drinks on date night. We made reservations online 4 days in advance and the only time slot open was at 5pm...on a Monday!  I do want to note that I'm not sure how accurate their OpenTable reservation system is, or how many seats they keep open outside of their reservation system, because for taking the last availability on this day, they were completely empty when we arrived. The place filled up within the two hours we were there, but if you're curious to come here and you don't see an opening in their reservation system, don't be discouraged and try your luck anyway!

Also, as noted by the other reviews, the entrance to this place is in an alley - east of Clark, between Hubbard and Illinois. There is a small brown sign hanging over the doorway so it was not too hard to find.

Once inside, you walk down a few dark stairs and at the basement level, you're immediately transcended into a dark Tiki bar with a lounge atmosphere. The lighting is fun, the bartenders and servers are festive, and the overall ambiance is sexy, welcoming, and nice without being too obnoxious. This turned out to be the perfect place to begin our date!

After a tour of the menu by our friendly server, we enjoyed the following:

Painkiller No. 109 - Virgin Island & Jamaican Rums, coconut, passion fruit, pineapple, cream
The Original Bunny's Banana Daiquiri - Jamaican spiced and overproof rums, coconut liqueur, banana, lime, nutmeg
Three Dots and a Dash - Aged Rhum Agricole, Guyanese rum, honey, falernum, lime, allspice, angostura bitters
Poipu Beach Boogie Board - Rye whiskey, overproof rum, guava, maraschino, grenadine, pineapple, lemon

Can I say they were all good?! The drinks are expertly crafted and arrive adorned with cool garnishes, like the banana dolphin on my daiquiri. Seriously, this place is bomb dot com and a must-try in the city!

pics.caption: Three Dots and a Dash & The Original Bunny's Banana Daiquiri
Painkiller No. 109 & Poipu Beach Boogie Board
The Original Bunny's Banana Daiquiri - Jamaican spiced and overproof rums, coconut liqueur, banana, lime, nutmeg

review.des: I caught up with my friends here.  The hostess was nice, but this place closes early for a weekend, but if you like rum based drinks, this is the place to come.  The mucis is loud, and its diffcult to find a table

This bar is playful with great vibes. I didn't think I would have enjoyed an Hawaiian themed bar as much as I did! I checked out this spot when I was visiting Chicago and would definitely recommend this place even for tourists.

The bar is busy and dim light with tropical cocktails and good strong mixed drinks. Tables are available but there might be an hour wait on a busy night. I ended up hanging out next to the bar where there is standing room available. It is hard to not get into the aloha mood when you see cute dolphin shaped bananas coming out of drinks.

pics.caption: His & hers drink . Both were very good
The painkillers are good and not too strong on coconut flavor.

review.des: Happened in during a guest bartender night last year while in town for a food show.  The bar is absolutely packed with bartenders- no wonder, because so much work goes into each drink!  Amazing, memorable time.  Decor and lighting are fantastic and the drinks are inventive and delicious.  Go!

I'd recommend this place for folks visiting Chicago for the first time or those from the suburbs who have never been before. For those in the city, go once and you're good. The drinks are okay and decently priced for what you get, but overly sweet. I couldn't really drink for the rest of  the night after one cocktail because the sweetness was just too much. The place tends to be overcrowded, making it hard to get a drink int he first place and they typically have staff directing people to move (but to where?) because of safety (valid). Not to mention, there's not much of a dance floor and the music sticks to the standard tiki bar music...and no, no Jimmy Buffet that you could at least sway to. Honestly, it's a fun place, but it's turned into a tourist trap in the last few years.

Honestly, when someone told me "tiki bar" I imagined a college-y bar with a sticky floor littered with drink umbrellas. Not here. This is a classy, sit-down bar. Gets loud in the later hours, so if you're thinking of a date or catch-up, definitely come early. I was here for a friend's birthday. We got seated right away at 8. Drinks are expensive but really creative and good, with really fun glasses. The decor is classy. A perfect place for a classy night out. The two things I'd keep in mind is that they are slow with drinks, and they're Chicago drink prices, so expect to pay more than expected.

This is a fun idea for a bar, but it does get very busy and loud! The drinks were sweet (obviously since it's a tiki bar) but also a bit weak for the price! Our waitress was a bit neglectful to be honest, and our table placement wasn't great (right in the middle of the room, lots of people walking by and bumping into us or the table itself). Make sure to reserve a table or be prepared to wait in line. Fun to check out though.

What a cool hidden spot! Our group finished the evening here and we are very glad we did. We ordered the treasure island drink, which was hilarious and fun, and we got some appetizers that were great. Definitely make a stop here! (:

I went here with a great friend on a cool Saturday night. There was a short wait around 8pm. There was a line outside too. However, if u preferred standing only, you could enter sooner. Great Hawaiian atmosphere. It was really crowded. A lot of, "excuse me, excuse me". But the place wasn't super big. I forgot the name of my drink, but I posted the pic in this review. The young lady with the grey dyed patch in her dark hair made it. It was amazing to watch her craft the drinks. Great time. On my next visit, I'll go earlier and during the week.

Everything about this place is WOW. Came in on a Wednesday night which was probably the best decision ever because what I hear from my friends, there is always a crazy line on weekends so actually I recommend to go on a weekday to avoid any line!

It was my first time there and definitely got lost because I had no idea where the entrance was! I heard from a couple of people how the entrance was in an alley way and using the GPS it was not really useful. Thankfully, we ran into a stranger who has been there before and helpfully pointed us in the right direction. It's actually hidden to speak on a serious note. When we were walking, we actually passed it without even noticing it. So just note that the entrance is actually in the alley.

When you enter, there is a wall of skulls before heading downstairs and it was so beautiful. Even when we were downstairs, the decor was amazing. It definitely kept with the tiki theme and it was so cute. We grab three drinks to share amongst the two of us and seriously it all very strong. I think we left kind of buzz which sometimes is a good feeling. Definitely recommend! Pricing are as how it should be for a downtown location, pricy.
I went here with some co-workers a few years ago and we love it. The food and drinks were good. The service was excellent.

If you enjoy strong alcohol with a bit of sweetness this is the spot. I came here with my friend to celebrate her success on the NCLEX. We got the WIKI WIKI which had Brandi along with Mango. The vibe here is very chill with Hawaiian  music in the background. This place is pretty packed, so I would suggest to reserve beforehand for a group.

You hate tipping bartenders for bringing you beers from the cooler?
Don't you worry, the bartenders here are very skilled and so much work will be put into make one drink.

Please tip them well and don't be cheap. The drinks are amazing. The mugs are very unique as well, not your average drink.

I've been here many times and always enjoy coming here.
Try aloha Felicia you won't regret

You know you have to go to a bar you've already bookmarked when your friend's hip parents also highly suggest the bar after being knocked out after a drink and a half.

Okay, so I wasn't particularly looking to experience that last part since it was my last night in the city and didn't exactly want to wake up at 1 p.m. with a huge hangover before my flight. Apparently, Three Dots and a Dash shares the same address with Bub City but Three Dots and a Dash's entrance is in the back alley between North Clark and North Dearborn...which is makes this place kind of hidden, but not quite so because almost everyone knows about it.

I was not happy to see a line stretched down the alley/parking lot, especially in the cold but the 20-minute wait was not awful. I haven't been to enough bars in Chicago to know if bars usually get crowded to the point where you feel claustrophobic and have to squeeze in to order at the bar, but I can see why they like to keep a limited capacity. It was not overwhelming at the bar and it was pretty refreshing to not even have to try to flag down the bartender (who I think his name was Eddie) and have him come to you.

I had the Bunny's Banana Daiquiri and I love that they used a real banana in the mix but oh man, this was too sweet for my liking; the best I can describe this is that it's like a spiked, watery smoothie. This was no light drink at all--the mix was heavy (not necessarily heavy on the alcohol) and will probably make you regret having dinner. My friend had the Dead Reckoning and it was a lot lighter. They seem to mainly use Jamaican Rum in their drinks, so a plus if that's your calling. 5 starts for presentation, too.

This place was filled with a lot of nice people and because they limit a certain amount of people at a time, you will probably not have to push your way to get through and get elbowed. There was a dance floor...but it was dead, which was sad. Gimmicky but a must-visit for Chicago nightlife...unless you live in the Pacific Islands.

Truly a fun place .They have really creative drinks - very HAWAIIAN kinds ... also, has a good decor . Kinda has a secret passage . So google map it. We ordered some shrimp appetiZer which was presented very well but I think food can be improved and drinks can be stronger .

Came to this place with a few of my girlfriends and it was good. The service was excellent and the food and drinks were ok.

We got the $35 plate with mix of all the appetizers. I only liked the sliders and crab Rangoon. The other appetizers were either cold or too salty.

The drinks were also good but I got a stomach ache drinking the aloha Felicia.

Overall, I would come back because the service was the best and the place is pretty cool.

The service at Three Dots and a Dash is exceptional. In an environment that makes you feel like you're enjoying a tropical getaway (even in a brutal Chicago winter) the service was personal and the staff personable. We thoroughly enjoyed our server Carly, both friendly and informative about the menu, and the manager Kurt- who visited our table to welcome us and check on our experience. On a busy night we still managed to be squeezed in to a great table. Would absolutely recommend to friends!

As if this place needed another review!

It's great for the experience - it's hard to find tiki bars in downtown Chicago but if you want to escape for a little bit, it's perfect. The drinks are about $13 and they're strong as hell. 2 will keep you buzzed for the night -- in the best way possible.

My friends and I ordered so many but my favorites were the mai tai and the painkillers. You'll see skulls next to a few drinks on the menu. Be careful - they are STRONG.

The ambiance is great and if you go on a weeknight, the lines aren't too bad and you'll get a table pretty easily! I would also recommend Lost Lake, since it was started by the same person! It's kind of like a scaled down version of Three Dots. So glad I went! Service was prompt and great too!

pics.caption: The banana daiquiri! So cute! Props to the guy who thought of a banana garnish.

review.des:
This wonderful little underground tiki bar is adorned with tan grass fringes, skulls, and totem poles throughout. Three Dots reminds me of Polynesian island in Hawaii. Luau-y, tropical, and laid back.

Reservations are hard to get at this place, so reserve well in advance. Reservations were made for myself and four others two weeks before labor day weekend for Saturday Night of that labor day weekend. We had a booth, and ordered just the drinks.

All of the drinks come in unique glasses & containers, some of the glasses you can even buy as keepsakes. The drinks are also garnished with fruit peels, spices such as cinnamon sticks, and/or toothpicks with plastic skulls on the end.

Our server was friendly, kind in helping us choose drinks, and was good with refilling our water glasses.

DRINKS: most of the drinks are pretty strong, the stronger drinks are indicated with a picture of a skull next to the name of the drink on the menu.

*Saturn* This drink comes in an alien, tiki-god style glass.  Tastes like Pineapple Sunny-D!

*Chief Lapu Lapu* The presentation of this drink is fun, it comes out smoking in a boat-like container, and has a giant slice of pineapple in the middle with colorful flowers and figurines.

*Jet Pilot* This drink comes in a tiki-god/skull glass.

I highly recommend coming here to pregame before a party!

They have very creative/strong cocktails if you want to explore your taste buds! I was able to get in here with my friends twice with no problem and not much of a line. Entrance through the alley way if you don't know already. :)

Had some beers at Goose Island before stumbling over here and I'm glad we did because I'm not sure how long I would've stood in line for a tiki bar if I was sober :) JK! Or am I ..

We made some new friends while in line and to be fair, the line did move pretty quickly. I want to say that we waited about 15 minutes at most. We walked downstairs into a dimly lit room and it was pretty packed but we were able to squeeze in the bar to order some drinks and stand off to the side where there was a little side table. It was very busy but everyone was more or less understanding of how packed it was and no one really had any problems ordering drinks. I had a banana daiquiri first which was delicious and even had a banana dolphin sticking out of it! Then, I asked the bartender for 2 of their strongest drinks and ended up with some mai tais :D The bathrooms were never busy [always a plus when everyone's drinking] and super clean with an attendant inside as well.

The lighting and fun staff definitely made this an enjoyable experience and all the customers were there to have a good time which also added to its charm. I don't know how often I'd come here if I was a local but I'd definitely recommend it for out of towners to experience at least once!

Note: I was wearing jean shorts, Nikes & a tank top while our new friends were dressed up .. safe to say there's no dress code.

Well, this place is extraordinary for atmosphere.  
From the moment you descend the stairs into to the lair, you are entranced.  The host last night was very courteous and granted us a table for a hour or so even without a Rez, on a very busy Saturday evening.   Most drinks are served in classic, fun tiki kitsch containers.  But, and this is a very big but, my Mai Tai was terrible.  It tasted like pure rum, nothing else except ice.  The waitress did warn me it was strong, or high octane, in their parlance.  I should have just sent it back and got something else, as I could not drink it.  If you have a tiki bar, you have to be able to make a great Mai Tai.  I tasted my friends drink, something with cucumber and foam, it was delicious.

Overall, I love the concept and the decor of this bar.

Unfortunately, this bar has become TOO popular. There is not enough room for all the people, you always have to wait outside in line for at least 10 minutes to get in, and when you do get in, it takes about 20-30 minutes to get a drink at the bar. That's only if you are aggressive about it!

The drinks are $13 which I think is fair for Chicago and the amount of work they put into their drinks. The drinks themselves are really good, full of liquor, and have a cute look to them.  

There is just way too many people for me. I will only come back during an off time.

This review is for Sunday, July 31.

I usually come on weekdays and it's pretty awesome concept.  However, the current service policies don't scale when the bar gets busy.  Bartenders with a PACKED bar don't have a designated service area so you must shove people and shout your order at the bartender. I counted 8 empty tables when I came in.  When I asked the hostess for any space for 2, she said I would be 17th on the list. Yeah sounds like management is waiting for the ever elusive 6 -8 top table to walk through the door while they lose out in flipping 2 - 3 top over and over in the same time generating equal or more $. I'm a food service vet so I know the concerns.  However, the fear of having a 2 or 3 people occupy a 5 top is never a reason to keep it open for hours at a time.  Because we couldn't sit down, we were ready to drop $100 plus on food and more on drinks.  Oh well, I guess they're still waiting for that potential party of 6. On Sunday. At 12:30AM.

Word to the wise? CALL BEFORE YOU GO.  Ask how busy it is and ask if there are tables available for your party.  If no? I strongly recommend some place else.

Although this bar is located in a windowless Loop basement, the decor and the staff make you feel like you've been transported to a tropical oasis. The space is surprisingly large. I've never had trouble being served right away. The menu is very heavy on rum based drinks, but the waitstaff are super helpful if you're in need of recommendations.

Trust me when I say this is a 2 drink kind of place. You will either walk away escaping diabetes or dive into a third and crawl away thinking you have been rescued off an island. Cathay long enough and you forget you are in the middle of the city till the fresh air hits you.

The flavors across the different cocktails was impressive. I greatly enjoyed the Thai Fried Chicken - like Orange Chicken's mature and spicy older sister.  I honestly crave it again!

It's such an eat atmosphere.  Great date place.

Totally visit, eat, drink and tip your server!

Known for their pretty, exotic looking drinks, my friends and I decided to come and check it out since it has great reviews and pictures on Yelp. The drinks were indeed pretty but they weren't that good. We wanted to eat here so we put our name down but after an hour or so, we still didn't get a table. They had so many empty tables but they had reserve on it. Not very smart for them to do that imo because they had other customers waiting or leaving because of the wait. There were so many people by the bar to get their drinks but it was extremely hard to even order because it was loud, crowded, and difficult to get the bartender's attention.

After we got our drinks we didn't even know where to stand since 1) we couldn't use the tables even to just put our drinks on it and 2) extremely crowded to even find a space to stand.

All in all it was a good experience because of how much effort they put in to present their drinks to customers but don't expect to comfortably drink if you don't have a table.

This place is quite the experience! A tiki bar to warm you up from the cold Chi weather! I love the entire Caribbean theme! Too bad we only made it to the bar because there was absolutely no seating and you needed to call way in advance! It was crowded! The drinks are expensive but it does give you a tropical feel. I'm not sure if I would go back but I'm glad I came out to experience it!

Such a fun place to grab a drink with friends or fun date night! I stopped by with a friend to grab a drink and share an app! This place definitely lives up to its hype!! The entrance is down an ally way but is easy to spot due to the doorman and the row of tiki torches leading up to it!! We ended up sharing a drink that was served in a small punch bowl with a smoking tiki cup inside!! I had the spring rolls which I would also recommend!!

LOVE THIS PLACE! You have to go around and go through the alley to find this place. It's def a hidden gem. The decor is great, service was great. The drinks are strong and actually a lot smaller than I expected. I would def come back here for good food, drinks and music!

Some co-workers and I came here after dinner for a night cap. We enjoyed the atmosphere and the theming a great deal. The rum drinks named after various bars in Hawaii are a nice touch.

We did not feel adventurous enough to try one of the group drinks, but they sure looked interesting.

The wait staff was friendly and attentive.

Favorite Tiki Bar; it's sophisticated, and yet very fun. You should make a reservation if you're in a group of more than 2 and want to sit, but it's also possible to stand at the bar while you wait for your table. The treasure chest drinks are super fun, and worth getting even if you're just two people- you'll definitely be able to finish at least the smallest one.

We came all the way from dallas, texas to visit the bar. We had a really bad experience before going in. They checked our ids and one of my friend had a valid  passport but he wanted another form of id !!! How can you consider another id as more valid than passport? Very racist behaviour!!! We tried to convince but he was very rude and said that she will not be welcomed in for no reason!!! I do not recommend anyone going to this bar!!!

I really like that place, except there were big lines to get in and to buy a drink. It was super crowded, but we definitely enjoyed the cocktails we had:)
So just make a reservation and you will love it!

pics.caption: We tried almost all drinks from the menu
The Three dots and dash special cocktail-one of the best
I liked the middle one the best

review.des: A tourist must. A little hard to find, as the door is in an alley, but that only adds to the hipster vibe. Best tiki bar I've been to; being underground helps the illusion. Very Pirates of the Caribbean. Drinks are pricey: $14+, and without a reservation you'll end up standing by the bar, but that was fine with us. The drinks come loaded with decorations and are presented in killer fashion. Utterly delicious, too. They're not skimping on flavor or liquor.
Very cool atmosphere especially when its really cold out as this establishment has a very Hawaiian vibe! Drink were tasty and filled with alcohol. A bit pricy.

Went here for my 21st and I loved the atmosphere! A super lowkey spot if you wana just chill with your friends. (Literally took a minute to find the alley to enter as its hidden) Minimal lighting and the drinks were the bomb! This is a tiki hut so expect flowers and cool looking skeleton cups to drink out of. Ordered a few sliders as we got hungry and I must say they were quite tasty. Overall, very happy with my experience!!

One of my favorite bars in the city! The tiki bar atmosphere can offset the awful winter weather in Chicago. The drinks are pricey but you get what you pay for.

I was lucky to get a spot at the bar the first time I went and chatted with the bartender as she made my drink. She was super knowledgeable and spent about 15 minutes making 3 drinks for my group. Whatever she put in there was amazing, I couldn't get enough. The drinks are strong enough to feel a little buzz after only 1.

Three Dots and a Dash is extremely popular so expect to wait if you go during a popular time. Even if it isn't busy they like to have a line so they make you wait to get in which is very annoying.

Went here for a birthday drinks night, 4 of us got a reservation for a table, very busy place. We tried all the shared drinks and loved it, had a few of the single rum drinks as well. Such a great spot for fun and giggles, the glasses are amazing, along with the cocktails. Definitely try this place for a gem in the city.

I feel like this place is more hype. You go down a small alleyway and into the building with the tiki sticks. When you enter, it looks so fun and colorful inside! I had high hopes when I walked in! I came with a small group of about 6. A bunch of us ordered the alpha Felicia (I think that was the name) and a couple others ordered different drinks. They all came in fun glasses that were decorated to fit the vibe! We probably should have tried the bowl drinks with the liquid nitrogen or fire or something because all the drinks we got were very sweet. I wanted to try some of the food. Coconut shrimp caught my eye first but I figured I can get that anywhere so I opted for the tofu noodles with vegetables. Most of us had assumed they were regular noodles WITH tofu, but the noodles are actually made from tofu. I didn't care for it too much, to be honest. A couple other girls ordered the spring rolls and the chicken which looked better but I hadn't tried it. Our server didn't seem to keen on helping our table either. It's an interesting experience, but I'd rather go to a different bar next time.

I was excited to bring my wife to this cozy, intimate tiki bar for cocktails and hor d'oeuvres. Unfortunately, the rude and unprofessional doorman set the tone for the evening. It began as we exited our vehicle and the request for ID's. The interior staff were s bit more professional, but may have picked up on the fact we were a bit put off by the alley doorman. As a Silver Rewards Member of Lettuce Entertain you, I am a bit surprised this particular conduct would be encouraged let alone tolerated.
The drinks were pretty good, but expensive. The food was also good, but expensive. It may have been worth it, because the concept is pretty cool and intimate. It's unfortunate that entry into this establishment was not pleasant and set the tone for the overall experience. This doorman, if he remains in the hospitality industry and wishes to advance needs to realize that he is a representative of the business, the first one. Probably won't be back. Plenty of other places such as "Aviary".

Not gonna lie, when I first saw you had to walk down an alley to enter, I thought I was visiting a sex dungeon. I like the dark nature of the bar and it's a great place to go with friends. You will spend a bit if you're ordering multiple drinks, but you will be pretty drunk afterward.

Love this bar! Creative drinks, awesome decor and fun atmosphere. Jet Pilot is outstanding.
Need to go back there every time I'm in Chicago.

Came with a friend on a Thursday evening around 9 pm to get drinks! Would definitely recommend getting reservations for this place - we hadn't and there was a 20 minute wait but the person graciously allowed us to take one of the reserved tables (next time will get reservation before!!). Getting to the place was a bit sketch feeling at first - you need to go into an alley and go through a door with lights around. They card you at that door so be sure to bring your ID! Then you head down the stairs and are greeted by tiki paradise!

The drinks are INCREDIBLE! My friend got the missionary's downfall (LOL) and it was sweet and fruity without being overly so. It was a beautiful yellow color and came with some fruit on top! I got their namesake (Three Dots and a Dash) and boy was it worth it!! It looks just like the picture and felt to be larger than my friend's! Took me awhile to get through it but it was delicious - the spices complemented the fruit juices and the rum was doing its job too!! Make sure to pay attention to the little skulls to see the strength of the rum because they're definitely good to follow. XD

The atmosphere was fun, the wait staff super attentive (and cutely dressed in vacay gear), and the music was relaxing and upbeat. And of course, the drinks were INCREDIBLE! Cannot wait to go again (with a reservation this time!!).

Went on Fri night to celebrate with friends for a bday.  Service was horrible, the waitress didn't come back on her own, we had to ask 2 different people to send her over so that we could order more drinks & food.  
When paying the bill, she charged our cards incorrectly after we listed the card # and amount to charge on the back of the receipt. When we showed her the issues she passed us over to someone else without an apology or anything.  This was my first & last time coming.  The drinks were good, food ok but service was horrible.  Not worth the $90 spent on two people.

I love three dots!...So long as i have a reservation or a table or it's not too crowded.

On weekend nights, it can get so outrageous that standing room feels like a privilege.

Yes, the pricepoint can be a bit high, but honestly, this is one of the few places you can feel a buzz off one drink so just bite the bullet, order something, and for goodness sakes make sure you get a table!

pics.caption: New menu! Bali Bali, dead reckoning, jet pilot

review.des: Came here for the first time on a weekday and it was absolutely packed! Totally see why though as this is all about the experience. Ambiance here is everything and drinks are strong and tasty. Loved everything I tried (two drinks lol). Every time I try to go back they are closed for a private event, but if you come earlier around 5pm they are typically open before the event. The light bites are ok but don't come here for the food. Great place to go with friends or on a date.

This is an awesome place. It's got a very Hawaiian/tiki theme to it that just makes the entire place look festive in a party way. Not only are the drinks tasty, they also come in really cool tiki cups (unfortunately you cant keep them). But I did get to keep a little alien toy I got with my drink. Great place to come with friends or family
I love the decor in this place. The entrance goes downstairs with a wall of skulls overhead. The drinks are over the top and awesome. You must visit at least once while you're in Chicago.
Pretty cool bar. Really well taken care of with CLEAN bathrooms!! Staff is super friendly. Music is great. Lots of sitting room if that's what you're looking for!

I visited this place months ago, apparently I forgot to write a review.  I was a Chicago resident for MANY years before moving to the burbs, so I only make my way to downtown Chicago once in a blue moon, and this was one of the places on my list of places to try, and in fact I had it bookmarked on Yelp.  I always think of every place down there as one of those you have to wait...horrible crowd...tourists...etc.  I sound old.
But, nonetheless my friend suggested we check this place out after dinner at Sienna Tavern, and off we went to find it...in a alley, of course.
First off, if you PLAN on coming here and KNOW you are coming here, I highly recommend making a reservation.  We came here on a Saturday night in September and thankfully scored a seat, though it was in the bamboo room, though.. a seat and got waited on.  We were allowed in the main room but it looked crowded and loud & whatnot with 20-something year olds, and that wasn't the scene we were looking for on this particular night.  We stayed for two drinks...yes, they are pricey but you get what you pay for and you pay City of Chicago prices of course.  The bamboo room wasn't horrible either, decent people watching, including the most boring bachelorette party ever.  The drinks were good, and so was the service.  I'm no sure I will make a point to return here, but I wouldn't necessarily stay away either.  Also, get in early...when we left there was a line to get in!

I don't really drink.  May be 1-5 drinks per year.  This place is absolutely outstanding.  You can never go wrong with a tiki-bar.  I really like tiki-bars because they are just so relaxing.  We went earlier this year and the weather was still cold.  We came in, walked up to the bar and I ordered a virgin drink in a coconut ceramic mug.  My date ordered something else.  The bartender meticulously makes our drinks.  When the bill comes, he only charges us for her drink and tells me "don't worry about your drink, it was just fruit juice."  Fruit juice huh?  The guy spent 10 minutes making my elaborate virgin drink which tasted phenomenal.  He even slapped some mint stalks around and threw in some fresh mint.  What did I do??  I gave him a $20 tip - that's what I did.  And I would do it again.  The passion that this bartender had for the drinks that he made and the way that he made us feel was superb.  Can't wait to go back.

Wow! This place was a blast. I'm typically a steak house guy so this was really worlds away from what I'd normally pick to visit. However, I was on vaca in Chicago and was told to check it out and am so glad I did.

The drinks were adorable, such a fun presentation. We got a handful of drinks, some had too much of a sour mix taste for me but the banana daiquiri was actually really delicious. I was craving it the next day. Also, the drinks were insanely cheap. It was like $12 for a drink with a beautiful presentation.

The decor was really cool. It's down some dark alley and then you go down stairs decorated with tons of skulls lit up in blue. The downstairs opens up to an awesome tiki bar. Reminded me of being on a cruise ship! The bartenders were super friendly even though they were crazy busy.

We went around 6:45 and still had to wait about an hour to be get a spot at the bar on a Thursday night. This is really the only downside...it was really disorganized and competitive to grab a seat. People who hadn't been there very would elbow their way into a seat opening up. A lot of steak houses will take names at the bar and seat in order of arrival, I think this would make the place more enjoyable and organized.

pics.caption: How adorable is this daiquiri? I was scrumptious too!

review.des: Loved it here! I went with some friends on my birthday this year, and even though more people showed up than I had booked a table for, our server got us in a booth on a crowded night and was super nice and attentive all night.
