I got the Three Dots and a Dash and it was very yummy. Can't wait to come back!
Great ambiance , cute cocktails glasses , delicious cocktails, a little expensive - good for date night or group of friends outing

This place is AWESOME! the cocktails are delicious! Love the ambiance!  You must have reservations if you actually want to sit, if not there's a standing bar area. Service was great, I'll definitely be back!

Probably one of the cutest coolest bar spots in Chicago! They have awesome drinks and i love the chicken! I enjoy coming here to relax, chat with friends and enjoy a great drink. I would definitely suggest this place if you want a chill low key environment with friends in the river north area.

A really touristy spot indeed but so cute. I recommend to anyone in town for the first time and wants a fun experience (versus high-end one). They do a lot of drinks with theatrical elements, such as smoke/fog. Cocktails are very strong and some of them overly sweet. Won't be able to hear your partner/friends talking and may not be able to get a seat, but in a centrally located area.

The pandan pain killer here is my favorite mixed drink EVER lol. I loooove pandan but have never seen it used in a drink. Easy to drink, and not as strong as their other silent killers like the jet pilot that my fiance got.  We only stopped by for a quick drink before dinner but will have to come back for dinner sometime. Love the tiki ambiance!

I had an awful experience at this establishment. The hostesses were delightful, and attempted to accommodate our two separate parties of 8 and 4   by sitting us together and only requiring us to pay 20% gratuity to the server, no problem.  The manager, Gregory Ruger, approached hour party 30 minutes later before we were seated and stated we were given wrong information by his staff and would be required to spend a minimum, no problem, but a contradiction of what we were told. After being seated together, the manager and security than told us we couldn't sit together and ask part of our party to move to another table, another contradiction of what we were told earlier.  The manager then stated we have to increase our minimum spending limit in a rude condescending tone, assuming we were not  there to spend money. We left and went to an establishment that appreciated our business. We felt unwelcomed and targeted by this manger, the staff and security stated under anonymity that he targeted us due to us being a party of people of color.

Only reviewing the drinks, but I'm a big fan of this place! You can't go wrong with a tiki speakeasy! The atmosphere of this place does not disappoint....the exterior and means of getting to the bar induces a bit of giddy excitement....you have to go down a dark stairwell. And then the bar itself has a tongue-in-cheek, retro, sophisticated tiki bar!

Their drinks are BEAUTIFUL! Jet pilot and their daiquiri are some of their best! They have elaborate, kitschy garnishes...some with lovely flowers and elaborate "straw art". My second trip I tried the crash landing, which was good, and strong....it seemed to have a bit too much of an anise and nut meg flavor to it, which left a pretty yucky after taste.

The drinks are definitely pricey, but the motif of the restaurant, strength and appearance of their drinks makes up for it! I haven't tried their food, but it seems to be a bit of a limited menu--mostly Hawaiian style bar food.

Highly recommend for cocktails and a unique experience!

I absolutely love it here.  When you first enter there's a really dope skull wall art where you might want to take a photo.  

There are great island drinks here with awesome music. All the drinks are made differently and of course I had to get the dolphin drink.  The Three Dots and a Dash actually has 3 dots and a cut of pineapple.  Tropical drinks are usually creepers and is always like juice.  

Before coming here I heard it would be packed, but thankfully when I visited there was space to move around and actually have a table to sit.  Make reservations to avoid all this or walk-ins are welcomed as well.

This is a great bar, it doesn't matter what time of year.  The drinks are delicious and it is obvious that who ever creates them knows what they are doing. The drink menu changes enough that it keeps you coming back for the latest and greatest. Compliments to the creator of the drinks.  

The next best experience at 3 Dots is a young and beautiful bartender named Sophia who knows the drinks, knows how to treat a customer and has the most beautiful smile to keep you coming back for more. She is 3 Dots shining star!

The food is delicious but could use a bit more variety.
Drinks were ok but very rude waitress.   She seemed more more concerned about closing the tab for the night than giving good service.   Will not return if this is the level of current service.

Ambiance is cool! Love the tiki! Drinks are all tiki related... Lots of rum. I was visiting from San Diego and decided to try this spot out-someone recommended a reservation because it's packed on a Sat & they claimed they waited 2 hours previously. Tried getting a reservation without success but decided to see if we could get in. The wait (in an alley with tiki torches) was about 15 min- not bad. The wait for drinks (with the first couple of our group) took 20 min, a piece, at least. We had a group of 8, the waitresses were extremely rude about where we were standing, yet there was only so much room to stand in line and we weren't trying to cut or stop people who were waiting from getting drinks. I quickly got tired of being stuck in line after almost an hour of holding a drink I didn't feel right drinking since a few of my group didn't have drinks yet. I also noticed quite a few open tables so I walked out to talk to the hostess who was sooo cool and tried to find a spot to have us seated- successfully! Friends were happy & impressed but our waitress wasn't interested in waiting for us to finish with our first round, nor was she interested in bringing us menus for us to order another round, so 3 of our 8 decided to leave. Buzz kill! I asked another waitress for menus and we eventually ordered fishbowls. Too bad half the group already left. I requested light ice in my fishbowl (hot/cold tooth sensitivity) from our disinterested waitress- didn't get it. We quickly left. It was my birthday and I was visiting from San Diego- this place was not worth the hype (check grass skirt, false idol, & Bali hi in SD for decent tiki bars). The 3 stars are for the front door staff, hostess, & bartenders. Chicago- I expected so much more! What a disappointment!

Walking into that alley, through that door with the very small sign, and down those gloomy stairs, I would have never expected to find a bar like this. You walk in and you feel like this is the bar you've been going to all your life. So much fun! I've never been to a bar with this kind of atmosphere before.

Even though it was noisy, it felt so chill and relaxed. The drinks are so creative and tasty. Where else can you get a drink with a banana dolphin in it? Plus they are super strong! They really give you your money's worth. I really didn't need a second drink for the rest of the night.

Since it was completely packed, we weren't able to sit down and get any food. Hopefully the next time I come back to Chitown I will be able to try some because the pictures look delicious.

This place is unique and I completely recommend it for all you tourists and out-of-towners like me. You'll have such a great time. I guarantee it.

The location and the layout are very cute and fun looking i love how you have to go down to the basement to get there. The drinks look very fun and great. There prices are as bad as some drinks down town the only thing is im not a big rum drinker so they didn't satisfied me. over all the concept of the this place is great tho.

I went to Three Dots and a Dash after dinner on a Friday night. My friend and I arrived at around 9pm and it was packed! The wait for a table was 2 hours so we opted for bar seating instead. The bar had a nice atmosphere but the drinks were definitely on the pricier side. They came in very festive cups. I would go again for an occasion but maybe not for happy hour.

Went here with my family.... They love to drink, so I thought this was a nice place for them to experience.

We got the pu pu platter and our faves were the thai fried chicken and coconut shrimp. For drinks we got: chief lapu lapu - very refreshing, the jet pilot - don't get if you don't like cinnamon, violet revolver - strong drink, good if you like cognac.

All in all a nice and different bar scene from the usual

I've been wanting to try this place for a long time but have a small tolerance for lines which gets even smaller when its winter.  This was a good option for happy hour especially being able to arrive there just a few minutes before the opening and we could get a table.  (Apparently, they now take some reservations which would be a good option in the future.)

It is a little difficult to find if you don't know what you're looking for.  The entrance is off the alley by Hubbard. Since it is somewhat speakeasy-ish, the sign is small but just look for the line.  Once you get in, it has a nice decor which goes with the ambiance.

Being a newbie, I relied a lot on our waitress to pick a drink.  When she suggested the Mai Tai, I must have looked skeptical, but she assured me iit was amazing and most other places don't make it right. It was the best Mai Tai I've had.  It wasn't too sweet at all but was fresh and light.  My sister had the Bunny Banana Daquiri which was a boozy smoothie (and came with a banana dolphin).  Both drinks definitely pack a punch.  Finally, we shared the Dead Reckoning on recommendation.  The rum, port, pineapple, vanilla and bitters played very well with each other.  All of the drinks were well-balanced and boozy but smooth.  

The drinks aren't cheap at $13/cocktail but are fairly in line with the area. They also offer punch bowls which would be good for a group.  While I wouldn't wait in a really long line, it was a good experience and I'd definitely go back.

pics.caption: The Bunny Banana Daquiri and Mai Tai

review.des:
This bar located in old speak easy is a fantastic place to go the prices of the drinks are expensive so this might not be here every day hang out there for special occasions for to bring a certain special someone this is definitely the place to check out.

We also have some appetizers while were there and they were absolutely delicious

This is a cool place to go if you're really into having a cool atmosphere, but that's pretty much the only reason to go.
That being said, the atmosphere really is grand. Just looks cool and feels cool even if it's way too dimly lit in there, even for a bar.
The drinks are awesome to look at because they come in seriously unique glasses, but they're super pricey and none of the four people in my party were particularly impressed by what we got.
Bottom line: cool place, not worth the price.

The entrance is kinda shady because it was in an alley but was really cool. Staff were really friendly. We ordered "jet pilot" for my husband and "pandan pain killer" for me, it was really really good. Jet pilot was strong but delicious. Pandan pain killer is superb. Love the ambiance. Will definitely go back.
We loved this place. Really good service. The cocktails are awesome and the food is very good too. It's hard to get a table in a Friday night so make sure you call and reserve.

The best tiki bar in he US.  I used to travel extensively for work and always sought out tiki bars as a fun pastime.  The bartenders are amazingly fun to chat with, drinks are nothing short of spectacular, and the food is certainly not to be missed.
Cool drinks. Obnoxious to find a spot in the bar to drink it.... Like... people are aggressively posted up at the bar with their drinks. Whatever I guess.

This place is pretty unique, and I have yet to find a place in the U.S. that combines the fun atmosphere of a tiki bar with a DJ and a lounge ambiance.

The drinks are somewhat pricey, but they are strong, potent, and intriguingly flavored, so it's worth the money!

The only downside is it's always packed every time I'm in Chicago visiting, and it's almost impossible to walk in and get a table/reservation.

3 Dots!! If you like those crazy cool looking drinks this is the place to be. If you want to go on a cute little date I feel like this is the place to go. Drinks are a little pricey but hey you're paying for the experience. It does get very busy and usually have to book reservations weeks in advance.

Brilliant! The appeal of this tucked away hip and hard to find basement treasure is the experience. It is not so much a culinary find as a place to be seen drinking deliciously presented libations. The attention to detail and creative presentation of your liquid dinner is something not to be missed by avid night owls and party animals.

I paid over 70 dollars for three cocktails and a beer for a group of four. I'm pretty sure I was overcharged. Those prices are pretty ridiculous. That's an average of 17.50 per drink, and one was a beer! We ordered basic cocktails like a whiskey/ginger ale and vodka/tonic and yet they charged more as if they were fancy. Pretty upset with my experience here.
The drinks were delicious, the service was amazing and even helped me with which drink to get. And i love the location very tropical and mysterious.

The drinks are really good and a lot of fun.  That said, the food is pretty underwhelming; mostly appetizers which are good but nothing to write home about.  The atmosphere is fun, though.  It's a good place for a drink or two after work or on a date.

Came on a Thursday night with 4 people without a reservation and was seated right away.  I've heard that doesn't happen often so a reservation is a safer bet.  The drinks are strong and the ambiance is awesome!

I was informed by the doorman that they have a dress code. I came wearing sweats and flip flops but was not allowed in. It is a Tiki Bar! People wear flip flops while sipping cocktails in a cute mug! Besides, there was a manager answer in April here saying theres no dress code so there must have been some profiling or the guy at the door was not trained properly.

One of my favorite places in the city - it is decorated like a true tiki bar - each drink has its own special glass - and they are tremendous!

If you come to Chicago - this is a must stop!

Despite going on a date here where I tripped into another customer's table where their drinks flew onto them and glass shattered, I would say Three Dora and a Dash is a great place! They have such a fun variety of drinks, their ambience is refined, and staff are very helpful in embarrassing situations.

Oh my gosh i love this place! My friend and I were looking for a place to eat on NYE and somehow got a 6pm reservation at Three Dots and A Dash for 4 people. Crazy! First time here.

Not the easiest place to find let me tell ya. We walked around in 0 degree weather with no coats looking for the entrance. After asking about 4 different people, we finally figured it out. But this is part of what makes the place so cool. Right when you walk inside, you walk downstairs to get to the restaurant.

Right when we walked in (15 min late because it was so hard to find), they told us they were doing last call because they were closing down at 7 to prep for NYE. We were confused because the lady on the phone told us we could order drinks until 6:45 so we spoke to a manager who was very friendly and let us order two rounds while we were there.

DRINKS: We asked the server for her recommendation (great server!) and ended up ordering the Zombie Punch. It was so delicious and such a cool concept! It came in a big skull head and there were four huge bendy straws so we all just shared and sipped it. Then ordered another one. Oops. Never had a drink like this before!

FOOD: We ordered the Luau Chips with Pineapple/Avocado dip, Thai Fried Chicken and the Hanali Spring Rolls, which were both delicious! So tasty. it was perfect too because none of us were that hungry and really just wanted some light bites.

It is fairly expensive but such a cool spot with great food, drinks and vibes. I'll be back!

pics.caption: Zombie Punch plus Luau chips and guac

review.des:
The cocktails here are so instagram worthy it's ridiculous.  They are pretty tasty as well.  Mine came with a flower and an alien.  I mean, what more could you want???
All of the tables are marked reserved.  I am not sure if they really are.  The second time we came with my husband's colleagues.  En route, I decided to look for reservations for tables online.  There were plenty.  So, I reserved a table 5 minutes before arriving for 8 of us.  Go figure.....

THREE DOTS AND A DASH IS INCREDIBLE. I would frequent this bar if I lived in Chicago. The drinks are unique and the atmosphere was so fun. I highly suggest to anyone looking for a fun date or wanting to try a new bar. You might have to wait in the alley beforehand because this bar is always packed!

I came here on a recent trip to Chicago due to some suggestions from friends and some buzzfeed and thrillist research. The atmosphere is awesome, the experience is worth talking about, but the drinks were terrible. If I'm going to pay $80+ for a punchbowl it should presumably serve me more than one serving (even split 4 ways), and it should be a drink I actually enjoy the taste of, it honestly tasted like trash can punch I've had in college years back, except way worse. Im a huge fan of an experience, of punch bowl drinks, and a place with good vibes, but this is a place I wouldn't bother going back to-- especially when the dive bar we ended up hopping to around the corner was cheaper (obviously), with better drinks, and way friendlier staff.

Pretty pricy but the drinks are so cute and tasty! I'd also say you get your money's worth with the alcohol in the drinks, it's a fair/reasonable amount. Service has always been great too! They're funny, friendly and attentive.

I would say this is the top bar that we end up taking friends or family visiting from out of town as it is a really well done tiki bar with a cool vibe and ambiance. But beware as the drinks are super potent! My go to concoctions would be the Jet Pilot or Dead Reckoning. They do offer small bites if you're looking to snack, but definitely would not think to do a full meal here. I've had the coconut shrimp which was super tasty! If you're looking to get a table, be sure to book a reservation in advance!

Always a good time here! Go go go! 'Til next time, cheers!

pics.caption: Surf Report ~ gin, cucumber, anisette, & mint! Cowabunga dude!

review.des: Love the atmosphere. Service is always great! This is a Lettuce Ent spot. Amazing cocktails food is also really good. Nice date night spot  and always fun with groups.

It's expensive and touristy feeling, but the drinks are tasty, unique, and Instagram worthy, plus the food is melt in your mouth good. Make sure to make a reservation, it gets crowded and you'll definitely want a table for all the delicious food and photos you'll be consuming and creating.

I went here for a friend's birthday. I was so confused as to where the door was for this place. J saw tiki torches in the alley but no entry way and no sign that showed me where I could enter. Finally someone who was leaving, showed me where to enter. I love the vibe inside and the drinks are all pretty interesting. The waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable about everything on the menu. The food is not bad either. But since we had dinner plans else where, we only had appetizers.
Amazing drinks!  It's cool and hidden.  Pricey but worth it.

Amazing tucked away spot to gets drinks in the River North area. As soon as you walk down the stairs it seems you are transported to a tropical beach. The place was packed and the music was a bit loud, so it's not a great place for conversation but if you are looking for a cool place that serves awesome drinks this is it. I sampled a few drinks on the menu and all were great, but the shareable drinks are definitely the star of the show and the presentation of them is amazing.
This is late but we had the best time. The drinks were as tasty as they were lovely. The service was so friendly

Drinks are very strong. You can only get drinks that are in their menu and it's just an average bar. I thought it would be more fun. The theme was cool and the cups and decorations were also very interesting and fun.

Would I go here again?.... Probably not :/

Went here on a Sunday evening at approximately 7:30 pm.  We were early for our reservations, but the hostess seated us as there were available tables (no booths available).  We were immediately greeted by our waitress.  We asked for ideas as to never being there, and she made a few suggestions. One of the drinks I wanted in particular was no longer on the menu (saw it on yelp) and she suggested something that was similar.....but it wasn't close just looking at the list of ingredients.  She was not very knowledgeable on the drink menu.  The two drinks we had (pictured) were good although like most of the reviews state VERY small and filled with lots of ice.  The drinks reminded me of Sugar Factory (with the dry ice, etc) and small portions.  I gave 3 stars as the drinks were tasty though and would like to try again in the future, but this time really review I the menu and not ask for advise as we felt we were steered in the wrong direction.  Neat concept, very dark inside, difficult to see menu. I saw many patrons using their flashlight on the phones.  Didn't see any elevator for anyone that cannot make the stairs.

Good place to take visitors for a unique bar or go for a drink on a date night. Bartenders put a lot of effort into make elaborate, complex drinks.  Drinks are good but a little too sweet. Ambience is great!

We just went for drinks celebrating an anniversary. Wonderful service, DO make a reservation, DON'T expect too much drink with the specialty eye catching drinks. Although delicious, the Chief Lapu Lapu is not really for two, perfect for one. It's about 1.5 drinks. Most of it is just the pineapple with the dry ice. Beautiful but not much substance. Will definitely go back, however because of the setting, theme, and service.  Even the drinks were delicious. The second drink we got was the Main Tai and that drink felt like it was more than the big one  it was pretty and substantial and delicious. Love this place ! Next time we will have to try the food.

I love the drinks and ambiance here. My friends and I sometimes go here in the winter to escape the cold and transport ourselves to a tropical place. The drinks are a bit on the strong side, but tasty as well. If you're coming with a big group, you can try to make a reservation in order to avoid the long line.

This place is a cool gem hidden in a decent area . Went here for my bday the other day and the service was terrible the waitress obviously had a issue with serving us. I asked about a drink the table got next to me and she stated oh that was a gift . She wasn't helpful and just made it a poor experience.

This was my first tiki bar experience and I absolutely loved it!

The atmosphere is really laid back here and even though the bar was busy, it didn't take too long for one of the bartenders to acknowledge us. All their drinks are dangerously easy to drink (thus their warning on their menu to sip slowly!). The bartenders were fun to watch and really enjoy goofing off as they're making the drinks. Though their having a good time, they are serious about making each drink delicious and spend quite a bite of time preparing each concoction. Most of their signature drinks were about $14 and they have a drink to suit just about anyone's tastes. They also offer shareable drinks that served about 4 which looked really cool that ranged from about $60 to several hundred.

My favorite drink was probably the Poblano Escobar which was a pretty fruit drink but had a little spicy kick. The Aloha Felicia was a refreshing fruity yet creamy drink with a combination of coconut milk and basil which I  also enjoyed. Missionary's downfall is also a good one to try if you like the combination of citrus and mint. Their namesake drink was very strong and very citrusy. I also got to try the Western Sour and Painkiller, both of which were just too strong for me.

Overall this is a really cool spot to visit if you want something different from your typical club/bar.

The cocktails are to die for. Not many options for a meal. But if you are catching up with friends  and celebrating relations over cocktails , this is the place ! The coconut rum cocktail was AMAZING ! Keep smiling and keep drinking.
FYI: The entrance is through an alley kind of thing.
Amazing drinks. MUST have a reservation almost every night. All the frozen drinks don't have any chunks of ice and the big bucket of drinks are delicious.

Love this place. Super fun to go with some girl friends for a girls night!! Drinks are super yummy and they always change up the menu. Glasses and presentations are spot on. Such a fun place and for the amount of money you are spending on the drinks they sure are boozy! You cant taste how strong they are but three drinks will put you on your butt! Brenda is a bartender there she is fabulous you should go check her out. Girl has killer skills when it comes to making cocktails. There food is like appetizers but they are all so delicious, lettuce entertain you has made another great restaurant. I love there guacamole and chips (which I believe is friend banana or something similar to that but those are similar to pork rines and they are delicious). When your trying to get there you have to go through the alley which is a little creepy but once you get downstairs it is like you walked into a different place so crazy how cute it is. Music is always on point and if your going thursday-the weekend expect a little bit of a wait I have never seen it dead there.

Where to go with this one? Admittedly, though, this review took months because I wrestled with the desire to subjectively love the drinks and the raw idea of this place as contrasted against the overcrowding.  Ironically, this place shares an alley with the fire department, but I have the feeling that the occupancy is 100% wrong because it is always too crowded. Plus, it gets automatically docked for being in a basement.  (Please see, "Inglourious Basterds" regarding basements.)

Let's start positively: amazing drinks!  I mean, you need about three (3) total, and I have an insane tolerance.  Drinks tend to be on the tropical and sweeter side.  Personally, I recommend the "Pain Killer" with subtly tangy but thicker viscosity and several types of rum & 'Island-style' liquors/liqueurs.  It is a tasty compliment that is higher on the sweetness scale but not overly sugary.  Obviously and if it's a group effort, go for the Volcano or other monster drinks for the experience.  (Again, it's definitely a taxi/ride-share night.)

The execution requires, though, that you have a state of awareness.  Breaking that down, the theme of Island/Hawaiian/Tahitian/Caribbean means that you're getting amazing, hand-crafted drinks; so SOME WAIT is to be expected.  HOWEVER, I make a stern recommendation to get a table--either reservation or on the spot.  (I have experienced that their rules have changed a few times as to whether you can have a reservation back-and-forth, so call ahead to see what they're doing that day.)  Additionally and as of my last visit (see, I don't hate it b/c I keep returning), they had removed a terrible manager that was basically a Persian Frat Guy A-Hole, so already this place reacts and improves: excellent.  With that, the staff is putting out QUALITY--NOT QUANTITY.

As to the ambiance, this as started to improve.  Recently, this place HALTED the "wall-to-wall" people posture and the 5-deep bar wait.  However, it can get full.  Thus and again: Get at table!

I have to say that "it is worth the wait" applies if you approach this place with your eyes opened.  But for a tag line, let's go with "Best Hawaiian/Island drinks outside of the exotic locations in the world."

The doctor is in. Fortune smiles on the good doctor. With the prices of anesthesia skyrocketing, I stumble upon the cobra fang. Once a patient chokes down the gasoline flavor they are instantly ready for surgery. Meanwhile I can drink a few "Too many Chiefs" and steady my surgery hand.

I seriously loved this place!! SO fun. I'm almost 40 and waiting in line for a bar is not something I do anymore.  In this case, my boyfriend and I had eaten dinner nearby and decided to check it out. The line was moving quick, the tiki torches outside were warm and inviting, so we decided to stay. It was a Friday night just before 9pm and we only ended up waiting 5-10 minutes I think. Upon entering the building you are transported down a lengthy staircase and the experience starts the minute you step foot through the door. You are greeted by a wall of skulls, I felt like I was in line for a ride at Disney or Universal Studios!  Most walk-ins are escorted to a huge tiki bar for a drink in an area that is standing room only with a few high-tops. We were lucky to get a small table for 2 without a reservation!  The menu is vast with classic tiki cocktails, and Three Dots own creative concoctions. I had a hard time choosing, there were so many that sounded good. I was not disappointed at all with both the signature Three Dots and a Dash cocktail or the classic Trader Vic's Mai Tai. The ingredients were fresh, but the drinks are even more appealing to the eye. So creative, it's fun to just sit and watch the servers bring out the drinks to everyone around you. Each is a gorgeous work of art - especially the punch bowls to share. Every one, glowed, smoked or was on fire, so cool. The bar just screams fun including awesome music by a live DJ!  I can't wait to come back.
Cool Tiki bar in Chicago, recommended for visitors.  Atmosphere is very touristy, drinks are fun but overpriced.

Wow! This place will make you feel like you're  in paradise in the middle of a cold Chicago winter! Had two drinks and was buzzed after (not a heavy drinker) can't recal the names but I'll post pics. Also Book in advance or prepare for a long wait unless you arrive during opening time on a Monday.

This was a fun place!  I really enjoyed the Island theme and the drinks that accompanied it tasted great.  The only drawback was that as it became more and more crowded, the service started to slow down, and it seemed like more attention was paid to new customers.  

I get it, not a big deal at all, it gets crowded and there are just more people to handle, but we ended up going somewhere else, because we didn't want to wait anymore for drinks.

Will definitely be back.

I must say the best Tiki bar in all of Chicago!!!! If your in the area you must check it out. It may be a bit hard to find since it's down an alley but follow your GPS and you will find it. The neon in the alley way gives its location away. Once you make your way down the skull lined stair way you will be transported into that good old tiki era. Super tasty and strong drinks served in small and huge Tiki style glasses and containers. As for the food it too was amazing. The island flavor blended well with the drink and the atmosphere made it all come together to make a perfect and fun evening out for drinks.

pics.caption: Don't miss this great spot hidden down the alley
What's frozen is always fresh and tasty

review.des: Personally, I think this is one of the best bars in Chicago and a must visit. It gets very busy on the weekends, but that's a good thing. Drinks are very good and have won awards according to their menu. I ordered a "Saturn" (Gin) and Tropical Itch" (bourbon) and they were top class. This is a MUST VISIT, so quit searching for a bar to go to online, and come here and try this one for your travels... it is located in an alley way, so you may walk past it when GPSing it. In addition they have bathroom service with all your needs possible!
This is a super touristy spot, but I really like the vibe here. Drinks are good and they have a ton of strange options. The only issue is that it is a bit hard to find, especially after a few drinks.

Fun spot! Great for groups. It gets pretty wild later at night, and the line can be ridiculous -- I'd recommend making a reservation so you can waltz right past it. The drinks are strong, and make for a wicked hangover since they're pretty sugary, so it's not a place for multiple rounds. I've never eaten here, but I've heard good things about the food.

You know I find this place to be so pretty and artsy inside. It's just freaking beautiful.  There's no need for me to even post pictures because what's on the yelp page already is pretty much it.  Gorgeous. The drinks they do have are really pretty looking as well.  After working at the office for what seems like every day, this place really changes the mood - and that happens as soon as you walk in.  Very cool.

I'd have to say that although it is gorgeous and boutique-like and the drinks are presented beautifully in the boutique-like style look too - I wouldn't make this place my "go to." I just don't really like that there's not a lot of other options for other basic alcoholic beverages.  It's what they have created only (though this might have changed since the last time I went - June 2017).  

Also, the music is good but no one really dances. Not that this place can handle all people getting out of their seat to dance; however, the music is so loud that it makes it hard to talk so a little mingling while standing at the bar would justify the music being so loud and consequentially tolerable. Music is so good and yet I find it interesting that no one dances. They just wiggle in their seat and that's it. So either the music should be lowered a bit or perhaps a little bit more space - especially space closer to the bar- should be made for people to just stand up and have a drink and perhaps wiggle while standing, as it is difficult to carry a conversation there.

With all that said - please just remember this the most: it's a must "go to" for at least that one time. The place really is artsy and that's always nice and appreciated.
:)
Great drinks, wonderful atmosphere and knowledgeable bar tenders. Suzanne was fabulous!
One of my favorite bars in Chicago. I love bringing guests here because they are entertained by the ambiance and the drinks. A little pricey, but definitely worth a try and worth the fun!

We were super excited to visit after reading all the other yelp reviews. But we were just so disappointed. We got there and right as we walked up, the bouncer told us that they've reached max capacity. Then he pointed us towards a set of velvet ropes... by the largest trash chute in the alley. It smelt so bad we gave up and we left. No bar or lounge is worth waiting 20 minutes for by a smeller trash container when there are so many other cool places within blocks.
What a cool spot!!! Great atmosphere, awesome service, delicious drinks. What more could you want? Check this place out, you will be glad you did!!!

Overrated! Definitely make a reservation for a table - we decided to stop in on a whim and were told there were no reservations available. The space by the bar was super crowded, not many places to stand and set your big drinks down. The drinks were expensive, and they were so strong we couldn't even fully drink/enjoy them.

A great little underground bar! My friend and I met up with another friend here for a drink before dinner. We all ordered one of the specialty cocktails. Mine was sweet, which I like but very refreshing! Not totally crazy in prices either. A nice experience!

V for Victory, indeed...the drinks are amazing! This is a fun hideaway in downtown Chicago. Difficult to find, which is possibly part of the fun, and a great place to dine when you're trying to impress! If you're with a group, it's worth it to share a drink!

Amazing!! We ordered the Mai Tai, Tropical Itch, and Thai Fried Chicken, all of which were spectacular. If you plan on splitting the chicken with another person, don't! It's not enough! I could have eaten two orders on my own. Highly highly recommend Three Dots and a Dash!

Dimly lit ambiance with a tiki bar theme. Besides the location being non descript, not sure how this is a speakeasy...(they are on open table). Overall, you go for the experience...it's only good for drinks, bad for dinner.

I tried the Dead Reckoning which, frankly, had more ice than rum. My friends' Painkiller 639 was very yummy...so I'll probably get that next time.

We shared the pu pu platter which had 6 preset samplings of the regular menu. The best was thai fried chicken....there were a few items that were not so great like the coconut shrimp (no flavor), and  the ribs (super dry).
I love tiki bars such an amazing hidden gem! Love everything about it! I've gone back way too many times can't wait to visit again on vacation.
the atmosphere was really fun. great drinks, great food and i enjoyed the music selection. only downside is it was really hard to find.

Six ladies visiting Chicago, Tiki Bar, alleyway/speakeasy entrance, a fun menu with a variety of special drinks, and friendly, helpful bartenders.  WIN!

High end, speakeasy bars with craft cocktails are all the rage all over the country, but I can do without the attitude, lights so low you can't see your friends 6 inches away, and the ridiculous price tags.  

This place is much more my style!  We entered through an alleyway and were led through a door and down two flights of dark stairs, and under a skull-covered wall into a cheery Tiki Bar!  We took our places at the bar and were immediatly greeted by the bartender.  He did a great job explaining the menu to us and helping us decide what to order based on our preferences.  Each cocktail was then individually crafted with a dash of this and a splash of that, finally garnished with all sorts of fruit, umbrellas, swizzle sticks and other goodies.

This is a very fun and unique bar.  I would definitely return the next time I'm in Chicago!

There's a reason this place has a reputation as one of the best Tiki bars in America!!!  It rocks. Quintessential tiki. You enter via the alley and it's underground. Complete refuge from the cold above!!

I had the signature cocktail, followed by the Dead Reckoning. Fantastic. Looking forward to moving downtown so I can go more often!
Fun, unique, great food and crazy drinks. Ambiance is perfect, whether on a date or with a group.
Love this place!  Drinks are sooooo good.   Chris, our bartender, was a gem ... made recommendations and made our amazing drinks.  Can't wait to go back!
Fun place to visit, especially during winter or with guests in town.  Tasty drinks and apps, but a little pricey and can be busy.
This is a Great little ourt of the way spot with amazing Bartenders & drinks. I loved the atmosphere & will be back soon!

Drinks are very boozey, fresh, flavorful, craveable, and cute. They're a little on the pricey side, about $15 a drink but well worth it.

We came in on a Friday night and it was packed 3 hours wait for a party of two so we just wiggled our way up to the bar and were very fortunate to get a spot up there.

Very friendly staff and fun atmosphere!

I came to Three Dots for my birthday in June and I loved the atmosphere, the drinks was really good. My friends and I returned August 11th, when we arrived we came in and was seated with a party of 8 and it was so hot, when the waitress came to the table we asked why was it so hot we were informed that the air was broken. The waitress brought us warm water and when we asked for ice she brought it to the table and we had to ask for a spoon to put the ice in our cups. I feel like we should have been told the air was down before entering.

This was recommended by a friend and it was an experience. After walking around the block a few times, we realized it was the blue glowing light down the alley. And we had to wait it line, but the mystery of it had us intrigued. We went in and you walk down a couple flights of stairs that have a wall of skulls to see. We wound our way into the actual bar which is super loud and slammed packed. They give you menus you can't see as you wait at the bar. We settled on the "long walk off a short pier" which was efficiently made along with a half a dozen other drinks by a veteran bartender. We paid our tab and attempted to sit. We went back out of the bar and found a nice, quieter sitting area to the right of the hostess station. Would not be a regular go to, but it was fun.

pics.caption: Long walk off a short pier

review.des:
Just a tad underwhelmed.

Like many speakeasies, the entrance was in a shady ass alleyway, guarded by a bouncer who didn't give two fucks. Waitresses were attentive and sweet. Drinks were standard American prices. My friends and I ordered the one with the flaming skull. Cool huh? The sound of it was bad ass but it was just a piece of burning bread in a container floating on top. I mean, I WASN'T EXPECTING A GRAND, BURN OFF YOUR EYEBROWS type of fire, but just thought it'd have a little more flare. The alcohol content was definitely there, granted I'm a four feet eleven lightweight but still. Anyways, y'all cute. Don't know if I'll stop by again but still cute!
Valet lost a 200k car and no contact. Ruinnes a great restaurants reputation. Everything was great until the valet was tipped well and a ramge rover goes completely missing
Sad we waited in line for 45 minutes to come into a crowded bar with rude workers. Looks fun until you're inside and step in the wrong direction...

I came here for drinks after dinner, I don't see what the big hype is of this place. I am not a fan of fruity drinks, so that is why I was not a fan. It was super crowded, and when we left there was a line out the door. Music was ok, drinks took a while to order.

You Yelpers are ALL right about this place! All of you ARE right ... almost. Your reviews both hate filled and adoring are right to you. "3 Dots and a Dash" is like Mackinac Island fudge,  The Exorcist, The Rolling Sones, Trump, or heterosexual sex. You either like it or you don't. Can't make anyone like anything. But those that LOVE it - LOVE it! I won't say those of you that don't like "3 Dots" don't "get" it because I HATE when I hear that. (Mostly from my wifey poo.) For instance after lame romantic comedy she'll say to me  "You just didn't get it". And I'll reply back "Nope just didn't like it." For instance I enjoy ALIENS 4, Akira, Spirited Away, Japan over France for vacation, and truly believe The Moody Blues "A Question of Balance" is the greatest single recording from in history . Good luck convincing anybody else. I've tried and failed . We humans like what we like.

I'm freakie for tiki. You just don't like it. That's it! But I believe many of you may grow to dig "3 Dots and a Dash." Someday. One day you may (sorry) "get" it. I used to be teased about  my love of the musical Hamilton, Shatner, West World, The Prisoner (TV show), Iron Man, Biale Black Chicken wine,and Star Trek. Now they are all retro hip and cool. I was ahead of the curve. However, sometimes I'm not ahead of the curve. Lost in Space (1965),Johnny Quest, Land of the Lost, Thundaar, Voltron, The Kinks (Arista years), Ultraman , Riverview Amusement Park collectibles, Johnny Socko, & Wizzo the Magician, I'm still almost alone on in my appreciation of.

"3 Dots & a Das" could turn out to be either for you . Epic or just Blah. Both crowds correct.

To me? EPIC! Big time!

I'm fascinated by tiki culture. It's my private obsession. I've always DREAMED of being in a Tiki Bar when it was happening, hip, and THE place to be. Don the Beachcomber, The Luau, Trader Vic's, Kahiki, or Kona Kai, in their heyday in the 1960's. Wow, to have been there once upon a puff when Tiki was THE scene. To me it'd be like being at the original Playboy Club in Chicago, The Pump Room w/ Irv Kupcinet and Sinatra drinking 2 fingers of Jack, or seeing The Doors on stage at The Whiskey a Go Go, back in the day.

My experiences of seeking tiki in every city during a lifetime have always lead me to the old, the faded, and the dingy. Their heyday but a mustard burp lost to the vapor. Their glory years in the rearview mirror.

So my visit to "3 Dots and a Dash" made me burst w/ joy and almost cry. Sincerely.

It's but a dream. An oasis in a basement. Beautiful women in Polynesian attire bring bizarre expertly crafted concoctions loaded w/ the freshest fruit and ingredients YOU CAN TASTE. (Their intricate drinks aren't from some stale powered mix or a can.) Exotica fills you from first sip.

Notice the thought that went into the menu . Kitsch overload! Just holding that menu was worth the visit. Did I just time travel? Nobody does menus like this anymore. Slapdash and rehash is the norm now. Not here. Delight is in the details.

Notice the different sculpted glasses for every drink!!! Each individual  one a work of art.

It has an almost "secret" speakeasy entrance The Batman would tip his cowl to.

The swizzle sticks are mermaids.

Is that a full cinnamon stick and large chunk of coconut in this icy ceramic totem?

Now my treasure is others trash. I get that! You may HATE this place. Some evidently do. I read your reviews. But I think they are  the born in Chicago types that sit at Blackhawks games and cheer on The Redwings. Jag offs.

Some will see silly glasses, tacky menus, dank basement, and sexism on display in some of the art and required staff garb. Ugh. I feel sorry for those that recoil in falsehood. Oh , the deluded brainwashed masses.The offended by everything crowd. A cancer to our society really.  

Sorry, I keep getting off topic because I'm still buzzed out of my zombied skull right now.

If I wanted to be like hipsters that breathe out loafs of loathing at all they survey I would complain that the music they play wasn't even a bit tiki. The music could be much better. They could throw a bit of exotica or space age bachelor pad music  in. Heck, even a minute of Walt Disney's Enchanted Tiki Bird music might be nice. Xylophone anyone?

The food I tried was great but the drinks are the real stars.

Drinks that could fuel a stealth bomber.

BEWARE LADIES you might wake-up w/ someone that looks like me next to you if you aren't careful.

Deceivingly POWERFUL in their almost unseen ability to sneak up on you their drinks are like an invisible maniac in his invisible Cadillac that run you over. Tiki drinks will get you gurglerbslobbered. (That's a just now made-up word that sounds like what I feel like right now.)

I found the steps out of the place harder than my college SAT's to navigate after all those drinks.

Now steal the audio of Martin Denny and  "Quiet Village" off the internet and crank it!

That's the sound of my soul right now
Fabulous place! The drinks, though expensive, were fun and delicious. Fun atmosphere as well. I'll be back!
Amazing tiki cocktails, cool ambiance and good place for celebrate something for little group.

I simply love Three Dots and Dash! From the speakeasy vibes to the giant tiki fish bowls and fun quirky glassware, Three Dots does not disappoint. From the minute you walk around the corner and into Three Dots, you know you are in for a great experience. I recommend ordering a pupu platter for you and your group to share and maybe a fishbowl or too! If you're in for trying something stronger--try the pain killer!
I loved the vibe here! The drinks were really unique and I had a great time with a group of friends. Highly recommend you make a reservation though. I'd love to go back to this place!

Shru was amazing the only one that Knows customer service. I'm giving her 5 starts but not the place itself. We had a security guard who wanted to talk to my friend like if he was his son "saying let me talk to you on the side" when all he could have simply done was ask on the walkie if they had gotten confirmation to let us sit at the table. Why are you going to wear a walkie if your not going to use it to communicate? Their was just no effort to even attempt to help clients out. I understand their guards but they are also in an environment where it requires customer service. To be quiet frankly I can tell you this is a leadership problem! I have been doing management for so long that I know a problem when I see it. Their was another situation where the bar tender offended one my friends. Once again management problem. If it happens with more than one associate I can tell you management takes complains and just brushes it off rather that providing proper coaching or accountability. Shru you were awesome you deserve a better job than that place and you will go far !

Hard to get in here (they take reservations), but if you line up ahead of opening time, you can usually get in. They have a good food selection (including pork rinds with guacamole... yum!), but sadly, we were getting dinner after and just had drinks here. I am not an alcohol person but I thought their drinks were well crafted and well presented. I had the Aloha Felicia, which is their most popular drink. It was rich with coconutty flavor. I just loved the look and feel of this place. Very cool underground tiki bar!

This place was awesome! My friends and I were looking for a nice place to chill and drink, and I'm glad we found this place. At first, it was sketchy because when we were looking for it, we were told it was around the corner in the alley...Once you get inside, however, you instantly see the Hawaiian/Tiki bar theme. The bar opened at 10:30 because there was a private party, so we got there slightly after 10:30 and got seated right away. Good thing we came early, because it started getting packed later on.

Now they have one-person drinks and a food page that you can order from, but the main attraction of this place are the drinks you can share. The drinks are pretty pricey, but they look and taste phenomenal. You're basically paying for the awesome presentation, which is totally worth it. Not to mention that the drinks are pretty strong as well.

I'll definitely come back to this place next time I'm in the area.

I love love this place! It's definitely somewhere you can go for a chill or not so chill night drinking. First off, the entrance is kinda sketchy because it's in an alley and then you get carded and go down the stairs. Then you see like a tiki bar and you get seated at your table. The night we came, there was a private party until 10:30 so we went back to our hotel and came back around 10:30. Luckily we didn't arrive later because this place got packed fast! So we're looking at the menu and there's single drinks and big drinks that you can share with people. The big drinks were pretty pricey but I guess you're paying for the presentation bc each drink my group and I ordered came out with dry ice and it was very fun to make videos with it. After two big drinks, our whole group of 5 was feeling pretty good but it was so hot in there and so we decided to call it a night and went home.

Overall, I will definitely be back!
Oh and they have some food on their menu too

Was visiting Chi for my bday and a friend recommended this bar, said it was his favorite and I totally see why! 3 dots is a must do for anyone in the city. They have amazzzing one of a kind drinks, yummy bites and good service. I loved the vibe and wish they had one in my city. I recommend the Chief Lapu Lapu, you won't be disappointed :)

I have been here on a few special occasions and the decor is always a point of discussion! They have down a great job with the interiors and details, so hats off for that! Yes, it can get crowded. This place is is downtown Chicago so I don't expect 0 lines at 9pm on a Friday evening. The drinks are strong so you do get your money's worth.

The reason I don't LOVE this place is because the music is always loud which hampers conversation. The group seating also has some low chairs (for my taste) and is generally not arranged well; a group of 7-8 ends up being split. Food options are limited, I understand it's a bar but even the servings are off. A huge basket of nachos with a tiny cup of guacamole?!

That being said, I usually recommend this place to people who haven't been to a tiki bar before. Personally, I am happy coming here about once a year for the experience.

A peculiar take on the traditional Tiki bar, with a unique atmosphere & crazy (also strong) drinks. It's one of my favorite place to bring my out-of-town friends and colleagues if we end up having a late night.

I love tiki bars!  Whenever I visit a new city I look them up.  Three Dots and a Dash kept coming up as the place to go in Chicago.  I have to agree.  I loved it.  From the incognito entrance to the tiki decor that starts the moment you walk in the door.  The drinks are delish and pack a punch.  Presentation is great.  It gets pretty busy and when we were there, lots of empty "reserved" tables.  We talked to one of the security guards and after some persuasion, let us have one of the reserved tables.  Your best bet is to make reservations.  They are super easy to make on their website.

pics.caption: $385?!?!  Yikes.  Imagine waking up the next morning and you ordered this.

review.des: I love tiki bars so much! This place is so much bigger than I imagined it would be. I went on a Monday night and it was packed!! Luckily we spotted a few seats that had just opened. After looking at their drink menu, I decided to go with the classic daiquiri. It was perfect and they even garnished it with a pretty flower. I only stayed for one drink. I found the atmosphere to be a little too loud and crowded for what I wanted but I really loved the tiki vibe and decorations. Very beautiful bar!

I really dislike going to this place it's always insanely crowded and just such overpriced drinks especially considering the experience. I'm always disappointed if my friends want to go here and we always wind up leaving pretty quickly because we remember that we don't enjoy being there because of the crowd. Still can be fun though if you're in the mood and do like that they have red stripe- maybe it's just not my thing!

Easily one of my favourite bars, packed with character and off the main drag it could be missed. The bartenders were helpful giving suggestions of other places to go. I went on a weeknight and it was still busy, I would imagine a great place to go on the weekends if you want to meet people. If you just want a quiet drink in a cool place this is the spot for you. Definitely one to take friends to.

If you ever find yourself in a dark alley in River North, chances are you're near the entrance of Three Dots and a Dash. This place is kind of hidden but it's definitely lit - like some of their drinks (no pun intended). We didn't have reservations so we just went straight to the bar, which was packed at around 5pm on a Friday night. There were three bartenders working hard so rest assured you'll get your drinks pretty fast.

I ordered the Aloha Felicia, which came in a super cute coconut mug and was garnished exactly the way any tiki drink should be. My boyfriend ordered the Poblano Escobar - how can you go wrong with a drink named after the biggest drug dealer of all time?

Overall, the drinks were super tasty and refreshing - which makes drinking them a little dangerous when you can hardly taste any liquor! I'd recommend coming a little earlier on the weekend as it can get pretty busy as the night goes on.
This is the coolest place for staff parties and friends to gather and hang and their wall of skulls is the greatest display ever.

Totally overpriced. This place gets way too much credit than it deserves. Pretty difficult to get in without a reservation. We were shoved in the middle of two groups of bachelorette parties so it was incredibly loud and annoying. I just don't understand the Tiki trend I guess.

What an awesome find. However, finding this place proved very difficult.

Located in a very small alley behind a side street, I walked past MANY times before I figured out where exactly this bar was. My gps was no help either. It literally is along a side street and in an alley, and then down the stairs. I arrived around 6pm on a Fri and it was PACKED! There was not one empty seat in the place and since it is first-come-first-served seating, it took a while for me to get a seat. It actually took about an hour for me to get a seat (and I was by myself).

The decor is interesting- cheesy tiki theme. However, it is not too cheesy, it's actually kinda cute. The bartenders are all decked out in the typical tropical garb equipped with the standard Hawaiian shirts. They were all very friendly and patient, especially considering most people in the place appeared to be tourists. My bartender wasn't even annoyed by me asking her to describe each of the drinks before I ordered and to order them by level of sweetness (this is a tiki bar after all). Luckily, the three drinks that I chose were not terribly sweet, as tiki drinks tend to be. Here are the drinks that I tried:

1. Painkiller No. 3 (called 109 now) - made with Virgin Island and Jamaican rums, coconut, passion fruit, pineapple and cream

2. Banana Daiquiri (most popular)- made with Jamaican spiced rum, coconut liqueur, banana,  lime and nutmeg, all blended together like a smoothie

3. Jet Pilot- Jamaican and Dominican rums, lime, cinnamon, grapefruit, Falernum, Absinthe and Angostura bitters

Drinks are $13 and punch bowls are $65 I believe. All drinks were very well made and none of them were too sweet. Every last one of them was also extremely boozy, even the banana daiquiri. After three of those boozy tiki drinks, I was drunk and needed to stumble back to the L. Definitely can't wait to go back.

Fun note: All of the drinks come in cool and unique tiki cups, in which you can purchase if they have extras for around $10. Also, each drink is is a masterpiece, adorned with flowers, shrubs and other cool things to make it fancy. The banana daiquiri came with a banana carved into a dolphin (it really looks like a dolphin too).

First time coming to Chicago this was the first bar I visited. I've been to a few tiki bars in New York before but Three Dots and a Dash takes it to a whole other level!
For some reason Chicago's filled with all these alleys. Every block you turn to you see an alley. Growing up in the city I know to stay far away from alleys if you want to be safe but in one of these alleys lie Three Dots and a Dash so keep an eye out for this place or you might pass it! Except there is a line formed outside so you'll probably notice it.
Walking in this place has all the jazz of a tiki bar and the drinks are as good as how adorable they are! The presentation of all the drinks are on point. They only have two people working behind the bar and it's always super packed so service can be super slow. The drinks are also on the pricey side seeing as how they're suppose to be shared among friends but to be fair it's not that strong so you could probably just drink it yourself...
This place is great if you've never been or want to bring new friends to a place they haven't been before but I don't think I would be a regular. There's so many other bars especially in that area that are more attentive with serving patrons.

I love tiki bars and I really couldn't get enough of the speak easy style find.

I came with my sister and found a seat at the bar.  We shared a banana daiquiri and a larger bowl drink. They were tasty and the bartender,  Aiden, was very friendly and tentative.

Very limited seating so if you're going during the most social hours,  you should plan a head and make reservations.

pics.caption: Banana daiquiri was strong and delicious. I forgot the name of the bigger drink but it was very tropical and refreshing
Too cute not to play around with our decors

review.des: This review is strictly towards the way my clients and I were treated. After wrapping up dinner at a different establishment around 8:45pm we asked our server for any recommendations for a night cap before heading back to our hotel. Considering we are from Miami, on a business trip and unfamiliar with the area we figured asking a local would be the best option. She pointed us over to three dots. Upon walking up to the establishment which had a back door entrance we noticed a reception booth/kiosk but no one was around. We waited for a couple minutes as we were under the impression the establishment was closed and began making other plans. A couple minutes later a rather large/heavier set gentleman with a beard in his mid 30's, about 5' 10" and a hat came outside and IMMEDIATELY told us we could not come in because "we were too drunk". There was no prior engagement with this man, he walked outside without hesitation and without any exchange of words between our party and him immediately gave us that line. We initially thought he was joking considering there had been absolutely no interaction with him when stepped out side to greet us, unfortunately he was not joking. Also, 2 out of the 3 clients I was with DO NOT even drink alcohol. I asked to speak to the manager which he then told me was not in. This might have been true however on a busy Saturday night I can't believe there would not be any managment on the property. I was extremely disappointed, offended and disrespected as my clients and potential investors were with me and looking to have a good time. I hope management can look into this issue as it would be a shame if this happens to anyone else. I am a partner at 2 different restaurants/bars in Miami and this kind of behavior would be totally unacceptable In any of my locations and would not be taken lightly. This is not how you treat guests. As a business owner myself I would hate to see an establishment go down for issues like this which could be easily resolved with proper training and staffing.
Great drinks and strong.we went and it was crazy busy. Over a 2 hour wait with no reservations.

Great cool spot for a drink. The drinks are very delicious! I love the decor and the speak easy feel to the place. Didn't get to try any of the snacks but, I'll be back! The Pain Killer drink with pandan in it was WELL WORTH IT. At $12-15 for their signature drinks 1-2 go a long way. Very cozy and I would recommend a reservation for the weekend.

Three dots has an incredible drink menu and bar. Though the menu is limited, the food they do have is like heavy apps so you could make dinner out of it if you wanted to.the food is also delicious. The entrance is from an alley with mood lighting giving you the fun sense of a speakeasy, but without the sketchiness or grime.

One of my favorite spots to grab a drink and eat! Its incognito entrance is always fun when taking friends in Chicago! It allows u to escape the frigid cold and transport yourself for even a few hours to the most beautiful little place. Take family, friends but if you are planning on eating make sure to get a reservation days to weeks in advance!! It's a great place to celebrate!!!!

Amazing!!!
Would love to have this kind of establishment in Atlanta, better yet, I wouldn't mind investing into opening up a business like this in buckhead.

Location was a bit sketchy, with the entrance located in a back alley, but once you're in, you'll be amazed.  We waited out at the bar area waiting for our table, drinking delicious speciality drinks.  Not only are the drinks served beautifully, they taste great with nice kicks of alcohol.  We tried the banana daiquiri, pain killers 109 & 639, as well as the mai tai.  Mai tai was pretty strong and the daiquiris were delicious to go bananas over.  My favorite was the pain killers 109, however! It's just so dam* good!  Would highly recommend it.  

Did get a sip of the the 3... & - drink and Pieces of 8 and it wasn't as good as it appeared.  They were more on the bitter/sour side.

Ambiance/decor was nice, bathroom was clean, and the crowd wasn't crazy and annoying.  Definitely would come back here when back in Chicago.

This place gets tiki bar done right! The ambience, libations, and food are all fantastic. Just go with a group of friends (make reservations in advance, though) and go to the back alley doorway and down into a cavern where you'll first be greeted by a wall of skulls, then the host. The private rooms are absolutely beautiful and there was an ukelele meetup of some sort when we went. I highly recommend the Missionary's Downfall! Place is pricey but it's just worth coming here for a good time.
Aloha?! Moana?! Very fun but always so crowded. If you can get a table, it's awesome! Get on of the specialty drinks to share!
This place is quirky and really freaking fun. Delicious cocktails, silly drink stirrers and good service. We had a blast and we'll be back next time we're in town.

Kind of difficult to find, it may be my fault that I didn't do my research, but it's tucked away in the alley directly behind Bub City. We were just looking to get a fun cocktail before dinner, but unfortunately there isn't much bar seating available and we had to stand up against the DJ booth that wasn't in use. The sugary novelty cocktails went down rather smoothly, I just don't know that I would go through the hassle again to come back.

my last few reviews are of bars.  i swear i don't have a drinking problem, i promise! anyways, this place gets high marks from me.  i suppose you can consider this place like a speakeasy and a tiki bar fucked and had a kid, and out popped three dots and a dash.  

we ended up getting the painkiller and the three dots and a dash.  
both signature drinks, and both equally good and strong.
they also serve food, so if i'm in the area next time i might try the teriyaki burger .

i know you can rent out private sections of this place if you wanted to host a party over here.  i can see how this place would get rowdy... some of the drinks are meant to be shared.  

i don't know if its me, but rum is just too strong for me.  after one drink, i was feeling dizzy.  i know, weak sauce.  :(  but i suppose i'm a cheap date???  lol

pics.caption: Signature drink.  Three dots and a dash.

review.des:
I've had 3DD on my "Wish List" for what feels like forever, so while out to celebrate a 30th birthday, this was our first stop of the night. I had made reservations for 8 two months in advance for a Saturday at 5pm. Knowing it was super early, I didn't think we'd encounter any issues.

We only ended up with 7 in our party, but I'm not sure how 8 would have even squeezed in the booth they gave us. Even though we had reservations two months prior, we were jammed into a booth. We did even come close to fitting, so they ended up placing two chairs awkwardly on the outside of the booth. We were told this is how they always do it, but I find that hard to believe given how awkward it felt (and I don't understand why it wasn't already set up like that). We also weren't given enough menus, so we had to share. Given the size of the drink selections, we would have loved to all have a menu to peruse! There were lots of open tables, so I was quite irritated with the lack of service.

That all said, I ordered the "Painkiller". It was definitely strong and fairly tasty - until I tried my hubby's signature cocktail. And let me tell you, it's deemed that for a reason. The "Three Dots and a Dash" drink was fantastic. The drinks came out very quickly, and were fairly reasonable in price for the amount of alcohol in them.

I had a hard time figuring out how this place stays busy at night - because I didn't see any set-up for a dance floor and although the drinks aren't expensive, I wouldn't want more than 1-2 since they're so strong and sugary. But - it's a great place to start the evening out with, so long as you have a smaller group.

This was my second bar stop in Chicago. Once again for me, this is a place that has no comparable bars in DC!

This place is in a back alley and goes down underground and turns out to be.... a tiki bar. How cool is that? Really cool. We were able to just walk in and wait for a few minutes before they got a table set up for us. It was actually pretty busy around 11:30-12 on a Thursday night so that told me it had to be pretty popular place to hang out.

We saw a variety of fun drinks coming from the bar that made us pretty excited to try some. There was one with a DOLPHIN banana sticking out of it, one that was on fire, and our personal favorite, one that had dry ice to simulate smoke coming out.

Naturally, we got the one with the dry ice - the Zombie Punch - for 2. We split it three ways and the drink was really, really strong and tasty. A lot stronger than what I would expect from a tiki bar and as tasty as I would expect from a tiki bar so that was a Win. Also we definitely had a good time blowing the dry ice in each other's faces and just generally playing around with it.

I definitely recommend this bar to anyone who wants to have a sweeter drink in a cool place to hang out. When I'm back in Chicago I can see myself being back here again!

pics.caption: Zombie Punch for 2 - delicious AND fun
"There's a banana in that guy's drink!" Nope. that's a dolphin.

review.des:
A line from a bar that's hidden in an alley way means thumbs up.
Three Dots hit the spot for a cool atmosphere over a cheesy Hawaiian themed one.

The prices are on par for the River North area which is slightly above average but the drinks are strong, fun, and good. Like everyone else, I love the cute banana dolphins in the drinks (which also helps the alcohol from hitting me too hard).

Our table once got the treasure chest which is expensive but a fun experience and lots of alcohol.

It's not a dancing bar. People really just come here for the drinks and cool atmosphere.
I don't drink often and I don't particularly like bar hopping but Three Dots is tiki-themed, fun, and very quality.

This is a must-stop for anyone visiting the city. This tiki bar serves a bunch of adorable drinks, but come with a group of friends so you can share the really cool elaborate drinks (that are also on the expensive side). Service can be stretched thin sometimes but theres a bunch of sights to see and people to watch and music to enjoy while waiting to check out.

Normally I wouldn't waste my time reviewing a place with so many reviews, but this place was fantastic! A group of us were here the night before the 4th of July and even at 8:30 had no problem getting in and getting a table. Every drink was amazing, we were able to try about half the menu and no one had a bad drink. We ordered a appetizer platter to share and our favorites were the chicken and shrimp, so much so we ordered an extra of each and made it a light meal. Prices were what you'd expect, a little high but it's downtown Chicago, super trendy and the drinks were strong. Don't hesitate on this place, next time I'm in Chicago I'll be back!
Awesome place for a drink.  Hidden in an Alley, down in a basement.  What a nice surprise.   Bartender was great.  Drinks were good!

Glad to see that this spot was right across the street from our hotel, which is hidden in the alley. Right when you walk down into the entrance area, the ambiance conveyed an upscale island vibe. We ordered the Pu Pu Platter which was really good, liked all of the items in that entree but didn't care for the fries very much. Make sure you order the shareable drinks, they all have their own theme varying with dry ice and decorative lighting.  Definitively recommend this spot!

Even though I've lived in Hawaii, I wasn't sure what to expect from this local tiki bar.  Had a little trouble finding the place because you need to go down an ally between buildings.  When I found it - a bouncer was checking id's out front so I figured I'm at the wrong place.  Thought (hoping) I'd be carded but unfortunately I wasn't - my ego was crushed.  You first go down stairs and are greated by an overhead wall of skulls - now I know I'm definitely in the the place.  I'll be the only one not in chains, leather and full facial tattoos but I went ahead anyway...  I turned the corner and felt like I was I in a Hawaiian tiki bar.  Good service, cool drink menu ... about 20 pages of drinks and two for finger foods.   Drinks were great and food - okay.  At least check this place out once.

I am so glad we ran across this place! Spending a weekend with my BFF, we wanted a place where we could have good drinks. Three Dots and a Dash came up in my Google search. We didn't have reservations, but the hostess was nice enough to give us a table for 90 minutes until the reservation showed up. Kudos! The server was great and knowledgeable. I'm allergic to pineapple, so I tread lightly on tropical drinks, but she accommodated my needs with no problems. Kudos again!

I LOVE the ambience and the decor. I love the hidden entry and the vibe of the entire place. It's not claustrophobic and you don't feel like you're in a basement level place. The drinks are STRONG, but good and we even got to try an appetizer to go along with it.

I'm DEFINITELY returning. I'd recommend making a reservation if you plan to go.
Always take co workers and buddies here when visiting Chicago. It's pretty busy on weekends. But hit them up on. A weekday and you'll get the best table and supreme service
Wow! Great atmosphere. Drinks were unique and tasty. The best part? Brian our bartender. He was funny AND kind. Lucky to have had drinks here!! It's worth the hype!

Their drinks are amazing!!! If you have been to Hawaii you know what I'm talking about it. Go there and have a good time with your friends and their cocktails. Must go if you want to try amazing drinks! So far I tried 5 and no regrets :) Everytime I have friends out of town I being they there and they love it!!!

Solid, fun bar. Drinks are well made and delicious, bar tenders are great.

The only downside is a shortage of seating. When it's busy and standing room only, it can be hard to find a spot for your drink.

Now that there's a Tiki bar near me in my own city - Three Dots and a Dash's environment really opened my eyes on how Tiki bars are done. I wish the one near me was as amazing as this one :( Three Dots and a Dash really set a high bar.

The entrance is in the back alley. Kind of sketch, haha. But if you see two lit torches, you're there!

The bartender we had, Alex, was super cool & fun. The ways he made the drinks were very eye appealing. I was actually standing majority of the time ... time flew by while Alex made different types of drinks. I was barely tired from standing. I'm not a bar person, so I have no idea how bartenders get their groove, but sheesh - Alex was solid.

The bar itself is pretty big. I could see a ton of people around & they had several stools. We were told there was a long wait for a table, so.. off we went to the bar. Even inside, the tiki decorations looked cool.

My buds who had the drinks were satisfied. Each drink was nicely decorated & looked like a piece of art. The pictures listed on Yelp are accurate. One guy ordered the Treasure Chest - thing costs like 400 bucks!! It was huge though. It's worth it IF you've got several folks with you.

I'll be back!
Great drinks and a super fun atmosphere to go with a group. Definitely have to make a reservation but it's fun for special occasions or even just a friends night out!

Really Cool place. Went here on a Saturday night. No cost to get in but the place was PACKED like any usual bar/club in Chicago on a Saturday night. Drinks are overpriced and kind of watered down. Me and my boyfriend had one drink a piece and left. Nice glasses but don't think it's worth the price. Go here if u want a something different too do. Cool atmosphere, besides being super packed. Oh, and you can miss it if your not looking for it.

My favorite spot! Every drink I have had here has been magic. I love the different flavors of each drink and of course, the presentation! Definitely give props to the bartenders who are always friendly despite the crowds. The most recent favorite of mine is the Lapu Lapu which tastes freakin' amazing! I love the tangerine/passion fruit fusion!!

One of my favorite destinations in downtown Chicago, the River North area. The atmosphere is amazing, the brand is awesome. The drinks are just so creative and delicious. Pricing wise, it is at the higher end . Highly recommended to take your friends and visitors there. Great management.

*I don't recommend this place to anyone* "Chad" the bar tender called me a "cheap fuck" for not leaving a tip after I just purchased an $85 dollar drink for me and my friends. Mind you group of 5 had already purchased +5 drinks and tipped. Did he think I was made of money? To top it off, he didn't make the drink. Visiting from LA this very moment made us hate your city. Then the incident with the security "Jeff", it was 2 am and the waitress said we can sit anywhere. When we tried to sit at a booth he went off on us and when we tried explaining to him that the waitress said it was ok he kept ranting. Talking to me like he was my dad. He was so dismissive and didn't even bother hearing us out. So what did we do? We went to the waitress "Shu" and she kindly sat us down. From the whole night I thank her for being to kind. Honestly we were just out trying to have a good time. Never coming back here again. Hey Chad, if you're reading this "**** you" dude. Learn some manners. Oh did I forget to mention I was asking him for water when he called me a "cheap fuck"..... yeah but I'm cool man, if my tool was tiny, I'd be mad too.

I agreed to meet a date here after work because it was closer to our destination and to his place of employ. So the place is clever on the décor. I'll give them that. And, I'll cut them some slack because at happy hour, it's bound to get crowded and uncomfortable. Now granted, I always seem to have a penchant for attracting whatever major douchebag(s) happens to be affixed to the bar. I left my drink, a book, and my umbrella on the bar noticeably close to my chair when I went to the powder room. It was crowded in there, so by the time I returned to my seat at the bar, I found that the douchebag who had been formerly sitting 3 seats down from me had not only taken the seat next to me which was previously occupied,  but he had also parked the sloppy bony ass of his Tart Du Jour in MY seat. After I politely argued with him to make a point about him stealing my seat, he effed me off with a few explics and flung the seat in my direction. Then he stomped off, dragging the tart by her arm. Spilled his Stella all over my book & umbrella, too. Nice guy. Now for the libations: The drinks are heavy on sugar and short on alcohol. I like my mixed drinks STRONG. Substantial. If I wanted a kiddie cocktail with a cherry on top I could have gone up to the Walnut Room at Macy's/Marshall Fields at Christmastime. I finally cut to the chase and ordered a double Jamison's to calm my rattled nerves and did enjoy some nice convo with one of the bartenders. The bt's are primo here as far as service goes. My cousin Donna used to be a bartender at Park West in the 70's-80's so I guess I am used to perfection when it comes to shaken vs. stirred. But I digress... So, date shows up late. Naturally.  Five points deducted, but then given back once he presented me with a gold doubloon box of Godiva chocolates.
