Pulled out chairs, opened door upon exit, and hailed a cab like a 5th Ave pro. He had possibilities. Three Dots & Dash - meh. But with a little work in the drink dept, could turn out to be a diamond in the rough.
Great atmosphere and delicious drinks. However, drinks are super expensive and it's a tourist trap. Be mindful that you'll be overrun with non Chicagoans when you're here.

What a cute little speakeasy. Drinks are all so pretty, generally on the sweeter side, and most of them start at 14$ a drink. Love the ambience and decor here. Everything is themed which makes it so fun!
Love the urban tiki ambiance. The drinks are visual masterpieces! Fun place for group outings

Great spot to get away from the norm. Hidden in a Chicago alley it's easy to miss but a great find when you do. Awesome original drinks and cups to drink them out of. Must stop in if you haven't already.
Yummy and Fun!!  I really like this bar.  Great for dates or business meetings.  I love drinking, I do it all the time, this makes my drinking extra special fun!

Fun tiki bar with unique, tropical drinks!

I visited back in December 2016 with some friends - it was on my Chicago Bucket List.  Definitely a must for first-time Chicago visitors!  It can get pretty crowded, so if you are with a large enough group, get a table and order drinks there.

It is a dimly lit place, so be aware of that!

I really enjoyed this place! Great atmosphere and music! I had a party of 4 we got seated very quickly. Service was great and the drinks were nice and strong it's a really fun environment! I will definitely be coming back!
Omg.    WhAt a fun bar!  Young fun crowd, good music, and great drinks!!!!! Will definitely come back here. We had the Bali Bali which was amazing and definitely worth it!
Very talented and knowledgeable bartenders made for a great experience in a cool environment
Very cool place, drinks and fun and beware, they are strong! Fast service and excellent place to take guests if you have someone visiting Chicago!
Great atmosphere and drinks. Definitely a cool spot to end the night. Tip, it's in an alley so pay attention.
Eh... food it ok, drinks aren't great.  Ambiance is fun, but that's about it.

Fun spot to have a few drinks with some friends.  Upbeat island atmosphere makes you forget you are in a frigid Chicago winter.

The drinks are fun and come in really cool looking glasses.  The pupu platter was okay, but I think next time I might order just a few individual appetizers--Some of the appetizers were a little too oily or saucy.

Overall, great experience with many hours of drinking and good conversation in a fun environment.

pics.caption: Drinks in cute bowls and cups!

review.des: One of the coolest places in Chicago. You enter through a back alley and walk through a dark lobby area to the most surprising little tiki bar. It's great for large groups or couples. The drinks are delicious and come in super fun tiki mugs. Awesome place to bring someone who has never been!

This tiki bar was one of the absolute highlights of our trip. We were lucky to find this place with the help of the tips and reviews listed. When you see tiki torches, you're in the right place. We got in line just in time. The rain storm had started coming down as we entered.

Entering, skulls lined the ceiling. When we got to the lower level, we were greeted and was told there was an hour wait for tables, but bar seats were first come, first serve. My companions and I got super lucky! We got seats by the bar within the first ten minutes. Ordered our libations with Alex, our super-duper-talented bartender. He worked so fast! Prepared more than five drinks at a time and meticulously decorated all tiki mugs. There will be a wait for drinks since it gets busy.

I got the "Cacchen" Some Rays; beneath it marked a skull. My travel-mate ordered a Painkiller No. 639. Delicious concoctions. We also ordered another round of Mai Tais, equally tasteful. Tiki mugs were expertly decorated with blossoms, pineapple leaves, crazy straws, or with banana dolphins (Adorable). One of the places to check out in Chicago. DJ played some amazing mixes. Please drink responsibly. Don't drink more than you can handle. Thanks Alex for making our last night in Chicago memorable.

This place is AWESOME! My friend and I looved it here! Definitely one of the highlights of our Chicago trip!

We went around 8pm on a Thursday night and the place wasn't too crowded yet. We managed to find a seat at the bar! Let's be honest. This bar is underground, so we had some trouble finding this place since the entrance is in the back alley and nothing but a door and a couple of bouncers. haha! Once you're inside, the Hawaiian tiki themed interior is suuper nice!! I was blown away by the decorations and the beautiful lighting.

We ordered a total of 4 tiki drinks ($13 each) and the luau chips n guac ($9). I'm into stronger drinks, so I got the Dead Reckoning and Poipu Beach Boogie Board, while my friend who's into sweeter and milder drinks, got the Painkiller No. 639 and Demerara Dry Float. Our bartender was very friendly and fast! She made sure that our drinks are nicely decorated with different flowers, umbrellas, mint leaves, etc. All the drinks are SUPER pretty and pretty STRONG too, so 2 - 3 of these drinks will get the job done. I was also pretty enticed by the Zombie drink that has smoke running out of it. Cool!

tl:dr - Very reasonable priced beautiful high quality tiki drinks. Friendly and efficient staffs. Beautifully decorated interior = 5 stars in my book!!

GO HERE if you are a fan of tiki bars!

Open up one in SF pretty please...? :)

pics.caption: Demarara Dry Float & Poipu Beach Boogie board

review.des: Down an alley lies this wonderful gem. It gets really crowded, so definitely make a reservation if you can. Such a fun tiki bar. The drinks are really expensive but boy are they strong! Definitely worth the price and they come in a fun cup of some kind depending on what you get.

Really awesome place. Went there with a small group and had a great time. The line wasn't really long (though I was a bit annoyed that some bachelorette party of like a zillion people cut in front of us). The cocktails were unique for sure, and they didn't skimp on the alcohol. Good service, good vibe. Would highly recommend the aloha cocktail.
This place is simply so much fun. Great atmosphere and super kitschy in the best way possible.

Entrance is a little difficult to locate since it's in an alley, but if you are able to see Firecakes Donuts, you're golden (just go to the alley on the right of Firecakes).

Three Dots and a Dash is a tiki themed bar with themed drinks to match - making the environment super fun and enjoyable to go with friends on a night out. Servers are attentive and bartenders are super friendly. Drinks are each meticulously prepared and are crowd pleasers. Personally, I believe the drinks are on the strong side but it's not bad for $13/drink. There's also group drinks depending on how large your party is.

Regardless if you are living in Chicago or visiting Chicago, I would definitely recommend visiting Three Dots and a Dash.

While a fun concept, I feel this particular spot is past it's prime. The drinks are good but in the range of overpriced. The line can be long so get early. Keep in mind that this is in a basement in an alley so if you're from out of town, the location could be hard to find. I'd recommend Lost Lake or the Flamingo Rum Club over this but if you just want some tiki drinks, you could do worse.

Cute little bar with a cute little name!

Came here on a Friday night so it was a bit packed and it took a while for the bartender to greet us (not such a big deal though because of how busy they were). The drinks were fun and pretty. They were garnished very nicely. In other words they are very "instagramable." The only thing I did not like was that they were very light on the booze and pricey.

Gross drinks. Stupid reserve buy a table thing for a crappy spot. When it first opened it was cool, it's definitely gone down hill.
Tell your relatives that are in town that you don't like to go here.
Its pretty dark down here so if you like people not seeing what you actually look like this is the place for you! The drinks and atmosphere is really cool, great people, over priced a bit though,
Fun, loud & crazy expensive. Nice they take reservations so you can have some elbow room.

I really enjoyed my evening at Three Dots and a Dash.  The atmosphere was pretty cool.  Loved the Tiki motif.  Having never been to three dots, I found the address on yelp and I had heard the Bar was a fun place to go to, but did not have any expectations.  We arrived at 435 N. Clark, but could not find the entrance.  We asked a nearby valet where the bar was.  He said the entrance is in the alley.  We walked around to the alley and sure enough there was a bouncer standing between two tiki torches.  We walked in and then proceeded down stairs, past a pretty cool wall of skulls.  (They were doing there best to get us into the mood).

Personally, I was on a mission to learn about the bar and its drinks.   And I would say I succeeded in increasing my curiosity for Rum.

Our bartender was Aiden and he was quite engaging.  He gave us the spiel on the 290 rums that the bar has.  I was surprised that there were that many kinds of rum.  But knowing the little history of rum in the americas (and the west indies), I should have known there would be a significant selection of rum at this tiki bar.  

I was not sure what to order and Aiden was quite helpful.  He made me a daiquiri (not on the menu) which if I had I been paying attention it, would have been added as a cocktail of the week recipe for my youtube channel (chezmacbistro).  

We had a couple of the appetizers:  the Tuna Poke and the Thai Fried Chicken.  Both were delicious and made the whole experience fantastic.

I watched as they prepared a slew of different drinks using traditional and modern presentations.  They even used liquid nitrogen to chill the glasses!

I will be returning to Three dots for more research on the rum list!

Probably one of the coolest bars I've been to!!! I felt like I was in the Caribbean escaping the cold Chicago weather. Such variety of cool drinks and amazing rums. This spot is great to go with friends (chill atmosphere, music is amazing and just loud enough to be able to have a conversation with friends). Definitely recommend coming here! The staff is friendly and attentive. I'll be coming back whenever I'm in Chicago.

I have been here several times and I always enjoy myself. Definitely make a reservation because this place gets crowded and the drinks are heavy to be carrying around. Also beware that the drinks are pretty pricey, but they are tasty and the ambiance of the bar is also great. Overall, I would recommend to try this bar out, but make a reservation and be prepared to spend around $12-14 a drink.

They take reservations. Upscale tiki bar. So far I'm impressed!

Entrance is in the alley, marked by blue lights and a bouncer by a black door.

Building is handicap accessible (I was on crutches) but staff have to help you access the elevator.

Interior is in the lower level and swanky with tables, booths, and standing area around the bar.

All drinks were between $10-16 individually and with really cool ones for bigger groups. Appetizers/food was good though nothing Super memorable.

Would recommend for anyone looking for an upscale good time and drinks with fun, swanky friends.

pics.caption: Three dots and a dash drink $15 (?) - good, a stronger drink with a little sour to it.
a coconutty drink - can't remember the name. Had a nice nuttiness to it. this was the most memorable one IMO

review.des: This place was beyond cool. I loved the dark and almost seductive lighting and decor of this place. Drinks were also amazing! Pricey, but they are totally worth it, and they dont cheap out on the amount of alcohol put in them! I was sad that I couldnt purchase the anglerfish mug, however I got over that haha. Their food was ok, nothing amazing but good enough for the price. Id definitely visit if you get the chance.
The drinks are too strong and don't taste very well. The place is always way too crowded and there's no where to sit unless you make a reawervation weeks in advance.

This place is extremely difficult to find! I ordered the banana daquri and it was excellent. They are heavy pour-ers to be warned :)

If I'm back in this area I would definitely come back and try other drinks.

So over rated!!! Place has ok drinks not up to par for the wait. Tried to get a drink at the bar it was packed not organized at all. Bartenders wouldn't even look up. Don't waste your time. Just a dark hole in a basement.
More than a tad over priced on there drink and way to sweetfor my taste. Ambiance was really cool and they turn tables pretty quickly. It's a one time visit only place for me.

I was there during a special event and it was wall to wall so it's hard to say how crowded it is normally. Love the underground location and the catacomb like stairs. Dark but cool decor inside. The drinks and garnishes were fantastic. Only had one night on a business trip but was so happy I could check this off my tiki bucket list.

It's unfortunate that I can't rate zero stars for this establishment. Our experience here was nothing shy of embarrassing and discriminatory! We had a reservation for a party of 8 and learned earlier that evening that our friends also had reserved for a party of 4. Upon arrival, we checked in with the hostesses and asked if at all possible could we be seated near our friends. They stated that it may not be possible however approached us later with an opportunity to be seated together- both parties in one area. We were told there would be a required 20% gratuity, one bill with no more than 5 separate cards for payment and no minimum requirement. We were very appreciative and excited at this point. This quickly changed as we were shortly after approached by who we later learned was the shift manager, Geoffrey. Geoffrey came over and stated that we would be seated shortly however the hostesses left one stipulation out as a requirement for our party. He continued stating that because we were a party of 12, we would need to secure a $400 food and drink bill and would have a 2 hour maximum time frame. We explained that we were not a party of 12 and that we were told by the hostesses there would be no minimum required. Not that this would be an issue with a party of 12 successful working professionals. Geoffrey then expressed that he wanted to get us seated and "would be wiling to meet us halfway at $200". Please note that we never asked for any accommodations in reference to payments and would have been perfectly fine if our friends were not seated with us. We stated this multiple times. Nonetheless, we were then seated together and approached by a rude female server who literally snatched the menu out of one of our guests hands and proceeded to review the drink options. A male server then approached another guest and stated that he would need to move. At this point, we are certain he made a mistake however he returned with Geoffrey. This time Geoffrey is holding a laminated pamphlet and a bill from the previous seated guests in the area. He stated that he wanted us to see what the guests seated in the area prior to our arrival paid or secured in food and drinks- which he said was roughly $600. He went on to say that the policy of Three Dots and a Dash is that parties over 8 would require a deposit. We again explained that this was never our intention and we were only given the opportunity to be seated together per the hostesses. At this point, other restaurant guests were beginning to turn around and watch as Geoffrey continues to explain why he was now requesting a group of now 12 people squeeze into a booth and two chairs that would barely seat the original 8. The behavior exhibited by this manager was completely unprofessional, abrasive and discriminating. The assumption was made that we would not spent what he felt was appropriate from the moment he approached our group. Additionally, there was never any attempt to recognize that we were only operating on what we were told by his team. As a leader, he made no attempt to ensure customer service was priority and address miscommunication regarding the situation with his team. Instead, he stood in the middle of the establishment and in many ways attempted to berate guests who were looking forward to an evening of celebration.  For purposes of time, I will not recall verbatim everything he stated however at one point he nade reference to his skin color in comparison to ours. As if this was relevant, perhaps to him it was. We were embarrassed and disappointed to say the least. The hostesses were very apologetic for our encounter and we were thankful however I will not be visiting this establishment again.

This is a nice tiki bar place. If you have a small or big group of people, call in advance to reserve a table. The waitress was nice and explained the drinks to us. The music was decent and the atmosphere was good. I wish we had ordered the larger fishbowl looking drink with many straws for people to share, but we had only 3 people. Will definitely come back again next time!

We stopped in at about 8:30 on a Friday for drinks while in town. Yes, we were those tourists everyone seems to mention on here. Finding the bar was not as difficult as I had expected.  Just look for the blue lights in the alley and you're good to go. The atmosphere was great and did not seem over the top like some bars can be when they have a theme. Despite the room filling up with people, we were greeted and served promptly by the bartender. I ordered the strip and go naked and the SO ordered the rum barrel. My drink was served in a cute tiki glass with a mermaid swizzle stick, orchid, and pineapple leaves as garnish. The presentation was really a treat. The drinks were balanced and not too sweet. Mine was fresh and fruity, though for the price tag, I'm on the fence whether it was worth it. The ingredients were clearly fresh and the bartender knew exactly what he was doing, and the bar is downtown, so I suppose it's just the typical price of admission. The rum barrel was strong, which was designated by the single skull next to it on the menu. By the way, the menu does a great job of describing each drink along with the ingredients. The rum barrel was definitely worthy of at least one of those deadly little skulls, so I shudder to think what a double skull tastes like. This place was on my bucket list, so I can happily say I can cross it off. Would I come back?  I would consider it, but the size of the crowd and lack of seats is a huge turn off (yes, I realize reservations can be made, but the place just gets packed and more than a little claustrophobic). The drinks, service and atmosphere were top notch, which is why they are so busy. It's worth checking out at least once.

Fun and yummy! Beware of long waits and large crowds. Highly recommend coming with a group of friends and making a reservation -- the group drinks looked yummy! I got a banana drink and my husband got their classic three dots and a dash. Both were delicious and we had a lot of fun.

pics.caption: Banana on the left, three dots on the right

review.des: Extremely over crowded but the drinks are great if you're looking for something tropical. The drinks are also so cute with the tiki theme. Though very hard to come here with a date because 100% it'll be crowded standing room only.

I understand that there are reservations required to get a table and we were only 5 minutes early. The girl at the door was so annoyed by us showing up early that she literally rolled her eyes at us. I asked her what the issue was with her rolling her eyes when i can clearly see that there are more than enough tables EMPTY! This was our first time there and i already was mad that this "Hostess" was giving us this nasty ass attitude.

People in the service industry need to understand in order to keep your job or even have one, you have to polite to your customers. I didn't ask you to kiss my ass, i asked you to seat me and didn't ask for your eyes to get rolled. I understand people have bad days, but suck it up when you are at work and fake it.

One we were seated the server was nice and super sweet but this place needs to clean up their staff.

Three Dots and a Dash never fails. This is my go to spot in the city when people visit. The drinks are strong and a bit more on the pricey side, but definitely worth the experience. If you go with a group, I highly recommend reserving a table far in advance because this place fills up fast.

Great drinks and a fun tiki atmosphere - you really can't go wrong

This is a cool spot to hit up for drinks in river north. With be entrance being in an alleyway, it really feels like you enter a Hawaiian club atmosphere without the loud music. The drinks all come in really cool cups, so it's a must to visit to get the sweet picture. I tried the surfers report, which was a gin based cocktail amongst all the other rum options. It was super refreshing and tasty. I'm glad I finally tried this popular place!

Drinks are a little expensive but you definitely get what you pay for. Very tasty and great time watching the bartender make them. I am a bartender my self and this is one of my go to spots when I have friends and family in town visiting.
So fun! A great place to go in the middle of winter when you wish you were somewhere warmer! Fun and tasty drinks!

This place is probably exactly what you think it is. I'm not here to discredit the cheesy ambiance or the overly iced, silly souvenir drinks. I'm really not. I am simply here to provide a warning to the budget conscious drinker who would prefer their spirits neat or on the rocks, as opposed to stuffed with children's toys and sugar.

Tonight, I ordered a whiskey neat. A simple request from most bars. I was told Four Roses was available, which as most know, is an excellent, though price-friendly whiskey. Seemed like a no-brainer. I was poured the whiskey and offered a giant ice ball. Great. Exactly what I was looking for. Then I was told the price. $16. Ha I'm sorry, I must've heard wrong, I thought you said $16. Oh. Oh you DID say $16. You mean $16 like HALF the cost of an entire bottle of this tasty spirit? You mean $16 like more than ANY of the 13 ingredient rum drinks you offer? Oh. Okay. Sounds reasonable. Yup. Makes sense. Nobody's getting ripped off here. Cool, cool.

Three Dots And A Kick In The Nuts, is more like it.

On my last evening in Chicago I headed to Three Dots and a Dash for a quick happy hour and it was a fun choice for sure. The entrance is in an alley, down a dark stairway, and then you find yourself in a fairly dim, tiki-themed space that fits the theme one hundred percent.

I had two different cocktails, both quite different and each quite delectable. The first was a bourbon-based drink with grapefruit called a Western Sour. The second was the Surf Report with gin, cucumber, and mint. I would order each again. Of course, they have the big sharing bowls and next time I'd be inclined to try one of those.

They do have some food options if you need a bite to eat, but the drinks alone are worth the adventure in.

The bone marrow here is awesome! Be sure too double up in the order if you like marrow. I ordered crown in the rocks and the two went very well together. The area this bar is located is very lively at night so enjoy the atmosphere, while eating and drinking the night away.

Fun aesthetic, funky drinks but honestly - it's a spot for just one drink and then head out. Signature cocktails are sugary and the food is not my favorite. Fun vibe and a great spot for a quick catch up with friend and fancy drink.

Beautiful yet welcoming underground (literally) bar with an aloha ambiance. The drinks are on a perfect spectrum promoting not only the few of us that "can't hang" but also that party animal in the squad that nobody actually invited but happens to show.

Definitely a must for any group that loves the basics: Good food, great drinks, and somewhere you can forget about the negativity from the grounds above.

If you like tiki drinks or rum drinks, you'll love Three Dots and a Dash.
That being said, if you aren't a big fan of rum, you're really out of luck. The menu is very limited around rum based drinks. One would hope even tiki bars have other drinks available - the occasional whiskey or vodka drink would surely be helpful in attracting additional people.

That being said, the drinks are strong and creative (one would hope so for the price for the drinks). So if you're looking for a tiki bar or some rum drinks, Three Dots is a perfect choice. But if you're looking for some strong, good drinks, I might suggest a more varied option.

great vibes and awesome drink combinations. only
complaint was that there's virtually nowhere to sit unless you make a reservation super early in advance. not exactly conducive for a spontaneous night out
Awesome environment, great ambiance, delicious drinks, friendly and knowledgeable bartenders!

$12, 13 drinks? Did they lower the price for me on a weekday night? STRONG. Umbrella drinks with ornate orchids, peels, and more. An awesome speakeasy vibe through a back door and down stairs. It was blazing hot at first, but was turned down upon request. Regardless, oh my the drinks are amazing. Based on recommendations I was surprised to find the bar pretty empty, but it filled up quickly.

Painkiller, Jet Pilot, try anything here. It is an amazing place, price, and theme. Tiki drinks specialized from all over the world are on the menu as well.

I would downgrade to a 4 star if this place becomes as packed as other people say, but really it was wide open for me to enjoy my assortment of beverages and stumble out. Definitely check it out.

Cheers!

I was told by friends that this is one of the most unique and fun bars to go to in Chicago. It's sort of a speakeasy as the entrance is down an alley.

The first thing that stood out to me was the awesome entrance. As you're going down the stairs to the bar, they have a wall of skulls with a blue light. To me, that's just awesome and I don't even really like skulls.

The bar was very packed and it was definitely a packed house by the bar. My girlfriend and I had to wait about ten minutes till we squeezed in and found two chairs to have a seat at the bar. This tiki bar had some unique drinks. The bartenders were very nice and would typically make 4-6 drinks at a time. Each drink had a specific ingredient list and their own glass too.

These drinks had enough alcohol in them for the price and was a great place to go out on a Saturday night with friends and get the night started.

Service was great... Drinks were okay. Big and sugary, but that's to be expected from a tiki-inspired place, I should think. I was initially, pretty excited as I'd heard from a lot of people it was a blast and had great food. Apparently, this was awhile back. Menu is really small and mostly fried. Would be a great place for sharing group drinks, I think. But, overall it felt like a strange version of an Elvis Presley movie.

Fun speakeasy. Original decor and drinks. The drinks are good, amusing to look at and very happy generous. Go on a weekday if you want to be seated. It is a popular but small location with very limited seating. Overcrowded during weekends if you don't have a reservation.

My best friend and I found ourselves here on an inpromptu bar crawl for two. It was the Sunday night of memorial day weekend, and a lot of the bars were surprisingly empty.

Both of us have been wanting to give Three Dots and a Dash a try (since we've been hearing all the hype) and we were hoping it wouldn't be pretty empty like the previous bars on our crawl.

Jokes on us, it was pretty hoppin! Which wasn't a bad thing. Sure, we weren't able to get a seat, but from what I've read this place usually has an even bigger crowd with a line out the door.

Their drink menu is super fun and tropical. I love the idea of a tiki bar in the alley of Chicago. Cocktails run $13, but they're well worth it! So many different options each filled with a ton of flavor, booze, and fruit. Not to mention the festive glasses, umbrellas, and garnishes that top off your drink.

It took us a few minutes to put our drink order in, but not too bad. We just wiggled our way up to the bar, and then were lucky enough to post up next to a counter where we had some room.

We only stayed long enough for one drink, because I had to catch a train. I ordered the Three Dots and a Dash signature cocktail (felt right). This lovely beverage is made up of aged rhum agricole, guyanese rum, honey, falernum, lime, allspice, and angostura bitters. It came in a green coconut mug and was garnished with a large pineapple slice - yum! Mad props to the bartenders who make these delicious concoctions.

I love that their cocktail menu is so straightforward - descriptions, pictures, and prices. Perfecto.

I'd love to come back with more friends and check out their menu and group drinks. Seems like a fun place to hangout!

pics.caption: Three dots and a dash cocktail

review.des: You need to make a reservation a few weeks in advance if you want a table but it's well worth it. The drinks are so good. Everything is fresh and the staff is incredibly nice. The atmosphere is awesome, I honestly felt like I could have been in Aruba or Jamaica. Would absolutely recommend.

First of all i couldn't even find the door man! Why don't you have a restaurant name on the door. Gps took me to the front which is completely different place! I had to call to figure out where this place is.

We got seated right away no complain about that but they seated us couple next too this lousy group of girls. It was a torture sat next to them. We could hear everything they said and it was so annoying

We didn't really like our drink. I had banana something and my guy had painkiller. But it was  pretty strong gotta say, if you wanna get super drunk fast i recommend it. The presentation was good though i like song they played and the vibe of the whole place is really interesting.

Food: we ordered thai chicken, papaya salad ,and the pork belly bun. Thai ch was good! Pork Belly buns was alright, and papaya salad as a thai person it was too americanize for me.

Great drinks, great ambience - just finding it was a little tough . Drinks and vibe are perfect for summer - great choices if you're just not into alcohol and looking for a mocktail. Had awesome service by the bartender - which more often than not doesn't really happen when places are packed.

This place is fun-- if you've never been, you should try it at least. It's not really a "speakeasy," but the underground tiki vibe is cool. If you want to sit, either go at a less popular time or reserve a table! It's usually super crowded so if you just go on a random Friday night to check it out, expect to stand and be very uncomfortable. Other than that, it's definitely enjoyable if you have a table with a group of friends!

The atmosphere can't be beat and the cocktails are delicious and POTENT. The entrance makes you feel like you're entering some underground, secret speakeasy, which is a great first impression. The menu is very broad and helpful in choosing your cocktail based on your tastes & strength of the cocktail. The ingredients are all interesting and fresh with global flavors - I became obsessed with pandan leaf in Thailand, and they have a frozen drink revolving around it. The only drawback is the inaccessibility on weekend nights after 8pm - the lines are insane and it gets really packed. Go for an after-work drink, but don't ever expect to get a table unless you have reservations.
great drinks and service. Came in on a Saturday around 4pm and got seated right away. fried chicken was the best thing we ate.

This bar is a must see in Chicago. One part mysterious as the entrance is in an alley, one part tacky as the place is decorated with skulls and tiki torches, and one part deadly as the cocktails are sweet but highly intoxicating. It's one of the most unique places I've seen and worth grabbing a drink. It's usually crowded and the drinks are a bit pricey. It's not a regular place to go but one to show people a good time. The signature "three dots and a dash" drink is great.

pics.caption: Three Dots and a Dash Signature Drink

review.des:
Love the presentation of the drinks here!! I've never been to a tiki bar in New York so I was super excited about going to this place when I was visiting Chicago.

Got here around 9:30 pm on a Saturday. There was a short line already but the line moved up pretty fast. You can tell that this place is pretty popular :) If you want to sit down and order some appetizers, make sure to reserve a table in advance. If you only want drinks, there's only standing room around the bar.

We ordered the western sour and the poblano escobar. It tasted very tropical fruity and strong at the same time (YUM). The drinks are a bit pricey though but I guess you're also paying for the ambiance.

It became really crowded after a while but this place is great for a group of friends if you want to celebrate something special. You'll definitely have a great time!!

Love this place! The Hawaiian theme reminds me of a rip off (but classier) version of a little place in the suburbs!

I love that they made this a secret entrance bar. And the mood you feel as you'e going down the stairs.

Drinks were delicious! They're so elaborate, I can't even begin to describe to you what I got but I guarantee anything you pick will be even better than the last!

They're missing a star from me because service was terrible. I do understand the drinks take forever to make and have a big ingredient list but it wouldn't hurt the bartender to smile for a second. It just seemed rushed. I definitely wish we sat down on a table to get a better experience.

I would definitely go back (maybe on a less crowded night?) and would recommend this place to anyone who likes craft cocktails or fruity drinks!
This is one of my go to hangouts when I what to go downtown and have a few cocktails and relax. The atmosphere is very inviting and the service will keep you coming back.
This place is too much fun haha. Going in via the alley it feels sketchy, and once you're inside it's so cool! Lots of interesting drinks. This place is a must-go. The music is amazing too!!

I feel like I have dropped so many hints about yelp and it's rating method but I give up. There will never be half stars on yelp or more than five stars. So based on that three dots and a dash it's SOL. I don't think it deserves three stars but I am not sure it deserves 2 1/2 either. My expectations were very high therefore I'm going to round it down. One star goes to the drinks or presentation rather and the other star goes to the service. Nothing else was amazing about this place. The menu was the size of Texas but there were barely any food choices there. So we ordered the Pupu platter and in my opinion it tasted like the name. The food was so greasy and so old I feel like I could've gotten better choices had I shopped at Aldi in the frozen section. Not so sure that I plan on returning anytime soon. I get that the place is about the drinks but there's nothing wrong with having a couple of solid food options on the menu to go along with those overpriced straws. No great drinks will wash the bad taste of the fishiest/greasiest crab ragoons. Aloha 3DD!

I was pleasantly surprised with this place!  We had to wait in line, but were not charged a cover.  When we got inside we saw that it was decorated as a tiki bar.  We were provided a drink menu upon entering.  They have a selection of specialty drinks that are tropical/fruity and are served in fun containers with an excess of garnish.

There were a lot of people there for dinner still at 9 p.m. and still more reserved tables kept popping up.  I'd go back and give the food a try, if it's anything like the drinks then you can't go wrong!

I LOVE a tiki bar, there's just something great about them. This one is hard to find, like through the alley into a door then down some steps and you're like are we sure this is the way, hard to find but worth it. Pricey drinks but I felt they were strong so you don't need many. Food options looked interesting but sadly we were just there for drinks, will have to go back and try the food.

Looked up three dots and a dash and the drinks looked amazingly good, well they were. I thought the were pricey until I saw how big they are. The ambiance is so cool and relaxing. Will probably go back and try another drink.

We had a mix up in our reservation which was actually due to miscommunication on our side, but the host staff were SO understanding and accommodating. They were able to find us a table and seat us pretty quickly even though it was really busy. Communication was clear and service was top notch! Thank you so much to the host staff!!

I love coming to this spot and tonight was no exception. I came here with a big group and even though it was a packed crowed our hostess Shru was very accommodating. Our group ordered the Head Hunter and Bali Bali which were instagram-worthy. I'll be coming back here shortly!
True craft cocktails with a tiki twist. Great ambiance and dancing late night. Try the large format drinks for groups!

This place is so cute! Was perfect for a girl's night on a Sunday. It was pretty busy for a Sunday night as well and they're open late until 2am. The inside emulates a tiki bar and the place is tucked in an alley. The drinks were delicious! And strong, especially if you order one that has 1-2 "skulls" next to it on the menu. I also ordered their spring rolls as an appetizer but their specialty is definitely drinks. The spring rolls were too oily and nothing extraordinary.
Love this place. A tad expensive but the experience is worth it. Staff is super friendly and energetic!!!

I wanted to like this place so much but it was average in my opinion. The drinks are very good but the food not so much. I did not like the short ribs and white rice because the rice was not good at all. The guacamole and chips were not tasty at all. I did not like the pineapples inside the guacamole or the chips. The painkiller drink was really good and the pupu platter.

pics.caption: Dipping sauces and the guacamole and chips.

review.des:
Ubered here from the Four Seasons and it was a quick $8 ride.

We were dropped off and immediately saw the blue light that you follow into the alley. Not sketchy at all, the alley was lit well enough.

We showed our Ids and were let in to the stairs that go underground. The host was efficient and gave us a great corner booth with plenty of space to enjoy.

Our server asked if it was our first time and we said yes. She explained the menu, gave her recommendations and we proceeded to order our drinks. We, shared the Bali Bali amongst the three of us and ordered the Pu Pu platter, extra order of thai fried chicken and duck rolls. The drink came first and it looked absolutely gorgeous. $85 was steep but we were on vacation and said F*ck it.

Next the food. Holy smokes. They do not disappoint. The food was delicious! It paired well with our drinks. Also, the portions were nice, again steep for $60 work of food but we enjoyed it. Soon we started to feel the alcohol, it was a nice buzz.

This place is nice for a casual night out. I wouldn't mind recommending this place as a first date location either because of how the atmosphere was. Definitely will recommend but will remind my friends of the prices.

pics.caption: This was when we realized he alcohol.

review.des:
Awesome spot to check out, especially if you aren't from the city! Cool underground bar that literally has you going through an alley to wait in a line formed by two tiki torches and a couple of bouncers. I got in line around 10:30 thinking it might take a while to get inside the bar, but the line moves pretty fast.

They have tables if you prefer being seated with bigger parties or if you want to order one of their big pirate ship/treasure chest drinks! Don't forget to check in with the host to do so, since their tables may or may not have a waitlist depending on how busy it is. I preferred just ordering at the bar since I was only with another girlfriend the night I came here. All their cocktails are $13 and I recommend getting their signature banana daiquiri and/or a drink from their painkiller series. I have to say that regardless of how busy it gets here, they still manage to put a lot of effort in the presentation of these drinks. Well worth the wait!

Most likely you'll be standing all night here since there isn't much seating available except by the bar or if you're lucky to grab a table, but overall it is a pretty small and dimly-lit bar so expect to get cozy!

What a fun spot! It's located in an alley and really fits the theme of a tiki bar. Minus the music. It seemed a bit confused and was pretty loud. All around, it was a fun girls night out on a Sunday night. Our server was bubbly and helpful, appetizers are available and their drinks are the showstopper. They can get strong so look at the strength of the drinks, as indicated by the number of skulls.
The vibe at this bar is really great. Drinks are super expensive at $15-16 per drink. But the two I tried were amazing and pretty strong. Definitely plan to return here!

Really cool tropically themed bar with really strong (but fairly expensive) drinks. One of those places with a really cool vibe that's nicely decorated that you'll be sure to remember far into the future. Each and every drink is spectacularly decorated with some type of visual wow factor that makes it memorable.

We have been coming here since the place opened. The service last night was terrible. The waitress completely ignored us. Even had to track her down just to pay the bill. We did notice that those who were younger in attendance had prompt service. Very disappointed and will not be returning.

I'm a Rum Connoisseur I don't think it has been a rum that i haven't had or know about
I went here for my birthday 3 years ago , my birthday is in December so it was kind of cold
but i though it was real exclusive vip the way everyone had to stand outside in the back of the building in the alley , once you get in you instantly go down stairs to a hidden lounge
which you are completely blown away by what you see
whoever the designer of this tiki bar definitely captured the real experienced of a tiki lounge
you feel like your on a tropical resort on island the girls bartenders and servers are in banana skirts , flower dresses & straw head ceremony head gear   , i loved the food i didn't like standing most of the time i would definitely come back and reserve a table it gets packed and if you don't have a table your out of luck but  the standing by the bar was ok i guess my guest that came with me was told a booth opened up , that's when the real fun happened i order the treasure chest , zombie and the scorpion bowl i ended spending almost $400 but i loved how all my guest could drink out the treasure chest it really stretched and also a bottle of dom P I really had a great time any one looking for a great tiki bar i recommend this place you will not be disappointed

We came here on a Saturday right when it opened and it packed up very easily. I'm glad we came early.
We ordered the bunny's banana daiquiri and it was delicious and strong. I had the virgin version of the poppy beach boogie bird.
The luau chips with the pineapple avacado dip is delicious. Great atmosphere and concept. Would return with friends!

Where to even begin.... How can it not be amazing when it is hidden in an alley way and you have to walk into a door at the bottom of a staircase. Once you walk in you know it's going to be fantastic. Brian was the bartender. Pretty cool guy! Drinks were great, tasty, strong, and definitely eye catching!!! Check it out and you won't be disappointed.

Came here with a group for a family celebration. Was our last stop of the night. We ordered the Treasure Chest (we had shared this before once in the past). It was a pretty good experience the first time, but this time was different. We were seated at a very small booth and asked to move to a new table. The man in charge of the dining room would not reseat us. We explained that we wanted a larger table (you'd think this place was all about a good experience) but they gave us pushback and weren't able to accommodate. It was pretty frustrating being that there were plenty of open tables available. I definitely won't be coming back and wouldn't recommend. There are too many other great places in Chicago to waste your time here on a subpar experience!

Very whimsical bar revival! We happened upon the entrance by accident as it's hidden away in an alley. Follow the ocean blue light.

Drinks are creative as is the seating area. The music is a charming 1950's mix and the bartenders wear 80's style ripped jean jackets with Hawaiian shirts. The menus have a vintage tint to them with an aged look to the obviously brand spanking new pages. So I guess the theme is 80's nostalgic 50's nostalgia? Regardless, it works.

The drinks are a pretty penny but not out of line for River North. It'd be a cute place to take a date and they have party spaces available with drink specials (drink out of a skull or treasure chest with your friends!)  Might come back if there are less River North brahs ruining the atmosphere.

I would say a big part of this place getting four stars is because we got a table; if we had been standing around like a lot of people it would be more of a three star place. We didn't have to wait too long to get in. The decor here is great. Lots of kitsch, total tiki place. I'm not a big rum fan, but when in rome...

Missionary's Downfall - refreshing and delicious. Probs the best tasting drink of the night, though it doesn't taste like there is much alcohol in it.
Jet Pilot - Heck yes. My favorite of all the ones we got.
Aloha Felicia - Incredibly sweet. Good, but you are basically just drinking coconut cream.
Chief Lapu Lapu - Kind of a middle of the road tiki drink. It tasted good but wasn't anything special, except for the passion fruit that came with it.
Navy Grog - Ordered a classic tiki drink off menu to test them out. It was okay, not the best I've had (that goes to Trader Sams), but a solid try.

Overall, I would totally come back if I was with other rum fans; just make sure you can get a table if possible.
Great bar with a wide selection of fun drinks.  Several options for group drinks. Good atmosphere and great service.
Loved the location. Service was excellent. Vibe was very welcoming and chill. Drinks were well made and decently priced. New favorite spot in Chicago!

Tiki bar heaven, great space for large and small groups alike! I've gone with a group of 4 without a reservation, it's a big space but fills up quickly on Saturday nights. The appetizers are fun and a great compliment to the tropical drinks!

I think this place is an absolute blast.  As everyone has indicated, it's a Tiki Bar and they go whole-hog (ha ha pig roast, whatever) on the theme. We went at 5pm on a Tuesday, there was no wait, although it filled up by the time we left.

I had two drinks - don't remember which ones - it doesn't matter too much, although I do remember tasting the Jet Pilot from someone else and didn't love the cinnamon much. They will hit you pretty hard, despite being so fruity.  They ARE sweet, but honestly, not as sweet as you might think.  I've had much more cloying cocktails at an average bar/restaurant (see my review for Whisky Thief Tavern).  Plus, they're in FUN!!! glasses...you can't help but smile.

The Lanai Luau Chips are surprisingly good, crunchy and light and with a unique root flavor - with decent guac to boot, if you're trying to absorb some rum.

I would absolutely go back - it's a terrific place to kick off a night, get you kick started with a good buzz, enjoy the decor, and pretend you're on an island for a brief respite. Try it!

Three Dots is superb. Establishments in the US that do tiki cocktails right are few and far between. Outside of Three dots there is it's sister Lost Lake, Smugglers Cove in SF, Latitude 29 in NO and the long shuttered but legendary Painkiller in NY to name a few.

The reason I suspect outside of financial ones is that it is hard. I mean most cocktail bars are preparing 2 and 3 ingredient cocktails as their mainstay and then there are some tiki drinks that require 12 to 15 ingredients all in precise amounts and then there are the garnishes.  

The location too is perfect and the ambiance has an appropriate amount of Tiki, without all the kitsch.

It was "fun" and by that I mean, yell at the person across the table from you while you drink a absurd looking drink that will make your teeth and stomach hurt because of the copious amounts of sugar.  Just to be clear, I buy at least 4 pound bags of candy at Halloween for myself.  It was too much for me.

So for those who don't know this is a tiki bar! This was my first experience at a tiki bar and I loved it! The drinks come in really cool glasses and on the menu they have some crazy cool drinks. Even though they were crazy cool looking I think they were a little light on the alcohol.

I don't know about you guys but I like feeling a little buzz off of my drink! Even if it's drink one.. these drinks aren't cheap! I didn't get any buzz from my first drink but did from my second. It's always crowded here and I would def make reservations if you want a table. I haven't had the food here but I may try it some time. The music is meh, I guess it goes with the tiki vibe but I wouldn't come here to actually party.

Overall I loved the vibes in this place and the atmosphere! I would definitely recommend stopping by here! This isn't an end destination but a stop in your night!

Oh, Three Dots and a Dash.  This place is very cool, although I have never been one to wait in their long line during peak hours.  I've been here four times, always either on a weeknight or in the late afternoon on a Friday or Saturday.  Most recently, I met two friends here after work on a Friday, and we had a great time.  We each enjoyed several drinks, and I loved both the Banana Daiquiri and Missionary's Downfall.  As I remembered from previous visits, the cocktails are beautifully presented and also remarkably strong for how tasty they are.  I also had the Crab Rangoon, and it was good as well.  Our server was kind and impressively remembered what each of us had ordered when taking our separate payments, and the well-done atmosphere speaks for itself.

The one thing that tainted my experience, however, was that when my friend arrived and got the table, she mentioned that the host told her he "needed the table back in an hour."  We ended up testing the waters and staying a bit longer (one of my friends was visiting from Europe and we hadn't seen her in several years) but this left a bad taste with me, especially because there were many open tables available even when we left.

So from the sounds of the name, I thought this place was Morse code. Googling tells me that it stands for "V", which must mean it's Very good (not really, Wikipedia tells you what it really means).

This place has hand-crafted, aesthetically pleasing, drinks, that are delicious. If you're a big rum person, this place doesn't disappoint. Besides the tasty drinks, we also ordered the Pu Pu Platter which had:
- Pork buns -- tasty!
- Coconut shrimp -- not a big coconut person, but the shrimp wasn't over-coated with it, so it was delicious
- Thai fried chicken -- not one of my favorites, but still as good
- Spring rolls -- soft-crisp shell
- 5-spice ribs -- probably the best out of the platter
- Crispy wings -- crispy and delicious!

The menu says it serves 3-4 but this beastly dude and his dudette destroyed it (ok, mostly me)

This place is a must visit while in Chicago! When the uber dropped us, it was a tad sketch when we were told the lounge was in an alley lol, but we walked down and found it. The guy at the door checked our reservations and let us in. When walking in, you travel downstairs to get to the lounge. When going downstairs , it feels like you are entering in a different realm/going on an tiki adventure. This really added to the setting. Once inside the lounge looked super cool.  You can tell they put a lot of time into it.

Our waitress was friendly and helpful. I started with the dead reckoning, which was awesome. It was really well done and came in a cool cup. All of their drinks come in various tiki themed glasses and cups which is great. I also had to try the actual three dots and a dash drink, which I was pleased with as well. They are a tad pricey so be prepared to shell out a decent amount of money. They also take reservations which is great. I'll surely be going back next time I visit Chicago!
Fun night with friends and delicious food.  Overall great atmosphere, food and wonderful service staff.  A really fun place, we will be back.

I can never get over this place. Took my friend who was visiting from California here on a Sunday night and she loved it as well. It was super packed considering how it was like 11 pm on a Sunday. This time I had the missionary's downfall and my friend had the aloha Felicia. Both were really good. They don't skimp on the alcohol. We also tried the food this time but the food wasn't anything special. Definitely returning to this place but most likely just going to stick to the drinks.

pics.caption: Aloha Felicia to the left & missionary's downfall on the right

review.des:
Very cute tiki bar. Came here for a bachelorette.

LOCATION: You'll see the random bar but it's not the right place, go to the corner and go down the alley way follow the blue lights to a random guy standing outside a door.  Go inside, down the stairs and meet the host.

WAIT: No wait on a Sunday night at 9:45pm, we actually made reservations 20 minutes beforehand but it probably wasn't needed.  

ATMOSPHERE: Definitely reminiscent of Tiki Sam's Enchanted Bar in the disney hotel or just the tiki room in general.  However, this one is a little more classy because they play normal hawaiian/tropical music and dont have random thunder storms etc.  It's pretty dark inside with colorful lanterns and lighting and beads.

FOOD: We ordered the zombie head which feeds 4-5 but for 6 of us it was plenty.  It comes on fire which is really cool.  Taste wise it was very strong and we had to keep mixing it and waiting for the ice to melt before it tasted bearable.  It came with long straws for all of us to share.  It cost about $60 but if you equate that to a drink a person that's about $10/person.

If you've had the fish bowl drinks before, they are very similar.  The zombie head was cool and overall it was a great experience.  Very girly, cute, and a good place to take pics or wow a friend.
I've been here a few times for cocktails. I'm a big fan. The bartenders are friendly and the drinks are unique, tasty, and sufficiently strong. There will be a line at prime time.

I've been to Three Dots and a Dash probably 3-4 times over the last 3 years and they have gotten progressively worse over time. What began as an excellent cocktail experience has now turned into an overpriced touristy ripoff. The bar nowadays ensures that each thin tall glass is full to the rim with ice to limit the amount of actual cocktail served to the customer, and the drinks seem further shorted in terms of spirit to mixer ratio. It's a fun concept and worth trying at least once. But don't expect the quality retro cocktails that made this joint popular. Three Dots and a Dash has become the movie soda version of a cocktail bar. Fill it with ice and overcharge -  cha-ching!
Love the cocktails and apps.. long wait to get in but maybe worth it.. small dark spot.. good for groups

I am a big fan of fancy smancy lounges and creative cocktails. Three dots and a dash got the Tiki theme to the details. From the drinks with pineapple leaves and fresh orchids to the unique cup that goes with each drink. Although this place is great for groups (with table reservations), but it is just too crowded for my idea of a lounge. I went on a Saturday with no reservations, and I felt like it was one of those speakeasy places that got too popular, and is no longer a speakeasy. I ordered the Jet Pilot and it was nice and strong. My friend really liked her Banana Daiquiri. I recommend going once just to check out the ambiance and have a drink, but don't plan on staying long and relax. Luckily, I had great company to make up for the long wait.

Make sure you go into the alley behind the Main Street. We had a really hard time finding this place but when we did, it was a real surprise. The decor is insane and he drinks are even more crazy. We had a shared large drink (the Port Lite). It was really cool looking - they use dry ice for most of their bigger drinks and the effect is awesome. We also had the classic rum drink (strong but not too strong) and the beef skewers (a bit salty but still good). This is a novelty place, but I'd still recommend checking it out at least once for the atmosphere and showmanship of the drinks!

A haiku:

Walk down this alley
Pay fourteen dollars to drink
Rum from a parrot

Officially a 'regular' at this place now! I usually end up coming with people who are visiting who have heard of this place, it's a fun thing to do in Chicago night life. I love the hidden entrance and how you have to know where to go to get in. The hype for this place was so big that the first time I went here I was disappointed. It is still cool, just don't have your expectations too high. The drinks are fun, I usually request "the drink with the banana in it" . They have a fun atmosphere and the drinks have a good presentation. The dance floor isn't that impressive so if you're looking for a place to dance, try elsewhere. I enjoy coming here and it's fun for out-of-Towners to see. But if I'm going out with local friends we don't end up here, too many other places to explore. Worth checking out once for sure, there are other tiki bars in the city I'd like to check out also!

Stopped by here on my trip to Chicago, and it did not disappoint! The bar itself is in the middle of an alley, so be sure to ask if you get lost. The inside is dark, and decor is spot on to the tiki theme. I only stopped by for 1 drink as it was starting to get crowded around 9pm on a Saturday. If you can, grab a seat at the bar. The bartenders making the drinks is interesting in itself to watch. I can't remember the name of what I got, but it came in a skull cup, with a stick of cinnamon. I'm more of a whiskey girl, but damn their drinks were bomb! A bit pricey ($15+) but definitely worth checking out.

Great place to impress out of towners with this side alley hidden gem. Love the drinks and the cool unique tiki glass you get the cocktails in. Don't love the small space around the bar everyone crowds into. Tip, come on a weeknight and snag a table or book a table and get some food as well as drinks so you can enjoy your yummy cocktails with space!

After many years of wanting to try, I finally went to 3 dots last night with friends.  We tried many, many drinks.  One favorite of the group (if you like Mezcal) is the Pablano Escobar.  I, personally liked the Mai Tai and Aloha Felicia and Surf Report.  I usually don't like Gin, but the Surf Report was very cucumbery and refreshing.  What I liked in general was that the drinks were pretty strong (especially the Seasonable Doubt) and after two drinks each, we were all feeling good.

As for food - we ordered the pu pu platter, and two sets of the Luau Chips.  The Chips and Guacomole were delicious - especially the chips.  The platter had crab rangoon, chicken skewers, egg rolls, pork belly sandwiches, shrimp, etc.  It, too was tasty and good for the group.

Atmosphere-wise - it's very dark inside.  To the point where you can wear a polka dot shirt with plaid pants and nobody would realize how un-coordinated your clothes were!  My husband and I wore shorts and didn't feel under dressed or anything.

Our server - Asiye - was really great.  Extremely helpful for us first timers and recommended some drinks.  She was also the right amount of attentiveness to us.

I would definitely go back for drinks and appetizers - it's certainly not a dinner place.

We went here spur of the moment on St. Patrick's Day weekend when it was really crowded.    From the moment we walked in, we were greeted by Sargina, who is just amazing, and she helped us get a great table.   Our server Wendy was also great and she recommended this $85 drink for The three of us.  We thought it to be pricey at first, but quickly realized it was worth every single penny.   Her service was excellent and that drink was strong and great.  We also met Kurt, the manager, who stopped by all the tables and was so gracious and made sure everything was perfect.  The food was exotic and wonderful and it really was a great experience and we can't wait to go back!   We highly recommend this place!

My only complaint would be the line to get in and how long it took, but it was January when I went and I am a Floridian. Freezing ballsack cold, which I'm not used to. Once we finally got in though, I completely understood why there was a line. This place was awesome.
I went with my boyfriend and two friends who had been there one other time. I don't remember exactly what drinks we got, but I remember asking for a whiskey sour (I was newly 21) and the waitress immediately said "we don't have any egg to make a legit one." We were all slightly confused and looked it up. Who knew. lol. Atleast we know their staff really knows their drinks. We ordered another round of drinks and a few appetizers and hung out for a while. The price was pretty steep, but I believe well deserved. If I'm every back in Chicago, I'll most likely go again. Just not in the winter.

pics.caption: Great drinks and such a fun place to go to!

review.des: Great bar with a great vibe, the drinks are great trust me I would know I came from LA to experience Chicago.
Rum bar in a basement with a speakeasy Caribbean feel. Very cute spot. Interesting craft cocktails.
Awesome cocktails! Super cool atmosphere- service was great. Definitely a must if you're visiting

When we came in it was not as packed as we were warned it would be, but still took us about 10 minutes to get seated. Then another 20 to get a drink made. By the time we ordered we were really irritated, but the absinthe in the yummy tiki drink (Jet Pilot) I ordered faded that away and I really enjoyed my time here.

Poke was really good and I had it as an entree.

The entrance is super sketchy and my friend was like WHERE ARE YOU TAKING US?! but it was worth it. Two drinks had us both very tipsy I don't think I could have handled a third.

Fun place to take friends who are visiting! Very cool atmosphere and creative drinks. I have taken quite a few friends from out of state who have loved it and are impressed by the eclectic nature. Highly recommend the banana daiquiri!

Great drinks and service!

Uber cool place, awesome tiki drinks and ambiance! But what sets it apart is their service. I was charged 18$ more because of a mix-up with some other bill. Contacted them a month later and they looked into it instantly, found out my signed stub and refunded me!

The appetizers are delicious, as are the drinks, but don't expect to run you under $40/person by the end of the night. The bar seating is crowded, and you're well to arrive before 7 or 8pm if you want table seating.
Fun spot to grab a drink with friends! Can get crowded at times so plan accordingly.

This place is really fun. Expensive, but fun.  The drinks are pretty pricey, and the menu could be better. The drinks come in kitschy glasses and have cute cocktail names. Once, I did have some attitude from a bartender when I told him he accidentally rang up 4 other peoples drinks on my tab. Correction was made no big deal. Cute place to take out of town guests or an after dinner drink

Awesome little secret! This tiki themed bar is hidden away in an alley and at first glance it doesn't look like much. (We almost walked past it the first time) you can usually spot it by a few guests smoking outside the entrance and a well dressed bouncer or two.

Once you get inside, be prepared to be transported to a far off place. Down some stairs and you'll find yourself at reception, if you're lucky you can snag a table right away (we waited about 10 min on a Thursday night). Once you go through a little hallway you'll find yourself in a Polynesian paradise that really plays off the tropical atmosphere. My favorite part about this cocktail lounge is the tiki focus and attention to detail from the decor down to the menu. Everything is themed from top to bottom and even the table settings are played off well!

There craft approach to both classic and modern cocktails are impressive! Each drink comes in a signature and memorable glass. We had the Dead Reckoning, Painkiller 639 and the Bunny's Banana Daiquiri. Each had a distinct taste but we're delicious, 1 or 2 of these and you're definitely in a good place ;)

If your only visiting Chicago or taking a trip into the city, this is a must-see!

A swanky place with good vibes (at least on a Tuesday evening), beautiful decor and knowledgeable bartenders. It's a bit hard to find as it's in an alley and there is no real sign on the door; that's part of the draw -- you get the feeling that you're going somewhere super secret. Like an underground club of sorts.

I can imagine this place would be crazy on the weekend and I've heard horror stories from people who came here close to when the bar was initially opening and having to wait in unimaginable lines and be packed like a can of sardines. Luckily, Tuesday night was pretty uneventful and there were a few empty seats at the bar.

I was catching up with a friend from college. The bartender was super helpful in crafting up a mocktail/virgin cocktail for myself and had some helpful recommendations for her for drinks that were not too sweet. Drinks are $12-14 each, so they are a little pricey. At one point, I asked for soda water and was charged $4.50. Ouch! The place can definitely hurt your wallet, but the vibe is right and the people (on this particular Toos-day night) were very friendly. I'd gladly return here. Even from the perspective of a nondrinker, this is a great place to hang out.

One of my favorite drink spots in Chicago. Sometimes tough to get into, but if you show up on the right day or early enough you are in for a treat. Every drink has a personality and fun presentation (Instagram-worthy for sure). I also enjoy the snack selection. Good spot to catch up with friends or have a relaxed meeting.

We went to Three Dots and a Dash for a bachelorette party and were able to get a great table in the main section of the bar! We did have to wait about 10 minutes in a line outside when the bar was at capacity before we could get in.
Pros
The environment was amazing! This was one of the best parts, the outside is like a secret underground club with only blue lighting and tiki torches to show you where it is. The inside is downstairs with tiki decorations and fun music.
The drink menu has lots of fun looking choices and cool picture worthy glasses.
The service here was incredible! We had the best service ever. The waitress, I think her name was Jessica, was amazing and super helpful with picking drinks and making sure we were comfortable. Great service all around!
Cons
Drinks are pricey, about $15 per person or larger group drinks for $85 and way up. This is typical for the area and you do get a good amount of alcohol in the drinks
Personally I wasn't a fan of the drink that I had. About half of my table liked the drinks and half did not. Drinks have a very strong spicy rum flavor for the most part.

Still was a great experience overall and would recommend based on the service and atmosphere alone!

pics.caption: The Painkiller (about $15, not my personal favorite)

review.des:
Here are my ratings!

EXPECTATIONS: Decent size place! Awesome cocktails with unique glasses! A place where you should go! Kind of hard to find, the front entrance is in the alleyway!
SERVICE: 5
CLEANLINESS: 4
QUALITY OF FOOD: n/a
QUALITY OF DRINKS: 5
AMBIANCE: Casual, club-ish, dark
OVERALL: Overall, awesome service from Ian! Unfortunately, we had a dinner reservation and had to leave a little early! All the bartenders are awesome!
TIP: The cocktails are pretty cool!

...-

Is that what this place is called? Clearly, my version is a lot shorter and gets the point across easier. Or maybe I need to be a little tiki tipsy for this one.

Nonetheless, this little gem of a tiki bar hidden in downtown Chicago is a must for anyone that wants to pretend flowers are edible. On any given weekend, you are bound to wait in line outside. Hot girls beware- you're more likely than not going to be sent to the back of the line even if you think you are hot ish based on American standards ;) (and when it rains, the lounge usually provides umbrellas while you wait in line).

I've been here on two special occasions already: post-interview and birthday jam. Both were super fun inside this VERY atmospheric lounge. You've got what I call "island remixes" to Top 40 blasting with a small dance floor, and plenty of tables if you decide to do table-service/make a reservation with food. It WILL be crowded up until 1:30 - 2:00 in the morning when the crowd starts to die down.

Now as for the drinks- yep, they are magical, mysterious, and tasty. You've got a range of drinks in skulls, tiki heads, boats... they've got it all. Drinks are on the more expensive side ($13-$100+) but you'll be sure to look cool while holding one! If you're drunk enough (or just hungry), be sure to take a bite on the flowers.

My only real complaint would be the abundance of island remixes. Sometimes I just need to get down to the original. Instead we get a lot of songs that remind me I should be in Hawai'i. Boo. Have fun kids!

I like this place a lot. It has got the tropical vibe and Mexican elements. The drink is strong. I got the Mai Tai and my friend ordered three dots and dash which she assumes to taste like coconut. But both of drinks turn out to be strong. We also ordered the chicken and it tastes really good.

Passive-aggressive discrimination that made our group and other guests extremely uncomfortable. A group of my friends (about 6-8) met to celebrate my sister's birthday. As this was her first time going, I filled her and her friends in on the details (location, atmosphere, vibe, and price range). Upon arriving around 11:15pm Saturday, March 25, 2018, I met my sister and her friends. My sister was seated with a 3 guests, whom I believed to be mutual friends or colleagues. As I went to the bar (which tends to be a long way for the crafted drinks) one of her friends pulled me informing me that my sister was crying. The guests she sat with were not friends but just other visiting guests to the lounge. She had asked them if it was ok to sit with them, to which they welcomed her. Three Dots and a Dash security and management made several visits to the table asking the guests (not my sister and her friend) if they were ok. My sister was confused to what the issue was and soon everyone felt uncomfortable. No Three Dots and a Dash employee or management member came over to discuss any questions or concerns.
I say all the above as a factual statement to leave out any prejudice and bias- Now this is where it leans to that. My sister, myself and the guests are all African-American. This is not the first time I or other friends have heard or experienced this issue at Three Dots and a Dash or other establishments in River North. My sister was hurt to the highest level emotional. She was embarrassed that the staff made an obvious yet passive attempt to point her and her guests out for sitting with other patrons. She was hurt as this was the first time she experienced racial discrimination in a large and open environment. It made the guests who she sat with (who were not African-American) uncomfortable to the point where they decided to get their check.

If anyone has experienced this at Three Dots and a Dash, please share this response and add-on.

LOVE this place!

I've been a few times now and have had a great experience each time. Every drink I've tried has been delicious, and some of them pair really well together. If you're hungry I'd also highly recommend the burger - it's delicious (although very messy).

This is a Lettuce Entertain You spot, so the staff is very professional. They reaaaally commit to the tiki bar theme, so if that sort of thing turns you off you may not be interested. Personally I love anything with a theme :)

If you've ever been to Hawaii and miss the vibe, this place is for you. Solid drink menu and polite staff. A little short on seating options , and you might have to wait a while for a seat, but definitely worth it.

Great atmosphere & music, but there is very little alcohol in the over-priced tiki drinks. We paid $25 for a shared drink that maybe had 16 oz of drink!

The "food" is just very pricey bar snacks. They are definitely not a restaurant.

Once was enough. $200 including tip for five tiki drinks, one soda, & the app platter. We could have had a great steak dinner for that!

This place is so much fun. When visiting 3 dots you are getting a unique experience from start to finish. The entrance in the alley makes you feel "in the know" and is an opportunity to show you have the scoop on the coolest places in town.  Once inside, the atmosphere and drinks do not disappoint.
Definitely a great place to go have a drink. The drinks are amazing. The interior design creates like a little great escape experience. A great gem within the busy Chicago downtown.

In all fairness I cannot attest to the quality of the drinks or food. All I can say is we put our name on a wait list and were assured we would be texted when a table for us would be ready (the bar was completely full, no room to stand or sit otherwise we would have). We were told not to go far from the location since it wouldn't be too long a wait. We stayed around the area for TWO hours waiting, and it is 11:24 the following morning and I still never got a text. The drink menu looked great, I wish we could have tried the drinks but it was a big waste of time and still frustrating that even though we were told we'd receive a text and have a table in no time, we weren't even given the courtesy of a text or any update at all.
Liked the vibe and the tiki theme, but didn't care for the crazy strong drinks and minimal food choices. If you like rum, this is your place!
Not really my kind of place, but my wife loved it.
Great in the winter, go to an outdoor space in the summer. Can be crowded but the first drink is worth it. Be careful with the second drink -- only close friends and a no judgment zone are required.

Its just ok. Drinks are good for about one, after that its all heartburn. We had some grub, the burger with ham and pineapple, and some really gross, cold, slimy noodles. Its way overpriced like most things in chicago but a cool bar to see if you've never been. Nothing to really bring ya back after one trip but worth checking out. Also, for $100 tab we had, i should be able to wear a hat if i want. Ive never understood dress codes at bars. Its practically a sports bar with all the bros and abercrombie colonge that was in there, what difference does a hat make? Kinda silly and pointless, just their way of being hipster i suppose. I work at a bar, and its never once mattered if a customer has a hat on or not.

Came here with a private party. Had some appetizers and drinks, both were very good as was the server. The ambiance is fun but not the type of place I would want to frequent. Main drawback was the cost/ value. Bring your credit card!!

I wouldn't suggest people coming here unless they like to waste two hours waiting and having people breathe down their neck.

The wait was extremely long for the bar, let alone for a table to dine in. It was almost impossible to get the bartenders attention.

Yes, their drinks are absolutely beautiful. Unfortunately, it does not taste as good as it looks. I had the Saturn. It was decent but had way too much sour juice to call it a cocktail. Did not taste the alcohol.

My friends ordered the three dots and a dash, the boogie board, and painkiller no. 639. 2/3 didn't enjoy the drinks. The three dots and a dash was okay.

Wouldn't come here again unless I had a reservation. But again, even if you had a reservation, people waiting around are probably gonna hover over you as you eat. It is just too packed to enjoy yourself.

They take reservations now! I felt like a baller cruising past the 50 person line because I had a Saturday night reservation for 4. The entrance is through the alley on Hubbard in between Clark and Dearborn, which is confusing as a first timer. Our party was seated right away and everything we ordered was great. I'm partial to the banana stand daiquiri which comes with a chocolate covered banana. Delicious!!! We also tried the painkiller, jet pilot, and Three Dots and a Dash. They were yummy and all very strong. Loved the decor and ambience with the Tiki vibe. On Saturday night's, they have a DJ, and the music gets pumping, so if you're looking for a quieter evening, I'd recommend coming during a weekday happy hour. Drinks might seem pricey, but they are loaded with liquor, so well worth the cost!

pics.caption: Every drink is cuter than the next. "Three Dots and a Dash". So yummy!
This mug was my favorite! "The Painkiller"
The wall of skulls near the stairway entrance.

review.des:
I've been drinking like there's a message in a bottle.

PRETTIEST. DRINKS. EVER.
Bartending is a real art in this place. A drink takes 10 minutes to make, but it's so entertaining to watch. I probably paid for the show of bartender making the drink instead of the drink itself.
If you ever want to impress your date, bring her here!

Cons though, LONG wait. crowded area, lots of people around the bar. Pricey, i think it was around $14-$20 for drinks?
Still really beautifully decorated drinks! Not sure if i would come back to eat, it's more of tapa plates.

Fun tiki themed underground bar with some bar food appetizers. Drinks are so CUTE. They all come in different themed cups with lots of island decoration to them. If you order from the high octane section they are VERY STRONG. Definitely pricey drinks but worth it for the experience.
This place was good and kind of crowded. We had to come back later because the line was so long to get in. The drinks are really good and a lot of fun!

pics.caption: Every drink is going to be way over the top and it's a lot of fun! You get the bang for your buck.

review.des: Awesome theme bar with a nice atmosphere. They did a real nice job decorating the establishment. We all had a great time.

Love this place!!!! It was our second time here! The drinks are beautiful and strong! Also delicious! The bartenders have been very nice both times. The entire vibe of the bar is phenomenal.
