You can't beat it. They take pride in their bar and drinks! Most certainly will forever be on my list to stop in while I'm in Chicago!

I absolutely love this place! The drinks are mixed well, not too strong or overpowering but definitely not weak. The food is delicious and you can order a variety of items to share. I enjoyed the coconut shrimp, thai chicken bites, their version of chips and guac, and the spring rolls. Everything was delicious. I've been twice and I plan on going back soon for my birthday. The place is nice for a Girls Night Out or a cozy date spot. Service was great each time. They are very attentive and make sure that you are taken care of while you're there. You will not be disappointed.

Fun, hidden basement spot for the adventurous crowd. I don't drink so I can't say too much about that, but the food was decent.

The Tiki environment is worth a visit and definitely something different from a lot of places in the area.
One of the best Tiki Bars around.  This place has amazing drinks to suit everyone plus the staff are so friendly.  One of Chicago's "must visit" bucket list, don't miss out!

Love the vibe and the feel that you have transported yourself to another place.  Unfortunately, not a fan of the long waits to get in.  I tried to make a reservation but they book up very quickly and tried my luck at just showing up and putting myself on the wait list for a table.  The great part is that you can wait pretty much anywhere by the bar with a drink. The bad part is if your party is planning to be fashionably late they will be stuck in line outside.  The only way to skip the line is if you have a formal reservation.  But once every one is inside its a fun time.  From communal drinks to single sips this place has it all.  Now most would say they think tiki lounge drinks are fruity and sweet but I beg to differ a bit on this.  There are definitely sweeter than most but if you select the right beverage you are left with a tropical punch of flavor and alcohol.  

I tried the painkiller 347D, three dots and a dash and poipu beach boogie board.  My favorite was the poipu beach boogie board.

Overall, a great time to be had.  If you are looking for a less pretentious but fun tiki bar go up north to Lost Lake...  The vibe is more hipster and laidback and the drinks are just as great.
Cool atmosphere but pricey drinks. Atleast they were strong. Went at a time when it somehow wasn't crowded but still couldn't get a seat or table. Love the vibe trough

Very cool tiki bar! The drinks, while expensive, come in unique cups. The whole feel is like a dark surf bar. The painkiller was strong but delicious. Crowded but a great place for the experience of it all.

Loved this bar!! I was there for a birthday party and what a blast we had! Starting with their entrance on the alley was cool and then walking down I felt like I was going to some old prohibition era bar! Once you make it downstairs the bar is really cool! Super cool vibe and the drinks are very tasty! It's a tiki bar so expect a lot of tropical/fruity drinks however everything has fresh ingredients (from bananas to all sorts of herbs). I sat by the bar and you smell all the good herbs and fruits that they are blending. You see smoke coming out of drinks left and right which just adds to the whole atmosphere of the place.

The bar has some chill music playing in the background (not too noisy) but just cool music to hang out. We ended up getting multiple of the "large" drinks to share with our table but some of my friends just ordered plain beer (yeah, lame I know!). My advice would be to make a reservation if you really want a table to sit with your guests otherwise the wait times on the weekends are pretty long (1hr+). By the time I left the bar (around midnight) there was a line to come in however I am not sure how long people had to wait to get in. I can't wait to go back and try more of their delicious drinks and just hang out! Next time though I will go during the week so it's not as crazy and packed.
Very great drinks and appetizers i deff recommend going here for a drink with friends its a little hard to find through the alley but has the coolest entrance and vibe
One of the more fun places to go for a drink with a group of friends. Reservations are not a bad idea. I would stop at two, they are strong. And the Kahuna Burger is delicious!

This place is awesome!   The drinks were spectacular and the food was delicious.  The service was top notch!   Our server was extremely attentive and accommodating to food allergies.  If you have a chance - grab a drink and food here!
Tiki bars are the best! If you are from out of town you HAVE to check this place out. Pricey, but worth the experience!

pics.caption: I forgot what the wave drink was called. Phenomenal!

review.des: Went here for a Bachelorette party. It was really great! We had a little reserved section where we got cocktails and had some appetizers passed around. It was really an awesome experience and the ambiance is really fun! Perfect place for a girls night!

Fabulous drinks, didn't have a chance to try the food this time but hope to return soon! The decor and atmosphere was awesome, service was great, but the music was a little loud. Definitely will come back.

Looking to escape on a minimum Caribbean vacation in the Midwest? Head to Three Dots and a Dash. They have an awesome tiki atmosphere, and a really great drink menu with very unique cocktails you won't find anywhere else. Drinks are a tad pricey, $14-16 dollars, and also have shareable cocktails that range from $14-20 per person. Perfect for a date or a fun night for drinks with friends.

Cocktails were amazing. Loved the ambience of the place as well.
Food options are limited especially vegetarian. The fries were delicious!
Great cocktails, ambiance and decor were excellent, patrons were all respectable. Try this out if you are in Chicago
Bartenders were very nice and the drinks were definitely strong! Fun music and atmosphere.
Fun and the drinks are top notch. I'll have to reserve a table sometime, the crowds can be a little overwhelming at times.

Really cool ambiance but drinks are SUPER sweet. Some people like that, but I prefer a little kick to mine! I would definitely go again, probably just switch up my drink order.

(My friends and I ordered the special treasure, skull drink ones - im not sure how the individual drinks taste! )

I went here for my cousin's birthday.  When she first told me we had to wait in line at night in an alley for 10 minutes, I almost walked away.  I was thinking, "I'm too old to stand in line in an alley to spend my hard earned money with a bunch of basics."   But for my cousin I made the effort.  I'm so glad I did!

We got there just in time to get a table.  Something that was a big deal I guess.  When you go down the stairs there's lots of blue lighting.  It's like the swankiest lounge ever.  So full of beautiful people of fun Hawaiian decoration.  We got seated and I noticed that the music was coming from a DJ.  And he was doing good!  The crowd wasn't really dancing but they were standing around on the dance floor, either too cool to dance or too nervous.  I got the feeling lots of people were on first or second dates (not a bad choice either).

The service was great.  We all got apps.  I was starving so I was a little miffed that they only offered apps, and had already told myself I'd stop by the Wendy's by my house on the way home.  But when the food came I noticed the food was more than enough to fill me up.  We passed some stuff around as well.  The egg rolls were my fave!

The drinks are pricey but on par with the area.  They are also POTENT!  Def tiki style drinks with downtown Chicago swag.  Delicious, strong, and sophisticated.  I loved this place, and will def be back.  But maybe not in the winter.  I'm still not keen on waiting in line in the cold.  I mean I get it, but I still don't like it.  :)

Amazing, creative drinks!
I love that they tell you which drinks are stronger on the menu. It sucks when you order a drink at a bar and it ends up being super dilute and not what you were expecting.

A lot of seated tables and couches, but plenty of standing space for when it gets crowded and noisy on the weekends
Dark ambiance, lots of fun kitschy tiki drinks. Went for drinks with coworkers which is about right. The poo poo platter was great!

Omg Aloha from Chicago i loved this place, I was visiting from Houston Texas and decided as always to try something new, so my friend that lives in Chicago and I decided to try this amazing place. My experience since the start was different because the entrance it's by the alley once we got in the vibe was my thing, the music, the people, the drinks, i was able to get us 2 sits at the bar so it was easy for us to get drinks, but one thing i was not able to understand the bartenders were kinda  their attitudes toward us  were overboard, they even kinda splash us with water while cleaning the bar that was still open anyways this didn't ruin the night but come on, This is a must have try place if you are visiting or live in Chicago.

I've been here a couple of times for work functions, and it's okay. The tiki theme isn't necessarily my favorite, but it's definitely fun and the drinks are tasty. I don't enjoy how dark and crowded it gets, though. I think there are better options in the area, but it's worth checking out for a drink or two.
I didn't like the drinks, they were very overpriced. The mood is nice but it's not a place I thought was worth the wait or price.
This place will make you feel like you are in the tropics even on the coldest of Chicago nights!

Well my original update was removed...however, I definitely feel the need to still leave something regarding our horrible service recently at this place.  Maybe I little less colorful...

Ok, I love the next stupid tiki bar, the next best stupid thing in Chicago to make the weather not seem terrible....THIS PLACE IS TERRIBLE. Went down the tubes.

I call to see if Justin is there...shockingly, no single person knows Justin.

Get in...order the Treasure Chest for legit the 4th time.
1. Service is bogus...girl is absolutely no where to be found.
2. Adam...the who ever he was, was a complete jerk.  Kicking us out when had just ordered all of this stuff...what the heck?!?  Also, it was the way he did it.  Like power trip!
3. bathrooms are tretcherous. No toliet paper to be found in 3 different stalls at the end of the night by 'Markus' the new GM...I think that was his name. No clue or disclaimer about the disgusting bathrooms. OMG...DISGUSTING!!! Give me the stupid attendant....I would rather have at least something.

This place is absolutely ridiculous in price. I love taking people here for a fun night out and some stupid dry ice...LET ME TELL YOU...THIS PLACE IS DUMB...dont waste your money, your time or anything else here.

I know Paul left and I think a lot of the old staff did too.  It most definitely lost its luster...I won't be going back here.  I would recommend you skipping it too.  

Another one bites the dust...

Getting here: it's off a busy alley in River North and has almost a hidden entrance. I had no idea where I was going but my friend had been here before so we all followed her. Kind of hard to get to if you've never been before, but the secret entrance added to the character and mystery of this place.

Walking in: Super busy but not as apocalyptic as I had previously heard. All the tables were taken and the bar was crowded but, we stood by the bar and after 10 minutes we were able to get seats. Definitely make a reservation if you want to sit and go on a date, as getting a seat at the bar is hit or miss. Still worth it though!

The drinks: so they are expensive but, one will floor you. So you have to come in with the mindset that you are paying $15 for some drinks, but it's really 2 or 3 drinks in one with the amount of booze they put in. Holy crap my drink was strong! I ordered the signature "three dots and a dash" drink, girlfriend ordered the Painkiller No347D. Other friend ordered the bikinis after dark. I'm pretty sure after trying all 3 that you can order anything off the menu, and it will be amazing. Each drink was meticulously crafted with care, and came with top notch rum. Definitely miles above any of those sugary frozen pre-made drinks you get at some resort hotels.

If you haven't been here before, definitely add this to your Chicago bucket list to try out! It's worth the wait, and the prices.

pics.caption: from left to right: three dots and a dash, bikinis after dark, and painkiller No. 109
from left to right: dead reckoning, bunny's banana daquiri

review.des: The atmosphere is awesome in here! Only giving it 4 stars because I wasn't a super fan of their speciality drinks. Also be aware it's in an alley. Look for the blue tikis & you're there

Cool place. Hard to compete with all of the other rooftop bars in the area, but for a basement bar they do a good job of spicing it up. I wish there was a more communal feel to the place - everyone stands around (or sits at a table if you have a group) but there's not really an area for everyone to mingle.

The drinks are super cool! Worth it to stand around the bar and watch the bartenders work as well. The food was good and priced alike other places in the area.

pics.caption: Drinks are definitely big enough to share

review.des: I was caught off guard by the alley entrance, however it leads to the cutest little underground luah! Expect a wait on the weekends. The drinks are really tasty and depending on the bartender they can be on the strong side ( of course that's not a complaint!) I didn't have any food so this review is solely for ambience and cocktails. I'll be spending time here his summer!

Mystery meets reality. Our first Tiki bar was pretty cool, but this place sucks for those without a reservation. The bar area is pretty but standing room mostly. Because you can order food there, its a long shot you'll get a seat (I started looking for reservations a week out at 5 pm slots and nothing). Aside from all that, the drinks are fun, boozey and silly. You MUST watch the bartenders. They take their job seriously: making their syrups, shaking, twisting, slapping and creating. It was fun, but you can't take this place long. No coat rack, not enough chairs, not even a place to put your drink while your holding your coat, hot (even in winter), and hard to get the bartenders attention (perfection takes time).

This is a great place to go once, to enjoy the over-priced but unique looking drinks and crowds. There is a small dance floor; however, it's mostly a place to drink and hang out for a little while. If you're looking for a place to sit or coming with a group, it's best to get a reservation so you're guaranteed a space.

I was really excited to get to experience one of the "newest, top rated" bars in Chicago tonight. Upon arriving tonight my friend and I waited in line for 20 minutes to show our ID and then we were ushered in side where we get downstairs to wait yet again. From there, we were hurtled into a tiny room that was packed full with tables and standing room only. We had to maneuver our way over to the bar and wait another 15 minutes before we finally got to order our $14 drinks. The drinks were decent, I wouldn't say worth the price. The bar itself was awkward-you stand around bumping shoulders with everyone (mind you: surrounded by people trying to eat dinner). I would say three dots and a dash is definitely overrated; a nice place to see once but I personally won't be returning.

This place is definitely worth a visit! *** If you're planning a night out, the entrance to the bar is in the alley of their address. Go around the building towards W Hubbard, and then into the alley. You'll see a bouncer standing outside waiting to check IDs and you'll head downstairs into the bar. ***

The drinks are so much fun and in keeping with the theme of the tiki bar. The bar fills up quite quickly, but I'm told they do take reservations! We got there around 930pm, and were able to find seats at the bar no problem. The drinks are VERY strong, and because of how much juice/fruit is in them, it's easy to get carried away and not realize how much you're drinking (although might not be a problem for some ppl).

The bartender made us a special drink off the menu, and unfortunately it was just so damn big, we weren't able to finish it. If you're planning to order the group drinks, make sure you have enough ppl on hand, and start them early on.

It's a great little spot to let loose, the drinks are beautiful (and strong), and they've got food if you want it!

pics.caption: Cute drink mugs - available for purchase if you really want them

review.des: I found this place on yelp and decided to give it a go. First, the whole entrance from the door till you reach the bar is really Inviting and interesting. The bartenders who work know their liquor extremely well. The drinks are STRONG and really GOOD! two of these drinks and you should be in for a great night. It's a great date spot as well.

Cool ass spot.  Great after a long Uber day, but also great for bringing a date.
Drink are real, as in real fruit.  Great chill, Jamaican style/island/tropical type of music.
Low-key entrance via alley, but they have bouncer which makes it more safe I guess.

pics.caption: I don't even remember what the name of this shit is, but It tastes healthy and gives you a great buzz!!!

review.des: This tiki bar is honestly great, it's so hip and the music is always good. I've never had their food but their exotic drinks are delicious. Also their tiki culture decor is amazing.

Such a great vibe at this place. Our first time visit to Chicago and this bar was suggested by a few friends. Had a great time. Very interesting drinks. The waitress was super nice and the vibe was awesome! Really felt like we were in the tropics :)

I'm never eaten here and truthfully this is not somewhere I would think of eating at (Sorry if they have awesome food and I'm not giving them a fair chance).

Three Dots and a Dash is all about the cocktails. It's a tiki lounge theme'd bar with an extensive menu of very decorated and well crafted drinks.

Since the drinks are a bit more expensive (but worth it) this is most likely a place you will want to start off your night prior to going to a "normal" bar with "normal" priced drinks after.

Some of my favorites include:
- Bunny's Banana Daiquiri
- Painkiller No. 109
- Poipu Beach Boogie Board

Your best bet is to go with a group and have everyone order something different so you can try them all!
Can get a bit tricky to get to. Delicious and refreshing drinks for a good price. The staff is really friendly. It can get a bit dark in some areas of the place, careful where you step.

Great place for a good cocktail! I have tried most of their cocktail on their menus, all are good in a different way!
I gave 4 star because as a bar specialized for cocktail, they should invent new cocktails at least twice a year? or add some seasonal drinks into the menus? The menus stay the same for almost a year, it's good for people visiting Chicago not often, but for local like me would love to have/try some thing new!

You will not be in Chicago anymore, rather, transported to an underground tiki land where you sift through pages of unique drinks. Love the ambience- from the skull wall, to beaded drapes, and blue and black lighting. The drinks are inventive, fun, and generous. You need to come here, You can thank me later.

Omg! I love this place. It gets packed and you need reservations ahead of time, but whoah! I love the drinks and the ambience. I tried a couple of their unique drinks and let me tell you that you won't be disappointed if you are actually able to get in! Best hidden gem in downtown hands down!

Yes yes and more yes !

Came here when they first opened up for my birthday for drinks with friends and another time for date night with the manski .

I Love that its in a hidden location that's somewhat hard to find, cool skulls at the entrance,fun ,lively atmosphere and most importantly the delicious drinks served in the most adorable glassware . Sure the musics kind of loud but atleast its good music and that adds to the lively atmosphere .

Great place to celebrate a birthday ,date night or even to stop in before a big night out to pregame at a fun spot.

I was told to come here because of the drinks. I would tell people NOT to come here because of the drinks! I came here with two friends and we all ordered three different drinks. They all were terrible!

I swear to you, one of them tasted like what I would think nail polish remover tastes like if you tried it. The other drink was bland and not anything to write home about. And honestly, the third one did not taste like there was any alcohol in it.

It was overcrowded and the bartenders seemed annoyed. I would not come back and I would definitely not waste your time here. I'm giving it two stars because the drink glasses were pretty cool. There are so many better cocktail spots in the city. Don't believe the hype!
Great decor, tried a couple of their drinks and only enjoyed the drink w the banana ingredient. It came w a banana  designed as a dolphin...very creative!!!

Best bar! Alex was so friendly and introduced us to not only amazing drinks but also educated us on spices rums and different liquors from around the world! The drinks are great and unique! They listen to what you like and create a drink specialized just for you. Alex explained everything in every drink! Basically he was the best bartender in Chicago!! :) we'll be back ... And bring friends with us!

pics.caption: Check out the people sunbathing on the pineapple island!

review.des:
Great drinks, appetizers, and vibe.

Went to meet and catch up with a friend and the night was so much fun. We didn't have an RSVP so I put my name on the waiting list. I was told an hour and a half but was called about 15 minutes later. Total win!

When you're inside the vibe is so cool. The servers, bartenders, and security all wearing Hawaiian attire. Which lends to the cools vintage atmosphere.

We had a couple of drinks each and two appetizers- all were fantastic.

We tried Painkiller No. 3, Poipu Beach, and Dead Reckoning. The drinks are delicious. The Poipu Beach was tart (which I love), the Painkiller was a bit sweeter (so good), and the Dead Reckoning had a great tart beginning taste with a vanilla after taste. Yum!

We also tried the Luau Chips (chicharrones with guacamole) and the Coconut Shrimp. Loved the guacamole with pineapple (very fresh). The shrimp come with 4 sauces. Like everything else here, they were delicious: a peanut soy sauce, a tart horse radish sauce, a mandarine (sweet and sour sauce), and a tangy chili sauce.

The service needs a special shout-out because it was friendly. I tend to expect a not so friendly vibe and service at all those Clark street bars/ restaurants but Three Dots was very accommodating and friendly. From the security at the entrance, to the hostess, to the servers. Thanks! You really made our night enjoyable with your great attitude.

Enjoyed ourselves and we'll be going back.

pics.caption: Dead reckoning and Poipu Beach. Thank You Hawaii for such delicious food and drinks
Luau Chips and Coconut shrimp. So delish :)

review.des: I LOVE this place. These are true variations of knock you on your "keister" tiki cocktails. The food is awesome. The drinks are well flavored, with the perfect balance of fruit & present spirits. Take heed to anything with a double skull emblem next to it. They mean it. Great spot.
Got there at 4p as soon as they opened. It was awesome. Service, Drinks and a great atmosphere.
Loved it here! Came to celebrate my 21st and loved it. Wonderful atmosphere, great drinks, great employees. I will definitely come back! Drinks are a little strong but I don't mind ;)

Prior to visiting Three Dots, I was really excited to experience the hype. Sadly, I was super disappointed! We went for a friend's birthday and they refused to seat us all together early on a Tuesday night when the space was pretty empty. Instead of seating us all together in two booths, they made us move across the bar and seated two people in a booth next to our original party while four of us sat on the other side of the room. The staff was cold and extremely unaccommodating. Service was slow but at least I got my booze eventually!!!

I am a fan of a good tiki bar-who doesn't like a tropical escape during the Chicago winter?! And maybe it's because I was already sour, but the environment was extremely overrated.

Check it out with a date if you're dying to. It's definitely not a spot for a group of friends.

Three dots and a SLASH! Am I right????

This is a really awesome tiki bar!  The decor is done very, very well, not at all cheesy.

The drinks are great!  They even look complicated to make with several ingredients, fantastic garnishes and served in really, really awesome cups!!  I was fascinated watching the bartender make them for a while. His level of focus and his perfectionism as he measured, stirred, and garnished each drink perfectly!  Lol  These drinks, I tell you,  look complicated to make, they are not just thrown together AND are definitely potent and delicious.  It definitely slows your consumption so sip and enjoy them.  I can appreciate that, because this style of fruity drink can be usually consumed in 5 minutes because they usually only taste like juice. (At least by me ;) ). Well worth the $13 price tag.

We did not get any appetizers, but what I saw coming out of the kitchen look great. I would love to go back and try a few.

pics.caption: Poipu beach boogie board!  Hard to take good photos in the dark.
Dead reckoning!  It's hard to take good photos in the dark.

review.des:
After wandering around an alley, we finally found this hidden place. It's very dark inside, but the decor is very cute.

We ordered 3 drinks, which tasted very fruity but were definitely strong! They serve the drinks in the cutest containers... very insta-worthy.

For the food, I highly recommend the spicy thai chicken, as it went perfectly with the cocktails. Honestly the whole menu looks very good. I'd love to try the treasure chest one day with a party!! The table next to ours got it and it looked like a lot of fun.

Lines can get long, so try to make a reservation well in advance.

I've died and gone to retro tiki bar heaven! This place makes velvet and cheesy umbrellas and tacky Hawaiian shirts look cool! The drinks are not cheap (starting at $14 and up for a cocktail) but they are made super well and with impressive presentation! They have private rooms you can book for parties and souvenir glasses to take home for a small fee. They also have shareable cocktails for 4-8 people, which is pretty fun. There is lots of open seating so this place would be great for a group. Take your friends, take your uncle, take anyone who appreciates kitsch and whimsy and BOOZE!

pics.caption: A glimpse of the main dining space

review.des: Can never go wrong with Three Dots and a Dash! I always bring out of towners here and they absolutely love the ambiance and drinks! Huge selection, and such neat creations. Finding it the first time was a bit of a struggle because it's in the alley but it's so worth it.

Made reservations for a Saturday night and were seated right away. Between 4 people we ordered the crab rangoon, spring rolls, thai fried chicken, pork belly buns, coconut shrimp and grilled ribs. All were very good; the Thai fried chicken had some kick, but not too spicy. All food items are more appetizers/small plates rather than meals.

Between us we had "the peices of eight, zombie punch, pain killer 109, pain killer 347D, white glove, dry float, banana daquri, jet pilot, and a couple of thier drinks that are on rotaion". "Painkiller 109" and the "peices of eight" were my favorite due to them being fruity and perfectly mixed. The liquor did not over power the light fresh fruit flavors.

We all took sips of each others drinks and the only one I was not a fan of was the "jet pilot" due to its after taste from the bitters, not bad, just not my thing.

The prices are not low, but it was a special occasion so, we splurged. The food and drinks were perfectly made so it did not feel right taking away a star for price,  it was worth it. We were there for a long time and the waitress was pleasant and attentive the whole time. Low lighting adds to the late night tiki bar vibe.

pics.caption: Pieces of eight was a slush type drink. Lemon,  rum, and passion fruit

review.des: This place is fantastic. I went here with a few friends to spend the night in downtown Chicago and this place did not disappoint. The tiki theme is carried throughout and the drinks are delicious as well as creative. This is a must visit place for locals and visitors alike!

Most fun tiki bar in downtown. awesome cocktails. We went there around 8 pm on a Saturday night but there was a huge wait. Thank god we reserved a table before hand. The bar was crowded but we didn't have to worry about it since we were assigned a waitress. The ambience and the vibe is amazing. got some cool instagram stuff to post too. definitely going again.
Great Party and place to hang .  Feeling the tiki bar vibe, late hours,  and souvenir glasses. Only wish they were slightly cheaper or at least came with the drink!

The real attraction is the Tiki bar theme - it's very well done, and a lot of fun. I like the "hidden" entrance, the it fits the theme well. It fills up quickly even though it's a decent size, so be sure to get there early.

They have some really interesting rums available, and the bowls and drinks seem very interesting. The one we tried was really sweet, but fairly good overall.

Definitely a good place if you're looking for something different/unique.

So let me get this right.    I can't wear my Blackhawks ball cap but they can wear Hawaiian shirts during service?

I walk in and go to the hostess and the first thing out of her mouth was, "no seats you can go hang at the bar".    Not a hello how are you, we are really busy would you like to go to the bar.    Nope.  

On the way to the bar I counted 5 open table with reserved signs on them. What the heck?  After waiting over 15 mins for a bartender we left and went to another bar that wanted our money.  

First time there and will be my last.  Good luck.

What's the point of a "Mixology bar" if you can't see the drinks being made. There's large crowds standing and waiting for drinks right in front of the one bar, the large decor on the bar blocks the view of what the Mixologist is doing. They have a bunch of empty tables with reserved signs. We were 4 people, me and three ladies. It would've been nice to sit at a table and enjoy the beverages, instead we were stuck standing, holding super cold awkwardly shaped cups, on super sticky floors. About getting in....There was a line for people to get in. Which was moving pretty quickly. But it wasn't too joyful once inside. Overcrowded, super loud, no dress code which made it seem a little lower class. If I'm paying $16+ for beverages I want the place to feel a little more classy, hip, and swanky.
Expensive! But, worth it. Three dots and a dash is a must at least once a years. Their large format cocktails are some of the most creative in the city. Great for a special date or girls night out.

Aloha! If you want to feel like you've stepped into a tropical paradise in the middle of a snowstormed Chicago, Three Dots and a Dash has what you're looking for. From the second I stepped in, I felt as if I was transported to the relaxing islands of Hawaii on a warm evening night. The entire lounge was dimly lit with non-cheesy tropical music playing, island vegetation and the staff in fittingly themed garb.

We had an amazing time this past Saturday as we were practically able to walk right in without waiting in their tiki torch lined club-esque line to enter. I have to say that my date felt a bit underdressed though in his hat & jeans, so it may be worth classing it up a tiny bit to hang out here. They told us it would be about 30 minutes for a table so while we waited, we hung at the bar. It was fun being able to do that first as we watched the bartenders make the drinks. They sure put a lot of ingredients into each one and I think it warrants the slightly pricey $13 for each cocktail.

Once they texted us for our table, we were sat at a cozy booth with an adorable beachy centerpiece further adding to the atmosphere. Our server was so friendly and on top of her game, it's been quite a while since I've had such fabulous service on all levels.

I tried a few different cocktails with my favorite being Bunny's Banana Daiquiri which was kind of like an alcoholic banana slushie. I think it was my favorite because of the adorable garnishes - fruit animals for the win! Everyone raves about Painkiller No. 3 and I have to agree flavorwise, it was a real winner. After trying the signature Three Dots & a Dash drink and the Jet Pilot in addition to the two previously mentioned, I feel like you really can't go wrong no matter what you order. Each drink is well executed, tastes delicious and comes out looking like a mini masterpiece.

Be sure to make a reservation because the wait outside can get up to 2 hours on busy nights. I'm sure I'll come back to Three Dots and a Dash as I simply fell in love with the upscale tiki joint.

My favorite part of Three Dots and a Dash - the bad@$$ skull wall on your way downstairs to the joint. Creepy and cool.

A hui hou!!!

pics.caption: Bunny's Banana Daiquiri - most adorable banana ever!

review.des: I was surprised when my friend and I came here one weekend in the summer and the line moved quickly. I love that this place is underground (entrance in a dark back alley), but heck, you had me at tiki bar! How random. We only had time for a couple of drinks. They were really strong, pricey, and took forever! It was well worth it though. Watching the bartenders make these well crafted concoctions was part of the fun!  Look up on the way out, you will see a wall of skulls. Creepy and cool! Next time I am in town, I will definitely be back, and will hopefully have time for dinner.

A few of my friends and I went here to start off the night for my birthday. The entrance is a little hard to find since the entrance was through the alley and not off the main street. We got there around 8:30 and there was already a small line outside. When we got in, the place was pretty packed since it was a Friday night. The main focus of the room was the actual tiki bar. There were a few stools at the bar and tables along the walls. Overall, this place had a chilled out vibe with dark lighting and buzzing energy from the crowd. I would definitely recommend trying to get a table if you have at least a small group of people.

Drinks: Damn, these drinks were STRONG. As a fan of making stiff drinks myself, I like their style. These guys don't mess around. One or two drinks could definitely get you going. Yea, the drinks are $13 each, but it's not your typical jack and coke style order. Each drink has a bunch of different components and you can actually see the amount of work the bartenders put into every drink. Expect to wait a little bit if the bar is swamped. All the drinks come in different style tiki cups and have different fruit and decorative garnishments. I think I even saw one drink that made a banana look like a dolphin haha.

Jet Pilot - Three different kinds of rum. Get it if you like stiff drinks.

Dr. Funkhouser - A little bit sweeter than the Jet pilot, but still good and equally as potent.

We were lucky enough to get a table so we also decided try 3 of their punch bowls:
Zombie Punch
Pieces of Eight
Scorpion Bowl

I'm not gonna lie, things were a little hazy at this point in the night so I don't really remember the different flavors of each. All I know is they all tasted good, had a ton of liquor in it, and was a fun way to drink with your friends.

Food: The food was pretty tasty, but pricey for the amount that you get.

Luau Chips - These were light and airy and paired well with the bunch of dipping sauces they gave us. It's definitely on the small side and we could've used more to soak up all that liquor haha.
Curry Chicken Skewers -  Asian style marinated chicken. I didn't really taste too much of the curry flavor.
Pork Belly Buns - Standard pork belly, tender and flavorful.

Overall, 3 dots is a cool, fun place to start off the night with really strong drinks. Could be a little wait, but once you get in and maybe even lucky enough to get a table, it's worth it.

pics.caption: 3 types of punch bowls....so many straws

review.des: Very nice atmosphere and very quality drinks. A bit expensive but you get what you pay for and this was just a cool place that a lot of people go to. Speakeasy is not that hard to find. Just look for the tiki torch in back alley

It's expensive, for sure, but the drinks are strong and delicious, the food is excellent, and the atmosphere is super fun. This place is pretty much exactly what you want and expect from a Tiki bar, just on the pricey side.

Like every other bar in Chicago, the bartenders are hipsters with big beards, but like almost all of the hipster bartenders, they were pretty nice guys. Danny suggested the mai tai based on my likes and dislikes, and it was spot on - delicious, strong, fruity but not sweet, and made me hanker for Hawaii. (Better mai tais to be had on the islands certainly, but part of that is simply being there...)

My man had the painkiller cause he wanted coconut but not too sweet, and again Danny was spot on. Just what he wanted.

We asked for Danny's recommendation for an appetizer and again he did us right - the Thai fried chicken was superb.

The ladies' room had a bathroom attendant, which kinda threw me for a loop - have not seen that maybe ever. A little weird, not a fan, but whatever.

Watching the bartenders make the drinks was pretty great - liquid nitrogen and all kinds of theatrics. And it's no "Essence" (from Parks and Rec), either - these drinks are legit, tasty, and strong.

We will definitely be back, but probably on a Monday, Tuesday or Wednesday when it's a little quieter...

I loved it here. The drinks were super fun. I love atmosphere. It is super unique. There are so many great choices on the drink menu, but I have singled the banana daiquiri out as my favorite! If you go with a large group, I would highly recommend the sampler platter of appetizers. It was very impressive! The selection of apps was pretty basic but the quality of the food exceeded my expectations. The coconut shrimp, beef skewers and the thai fried chicken were my personal faves!

We went on a weeknight at 8pm and there was already no where to sit so we did the standing room bar and ended up sitting at the bar after about 15 min. I've heard so much about the cocktails here and I was so excited to go!

The bartenders Ryan and I believe it was Danny? Were cool and made very good drinks. One of the best Mai Tai's I've ever had.

Expensive but that's to be expected and the atmosphere and quality of drinks was worth it.

My experience at this bar was negative but not because of the service. The patrons at the bar were not friendly at all. I'm a very sociable person, I like to go to bars to talk to people and have a good time. We tried to talk to like 5 different people at this bar and they all had the crappiest attitudes. One guys exact words when we asked what he was drinking was "Oh it's a cocktail, there's liquid in there..." We were just asking because the drink looked cool, he was such a jerk.

It was just an unfriendly environment and I was uncomfortable. Not sure what it was exactly because I've been out to lots of places around the area and didn't have this same vibe.

I feel bad because I know it's not the the bars fault how their patrons behave but because of the snobbish attitude I got from my fellow drinkers I will probably not return.

The food and drinks here are really damn good. I recommend the short rib (my favorite dish by a longshot) and the thai chicken but everything is good. The drinks are strong and overly fancy but that's kind of the whole point right?

The drinks that say 'for 3 -4' people are actually for 2-3 people, they're overselling their size a bit imo.

The biggest negative of this place is how rushed the experience is... they really want to turn your table over within an hour and it's pricey enough that you shouldn't have to feel like you're in the way.

Had a blast at this unique drink spot! It's a pretty popular place with lines sometimes outside the door and long wait times. Make a reservation or stand at the bar. Cocktails are tropical and presented to impress in punch bowls or tiki cups. Drinks are strong and delicious (which they should be for these prices).

Definitely not a fan. The hostesses were not pleasant. It was our friends birthday and they could not careless. The drinks are exactly what the restaurant promotes them to be and the atmosphere was interesting. Rude workers will prompt me to not be revisiting though.

I was a DJ at a private event here and the staff treated me so well. The food was amazing. I had sushi, chicken tenders, and Cesar Salad. It was buffet style. The drinks are really cool too. It was a little hard to find because it's located inside a Bbq joint.

"You know how to take the reservation, you just don't know how to hold a reservation.  And that's really the most important part of the reservation, the holding.  Anyone can just take them."

I made a reservation through OpenTable online for a 6PM table.  Arrived at 6:01PM to be told that my reservation had been cancelled by the restaurant for not showing up.  The host claimed that my reservation was for 5:30PM and they have a "very strict no-show policy".  

After asking for the host to write a note saying that I arrived at 6PM and that he would not seat me, I was referred to a manager.  After waiting about 15 minutes, I was finally seated with plenty of condescendence and disdain but no apologies.  I should hardly need say that is not an appropriate way to treat customers.

OpenTable later confirmed that the reservation was for 6PM, but had been changed to 5:30PM at the restaurant after my arrival there.

Do not assume that just because you have a reservation they will honor it.  Call ahead and be prepared to prove yourself.  Or just go somewhere they know how to manage reservations properly.  There are literally hundreds of places that do.

As for the drinks, they are decent, but they are super expensive, the average being around $14.  I would recommend averting the whole possibility of having issues here and trying another bar and a bag of cheap plastic toys to throw into your drinks.  You will save money and maybe also some frustration.

I don't get the hype around this place. The drinks are good, but very expensive ($20) and definitely not worth waiting in line. Went on a weekend and it was crowded and loud.  It's probably a place you can go to once just to say you did it, but I don't think I'll be returning.

Been here a couple times for birthdays and anniversaries. Pretty cool place for drinks. The entrance is pretty cool. All of the drinks looks pretty interesting. My only complaint is how pricey they are. Overall really cool place and definitely recommend
Any place that lets those who shove others aside sit at the bar because it's "first come first serve" does not deserve your money. Sweet place but they disrespect their customers.

Living a block and a half away from this place is SO. DANGEROUS. for me.  Fortunately, it also means that I can walk home from here just on muscle memory, a fact I have now proven to myself more than once.  Of course, to say I was "walking" and not "staggering" would probably be a teensy fib.

I've been a fan of tiki since before it was hipster-cool, and this place is the real deal.  Three Dots and a Dash features face-melting drinks, beautifully presented, a liberal use of fire and dry ice, never-in-real-life Polynesian decor, and a menu of outstanding Pu-Pu nibbles, also with more fire.  I absolutely love this place, and I've had some fantastic times here.  It was at Three Dots and a Dash that I saw my first light-up-label bottle of Dom Perignon.  I'm both delighted and ashamed of that fact, and really, what more could you ask from a tiki bar than wonderment and remorse in equal parts?

Be warned though:  Prepare to spend some money here.  Your basic drink is $13 here, and after a couple of those, you ARE going to make some bad choices and spend considerably more on something that "serves two."  I don't think we've ever gotten out of here for less than $100.

Also, unless you love the velvet rope, shun this place on weekends.  You're going to wait in line for a good bit, just for the privilege of standing five-deep at the bar with people in tight clothes who are WAY more drunk than you.
Great cocktails.  Recommend making reservations.  Perfect way to kick off girls weekend.  Fun and campy.

Their drinks are amazing!!! If you have been to Hawaii you know what I'm talking about it. Go there and have a good time with your friends and their cocktails. Must go if you want to try amazing drinks! So far I tried 5 and no regrets :)

Such a fun spot.  I was worried that I wasn't cool enough to visit a hidden tiki bar, but it wasn't nearly as intimidating as I thought it would be.  The drinks were expensive-- but worth it for the fun vibe.  I would definitely recommend this place to other out-of-towners looking for a low-key spot for a night out in Chicago.

I love this bar!! Typically when on vacation, I like to try a new place for every meal or drink to experience as much as possible.  We ended up coming here 2 nights in a row!

The place wasn't too hard to find for having a creepy back alley entrance (look for the blue light).  Once you get downstairs, the atmosphere is amazing!  Very dark and dreamy, with fun tropical music.  There are plenty of seats up at the bar, which I loved sitting at! It is so memorizing watching these bartenders make the drinks. They put such detail and effort into every single one.  Alex was our bartender the 1st night, and he said he knew over 100 off-menu drinks, so we had him make us his favorites.  They were DELICIOUS!  The 2nd night we had a different bartender (I can't remember her name), and she was just as great!!

Looking forward to visiting next time I'm in Chicago! Oh, and you can purchase the amazing glasses that these drinks come in. For about $25, they make an awesome souvenir!

Located down an alleyway which was sort of sketchy at night. I mean it wasn't that bad but if you drunk it could creep you out. Other than that entry was easy. We went on Saturday night, the service was slow due to the type of drinks they serve. The drinks were decent but the atmosphere is what made the place.

Terrible!! Do not go there.  We were a twosome and they refused to give us a table, much even a seat.  Terrible hospitality after a wonderful evening with my husband.  We were asked to give up a single bar stool and made to feel sub par.  Terrible!!
First time there Saturday. Great place, fun tropical drinks and excellent service. FIND this place, a lot of fun!

Such a fun night! We went to celebrate my friend's birthday, and had a wonderful time! There was a long line when we got there, but we got in within ten minutes.

They gave the birthday girl leis to wear and a free drink that was very generous on the alcohol and had smoke coming out of it. The drinks are all strong and incredible, and the decorations are all fun and festive. We met a lot of fun people inside--an eclectic crowd of friendly, happy people. Dancing broke out in the back when it got later, and it was a blast. Hope to go back soon!

Always a favorite! Personally, I think Three Dots has some of the best service in River North - let alone Chicago. The service, the decoration, and the drinks is why I love showing this place off to friends, family, and coworkers from out of town. I came on a Friday with a group of 10 people for a celebratory happy hour around 5pm. Although we did not have a reservation, they were extremely accommodating and were able to get a table until 6:30pm. Our waitress did a great job of walking newcomers throughout the menu and giving recommendations. She was attentive throughout the evening and was patient throughout the process of dividing the check. Our group started with individual drinks. I had the Jet Pilot which was awesome. I really enjoyed the cinnamon and absinthe components of the cocktail. My favorite part about the drinks at Three Dots is that while they are sweet and tiki themed, they always taste natural and fresh and are consistent. They also are great for sipping and last a long time (if you want them to). Next, our group decided on ordering the infamous treasure chest. At $385 it's an excellent way of celebrating. It comes out bubbling and overflowing with dry ice fog and a glowing bottle of Dom Perignon. Once placed on the table, it is opened to reveal a trough containing the drink and the Dom is opened and poured in. Our group drank it with excitement and it was definitely the highlight of our time there. After that, a few others and I split another large format drink called The Zombie. This was excellent as well and served as a great close to an extremely enjoyable happy hour.

Overall, I love this place because it truly is a great bar. The level of service and professionalism from all staff, atmosphere, and of course the delicious drinks is why this place is always my #1 to show off to people and celebrate at. I am already looking forward to the next time.

Fun drinks with over-the-top garnishes. I love it! Also, approached the bar with my friends, an opening came up right in front of us and we stepped back to let another two girls take it (because they were there first), then the next opening came up and a group of 5 girls elbowed in to take it. Karma took care of it because the hot bartender served us with the girls we let in, and the rude girls had to wait. #tikiwin
Sexy atmosphere. There is a server that looks just like Sophia Vegara! Great music. Drinks have a nice amount of strength.

Love the vibe of this loungey bar!
However tables are usually full so if you want to lay back and relax at a cool looking table make a reservation because it will be about an hour and a half to get the next free table!
The drink I had was the Seasonable Doubt with gin, it was good for the price but I am definitely excited to go back and try their other drinks
This place have a very beautiful and unique interior design. The Atmosphere there is always nice! Customer service is so excellent but drinks are way too pricey

Cool tiki themed lounge that we dropped in on by accident. Seems like a great spot for dinner/drinks and the decor is really pretty outstanding. Actually one of the more unique places in Chicago which I'd go back to again! Great atmosphere. Recommended.

10 stars if possible! I absolutely love this place. The drinks are wonderful and great value. The staff treat us like gold. The mai tai, painkiller, and the Pago Pago are favorites. Highly recommended!
My favorite bar in town, great cocktails, really cool decor, hard to get reservations

Highlights/Lowlights

1) "secret"/hard to find entrance gives this place a fun twist
2) super fruity tropical drinks
3) spacious set up

We visited Three Dots and a Dash super late on a Sunday.I knew from friends that the bar was one that has limited labels and is hard to find, but WHOA is it hard to find. My fiancé and I walked around the block a few times before discovering the entrance in a little back alley. In our opinion, it just adds to the fun but if you are looking for somewhere more straight forward this maybe isn't the place for you.

After you walk down the stairs, you enter a huge bar/restaurant space. Because we were there late, there were plenty of tables open. The space is way over the top decorated tiki creating a fun but a little gimmicky of an atmosphere.

We were starving and hoping to get some appetizers but unfortunately the kitchen closed at at midnight. However, it was a Sunday night so this seems pretty reasonable. The drink menu boasted tons of big fruity/sugary tiki cocktails. The cocktails are big, but you are definitely paying for the size. This isn't a place for cheap drinks.

If you are looking to try something unique in the downtown Chicago area, this is a fun place to try.

Three Dots and a Dash is a really fun and unique spot cocktail in Chicago; it feels like a tropical escape in the middle of the city. Finding it can be a bit of an adventure as you have to walk down the alley to the entrance, but once you're inside a different sort of adventure begins.

Standout cocktail favorites include the Painkiller and Missionary's Downfall.

The food is just okay. I would just come for drinks and then go out to dinner somewhere else personally.

Word to the wise: there are some very strong cocktails on the menu. I certainly appreciate that the cocktails are strong at Three Dots and a Dash, it does make for an interesting journey up the dark stairs when you leave. :)

Workers were rude however I am from the south where we have southern hospital.  Ordered the 65 dollar drink, which came with a cool wooden statue in it.  However if you remove the statue you will realize you paid 65 dollars for about 3 drinks.  Also while holding the 65 dollar drink I was told several times that I had to move and couldn't stand there.  Basically I couldn't stand anywhere in the actual bar.

Pros:
Tasty drinks
decent food
friendly service
killer ambience
great place to take guests when they're in town
fun menu experience

Cons:
slow service
a bit overpriced

The drinks are super sweet and strong so this is more of a single drink place rather than an evening hangout.

Very cool place.  We don't go downtown Chicago too often so I have never heard of this bar until today.  Super glad we checked it out.  It is in a random alley entrance way but that made it fun too.  It is a little dark inside and loud, but hey, it's a bar.  The drinks were so fun and crazy.
Favorite bar in Chicago! Friendly service and fantastic rum drinks. Don't forget to make reservations tho!
This is quite an interesting after work drink spot.  The drinks are beyond amazing, but super expensive.  One to two drinks is all it takes.  You'll need a cab to get home.

Must visit!

This place was a little hard to find. It's through an alley on the left hand side. Their sign is very small, so you have to look up when you're walking. When we got there, we had to wait about 30-45 minutes (on a Thursday night). This place definitely gets really busy, but you can also make reservations - which is recommended. We got couple drinks, they were good & cute. We also ordered food - Thai fried chicken & coconut rice w/ ribs. Both were very delicious. It's a must visit if you're in Chicago!

Came here on a blustery Wednesday for a **ladiez night**. Service was amazing!! Drinks were delicious, kitschy, and cute. Definitely try the Hurricane or the Dead Reckoning (if you want something stronger). The food is also definitely worth a try, but not as good as the drinks. My only qualm is this place is pretty touristy.

This is a pretty cool spot with an eclectic vibe. The drinks are pricey but are carefully crafted with attention to detail so you don't get a crappy drink that doesn't have its proper amount of alcohol. This is a fun spot to take out of town guests with a cool décor or a nice place to hang with original drinks you won't find elsewhere. A neat plus.. all drinks have their own special glass depending on what kind you order. Neat place in general.
Very nice atmosphere and the drinks have the cutest names, not the Felicia one but tasty nonetheless!!

Absolutely do not go here without a reservation! Every table is reserved and the staff would not even allow us to put our purses on an empty chair even though no one showed up for the table the whole time we were there. We were put on a list for a table but after an hour we left and two hours later they texted me that there was still no table! I don't mind standing in a bar but there is no place to set your drink down and when I set it down on an open table I was immediately told I was messing up the table and it was reserved and I could not use it. Ok, but the glasses they use are heavy, the drinks are very cold, and they tell you to stir them while you are drinking. Not possible while juggling a purse.

Love, love, love this place! So creative and cozy. It is placed in the basement, just beneath all the craziness of downtown Chicago and their theme is Polynesian, all the staff is dressed tropical and the whole environment and music make you relax, have a drink and transfer to somewhere tropical! Also, they have a small tapas menu which is delicious and they give you amazing sauces to dip in. My only minus is that they have no deserts! Please add something i am sure it will be phenomenal.

Great, fun atmosphere. We got lucky and there wasn't a wait for a table, but according to friends, it gets to be packed and standing room at the bar only. Love the fun glasses! I had a Saturn and it was delicious. Fruity, but packed more of a punch than I expected. I'll be back the next time I'm in Chicago!
This is a hidden jewel. A fantastic place to bring a group of friends for some SERIOUS tiki drinks. Or stop by for an after dinner drink. I love that they keep things classic. Great great great!!!
Very cool and down to earth. Great drinks and chill atmosphere.  Will return . Look for the tiki torch
The Best Tiki Drinks in Chicago!! Stephanie is an excellent waitress and is very Friendly and Attentive!! Everyone should have a Stephanie working for them!!

Great cocktail choices and great food..... ambience is gorgeous. Lack of seating is the only frustrating thing and the place requires reservations way in advance......It's a gem that's hidden, since the entrance to this establishment is in an alley. Enjoy the novel worth of drink choices!

I am a huge fan of tiki cocktail bars and, generally, love this place.  We tried the food platter, which was fun and had a good mix of tasty items on it.  The cocktails were, as usual, great. Service was hit and miss, with the waitress vanishing for long periods of time, so much so that another employee had to cash us out.  We probably would have ordered more cocktails but the waitress seemed to be largely MIA and seemed to be indifferent to the concept of service.

UPDATE: The business manager said someone would follow up. This has not happened.

Drinks are good, cool environment, but over the past few years it has turned into too much of a river north club (which is fine if that is your thing)-- and the drink prices have definitely rose.  Way different vibe than when it first opened.
Went for a birthday party, had a lot of fun. Cool setting, delicious drinks. Service was great, despite it being crowded. Would defiantly go back

I've always loved Tiki bars, since I grew up in Los Angeles, frequenting Trader Vic's, Don the Beachcomber, the Islander, Beachbum Bert's and many others. It's sad that they're all gone. But the good news is that Three Dots and a Dash tops them all.

From the moment you venture down the stairway full of skulls, Three Dots immerses you in perfectly themed kitsch. The lighting, soundtrack and set decoration are impeccable, and the drinks are potent and tasty.

The drink menu is divided between classic and modern sections. I had the signature drink, Three Dots and a Dash, which was not too sweet, and rendered exotic by the inclusion of allspice. It was invented at Don the Beachcomber in the 1940s. (Incidentally Three Dots and a Dash is Morse code for the letter "V" as in victory.)

Many of the drinks are for sharing, and each has its own unique presentation.

We stopped in before dinner, so we didn't have a chance to try any of the food, but most of it is traditional Tiki menu fare, and it looked delicious.

With a place this cool, you're going to have to wait in line unless you go at a weird time. We were able to walk in right after work, but the place quickly became packed; however we never felt rushed.

To find the door, look for the alley off of Hubbard and follow the neon stripe.

pics.caption: Signature drink, Three Dots and a Dash, created by Don the Beachcomber in the 1940s. Allspice adds an interesting note.

review.des:
Love it, love it. Strong  drinks, great atmosphere and great experience.

Entrance  is in  an alley.

One of the best cocktail drinks in town. Hands down! The place has an island feel and the music isn't too loud so you can actually have a conversation without screaming your lungs out.  But make sure you get all the drinks you want for your stay at once because getting a drink is a hassle. You can waste 20-minutes trying to to get one.
Such a fun place to start your night off. Drinks are delicious, service is excellent and the ambiance is perfect.

4-stars.  This place is a wonderland of fruity inebriation.  I have had some of their small bites- pretty good.  Their drinks make me happy, want to sing and dance, and travel to a warm place and drink myself silly.  What else can you ask for?

Why not 5? A little pricey, and little too much of a river north crown that screams "too cool for school."
Was missing home and needed some island fun. This place has good vibes and a laid back attitude. I got a virgin lava flow and they did not disappoint !

Nice drinks, but wouldn't let us back in after leaving. Got some really stupid policies about leaving.  We had some friends inside and we couldn't get back with them and the bouncers were dicks.  No maholo.

I came here with a friend of mine who lives in Chicago. I wasn't thrilled when she said the name of this place because the last experience I had with it was an annoying one. Well, we went on a Monday night and it was golden. The place was just right. Not a ton of people, but it wasn't a ghost town either.

Amazing tiki bars are very hard to come by. This one makes the cut.

This place really makes you feel like you are at a lounge on a tropical island. An enclosed one, that is.

Drinks and food were amazing. We tried so many different concoctions. We were able to carry on our conversation & actually hear each other.

I would go back. But only on a Mon-Wed evening.

Fun place to take out of towners. The drinks are STRONG- don't let that cute dolphin in your frozen concoction fool you, you WILL be buzzed up hard after only 2-3.

The food definitely leaves something to be desired, but who's coming to an underground tiki bar for appetizers anyway?

The crowd can get a bit annoying at peak hours, so be prepared to wait too long for a drink, and stand around looking like Jason Segal in Forgetting Sarah Marshall once that drink is delivered. But overall, cool atmosphere, unique place, and a nice time!

Great Vibe, Funky Drinks (a bit pricey) & OKish Food (limited options). About 1-2 years ago, it wasn't easy to reserve a table (1-2 days response time via the website); had to queue up outside (even in the cold) to get in. OpenTable makes it easier now.
Food is average, but the DRINKs are amazing!!! Great after work spot, but be carful their drinks will put your ass before you know it. Love the decorations and vide as well.

A group of six on a Friday night. Be prepared to wait outside.

Overpriced drinks, what they're trying to pass off as a dance floor is practically nonexistent, and the service consisted of long waits and mistakes on the bill.

I seriously felt like I was on vacation here!

Insider tip #1: though this place has the same address as Bub City, walk around to Hubbard and into the first alley next to Firecakes.  Look for a bouncer, blue door, and tiki torches, and you've arrived.  Once you get your ID checked, you'll enter the lower level tiki haven!

Expect dim lighting, grass skirts, a fun menu, and STRONG drinks!  My dead reckoning cocktail was a smooth combo of rum, vanilla, and pineapple, even though I mistook the lemon peel on the drink for tasty dried fruit (it's DIM in there!) and ended up chewing and chewing and eating it bc I didn't have a napkin to spit it into and was mid-convo with a friend, but that's another story.  Check out the banana made into dolphin in the banana daquiri too.  Food-wise: try the pork belly buns!  Delish.  I also give the chicken curry skewers and spring rolls a thumbs up.
Amazing place first time going and love it will go back and telling friends the drinks are good atom sphere is good appetizers are also good oh the prices

This is the first time I have ever taken advice from someone that involves going down a dark alley into an underground room. Sounded sketchy at first but the way I see it is... I was with two other girls and I run faster than them, so what did I have to lose?!

Jokes aside, it was a little difficult to find. Our first night visiting Chicago, we literally asked everyone on the street where to go. We took the advice of these three blonde girls.. (because blondes obviously know how to have fun) to go to Three Dots and a Dash.

Now I have no idea why the bar is named . . . -
but who cares? The drinks are strong, we were basically in Hawaii, and the crowd was awesome. It seemed like a majority of the crowd that night were out-of-towners like us. The bartenders were funny and even let us use their iphone 6 charger!

Thanks for an amazing first night out in Chitown!!

My ratings have gone down 3 stars for 3 reasons:

1) Noticed recently that several staff feel free to be snarky with customers. Especially the tall, skinny dude with the red hillbilly beard. Not cool.
2) Drinks are containing more ice than beverage. As in, you'll be lucky to get 5 sips. It didn't used to be this way! What gives?
3) Drinks are continually missing garnishes. It's a Tiki bar! Half the fun is the presentation. Especially if you're only giving me 5 sips of alcohol for $15.

Three Dots, I know you're busy, but maybe you should shut down for one night and invest in some
staff training.  

For now, I will go out of my way to visit Hala Kahiki.
5 star tiki bar! Go for the experience it's very well done and the drink menu is outstanding

I've had a great experience every single time! Great food, tasty exotic drinks, and awesome decor. I love the fact that it's underground and the entrance is in an alley. It took my fiancé and I a walk around the block to find the entrance.

Super great although the entrance is hard to find! The drinks are really tasty and strong and most importantly, presentation of food and drinks is beautiful. Downsides are just price, limited space, and mysterious entrance.

Honestly! One of the COOLEST places ive been to!
A bit cliche but it totally works. The drinks were amazing, the service was amazing and the food hit the spot. Definitely a go to spot in Chicago. I will make sure to be back! :)

Looking for a unique place to grab a drink and hang out with your friends? Come here! Don't be misled by it's location - you will have to walk through a small alley to get here. It's totally worth it to try it out. This place looks like a luau, from the decorations to the drinks to the girls dresses.

If you come during the prime time, you'll wait forever to grab a table as many of these tables are reserved ahead of time. You might even have to wait outside in line, if the bar is too full. If you're lucky and come before the rush, you'll get to really enjoy the ambiance of Three Dots & a Dash.

The first time we came here, the place was completely packed. We came on a Friday night around 7, and all the tables were booked and the bar area was completely packed. We were given an estimated of 2 hours for a table, so we hung out near the bar area. After ~15 minutes of trying to get the bartender's attention, we finally got our drinks and hung out on the floor while finishing our individual drinks.

The next time we returned to Three Dots & a Dash, we planned our trip more wisely. We came before the rush hour and were seated right away. It made our visit much more pleasant. We were finally able to order a group drink, the Zombie Punch - it lights on FIRE - which is super amazing. You really do get to enjoy the ambiance of this unique tiki bar when you have a seat. Each table is spaced far enough where you can enjoy your company without any disruptions.

Don't underestimate the power of these fruity drinks, they are SUPER strong. My friends and I barely made it home before we passed out.

I highly recommend this place for cocktails!

When we arrived it was Sunday during the actual business hours. I guy was waiting outside and told us it's lock but they will come and open it, a female came and opened the door to let us all in. All of walked in and the bouncer was so rude asking who let us in. We asked if they were open and he stated they were not open, yet they had music and the lights going. The girl who opened the door told the guy just go on they will let them go in, but he didn't want to. The bouncers made us leave and as we were walking out two other males were coming in and the female said once again come on they will let us in and sure enough the bouncer didn't even card them and just them go thru.
Cool spot! I liked that it was very different and the drinks were so strong. Good environment, great music and made me feel like I had a secret on the city by stumbling in on this bar.

Wow. No other word can describe the kind of experience you will have at Three Dots. I needed a good date spot with some good drinks and bites and found Three Dots on Yelp.

I used to live in San Francisco and frequented Smuggler's Cove which had the same vibes and was modeled after a wrecked pirate ship. To find the bar you must turn a corner into an alley way where you will be greeted by a bouncer who will ask for identification, he will lead you into a narrow stairway down into the land of Three dot's and a Dash.

The environment they have created is remarkable and beautiful. Blacklight's illuminate the room with vibrant colors and keep the tiki bar on full focus. The bartenders working here are some of the best in Chicago, they know how to pour and create glasses of happiness. The wait staff is colorfully dressed in matching outfits as well as the bartenders. While visiting I had the Poblano Escobar, What's Frozen and the resident cocktail Three Dot's and a Dash. Both incredible.

For food I've only had the Thai Fried Chicken and it is absolutely amazing! No really, you NEED to try this. So so good. While the drinks, food and ambience are amazing it does come with a cost. The average drink cost about 14.00 so if you're looking for a cheaper option, you probably do not want to come here. I recommend it for dates, girls night out, or office parties.

One thing I really enjoyed was that they even shared a few menu items from Smuggler's Cove in San Francisco! I hope to return soon, it's a great spot in the city!

Oh yeah, great find. Transport yourself to a tiki bar.   All I kept thinking about was the Brady Bunch episode where they find the weird tiki and think they are cursed because of it. Anyway...expect a dark, underground experience with strong cocktails.  Cannot go wrong with the Old Fashioned. This is a, "One and done" place so pre-game here and go on about your nightly plans.

OMG! What an amazing place!! One of the best bars I've been to. At first you're kind of confused because the entrance is in an alley and then when you go in it's a wall full of skulls which is kind of scary...But once you go down the stairs the fun begins. Very dim lights, great music, beautifully Hawaiian theme. The drinks are very creative. I love that the menu actually has a PICTURE of what your drink will look it. Trust me, they make it exactly how it's painted on the menu. They're all tropical flavors. Delicious! There's not one drink that I tried and didn't like. We sat at the bar while we waited for our table and I was watching the bar tenders work. They're so fast and detailed! I will definitely be coming back on my next trip to Chicago!

I am so happy I finally had a chance to try this place. After so much buzz, I had high expectations and man, they did not disappoint. I went on a weekday evening right after work with two people for just a drink at the bar. The bartender was super friendly and accommodating. He asked me what I liked and suggested a drink from one of their previous menus based on what I told him. The drinks are not cheap but they are strong, as well as beautiful. Being able to watch the bartender turn my drink into a piece of art before my eyes, was worth the extra few dollars more than your average drink. 5 star drink and 5 star service.

It doesn't need another review, but it was great, and I loved it, and I had to write something. Great vibe, decor is beyond fun/kitschy/perfectly-themed, and the drinks are strong and good. Can't wait to go back and try more.
Great for a creative drink selection and a bachelorette party. It's a full crowd and busy environment of that's what you're looking for.
Nice place great company great food amazing drinks One thing I have to say about the stairs I'll give it a 2 star because of lack of friendliness

One of my favorite spots in the city! The drinks here are worth the money. You will get drunk off of one if you don't drink much. The ambience is amazing as well. Go in here on a cold Chicago day and you'll feel like you're in a bar in the islands. 4 stars bc it's gotten pretentious with the line in the alley. I don't want to stand in a dark Chicago alley trying to get in. Dangerous. Also the food is pretty good.

DO NOT GO WITHOUT A RESERVATION. I do not recommend and am shocked by the amount of positive reviews. My husband and I showed up on a Saturday night around 8pm without a reservation. The hostess was stand off-ish and told us she could not quote us a wait time for a table - but that it would probably be two hours. We decided to try our luck at the super-crowed bar to give the place a shot. Luckily, two people were leaving their bar stools soon after we got there. Literally as we were sitting down, a waiter swooped in a took the stools out from under us. We told him and the bartender that we wanted to sit, and they said they always remove the stools at that time (although there was still a full bar of people sitting). So instead of being able to enjoy our cocktails sitting down, we would now have to stand against the bar with people pushing up against us to order drinks. No one seemed to care or pay any attention to us, so we left without ordering anything. Overall, it was pretentious, crowded and too trendy for it's own good.
Very gimmick in a good way. Lively and good for girls night out. However, the entry was a bit difficult to find.

Great service and great drinks.

My drinks was made to perfection. I was really impressed with the detail of every drink.

Alex, you made my list of one of my favorite bartender out there.

pics.caption: 50 degree weather outside but feeling like 85 degrees

review.des: I want to like this place, but it's corny af. Neat to show off to friends or family in town like "oh, this was a speakeasy" but then I'm like "actually who cares about that." The drinks are stiff, both in alcohol content and on the wallet, and the cups are pretty cool to look at, but I'd like, rather just have a beer. Not to be overly negative - worth visiting once for the experience, but idk why I'd ever go back.

Definitely one of my fav bars of all time. I love the food and the drinks. The environment is chill and they play good music!

It was pretty hard to find, it is sort of in a driveway but you won't miss it if you ask around.

We got the drink that serves 2-3 people and I thought it was good! The decoration on it is cute! Instagram worthy. (You can't order drinks that serves 2+ people without a table)

We also got the food platter and wow it was delicious. It is the perfect portion for a party of 3, I highly recommend it.

If I ever come back to Chicago, I would definitely visit this place again!
Great place for drinks. It gets busy and was a little hard to find (entrance in an alley), but it is so worth it. Tropical tiki bar theme and the drinks are poured strong!
Really good food, the egg rolls taste legit. The drinks are great and the menus is unique. Great vibes all around.

Mixed feelings about this spot.

Pros: The drinks are delish and the bartenders are super knowledgeable and friendly.  Even when it got busy, they didn't cut corners and really put effort into each drink.  Interior is cute, love the idea of Tiki Bar meets speak easy.  

The burger was freaking amazing

Cons: Really... A no tank top rule for a Tiki Bar?  Lame but it's Chicago so no surprise.  

Crowd is terrible, consisting of:
- Large business trip groups traveling in packs of 15 at a small bar.
- Way too drunk white girls
- Old dudes trying to land said white girls

Short ribs and rice was awful.  Avoid.

We live close so we'll be back when winter starts making us crave a vacay.

Pretty place for a date or for a gather, we ordered the platter but I feel they could add a little more wings, yucca fries just a little more food in the platter. I feel like $40 is a lot for what you get but don't get me wrong the food is delicious specially the veggie rolls and yucca. There are a lot of drinks to choose from, my gfs drink was really good but my mai tai was okay. Our server was great

My expectations may have been too high...I'll admit that going in.  We had a work dinner here and I guess I expected dinner.  
The entrance is in an alley and a bit hard to find...hipster cool I guess? Once you get into the place, it's mildly cool, but I enjoy a view when I am in a big city.  It's extremely dark [no windows] and laid out a little weird.  

Either way.  If you want to drink rum...you are in good shape as they have a ton of it. The food is all island fare and appetizers in my opinion.  I'm allergic to seafood so that took off a few of the items.  The pork belly sliders were good but other than that, not much to speak of.

Three Dots knows what's up. The drinks are strong and delicious. The vibe is tiki speakeasy-esque. Makes you feel like you're somewhere warm/tropical for a brief moment and not in Chicago...I usually go for the Painkiller because it's perfect and gets me where I need to go. But, the other drinks are just as amazing.

Only negative is that it's always hella crowded on the weekends. So, you have to be sure to make reservations far in advance, especially when you have a group. Other than that, the place is awesome.
Very cool and trendy spot. The drinks are incredible! Definitely a fun place to go for drinks and we've also catered their food at work and it's amazing!

Wow...this place will set you free!  A must "experience" if your visiting Chi-town.  A few of us went late at night...our last stop and most memorable. Speak easy back alley entry highlighted with glowing neon lights to guide you down the otherwise dark alley.  The mysterious tiki island feel strikes fast with the long steep raiders of the lost ark stairway that lead you to the underground bar/restaurant.  

The food and drink presentation was original and excellent quality. We snacked on island fusion style Appetizers and drank funky island drinks that are served in the coolest cocktail glasses north of the caribbean.
