I get it's River North and all but what made this bar stand out was the novelty of the tiki style and this really put a damper on that.

Bring back the original styles and drinks, nix the DJ and be proud of what you've built!
Love this place - it's very crowded, but the drinks are definitely worth the wait. I miss the drink with the banana dolphin!

My friend found Three Dots and a Dash on Yelp. We knew it would be hard to find, and it was! We went through almost every dark alley. Just remember: BEFORE GOING THROUGH THE ALLEY-CHECK FOR BLUE LIGHTS!

When we finally got there, we were so happy. It was such a cool place. The decor was very tiki/island. It really felt as if you were on an island.

The drinks come in super cool cups. They are all different and "islands." I had the Jet Pilot and it definitely did the job! We weren't that hungry, so we both had Thai Fried Chicken. It was a perfect portion.

Three Dots and a Dash was great and it's a must if you are visiting Chicago. If you're going on the weekend, I recommend to make reservations because it gets very packed.

I have always heard about this place, and I was finally able to check it out myself. Wow! It definitely lived up to the hype.

When you try to find this place on google maps, it will bring you to Clark St. I walked up and down the block on a cold, December night confused as to how to enter. I finally walked around back and could see two tiki torches burning. This lead to a nondescript black door that was the entrance to Three Dots.

When you think of Hawaiian/Tiki themed restaurants, one might associate that with cheap and tacky. However this was anything but that! They completely nail this theme from decor to music to waitstaff uniforms.

It's not all smoke and mirrors either. The drinks and food are quality. The punch bowls are fun and definitely pack a punch (no pun intended). Four of us shared the poo poo platter and each and every dish was delicious. Plenty of food for 2 guys and 2 girls.

A unique spot that is great to bring out of towners to! 100% recommend.
I have brought friends from out of town to this bar and they enjoyed themselves tremendously.   Nice tikki decorations, delicious drinks, and fun atmosphere

I had been wanting to try 3 dots and a dash for quite a while, and with all the instagram pictures on my phone I needed to see what the hype was about!

The first time I went was on a Friday night around 11 and found the place after a few minutes of walking around. Right when we got to the door, the doorman pointed my friends and I to a line forming by a dumpster....um....weird. Why is your line by a dumpster? Why is it so far away from the door? The line was long and we decided to go to another bar and come back later. Get this, we come back an hour later and the guy lets us in... I guess giving the illusion of people needing to wait is important -____-. Huh.

Right when we walked in, a waitress told us there was a table for 4 available and we took it up! Good thing too because the place just kept getting busier and the bar looked flooded with people. Our waitress was super friendly and got us our 1st round of drinks quickly. We had to wave her down the 2nd time, but that was understandable since it was so busy.

No doubt about it, the drinks are adorable and fun! I def. enjoyed them and the larger drinks too that we meant to be shared. I love the fact that there are pictures too on the menu- just order to what pleases your eyes :) The drinks were very sugary though and had a nice kick, so be careful how much you drink!

The second time I went we had reservations so there was no wait!

pics.caption: Perfect to share between 3 or 4 people! There are also little golden coins in the drink

review.des:
If you want a table here, DEFINITELY use open table or something and make a reservation, because at peak times, the wait can be HOURS. However, if you come here on off times such as awkwardly between the late night crew and the after work happy hour crew on a weeknight, you can walk right in and hope to snag some chairs at the bar which I've been successful at twice now! I waited maybe 10 minutes and then magically two people left right when we wanted seats. And then the real magic began because where else can you get a banana daiquiri type drink that is made complete with a banana that is cut artfully into a dolphin!!!?? Yup, you read that correctly--there is literally a person at this bar whose job it is to cut bananas into dolphins which I think has to be the best job ever--cloves for eyes, pineapple leaves as fins, and the stem part is cut open as its mouth! Amazing.

And these drinks even the fun dolphin one pack a true punch. They even say on the menu that these drinks are deceptively strong and that you should drink delicately and they mean it! They may be $13 cocktails but they definitely hit you harder than just one drink. And if you come here with a group, they have all kinds of fun giant group drinks served in clam shell cups, treasure chests....This tiki bar really is a fun spot to grab a drink or two. I haven't eaten here so I can't speak to that, but the second you start walking down the steps into this bar you know you are in for a treat!

This is a landmark speakeasy in Chicago and a place you absolutely have to visit. Sure, it involves going down a dark alley and a random staircase, but that's part of the fun.

THIS IS A GREAT DATE PLACE. Seriously, if your date drinks and would be willing to go down the dark alley with you, this is the spot. It's romantic, trendy and very unique. Cocktails are served in very unique glassware, with very unique finishes on top. I wouldn't normally brag about having flowers in my drinks, but mine came with an orchid on top of it!

DARK AND MYSTERIOUS. The whole place is creepy in some ways, it's odd in others and it's just fun.

REASONABLY PRICED. I am talking about the price here. Most cocktails are $13 and with the presentation and quality of ingredients, I don't think this is too bad.

BIKINI AFTER DARK. DEAD RECKONING. AND OTHERS...the drinks have not only awesome names, but taste amazing.

WAIT FOR A TABLE ON WEEKDAYS. Yes, even on weekday nights, the wait for a table is there. Usually under 30 min though, so not too bad and the bar area is nice to kill some time.

Very cool and fun place for drinks after work! Some of them can be a bit strong to the point where it takes away from the drinks flavor but thats a matter of preference. I have found a few that I really enjoy. During the weekdays I was pleasantly surprised at the music they play! I would say if you plan on attending on the weekends book a table ahead because they will all be taken or reserved.

So it's been a while since I've been here and going back for a drink and snacks made me miss it a little. Three Dots has the flash and premium feel that works for the downtown area. Although they have dumbed things down since they opened because if corporate blindness it's still a good spot to visit.

The Jet Pilot is still my favorite drink and there's a few good things to eat on the menu. If you spend too much time here you can rack up quite a bill and will need a 100ct pack of Tums to combat the acids from the fresh fruit juice! It's good going down but burns a hole if you have too many!! I'm over 40 so that may have something to do with it

Wow, this place was certainly hard to find! It's tucked in a very obscure alleyway that took forever to locate.

From the other reviews, they had indicated that this place was quite touristy...boy, were they right!  This place is the full on stereotypical tourist spot in River North, which I suppose is fun and charming in a way if you're visiting Chicago, but for anyone living here, it's prob gonna be an underwhelming experience.

While it was cool seeing and holding drinks in the decorative tiki ware Three dots is known for, the drinks themselves weren't anything too special or out of this world

And quite frankly for how crowded this place gets, it's just not worth it standing around suffocated with average tasting drinks that come w/ the typical River North prices

Three Dots and a Dash is Morse code for "victory." Unfortunately, it wasn't a victory for me when I visited this Tiki Bar. For those of you who can't find it on the map, it's by Firecakes on Hubbard and just walk behind Firecakes towards the alley where there's a secret entrance. I went on a weekday at 6pm, there was no line no wait (apparently there's long lines on weekends.) So my friend and I went straight to the bar, which was cute. I liked the Hawaiian theme and I was actually excited to try the drinks. Unfortunately, the drinks weren't exciting as the atmosphere. I ordered the Pago Pago cocktail which had rum, pineapple, and cacao and my friend ordered the Dead Reckoning which had Jamaican rum and pineapple. I was upset because the woman next to me ordered the Pago Pago as well and she had a piece of pineapple in her cocktail but I didn't... how inconsistent. I guess the guy was trying to hurry up and finish my drink because not too long after, it was change of shift and he clocked out. Both drinks were disgusting and too overpowering. I just wanted to enjoy my cocktail which I thought would've been sweet (especially with the rum and pineapple) but I was struggling to finish and savor my drink. Is $13 expensive for a cocktail? No, it's a standard price considering it's Chicago. However, was it worth $13? Nope! Sorry, Three Dots and a Dash, but it's a defeat for you this time.

pics.caption: Menu (this was before the new owner/manager worked there)

review.des:
A must when you're in Chicago--especially if you're staying in the Magnificent Mile area.

Hard to find--but don't be turned away. Look for the super sketchy alley and the dumpsters and the lack of decent lighting. ;-)

Once inside you're transported outside of the nation's fourth largest city to a cozy, dark, sexy, and relaxed atmosphere. No bathing suit required, but you'll feel like you're in the south Pacific, or maybe at the bar that sits inside of a Tahitian volcano (are there volcanos in Tahiti?). It's quite loud--so if you're looking for a place for a quiet date or a business conversation--this probably isn't your spot.

Drinks are strong and expensive--but a decent bang for your buck. They have several specialty drinks that are designed to share among 2-5 people. Think they huge fancy bowl withs several straws and all kinds of funness sticking out of the top of the bowl. #SelfieTime

Often very crowded, so make a reservation. Perfect place for a post-conference group drink, a birthday party, or a group celebration.

I came here about a month ago when I visited Chicago. The entrance is in a side alley so not gonna lie I was sketched out when we first arrived but I was with my brother so I was safe lol....

We were the first ppl there so we were able to get a booth which was nice. It fills up fast so if u want a table/ booth get there a bit earlier. The ambience was super cool and the waitress we had was very knowledgable and nice

I ended up getting the painkiller 639 and the dead reckoning. Both are very different but very good and smooth. I also had a sip of cacchen some rays. I'm not a coffee fan at all  so I didn't like it (duh me).

Prices are decent imo for the quality of drink and service. And I even bought a cup ($28) to take back home

Also this is important to me: the bathrooms are SOO clean. I was so happy. I judge a place by their bathrooms and I was pleased.

I had fun at this place and will def return when I go back to Chicago!

Unique experience! A good vacation stop for something different. Extensive tiki drink menu. It would be fun to taste everything on an endless budget. This is a good stop for one or two drinks... anymore and you will need a second mortgage.

What a fun and whimsical bar! We were in Chicago for one night and found this place on a blog. It did not disappoint. It's in kind of a secret location and underground which just gives it a cool vibe. The decor is awesome and fun, the drinks were creative and yummy (and strong), and our bartender Alex was so friendly and great at his job. I wish I could remember the names of all the cocktails we had, the pablono Escobar was yummy!!! Highly recommend this place.

pics.caption: Wish I could remember the names!
Poblano Escobar - super yum with a kick

review.des: Great place with a good atmosphere. Drinks are affordable and pretty strong lol. The food was actually tasty and had great flavor. If you are looking for a chill place with a good atmosphere, drinks, and tasty food come check this place out.

Nice place, but really for drinks. We went because of a review in the chicagoist that said we could get non-alcoholic cocktails.

After finally finding the entrance (in the alley, marked only by tiki torches) and descending many flights of stairs, we arrived at our super cute table. However, our server said they could only do three non alcoholic drinks: painkiller, Pina colada, and one other. We accepted defeat and picked from the measly list. We also ordered the coconut shrimp and short ribs.

Food was good, but small for the price. Drinks were fine, but not what we were hoping for.

I'll go back when I plan to imbibe!

This was one of the coolest places we found our vacation in Chicago. Don't let the alleyway entrance fool you - the bar is actually very well designed and the drinks are awesome. We tried three different specialty drinks, one being served in an illuminated skull with dry ice that was so cool people kept asking us if they could snap a picture of our drink.

Great place for something unique!

Ouch.

chicagoist.com/2016/05/1…

I've been here before and planned to visit again, in July. Rethinking that, now.
It's pimp.  Should definitely be included on your cocktail tour of the city.  Standard prices for a big city cocktail bar.  Pretty expansive menu for tiki.  Loved it.  Drinks were solid and strong.
It is hard to find. A nice environment However gets really crowded later in the day! The drinks are strong and good! I suggest getting there early for a table or a seat at the bar.

If you're not fun, don't go here. If your friends don't like it here, you need new friends.

Don't let the entrance scare you away. Ok so it's off an alley, then you go down to the basement, but then you're transported to an upscale tiki bar.

It's loud but in a lively fun way. All of the drinks are amazing which makes them deadly. You'll drink them quickly and want another. They don't skimp on alcohol so you need to pace yourself.

I typically don't go here to eat. The drinks are the highlight for me but I'm never disappointed in the food. The food is good. Get the coconut shrimp.

I might not bring my boss here, but it's perfect for a night out with the girls. They have a lot of booths which obviously are fixed in terms of the number of people they seat so definitely call in advance if you have a group. Reservations are probably a good idea  in general

I was in Chicago for a conference and took some clients to 3 Dots after dinner a couple nights. Don't be fooled by the slightly shady exterior. It is in a back alleyway but pretty easy to identify by the blue light above the door and the bouncer outside. After getting through the back alley and down some dark stairs, you are in a very cute speakeasy tropical getaway. It was perfect given that Chicago was rainy and cold that week. My customers loved it. Delicious drinks, fun atmosphere and great music. I had the Mai Tai one night and the Painkiller another. Both were delicious! I highly recommend coming here during a night on the town. Drinks are highly potent so don't say I didn't warn you!

This was the most unfriendly establishment I have ever visited. We are in town for a professional conference and the staff there greeted a group of 12 with nothing but ill manners. After telling them we had 12 in our party, we were told "we'll start with 8" and when all 12 showed up our server argued with us about how many people should be in our party. It took us 30 minutes before a server finally came over and then we were once again met with an unfriendly and abrasive demeanor because we were sitting at three tables to accommodate our group in the semi-empty bar. Only when we chose to leave were we told our group could have a private room. This establishment does not want business and unfortunately our group will never recommend 3 Dots and a Dash and will actively tell people not to visit.

This is an experience type of bar. If you like your same old same old boring vodka tonic or fancy Cabernet, this is not the place for you. This is a place with fun, exciting, strong cocktails and extravagant atmosphere. The menus is short but still tasty, it's more about the cocktails and ambiance! Cool spot to bring friends that are visiting out of town...

We went into Three Dots and had a BLAST! We finished dinner at Topolobampo and wanted and after dinner drink. Low and behold, we stumbled upon this underground tiki bar.
The host was accommodating and the server was the same. My boyfriend ordered the Saturn which was tasty and I got the signature Three Dots. Overall, a great experience! The manager Kurt, made sure we had a great time! We will be back.

This is my favorite place in the city. Without a doubt. The last time around I made a reservation on a Sunday night, and when I walked in alone I was greeted so warmly! I sat at the bar and just took it all in and enjoyed myself the whole night. The bar staff was incredible and really makes he experience special. There will always be someone fun and interesting to talk to here! I didn't want to leave, I hate saying good bye, because I never know when my next trip will be. But it will ALWAYS include a reservation here. Top priority!
Allie is so kind and helpful. I love the vibe here the music and drinks are always amazing. A great spot to hit before a night out and end for a night cap. Amazing bar. Great service!!

Three Dots and a Dash is such a fun bar! The decor is fun and small. I love the tropical drinks that are so fun and crazy (if you love to Instagram food/drinks-check this place out). Our bartender was sweet and made us delicious drinks. I would say the downside is during the weekend it tends to get PACKED but if you going during the week days it is not as crowded. I would recommend this place for a fun alternative night out. It is a chill tiki bar which makes you feel far away from the city.

This place was a lot of fun!  Great service and outstanding drinks!  The one con I will throw out there is they do not have as extensive selection of drinks as they do at Lost Lake and Hala Kahiki.   Walking though the alley entrance and down the stairs to a basement bar was a very cool experience.

Tucked in an alleyway underground this establishment lies.  Island style decor with rum based cocktails. Such a cool place to hang out at!  Customer service was great!  Actually everyone in Chicago in the foodservice and hospitality industry is overall friendly and awesome!  We didn't try any of the food because we came here after dinner just to hang out, but I would recommend checking this place out.  Aloha!

I love this place! If you want a table, you'll have to call several days in advance for a reservation. But it's a cool place to go even if you have to stand by the bar the entire time. The decor, and speak easy entrance is what I love the most. Coat check is free, drinks are great (I love the pain killer and banana stand), and the food is pretty good too - I've had the crab rangoon (they were OK, way too mushy in my opinion), coco's shrimp (very good), andddd the friend chicken (also good). Drinks cost a pretty penny by the way...

A very fun and interesting place. It's tucked in an alley and walking down the stairs you are greeted by a lot of skulls. It's creepy at first but after a second thought the skulls seemed very fitting for the place.

The drinks were very good though a little on the strong side. I got the Painkiller 639 and my girlfriend got the Painkiller 109. My came in a skull and hers came in a barrel which we thought was really cute.

My only complaint for the night was that we had to wait over 20 minutes by the hostess even though we had reservations. This was fine, however, when we walked in we noticed that there were at least five unoccupied small tables (not booths) so we were very confused. With that being said I will definitely be back!
Isn't this the last of an era? Cool drinks hard to find excellent snacks good for a group location what's missing nothing. Go for a good time aloha
I love any place that has a cute theme! It was a Hawaiian theme with lots of fun playful drinks! Great for dates and big groups as well!

A great Tiki bar in downtown Chicago, good strong drinks that are really creative and worth a try. The food is also pretty good.  If you want a similar vibe but not as crazy busy/touristy of an atmosphere, check out Lost Lake in Logan Square.

This is one of my go-to spots with my drinking buddy. The drinks are potent, we were quite sloshed when we left the last time we visited. Although that may have more to do with us sharing the Zombie which is meant for 3-4 people plus a few other drinks. Oops.
Really fun drinks and atmosphere! Plus love the Hawaiian dresses / "uniforms" the staff wears. So cute! You definitely feel like you're somewhere unique here.

Fun place!!! Showed up on Saturday night without reservations so I had to stand in line for 30 minutes.It was worth the wait! I really liked the atmosphere, bartenders were great and drinks were exceptional!!!

I have been to this place a couple times - without a reservation, on off nights (weekday evenings).  We have had no problem getting in but have ended up standing by the end of the bar with no chair - not terrible.

The atmosphere is really what you go for at Three Dots and a Dash - classy Tiki Bar I like to call it.  The wall of blue skulls on the way in and down the stairs is a great start.  The bar itself with thatched roof is classic.  The drinks are also beautiful - so many varieties with fun names, each with a special tiki cup as well.  Adorned with fruit and flowers.  I have tried many of the drinks and never found one I did not enjoy.

I have never had food here but the presentation of what we saw being brought out was also very fun and beautiful.

Over all - good but very busy.

Service: good when it's there, sucky when you have to find it
Drinks: two-mix drinks are strong. all others are maximum $$$ for minimum buzz
When to come here: Fridays after work so you can have two days to shake off the humiliation of having to be put in a cab by your co-workers before you see them on Monday

What else: dancing there is fun. do it.
Great atmosphere! You have to check it out if you are in Chicago! I asked the bar tender to make me something special and he made the most delicious drink I have ever had.
drinks take way too long to make but overall great vibe in the drinking area and good type of people to be around... and love the food looking drinks but how can we speed them up..?

A bit pricey, but much worth the splurge. The drinks were strong and beautifully decorated! The bartender that had my drink fixed was super nice regardless of having multiple drunk people flagging him for more drinks. It's a great hip place to unwind with friends but MAKE A RESERVATION. The line was horrid and I definitely learned my lesson to never skip out on calling in beforehand.

A little hard to find, uber dropped me off on a corner and told me it was in a totally different place than it actually was. You have to go around the building to the back alley, staff there was very pleasant, great drinks, tasty food. Considering the drinks are crafted with detail, The service was prompt and the drinks came relatively quick. Would recommend for couples and groups, not a single person type of environment, the bar was very small and so I was put up a table and I felt like I was sitting under a spot light all night. Other than that... worth the trip too. Thanks

Such a fun underground bar. Heard some women complaining about how the Painkiller tasted. We got the Aloha Felicia and the Missionary's Downfall which were both fantastic. Fresh juices in all the drinks. Very crowded fun bar. If you're wanting food, you should get a reservation as this place gets packed. Worth a visit.
Didn't want to leave my trip to Chicago without checking out this charming place. The bartenders were so nice and who doesn't love tiki drinks? Definitely an experience to try out

pics.caption: Great experience! Definitely will go back next time I'm in town
Top of stairwell leading to the underground bar at Three Dots & a Dash in Chicago

review.des:
Stumbled across this Tiki Bar in a sketchy alley across from my office downtown....was definitely not expecting to find this place! Very awesome decor, dimly lit, and very intriguing drinks. Be warned, everything is Rum! If you aren't a fan of that, this is most likely not the place for you. Also, the drinks are very tutti frutti, but some definitely pack a punch. The "Fish bowls" or sharing drinks are definitely great for groups!

My group got multiple "Treasure Chests" which are literal chests with dry ice steaming everywhere with a huge tub of booze in the middle. You need a lot of people to finish this. You also get a glow in the dark bottle of Dom with it (thats my favorite part!).

A little over priced...not really a fan of that, but anything downtown is going to be pricey. Definitely a different place, would visit again!

Drinks were yummy but the wait was terrible and it was so crowded.... It is worth is when you get a table to sit down at with your friends and just drink or eat. Good chill spot but overly crowded i would say...
Super cute atmosphere with adorable, strong drinks! It's a little pricey, but I think it's a fun place to get a drink.

It is difficult to describe the awesomness that this place is without simply going there. They have an excellent menu of classic and alternative Tiki drinks that would please any palate.  Everything here is done with finesse and care, each cocktail appears carefully crafted and balanced in both taste and aesthic appearance ensuring a wonderful experience.  The decor is great with kind of dark under the sea theme, every drink has its own unique chalice to call its own, even the food is quite good (mostly snacks and small bites).  

Do be aware this place is exceptionally busy and tables book quite far in advance and the lines to get in later at night are long so don't show up towards closing time expecting to get in.  We got here at about 6pm and were told we could stay for 2 hours and then our table was booked.
Awesome spot for signature or speciality drinks. I didn't do dinner here, but the bar service was great and the drinks were awesome.

I was quite impressed with this place. The bar/seating area wasn't that big but we were seated with no problem on a Sunday night. The decor isn't overdone, the music isn't too loud, and the food and drinks were amazing.  My husband and I started with and shared the zombie, followed by the pu pu platter. I honesty think these were the best spring rolls I've ever had. I then got a Mai Tai and he got the Dead Reckoning.

Our drinks were delicious and the food was fantastic. We also purchased a souvenir mug because that's what we do. :)

Service was great.

Highly recommend for those that like to frequent tiki rooms.

So much fun!  Expect to wait a long time for your drink, and you probably won't find a place to sit, but this is worth a stop.  The drinks are fun and strong. The decor is quirky, and definitely fitting for a fun, crazy night out.  Leave the debbie downers at home.
I can't comment on the food, we just had drinks.

Its a cool place to get drinks. Their drinks are fun and cheeky but too sweet. You gotta be careful because you can get pretty drunk off of just one drink since they are full of sugar and you literally get a sugar high. But it gets pretty crowded and the music is ok. The staff are friendly. The pain killer is really strong and honestly its not that tasty.

Dope place ! I was expecting the drinks to be all show but they tasted pretty good too! Place was packed on a Saturday night ! Not the kind of place you hang out at all night , grab a drink or two there then head somewhere else but it was an awesome time ! Line was only about 15-20min

Had a great experience! The seating was comfortable. Drinks were fun and boozy. Exactly what I had hoped for on a Sunday night. The staff were attentive and nice! Great service great drinks at a reasonable price point: 14/drink.

I've been here twice now, and here's what I've learned:

(01) Come before 7:30. Otherwise bring and book while you wait outside for up to three hours (even in January).
(02) Coat check is complimentary. Use it!
(03) Don't count on getting a table. You can either order from the bar or one of the waitresses who bop from group to group.
(04) Tiki drinks are $13 each, but the presentation is pretty awesome. (i.e. a dolphin made out of a banana coming out of a coconut shell.)
(04) The sweet and fruity tiki drinks have a power to make you forget that they're alcoholic. My three favorites are Three Dots and a Dash, Bunny's Banana Daiquiri, and Painkiller No. 3.
(05) The food is good, but I say spend your money on the drinks.

Enjoy your tiki drinking experience!

Pretty nice place to host an event.  Beware, the drinks are strong.  Entrance is a bit sketchy (under the light in a back alley).  Yep there are skulls as you enter (just look at the pics people are uploading, okay they are skulls, we got that).  Once inside the ambiance is nice, you get a bit of island theme from the decor and employee clothing.  Drinks come in fancy glasses with festive adornments, really going all out with the Tiki Bar theme.

Drinks, really strong and really sweet. Painkiller No 109 is close to a Pina Colada, and the sweetest drink.  Pretty much a hangover in a glass.  The flagship Three Dots and a Dash, Bunny's Banana Daiquiri, Mai Thai, and Boogie Board are all a bit sweet, with my favorite the Boogie Board due to it's Guava/Pineapple combo.  Personally I recommend skipping the frozen cocktail option.  They serve it in a metal cylinder which is chilled.  Basically you can't hold it without freezing your hand, even if you have a napkin in between.  Avoid the annoying logistics and just get any other drink on the menu.

Food is small hand-help apps, which were mostly tasty (and mostly not healthy).  Spring rolls are good with the sauce, coconut shrimp are fried shrimp with a mustard sauce (?), the thai peanut shrimp has the better sauce (and is also fried),  Pork belly buns were delicious (probably best food item), and tempura broccoli (to cure it of its healthiness).  The desert sandwiches are cute (also bitesize), but if you don't like coconut ice cream (like myself) then skip them.

Holy tiki goodness! This is the greatest place ever! The coolest decor ever, servers in long floral dresses and delicious drinks!

We had way too many drinks so I can say with confidence that most of the menu is wonderful! My favorites were the Painkiller #3 and the Zombie. The food menu may be small but it's so good! Dont miss the Thai fried chicken.

There is just something about the place that puts a smile on your face and lifts your mood.  I love a good dark, intimate bar as much as the next person but the tiki lounge feel in here should make most normal people feel like they are on vacation! Prompt great service just adds to the vibe.  

If I lived in Chicago, this would be a regular stop.

Was told to come here from another bartender at a pizzeria.  They did nit stir me in the wrong direction. This place was amazing!!! There drinks are something I never had before. Everything tasted great like truly great. Mixes and stuff I never heard of. There vibe is relaxed.

There are some great things about this bar. Certainly there is a place for everyone.

My problem is around the price. I get it, drinks are expensive because of atmosphere and size. That's why I wasn't surprised to see the house old fashioned was $18. It had a bunch of unique features and premium liquor.

After I had this "premium" drink I wanted to be a bit more frugal, so I ordered a standard old fashioned with their lowest shelf bourbon (4 roses). I ended up getting 2. Imagine my surprise when the standard drinks cost $19 each. Even in downtown Chicago, an old fashioned runs $10-12. This makes me wonder what the drink prices are based on?

Maybe the assumption is that because I didn't ask, they can charge whatever. Either way, I'm not going back, so, well done 3 dots.

This place is so awesome!!! I totally felt like I was going back in time to a speakeasy when I walked down that alley and the bouncer asked if I was looking for Three Dots and a Dash. I felt like I needed a password to get in! Once you walk down the hallway and go down the stairs, you are transformed to a tropical paradise. I was I awe. I completely forgot that I was in Chicago and its -10 out. I felt like I was on vacation somewhere tropical.

All the drinks we had were awesome! The Painkiller is great! Beware of the skull next to the drink! They will knock you down! The spareribs and pineapple guacamole were phenomenal. I can't wait to go back!

pics.caption: The Dr. funkhouser is no joke! Delish!!

review.des:
Went here with a couple of friends in search of anywhere with a solid piña colada. Upon arrival, we quickly realized we got more than we bargained for, in the best way possible.

First off you have to make sure you enter in from the alley, as the parking is validated at a place out front but the don't connect. After getting past the bouncer in the front, you almost immediately will go down stairs into what initially appears to be a Disney theme ride.
In actuality, its more of a scenic James Bond-esque tropical local. The music is subtle, with an excellent combination of tropical yet classy. While the cocktails themselves were a bit pricey ($13 each) they were well worth it. Personally I reccomend the Painkiller #109 as it most closely mirrors a piña colada, but with all of the tasty booze, fresh fruit, and other mixin's they toss together, you can't go wrong. Will definitely be coming back here.

Quick tip: Arrive Early! We went straight in, but if you come later, especially on a saturday, expect a long line outside.

Am I the only one that thinks this place is kind of depressing? I mean... Chicago is a beautiful city and it's meant to be seen. I felt like I was in a dark basement (I think I was). I couldn't even see the group of people I was with. Again... maybe my expectations were wrong. I guess this falls more in nightclub territory which I'm just not a fan of.

The drinks are really unique with how they are presented but the ingredients and flavor themselves are nothing special. The appetizers were pretty good but kind of ran on the heavy side. I would have liked a few lighter options since I planned on drinking and didn't want a lot of grease to go with it.

I think this place is more about the atmosphere but it was a miss for me.
Always crowded so book in advance, hence the four stars. Drinks are always delicious!

This place is so cool and a total hidden gem. Their drinks are tasty and beautiful! Our server was kind of sassy and intimidating; not the friendliest. This is a must if you're in Chicago or if you want to impress a date!
I was concerned the drinks would be too sweet, and sugary, but this was not the case. Unique creations, and very tasty. Place was very crowded and a little hard to find but totally worth it.

When you have to search for a door just to find your destination, you know you've found a cool place. But the "cool" didn't stop there-- this entire place is oozing with swagger. From the bartenders with handlebar mustaches to the servers with floral dresses on, I loved every minute of the fun they were serving up.

I was lucky to come on a night that there were only a few tables here. I know this NEVER happens and your experience will most likely include waiting in line to get in, but I think it'd still be worth it even if we had to wait.

The drinks are $13 but they're boozy and I was feeling a little buzz after one banana daiquiri. I can't wait to come back and try every cocktail on their menu. Who wouldn't want to come back to a place that serves a banana dolphin in your drink?

Came here for a couple drinks, it was extremely crowded and it took us about 30 minutes or so just to order a couple drinks. The people lined up to get drinks were kind of all in disarray.

The drinks were alright, nothing to rave about. Cups were cute though, and they do have some pretty cool looking drinks that I'd like to try (using liquid nitrogen it seems)..
Good night out. Only snag you have to wait ages for the (pretty decent) cocktails.  Go early to avoid queues
Wowwwww projectile vomited repeatedly multiple times here after one fish bowl after st pattys day. This place gets u real fucked up real quick. God bless this tiki bar

Ok, I can see the appeal of this place.

Fun glasses for your drinks.  They seriously reminded me of Olmec from Legends of the Hidden Temple.

And the intricacy of the cocktails themselves?  Impressive artwork, I will say.  The banana dolphin shooting out of the "Bunny's Banana Daiquiri" my friend ordered was quite the hoot, and I imagine took several minutes of fine culinary craftwork.

Plus, it's full of tikis, straw huts, bodacious babes and liq-liq-liquor.  It's Winter in Chicago, so it's totally logical to go to a place that will make you feel like you're at a resort mingling among hotties at the beach club.

Unfortunately for me, this just really wasn't my bag.  For one, nearly every drink on their drink menu is rum-based.  As in, the drink that I overindulged in once at a family party when I was in high school and it made me so sick that I vowed (and have pretty much stuck to it!) never to drink it socially again.  I know, I know, you're thinking "Oh, Damian, you could have ordered a regular cocktail from their expansive bar instead of one of their specials."  True.  But, why go to a place and not try their specialty?  You wouldn't go to Lou Malnati's and order a salad and not pizza.  It's just wrong.  With that, I drank my Jet Pilot and Poipu Beach Boogie Board in silent protest; thankfully I was among awesome friends who made me forget how rum makes my tum tum feel.

And I really feel like I got almost no bang for my buck.  Rather, no bang for the person who paid's buck.  I feel like a downer saying something like "AT THESE PRICES!...", but, downer I be.  After drinking said drinks... ya know, two drinks marked with a skull saying "DRINKS OF IMPRESSIVE STRENGTH", I expected that I would knock over at least two tiki huts and approximately 12 other patrons as I made my way to the bathroom.  Turns out, I hadn't the slightest buzz.  I was actually just kind of... tired.  Too much ice?  Not enough liquor?  Less time on creating the perfect landscape of a drink, more time turning the liquor bottle over in my glass.

And what was up with the flaming drinks that smelled like you left bread in the toaster oven a bit too long?

Again, I see the appeal and why people would enjoy this place, but I like more punch with my drinks, and not the tropical kind.

My friends and I ventured into this neat little bar to celebrate St. Patrick's Day in true American fashion: loud and drunk -- so be warned that this may not have been the best representation of my night.

I remembered the entrance being tucked away in a dark, creepy alley that we passed through a couple of times before we had the sense to recognize the people standing there were bouncers and ask, "Is this that place Three Dots and a Dash?" They confirmed that it was, and we stepped into an underground tropical bliss. Imagine skulls covering an entire wall and dim lighting with funky music in the background. Colorful lights and beachy theme and Hawaiian shirts. The decorations were good enough to convince us that we left chilly Chicago and entered into cocktail paradise.

The drinks somehow were way better when served in tiki heads and fun glasses with mini umbrellas and flowers as decorations. We ordered a drink with absinthe that was especially tasty along with appetizers of chips and guacamole that was devoured by the 4 of us in seconds. The chips had a similar texture to Asian prawn crackers/shrimp chips, but our waitress assured us they were made from corn.

This is an impressive place overall and kind of random (...which makes it that much better)! I definitely felt the island fever here :)

Definitely a fun place to bring friends from out of town. Who doesn't love a good tiki bar?! Plus it's a nice way to take a break from the bitter Chicago winter and get transported into a tiki world. The drinks are strong but the service is a little slower. Takes a solid 10 minutes to get a drink made, probably because there's just as much stuff goin' on on TOP of the drink as there is IN the drink. But honestly worth it, because like I said, the dranks are STRROOOONG. Seriously. Don't take that lightly.
Fun concept, kind of pretentious and service wasn't great. You're in someone's way anywhere you stand, and aren't made to feel too welcome by anyone. Bali Hai drink was good.

This place is fantastic.  What a great experience!  My husband and I are both tiki tourists and when we realized we were going to be in Chicago, we knew we had to visit this spot.  It is very important to try to get a reservation if you can, especially if you want to eat.  Otherwise, you may find yourself standing 4 deep at the bar, but it's still worth it.  The environment is somewhere between classic and modern tiki and everything you would want in a bar...dark, bamboo, candles and intimate booths, oh yeah, and skulls.  The staff is really into it as well, all dressed in some sort of tiki appropriate clothing.  The service is amazing - very attentive, nice and helpful.  The bartenders are definitely experts and very good at their craft.  There is a long list of both classic and new tiki drinks, including crazy bowls, smoke and lights.  We had several drinks, including the Crocodile Tuesday and Idle Hands Do the Devil's Work - both and all were well balanced and full of complex flavors.  We ordered the Pu Pu Platter which was listed for 3-4, but perfect for 2 who hadn't eaten dinner.  All of the food was the perfect combination of classic tiki food with a nice modern flavor (yucca fries, fried shrimp, pork meatballs, etc.).  Definitely visit this place and it would be a good idea to take an Uber because these drinks go down easy!

MaryKate is the absolute sole reason I had an amazing time at this fabulous tiki lounge. She gets 10 ten stars!!!

Being a busy gal, I don't get a chance to frequent all the local hot spots and, with the Chicago winter weather in full force, it's all I can do to get to point A to point B with very little deviation in between.

But not last Sunday. Despite bone chilling winds, my friend and I made it over to Three Dots and a Dash. Why, you may ask? Because I had the fortunate experience to meet MaryKate, who told me that I should come by sometime to where she worked. Now, this beautiful gal didn't just suggest it, you could tell she loved it. I mean, she wasn't even at work and she was gushing about how cool and fun it was. She genuinely likes it and, if she likes it that much, it's something to check out, right?

So, my friend and I go. He's vegan so the menu options are a little sparse but where aren't they unless you're at a vegan restaurant. First off, the decor is fabulous. My father, when I was growing up, made a tiki bar in our backyard. Yes. Complete with tiki torches, a grass bar, coconut cups, calypso lights strung around the fence, and a wooden totem that looked like a cheap knock off from Easter Island. Three Dots instantly, then, brought back some memories.

The banana daiquiri was delicious. My friend thought his was too strong so I helped him with it. It came, get this, with a half a banana carved to look like a dolphin with a ball in its mouth and it had a purple pansy. Adorbs.

Now, being the nerd I am, I actually was there to do work. My friend/bookkeeper and I had some things to go over. I was surprised that, while busy, the place wasn't obnoxiously loud. We could go over a few business things.

But, of course, the highlight was MaryKate. All I kept saying to my friend was, "isn't she so cute?!" Thanks, MaryKate. You made it a fantastic weekend!!!

This review is only of the atmosphere/ambiance. I think Three dots is a cool place to take friends from out of town to this unique tiki bar. The entrance is in an alley and when you take the stairs down to the bar you are welcomed with skulls which line the railing. Three dots does an amazing job with their drink presentation using sea creatures, clams, etc. I was there on a (an early) Saturday night around 9:00 p.m. and it felt a little collegiate to me, even though it was hard to see people since it is dimly lit. The bar was pretty packed and the seating is mostly booths around the perimeter. If you want to impress your friends with this unique tiki themed bar, suggest you give this place a try for the ambiance alone.

This place is a Polynesian paradise where the entrance is both easy and hard to find, the staff is kind and attentive, and the drinks pack a hell of a punch. I want to go back to there once I have recovered from going to there the first time without adequate preparation. I want all the Painkillers.

pics.caption: The Three Dots and a Dash - very good, but nothing beats a Painkiller.

review.des: The drinks were great and the atmosphere is really fun, but it's a bit too touristy and super expensive for me. If tiki drinks are your thing, don't miss it!

Love three dots and a dash! Great atmosphere.  Great drinks! Drink prices are comparable with tiki bars all over the city for a much better show/environment/drink taste!  Service is always great!

Although having your own space is nice, try sitting at the bar!  The bar tenders are so much fun.

In holiday came for drinks by our hotel, great ambiance and fun environment.  Couldn't wear my hat... That's ok the only thing I thought was challenging was ordering drinks.  Because the drinks are very gorgeous and great btw they take a bit to make, probably waited about 30 min standing way too close to this other guy to order a drink for me and my girl.  Overall very cool place not a lot of room to move around but if you're in town I would recommend it.  Cool spot awesome drinks

Great Bar and Specialty Drinks.  Great decor and friendly staff. Food is about average and could be greatly improved upon.

Specialty Drinks unique variations plus the gigantic share one's make this a great place.

Music is hopping..more club type

Nice place, line tends to be long and I am not sure if it is worth it.

Drinks are cool and strong but the place feels like another tourist attraction or good spot for girls night.

Been there twice and it was enough for me - worth to try at least once

Is Yelp deleting reviews? Because I swear I wrote a review for Three Dots and a Dash over a year ago.

Growing up in the Boston area, there were plenty of fun, cheap, greasy Chinese-American restaurants. They were described as Polynesian restaurants and they had bright south Pacific tropical decor. They had tropical with names like Zombie, Suffering Bastard, Navy Grog etc.

Three Dots and a Dash is basically the same decor but Three Dots and a Dash is much more upscale with much higher quality drinks and food. And the decor is more elegant with dark wood with a 1940's colonial spin on it.

The service is always friendly The pretty waitresses wear those long and elegant tropical dresses. I forget what music they play though.

The only drawback of Three Dots and a Dash is that it takes a LONG time to get a drink since the garnishes are complex.

Fun & cool  place - if you have a reservation or know someone give it a try. Standing room seems less ideal since lounge is intimate and cozy. Individual drinks are $13 a piece and come in unique mugs - sweet tasting and some stronger than others.

Favorites of the night: Dead Reckoning & Aku Aku Lapu. The frozen tiki cocktail was surprisingly strong. Attention to detail in drink presentation with each uniquely different.

Here, you could enjoy a Friday happy hour with friends.
The special glasses for the drink are so attractive and you will ignore the taste of drinks, lol

Once upon a time at a college campus far, far away, a 19 year old version of myself decided it would be a good idea to drink Captain Morgan straight from the bottle with a straw - partly because the party was out of chasers but mainly because I mistakenly thought myself to be a badass. Fast forward 5 years and the smell of rum alone still makes me squeamish - so much that I can barely eat pina colada flavored jelly beans. I really wanted to love Three Dots and a Dash - the interior is fantastic, the drinks are gorgeous...and all except one item on the menu contain rum.

I came here for my birthday with a friend a few months back - he got a Painkiller (which he loved) and after scouring the menu, I ordered the one gin-based drink in the joint (the Saturn) which, admittedly so, was still very good but I would have liked to have had more options. Call me crazy if I don't immediately associate "tiki bar" with "you'd better like rum" but hey, maybe I'm just an optimist. I will give major props for the strength of the drinks - they may be $13 a pop but they certainly get the job done.

The staff was wonderful and the door guy promptly wished me a "happy birthday!" after checking my ID. We only waited for a few minutes for a spot to open up at the bar (granted, this was a Wednesday night). All in all, great place for a date or meeting up with friends after work.

Throw another gin or maybe even a vodka drink on your menu, Three Dots and a Dash, and maybe I'll upgrade you to a full 5 stars.

I haven't been on a real vacation in years, yet I escaped to the tropics for a couple of hours last night when my husband and I went to Three Dots and a Dash. It was just as I had hoped. It was very themey and resorty. The cocktails were special, fruity, and refreshing, and they were served in the coolest of vessels. The service was fantastic too! As a special treat, the tattooed bouncer outside the entrance, which is in a back ally for a speakeasy tiki bar effect (Whoever heard of a speakeasy tiki bar?), was reading a book. Go for the tiki gods and skulls. Go for the tropical cocktails with little paper umbrellas and skewers of fruit. Go for the tattoed bouncer reading a book. Three Dots and a Dash is sheer kitsch and class.

Amazing environment. It was fairly busy but the wait at the bar was nothing to complain about. Gave us time to review the menu and make our selection. The bartenders we're efficient and friendly. Fun place!

Waitresses and bartenders were both super friendly and accommodating, but manager (?) confronted me about using the men's room,  made me feel extremely unwelcome and interrogated me like I was doing something wrong, was literally just trying to use a bathroom, complete asshole about it and probably won't return.

I've been here twice, and I always recommend to people who like something out of the ordinary.

The Banana Daiquiri and the Three Dots and a Dash are both great! I love that they make the drinks into an art, and the banana dolphin is my favorite. However, the drinks are pretty strong.

Context: Went here with some coworkers. This was my first time at a tikki bar and I was really digging the atmosphere.

Pros: The containers the drinks came in were gorgeous and the drinks themselves were great. The dead reckoning was my favorite.

Cons: None

I love Three Dots and a Dash for after work drinks and relaxation!

The cocktails are expensive but are worth it for the creativity, presentation, and amount of booze. The bartenders are attentive and seem to have a lot of experience. The bar is usually filled with travelers and good conversation.

Tips:
- go on "off hours"
- don't expect the place to accommodate large groups.

Cheers!
Definitely get there early!! I'm from out or town and my friend enjoyed it. The drinks are really good and there food looks good. Great environment and amazing presentation in the drinks!!

I was hesitant to try this place because I don't normally like fruity and/or sweet drinks. I'm so, so glad I gave it a shot anyway. They have a good variety of drinks that worked for me and ended up being much stronger than anticipated. The cocktails are mixed well, have high quality ingredients, and are different from what you can get in other bars. The presentation of the drinks is great and the decoration is fun - think tiki bar.

Tip: make reservations because they get pretty busy. Also, if you're hungry you may want to eat beforehand. They do have food but it's mostly finger food and not ideal for dinner.

I was once a big fan of this spot but no longer am!
YOu cannot get in without  a reservation, bar is always too crowded, menu has been reduced!

I went here after dinner last Friday and the hosts were extremely rude!! We wanted to inquire how long it would be for a table and we were told "there i no way in hell we would get a table tonight" How dare you speak to a customer like that? When we walked in we saw several tables that were apparently "Reserved" but not sat while we were there.

WIll not be back and do not reccomend - several other palces in River North worth your time and money!

Being from Milwaukee I have pretty high expectations for Tiki bar being just down the road from one of the best Tiki bars I've ever ben to- Foundation (in Riverwest)

However, I was pleasantly surprised with how well it compared.  The entrance is in an alley off of Hubbard with blue lights on the side of the building leading to the entrance.  The whole look of the place was very on-theme, well put together and very inviting. The drinks were many and exciting... didn't want to pick up and go home!

Cant wait to go back!

Wow, one second you're inside and treated like a king, but as soon as you're out the door they treat you like scum.  Way to trick me for my money then act like it never happens.  GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE GUYS.  Really.  Props to the door men.  I'm never coming back.
Really fun drinks which will leave a lasting impression.  Drinks are overpriced, but you are paying for the presentation and cool vibes.  Make a reservation before you go.

I am unfortunately so torn about this place..I had been wanting to go for so long. It's definitely worth going to, probably one of the coolest bars I've ever gone to.
I ordered a three dots and a dash, I have to say that for being named after the bar, this drink had a very particular taste, one not partial to my taste buds... I will hopefully have a better selection the next time.
My bf got the dead reckoning and they are not kidding about the "impressive strength" lol.

I definitely want to go back, highly recommended for a really cool night out on the town!

pics.caption: Three dots and a dash & dead reckoning

review.des: Three dots and a dash... for the door. Came to Chicago for a girls weekend, were looking for a cool spot to hang out and have a drink or two. Found this bar on yelp and saw the "glowing" reviews (lol) so decided to check it out. It was 8:30 pm, there was a 15 minute wait to get in, no big deal... however once inside that is where the night crashed and burned. No on greeted us when we walked in since we did not have a reservation, we were just peasants... ignore ignore. Walked into the main room to music that was interesting to say the least, and tables of people eating. There was crunched standing room only. You can hardly move let alone get to the bar- and god forbid you step outside the boundaries of their ropes for a breath of air. You feel the wrath of the tiki gods. "This is a high traffic area." Uh yeah when you cram all these standing people into a basement there is going to be high traffic. What was also concerning was the lack of security in a big city in this day and age. No one was checked when they entered, it was dark and packed, anything could have happened. Also when you have flaming drinks the fire hazard combined with all of the people is very real. The drinks were pricey which is to be expected in the city, they tasted mediocre at best. I almost wished I could have got a buzz to maybe somewhat enjoy myself, but my friend said to me please down these drinks as fast as you can do we can get out of here. Needless to say this bar was all hype and no delivery. Sadly disappointing we wasted our time and money. The dash to the door was the highlight of our time there. Next. My money would have been better spent at the candy bar- at least we left there happy.
Great drink food was not very good. Just get the drinks and eat elsewhere. Staff is friendly.  I do find the bouncers at the entrance a bit ridiculous especially in the middle of the day.

Amazing environment. It was fairly busy but the wait at the bar was nothing to complain about. Gave us time to review the menu and make our selection. The bartenders we're efficient and friendly. Fun place!
Such a fun spot! Came while I was in town for work. The drinks are DELICIOUS. I wish I could have consumed more of them. I will definitely be back.

Very cute spot!i It is a little difficult to find but once inside you are in a different world! We tried a fee of their classic drinks which were ok. I was not blown away but nonetheless they are good. I will be back!

I love me a tiki bar. I love the clandestine look of the bar with the alley entrance and the escorting you down the stairs and too your table. Excellent tiki ambiance. Very creative and good drinks. Good little appetizers. This a destination place so it's good to have the time to enjoy it.
AMAZING. The drinks are strong and delicious and the Thai chicken is to die for. One of the coolest drink hangouts in chicago. It's a must see!

Wonderful space - we almost missed it, but I saw the small sign in the alley. The theme was really well executed, from the tropical lighting and decor to the vintage-style decorated menu book. Service was great, and the Aloha Felicia (creamy coconut rum drink) was my favorite. Great for small groups - even though this place has a lot of reviews and is clearly popular, it felt special and clandestine to get to experience it. Can't wait to go back.

Had our Christmas Eve party here in Tuesday. The chicken was good but the short rib on coconut rice was outta the park. I am not one for fruity drinks so I am  a bad judge of them. Others said they were good

pics.caption: Flaming skull of fruity alcohol laden goodness

review.des: This place is amazing. My friends and I can each find a drink we're obsessed, even though we each have very different preferences, with because they've got everything. The atmosphere is incredible. I've only ever come in with a reservation, and never on a Friday or Saturday night--not a place I'd personally hit up at a peak time, since they're usually hopping during times I would think would be a little calmer. A must do Chicago experience!

We stumbled into this bar after dinner and we're not disappointed. The drinks were delicious and our waitress was very knowledgeable. They had shareable drinks that looked delicious, a bit more than we were looking to spend though. Worth checking out and great music!

You have to come down the alley to get into this place, even though the address says it's on Clark it's not really. There is a door guy even though it's 5:30pm in the afternoon. We were only the 2nd party in the room it looked like, and yet other reservation times were not available on Open Table. It was a cold and dreary day, and so it was welcoming to come to a tiki themed place to pretend that we were some place warm. I got the No Bye No Aloha drink and that was very tasty and good alcohol level content for me. We also got several food items:

banh mi - pretty good
hanali spring rolls - didn't really care for this, and did not like any of the 4 sauces
polynesian spare ribs - pretty good
pork belly buns - the best item we had

In fact, I didn't like any of the sauces and I am a sauce girl. I like to dip stuff. Nothing really blew me away in flavor. It's nice to have food if you are drinking but these are bit pricier on the appetizer side. Of course when you come to a place like this it's really about the drinks and not the food. Our waitress was really nice, and it was a very chill spot. I might have to come back when it's super busy to test out what it like later in the evening as a lounge spot.

Lovely ambiance, great fun delicious drinks! Ask for the Haitian Rum :)
for late night drinks there is usually line, it does tend to go fast.You can try going a bit earlier to skip the line.They also take reservations for tables if you want, but I recommend doing it a few days in advance (I usually just go to the bar). I had work event there one time (we rented the whole room) and the food was good.

Do you want to be transported to a Tiki Bar in the dead cold of a Chicago winter. Well now you can, at Three Dots and a Dash. In my opinion, the most unique and an always guaranteed good time. So a little shady when you try to get there, as its through an alley right by Firecakes Donuts.... just look for the line. Let me tell you, there is almost ALWAYS a line... but that being said, it is completely worth it for the good music, fun drinks, which by the way are SO STRONG and I swear they NEVER END.

It's fun, and it decorated with such Hawaiian flare that you almost forget the freezing that's happening outside this little bit of heaven. So get some sunshine to warm you up, if you know what I mean... with some belly warming tiki drinks that keep you warm when you end up trekking back outside into the Windy City.

This place was such a surprise!  Very good service and a nice selection of drinks.  The drinks were so very strong.  My girlfriends and I only had a drink a piece but that was more than enough at this cute tiki bar!

We spent 2016 New Years here with great friends and amazing tiki drinks! I had the bourbon drink which was served in a giant pineapple cup. The appetizers were amazing. We got coconut shrimp and crab Rangoon. The music was great and the booze selection was perfect. Only thing they need to add is more Kentucky bourbon!

Three Dots and a Dash is a fun downtown place for a night out. I went with my cousin when she was in town, loved the skulls along with wall as you went down into the bar. The entrance is kind of funny and easy to pass if you don't know where to look (the entrance is in the alley!). The drinks aren't any higher than a downtown bar, but their mixed rum drinks are strong! Didn't try the food, but the menu looks good.

Love this place! The decor makes you feel like you're on a mini vacay. The music and DJ were great, and the drinks... So fun and tasty. My favorite was the Pain Killer No. 3, a must try!

Food: small portions but good. Had the coconut shrimp, Crab Rangoon, and Thai fried chicken which was all great.

Only negative thing I would say is be prepared to wait outside if you don't make a reservation, but it's well worth it once you get in.

pics.caption: Jet Pilot & Dead Reckoning (although I think they gave me the wrong drink according to the drink pictures) Still good though!

review.des: Great place to come drink and have good appetizers. Great place to get drunk and hang with friends! Reserve a table waasssay in advance though because it's a wait list out side in the alley to get inside.

Me and my boyfriend had our first tiki bar experience here and it did not disappoint! The bar was so cute and made me feel like I was somewhere tropical. The drinks weren't too expensive for one, and the banana drink was really good! Apps are tiny and expensive, but kind of expected that.
I really think this is a great spot to kick back with friends and grab a drink or two with great vibes!

I hesitate to write this review, but seems the secret is already out, so maybe it doesn't matter?!

I tried getting reservations weeks in advance - no dice. So instead we rolled the dice when walking back to our hotel and popped in here hoping for the best. The bar was ultra-crowded, and a couple tables were empty because they were "reserved." Ugh. But we hung out for a few minutes, and just as my social anxiety started kicking in, a few people vacated the bar and we slid in - like it was meant to be.

Bartenders were super friendly, I loved the vibe, and the drinks were tasty! I got the Aloha Felicia and my husband got the Western Sour. I didn't care for his drink and vice versa, but we each liked our own. That's what matters, right?!

I really just enjoyed watching the bartenders work. They had dolphin bananas behind the bar (serious photo op) and had this weird skull that they'd stick some tube into and create bubbles to top drinks with. Lots to observe!

This should be on your list of must-see places in Chicago, for sure.

This place is fun, I guess. I maybe didn't have the same experience as everyone else did since we came here on a Monday night and it was pretty calm and empty (which is to be expected).
This place is hidden in an alley and it was my friend who brought us here. I guess the hidden aspect adds to its appeal.
As it is a tiki bar, the star of the menu are the fancy cocktails. They are all served in really cute mugs/glasses - see pics. And they are just gorgeous to look at, but 13 bucks a pop so not exactly cheap.
They were all delicious though!
The service could be considered as good, since the waitress literally was over at out table every 10 minutes asking us if everything was ok and filling up our glasses with water. (They brought over a pitcher of water and glasses - I guess they don't want anyone getting too messy after the cocktails lol). Quite often, another server kept coming over trying to take away our cocktails which weren't finished yet. I get that the glasses/mugs aren't transparent and so you can't see if the person has finished yet or not, but damn let me savor my 13 buck drink. It appeared also that some peeps tried stealing the cups (said something on the menu about the cups are not meant to be stolen - duh lol- and that you can purchase them at the shop if you want to take them home), so I guess maybe that explains why they were so eager to take away our drinks? I could see that being an issue on crowded weekends, or people drinking fast on weekends, but come on, it was a Monday night, and I'm not going to finish my drink in 20 minutes lol.
The waitress also kind of was putting pressure on us to order more each time she passed by, and I just wasn't feeling that. I mean don't worry, we're going to get more than one round, but stop hovering over our table. Maybe I've been living in France too long, where servers pretty much leave you alone. One extreme or the other, eh? While I prob wouldn't come back here again next time I'm in Chicago, I could see why people think this is a fun place. The cocktails are beautiful and tasty too, but be prepared to drop some cash! Lol

I visited here with a bachlorette party on a Saturday night.  My uber driver had a hard time finding it, as it is hidden in an alley with a very tiny sign.  **Note to anyone visiting for the first time, around the corner from Firecake Donuts...follow the blue neon lights!

It was packed, which was to be expected.  It took me almost 15 minutes to place my drink order and get it, which I understand as the drinks do require a lot of ingredients.  Once I was actually able to try my drink it was good, but I think I was a bit underwhelmed.  I had the painkiller no.639.  The presentation was beautiful, the flavor was okay.  

The party only ended up having 1 round of drinks before we were ready to leave....mostly because it smelled like someone was blowing FART BOMBS! At first we thought it was actually someone around us passing gas, but it became sooooo smelly and it would come in waves that we ultimately had to leave.
Awesome cocktails and tiki style that stays on correct side of swanky vs. cheesy. Has slipped a little since Paul McGee's departure, but still awesome evening getaway -- especially in winter.

Amazing drinks. They are on the expensive side but the drinks are quite strong. The more skulls the more potent the drink! Great music with an older crowd. It was hard to find at first because you do have to go through an alley to get to the door!

Trust me when I say that I love work happy hours. No, not because I get to small talk for a couple hours with people I already see 50+ hours a week. Or because I have to continue to wear awfully painful heels or flats instead of snow boots in 30 degree weather. I mostly love them because I get to go to awesome bars and drink/eat for free. And spend some time with some of my coworkers that I love.

We went to Three Dots and a Dash last night and let me tell you, I woke up with an awful sugar hangover this morning. I knew it would happen when I was having a sugar rush after finishing my first drink, but I regrettably went for another. When the drinks are as fruity as they are, all I could think about at the time was "mmmm, this tastes like juice." Now all I'm thinking is "uughhhh, that had the effects of jungle juice."

I got two of their cocktail concoctions and both were pretty tasty, albeit sugary as I mentioned earlier. The Painkiller with coconut, passion fruit, and pineapple was delicious. Seriously so good. I'm not much of a rum person nor a fan of sugar drinks, but this was so tasty. The sugar will definitely hit you, so I would suggest only having one of their cocktails, but if you can handle more, go for it! I went for a second (hey, it was free!) and since I'm a gin fan, I went for the Saturn with passion fruit, lemon, etc. It was delicious, definitely less sweet and it had more of a punch. The server said it was her favorite and I would definitely agree. After those two, I decided to step up my classiness to mask any potential messiness and ordered a split of Moet. My favorite.

We also had passed around appetizers, and I was the hugest fan of the Pork Belly Buns (my shirt was too). They were so delicious and the sauce that the pork belly was glazed in was yummy. Everyone was also a fan of the "Luau Chips," which were basically guac on a rice cracker. And it was pretty much like crack. I think I had 5 of them by the end of the night. We also had Crab Rangoon and Coconut Shrimp which were also good, but nothing spectacular.

The service was also amazing!! We had 2-3 servers for our large group, and all of them were so attentive, sweet, nice, and always made sure we had everything we wanted. Including water.

We arrived right when they opened (we had a reservation). I would highly recommend a reservation it filled up quickly. The drinks were strong. Listen to the recommendations of the servers. We ordered the chips and guacamole. It was fantastic. Restaurant is very dark and we had to use our phones to see the menus. Would return with friends for drinks.

Fun. We first went to go on a sat night and there was a huge line at the door. So we waited until Sunday around 6pm and got in with no wait. Atmosphere was fun and funky. Great drink selection. Glassware was awesome. Definitely worth a visit but plan accordingly because it's a hot spot.
What a fun place came for drink and dinner. Friend and I shared the pu pu platter. I will definitely come back!!! Good pour on drinks too.
Drinks are pretty good, some cocktail places have better but this is up in the top ten.
Awful drinks. Terrible service. Rude staff. The drinks had a strong clove taste that was very over powering. Worst drinks I've ever had.

Holy Hell! This place is ridiculously awesome (if you are allowed to put those words together)...
I really only write reviews if the place sux or is exceptional...Three Dots, truly is exceptional.
If you are lucky enough to get Scott as a bartender, you are in for an even bigger treat. The drinks are in no way watered down...and the vibe is super kewl.
I can't wait to return.

Great place for a girls night! Their cocktails are awesome. They're expensive, but if this is a girl's night out and you wanna treat yourself, this is definitely the place to do it. It's a tiki bar with a really cool atmosphere.

LOVE Three Dots!  This place is perfect for starting your night, hosting a bachelor/bachelorette/birthday party, having a happy hour, or a date night.  

From the creative and beautiful drinks, to the delicious eats, Three Dots has a little something for everyone.  I've tried several of their cocktails (not on the same days--they are STRONG) and their chicken bites are to die for.  The service is always attentive and helpful, and the ambiance is trendy, yet festive with a tiki bar motif.

This place gets extremely crowded, but they do take reservations--I highly recommend making one!  You won't be disappointed in your experience here.

This bar is pretty fun! My husband and I stayed across the street and always saw lines early in the evening here. When we came back to stay in the area without the kids we had to check it out. We arrived early on a saturday around 4:45 to avoid any lines.

This is a very kitschy place! We both agreed that it would be a better experience if we were with a group of friends than alone on a date.

The drinks were very sweet tasting but we had a good chuckle when they came out. We also tried the egg rolls and they were ok. Nothing spectacular though.

This is easily my favorite bar in Chicago. I am partial to fruity drinks, but they're amazing here. I would highly recommend the Jet Pilot, Saturn, and The "Catchen" Some Rays (in that order) for cocktails. If you are not a fan of tasting alcohol in your drinks, Three Dots is well worth the price; their drinks are very potent and the especially potent ones are marked with a skull symbol on the menu. Yet you hardly taste the alcohol, yet let me tell you there is plenty! Most people will be well buzzed after two drinks (if you're into that, otherwise pace yourself :D ). The drinks are expertly prepared with so many ingredients it would be hard to make a comparable cocktail at home - to me the true definition of whether forgoing $13 on a cocktail is worth it! The ambience - as cliché as it sounds - does make you feel like you're on an island in the Pacific, even if you're in the heart of the Midwest. The bar has a solid music playlist too, and a very intimate feel even if it is one of the most acclaimed and therefore popular cocktail bars in town.

Three Dots and a Dash is so popular there is a line down the alley by 9pm onwards (at least on Friday and Saturday nights). I came here on the earlier end, around 7pm on a Friday night. This way I was easily able to score a coveted table, even with my party of 5. Besides, it's worth it to grab a table because then you can order a massive group drink that is too large to be standing.

I came back to the bar last week and the menu was unchanged, great because it is already near perfection. I came around 10pm after another bar and waited in line for only 10 minutes (but it was a cold winter night and last time I came was in the summer). I somehow managed to grab a table for 3 by asking the hostess at the front - so just ask, it's worth it!

pics.caption: The "Blood of the Kapu Tiki" shared drink, well worth it!

review.des: Came in for a drink with friends at midnight on a Saturday. Place was packed and we waited about 30-45 minutes for a table. Its a different scene from the one my friends and I are used to here in Miami, but it was nice. No one was dancing but the music they played was pretty good. We ordered the Piece of Eight cocktail for the four of us to share, which is what every girl group was doing haha. It was nice and refreshing, not too strong. Prices seem reasonable as well.

What a hidden gem!  I visited here with some coworkers during the weeknight on a business trip to Chicago. We almost didn't find the place, secretly tucked away in an alley with a tiny sign you can barely see. I was waiting for a doorman to slide open a tiny window and ask for a password to enter!  We were immediately transported to another world as we entered the bar with narrow stone covered passages. At the bottom of it all, it opens into a very large room decked out in tiki decor. Very hip!  
They have a limited food menu, but we weren't there to eat. Each of us ordered a fruity concoction. The bartender was amazing!  No, I mean really!  Making 4-6 specialty fruity drinks at once without missing a beat. Each came in their own tiki themed mug and he added edible flowers and fruit garnish- these were works of art. One of the drinks even comes with dry ice smoking out of a skull head. Sic.
Gotta check out the hip place if you are in the Chicago area. It was packed on a Tuesday - I can only imagine what the weekends are like with a dj!  Enjoy!

The drinks are good. The place has a good vibe. But it is just not worth waiting in line for on busier week end nights. Just my opinion. Every where that is decent is busy in the area. So it is what it is. Go on a week day or at an earlier time...

Tiki-tastic! The drinks and atmosphere are the highlights here, although the food was solid as well! It is a super great place to have a quiet date or also to bring a group! Reservations are reccomended, and I didn't have a drink I didn't enjoy! They are all fruit and tropical forward, but there is something even for those who prefer things not too sweet (like myself). I promise you will have a great time!

I adored Three Dots and a Dash on my first visit, but my group *may* have received preferential treatment, so I'm not sure I'd love it as much as the average Joe that doesn't get to skip the line.

Once inside this cozy lounge, you'll either be seated at a table, a comfy booth, or be doomed standing amongst those gathered around the bar.  We were the lucky ones again that night and within minutes were seated in a booth.

Cocktails are $13 and worth it.  I had the Banana Daiquiri, which was blended perfectly and did not taste too strongly of alcohol, but I hear these will catch up to you.  Three Dots pays careful attention to the presentation of their drinks.  This one was served with a half of a banana, artfully carved into a dolphin.  There was a tiny candied cherry wedged into it's beak, as if it couldn't get any cuter...

The music here is current but keeps in theme.  They stay away from the cheesy Polynesian music and play more dance-able music with a tropical feel like Shaggy, Sean Paul, and Rhianna.  With our group of six, I was able to somewhat comfortably converse with almost everyone.  I had to strain a bit to hear across the table, but that happens to me a lot.  

Three Dots is "hidden" in an alley, but it isn't too difficult to find once you're aware of this.  I'm down with the whole "hidden and chic" appearance, but standing in line surrounded by metal dumpsters really takes away from that allure.  

I really loved Three Dots, but as I said, we got preferential treatment on a Saturday night and got to skip the line (sorry, I won't say how or why).  I don't know if I'd wait in that kind of line though, since the wait once you get inside is likely to continue.
