The burgers were decent.  Poo poo platter less good. Crab Rangoon tasted bizarrely fishy since there's usually almost no actual fish. Tuna poke ok but nothing I'd come back for.  

The drinks were just silly.  I get it. But doesn't mean i like it.  Polynesian restaurant serves fruity-sweet/ridiculous tiki drinks in kitschy glasses.  Perhaps fine for some.  Just not me.
If you're looking for great ambience this place is phenomenal.   Presentation is also unbelievable.   All the drinks are made wth rum so I wasn't a fan of the actual drinks.

Extremely rude service not only by the servers but by the manager as well. We sat down at a table and were completely ignored by the waitress for 15 minutes, the table was dirty, and the management was extremely rude when asked to come to the table. The host had attitude and did not give any help when asked. If you want to be treated by compete trash by management and employees this is the place to go!!

Amazing cocktail join!
A hidden tiki bar in the middle of city madness.
Great way of serving the stings each in its own unique mug. Services is great and the bar tender really knowledgable.

Very pricey, but overall a wonderful atmosphere! Down to their drinks, food, tiki themed decorations - absolutely unique and such good vibes. I had the big kahuna burger - which I'm actually glad wasn't as big as I expected - and OMG it was savory and delicious!!! 100% coming back soon!

Get the spring rolls! Bartenders are super kind and helpful! This place is a little "too cool" and too crowded after midnight. It seems there's always a group or two in there that don't know where they are...this is not the place for buttery nipple shots and bud light lol. It is a place where you might discover you actually like the rum and the coconut...

A tiki bar?  In River North?  Where is this little gem, said I on a cold and blustery night as my friends and I tried to remember exactly where we had been told it was.

Well I walked into an alley to find a line of shivering people waiting to get in to what is clearly the hottest place in RIver North.  And while I normally don't wait in line for much, the group I was with worked some connections and we were moved to the front of the line (sometimes it's just who you know!)

We walked down the stairs and into the most crowded tiki bar I have ever been to.  But don't doubt that this is Tiki at it's best.  I have heard that some of the décor is straight from the now defunct Trader Vics and that's easy to believe when you look around this space.  We fought our way to the bar and managed to carve out a small space for our group standing in the aisle and looked over the drink menu.  

You know that some of these drinks pack a wallop as they are labeled "Sip delicately"!  Ha!  So you know we went straight to those!  And if that isn't enough- some of them come in collector mugs so you can tiki again at home.  And while we didn't eat on this visit- they do serve a number of small plates like chicken skewers that you can nibble on between sips of your exotic drink.

While this place is huge (the bar alone probably has 25 or more seats at it) it gets really crowded so I need to go back on a less busy night and see if my overall experience goes up but I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt.

My favorite kind of tiki bar is usually on a beach where I can see the ocean while sipping my umbrella drink.  But in a pinch, on a cold Winter's night, Three Dots and a Dash may be just ne the antidote to Winter that we are all looking for!

First off, if it's not super busy and thus there's no line outside, Three Dots and a Dash can be pretty hard to find. Actually, even if there is the normal line it's a bit tricky. Located in an alleyway off of Hubbard, Three Dots is a speakeasy-like tiki bar that is a haven for island wear in the cold Chicago winter. Look for the velvet queue barricades and across from those is the door.

This place is super super fun, but if you don't make a reservation or come early, it's going to be packed and you're going to have to stand until you can swoop into an opening bar seat. Which isn't the worst thing in the world, except the drinks come in these awesome cups that are pretty heavy/uncomfortable to hold however cute they are. To give you an idea of how creative they get with presentation, one drink has a banana that looks like a dolphin with a cherry in it's mouth. Don't believe me? I got photo evidence.

The drinks are fresh, fun, and super yummy. I'm into rum but my boyfriend is a whiskey guy whose motto is "the bitter the better" and both of us found multiple somethings we loved. I got the Dr. Funkhouser and the Dead Reckoning, he got the Poipu Beach Boogie Board and Jet Pilot. They were *highly* potent. You can also get punch bowls to share.

The staff may be the only bartenders I ever met who seem like they are ENJOYING what they are doing. Actually, I know he was enjoying what he was doing because he told me. They mingle with the customers, the customers mingle with one another, so that it kinda feels like you're just at this big party and they're the hosts.

Overall, Three Dots and a Dash is a unique bar that is excellent for dates, girls' night outs, and people of all ages at all times of the year.

pics.caption: The Boogie Board (left) and Dr. Funkhouser (right)

review.des: Last night we took our cousin there for his 21st, and the staff were great. The moment we sat down our waitress brought out a lay and a free shot for the birthday boy. The drink menu had a ton of options. I ended up ordering the Bluths Banana one, it was very sweet and delicious. My cousins ordered the least sugary drink and stuck with that the rest of the night. The bathrooms are clean and nice, the service was stellar and the decor was fun. I highly recommend going but make a reservation so you're not stuck standing with big drinks.

Absolutely love this place and is a MUST-GO especially if you are a cocktail person! They have a wide variety of cocktails and they come in really unique cups with various designs with fresh fruits too!
They also have these massive chests and bowls if you come with a big group!
The atmosphere is really chill, and the staff are all so considerate and always willing to help out and recommend a drink :)
It's a great place to hang out, chill with your friends or to pre-game before heading to the next bar.

"Tiki, but never tacky"

There, Three D's and a -, I've come up with your new slogan. You're welcome. You can reward me with more absinthe-soaked fruit and flaming limes celebrating my birthday. Seriously this place takes Hawaiian tchotchke to a new level and it's amazing. Every surface, every detail screams tiki, and none of it came from Oriental Express. Or Party City. Who knew tiki had an upscale sister? Not to mention there are outlets behind the booths to conveniently charge your devices. Thoughtful!

The Mister took me to Three D's for a few birthday cocktails before dinner. At 6pm on Friday, we were still able to get a table, though we felt like royalty doing so since it was the last one available. Naturally I had to try two cocktails with the ever lovely warning, "Drinks of Impressive Strength. Please Sip Responsibly". Well, it was my birthday, and I'll sip as recklessly as I choose! Actually even after two of these potent potions I was still fine. A little warm... but fine.

The server steered me away from the sweeter concoctions, which I thought was going to be a challenge in Miss Hawaiian Tropic Central, but actually she informed me there were only two bevvies I would hate. Perhaps I will eventually prove her right. Or wrong!

I tried the Dr. Funkhouser with rum, absinthe, and  tequila (hey-o!) and the Jet Pilot with four rums. Because one or two or even three just weren't quite right. Both were great, but the Jet Pilot was rad. The Mister had the Poipu Beach Boogie Board, which is the Manhattan of the Tiki World. It was actually great.

I'll see you again, Three D's, if only to get my hands on the $400 Treasure Chest No. 2. I can only imagine what Treasure Chest No.1 looked like.

Oh, and to the people splitting the shareable drinks... did you not go to college? Do you not already have a photo of yourself and three other nerds sipping out of a fishbowl with extra long straws? Theses servers are working hard and nobody has time for your Spring Break Mexico circa 2002 repeat. Let them do their jobs and not be your photographer while simultaneously blinding the other patrons. (It's pretty dark in there, kids.) Take a selfie if you'll just die without the photo op.

pics.caption: You don't know me of you think I sip delicately

review.des: I bring all out of towners and here! I want to show off a place in an alley with a wall of skulls greeting you that isn't an organ stealing operation, and also bringing someone to an underground tiki bar gives you cool points. The drinks are incredible, and while some might say its expensive I disagree. The prices are comparable to any cocktail in the city, but the presentation is far beyond what just any bar does. Do you have an entire basil shrub in you $12 vodka tonic? I don't think so. This place can get pretty packed so I'd recommend going on a weeknight or off hour. Enjoy.

Here, like you visit Hawaii or some vacation place. Just hide underneath of chicago downtown. You can find one place giving you a short break. Nice place hang out with your friends. Having some fancy drinks with special unique mugs. Great experience.

Based on my taste in alcohol beverages, you could say I'm the furthest thing from a tiki bar girl. I despise rum. And I hate sickly sweet (or even moderately sweet) cocktails. But even I can't deny that Three Dots & a Dash is an nifty little spot that has filled a niche here in Chicago. No one hangs out at a tiki bar every day/weekend (nor should they), but as a novelty, and a place to take others (maybe out-of-towners), it works well.

As tiki bars should be, it's dark (basement), though I could totally use some more kitsch. The glasses are different for every drink, and I'm not going to lie - could totally be worth it to choose a drink just based on the mug it comes in. Presentation is spectacular (especially the flaming bowls).

And even me, rum hater, can find a good cocktail (specifically, Pinky Gonzales). Golden Glove is one of the "less sweet" options, or Ports of Call.

Expect a line on weekends. When busy, best to try and grab a spot at the bar to have a captive bartender. People may complain about service, but tiki bar bartenders have to have one of the hardest jobs out there (EVERY drink is a piece of work). So keep that in mind.

It was almost S.O.S. when we arrived at Three Dots and a Dash without a reservation, because despite the early (for Chicago nightlife) hour there was already a line. Since the weather is getting cold, be sure to plan ahead! (Really: the smelly, guttering tiki torches that rim the alley need to be replaced with heating torchieres.)

Speaking of the alley, despite the fact that they are seemingly trying to cultivate a quasi-speakeasy vibe, you can still find it pretty readily. If you're walking on Clark, look in the alley between Hubbard and Illinois (conveniently lit with blue neon); you will see a small sign hanging from the building (pass the service door for Bub City, oh yeah and look for those tiki torches). If there is a wait, don't buy it if they tell you ten minutes; it was closer to twenty.

Once enough people came out to let us in, we made the odyssey down the skull-lined passage into the cavernous depths of the lobby where we were met by...a Polynesian sage? A harem of hula girls? No, the hostess in a Hawaiian print maxi dress and huge hipster glasses, who told us there was standing room at the bar or we could wait for a table. The wait wasn't bad and we were soon ensconced in a clubby little booth along the bamboo-lined wall.

The cocktail menu is huge, and unless you are an advanced mixologist you won't be able to guess what any of these drinks will taste like, since there are so many ingredients in each and the average person probably isn't familiar with falernum, orgeat and fernet. Might as well pick the one with the most fun mug and go from there.

I chose the eponymous Three Dots and a Dash, which was rather spicy (probably due to its ingredients of allspice and falernum). Interesting, but I would try something else next time. My friend went with the Golden Glove, in a slender, gilded bamboo-shaped glass, and despite it not being a very large glass, and not one of the drinks indicated to be particularly strong (which are marked with a skull on the menu), she was quickly on her ass. We offset the booze with food: crab rangoon, coconut shrimp, and Thai fried chicken; all good, particularly the last.

Ambiance is fabulous: the lighting, the music, the sand terrarium centerpieces on your table. The place is run by Lettuce Entertain You and those folks know how to put a restaurant together. I'm too young to have crossed paths with the original Trader Vic's, and the fabled Chin Tiki of Detroit (RIP) closed just after I was born. But I don't know who wouldn't love this! Loosen up and enjoy.

After one drink, though, we were ready to bail. My friend had been overcome by her cocktail, and a table of four squealing twentysomething girls arrived beside us, quickly sucking down the Scorpion Bowl group cocktail they'd ordered. Once we finally flagged the bustling waitress, we made the malevolently lurking table-counting guy happy [this being the dude who relays via earpiece to the doorman when there will be space for new customers] and headed out.

Overall, it was fun to spend an hour or two in the islands and shake off the chill of the Chicago night! Three Dots was a victorious choice for an unusual evening out!

This place is a nice retreat from a cold Chicago February night.

The drinks are strong, so they're worth the money. I had one of the pain killers (with pineapple, coconut, cream, etc), a banana daiquiri and...I forget. It was a bit much. I wish they had a strawberry daiquiri or a pina colada on menu, maybe the bartender can make it, but I didn't ask.

Waitress was very nice and helpful.

Overall, I recommend going at least once - preferably when you need a break from the cold and want to hop on a plane and head to Hawaii but can't.

Definitely one of my favorite places to go, came here for the first time yesterday and I'm absolutely in love. it felt like I was in the movie Pulp Fiction and  the Big Kahuna Burger pretty pretty amazing stuff I can't wait to go back again 5 stars all the way around

pics.caption: Big kahuna burger. !!!   Pulp Fiction style

review.des: Love this bar! I love the speakeasy type concept and the atmosphere and decor are great. It definitely gets crowded but it helps to get there earlier on Fridays or Saturday's around 900ish. The drinks are amazing but definitely dangerous.

Where do i start? Oh yeah, how bout just trying to find the place...Now for me it didnt take all that long because im a fricken BADASS! But not everyone is...
Once I got inside i went straight to the bar and told her to light them up...She knows what that means. I got the Jet Pilot, pretty darn tasty. Dead Reckoning, eh nothing special. And the Banana Daquiri, magnificent...That Banana-Dolphin looking thing was pretty cool!
At $13 a pop its not cheap, but the drinks were damn good, service was solid and it had a vibrant atmosphere.
Oh, one more thing i know they are not about food but did i see a Curry Dish on their menu? Bend over Three Dots im feeling horny!

Always a blast. Also very busy. If you go on a busy night, expect to wait for drinks. We were lucky enough to go on a Monday when it was slower. Food is good, but a $1-$2 more than what it's worth. Bartenders need to get over themselves and put a little pep in their step. Servers are awesome. Ask for Laura B.
Fun place to take friends from out of town.  Cool environment with very strong drinks.  Beware, waiting time can be long
Everything was great. Exept some really dumb idiot white manager who thought his shit didnt stink! What a tool. If you cant be liqoured up at 0300 then fine! Wont be back soon

Made our way to Three Dots and a Dash last month during a trip to Chicago as lovers of all things TIKI. This review doesn't touch on food because we did not eat. First, let me say what a well done job of decor. This is one of the best decorated tiki bars I've ever seen. Loved, the whole vibe of the place with ample seating and even private rooms. Wow. Really dug the different rooms each having their own theme.
We sat at a comfy corner booth and had drinks we isn't an option everywhere. We really loved the menus which were artfully done and truly paid homage to the classics of tikidom. The drink list included the usual suspects but also some killer innovations to tiki drinks. Also, the large format drink options seemed great since this place must do a ton of large group gatherings. Service was pleasant and left us to ourselves while being there when needed. Totally recommended spot for lovers of cool, interesting bars not just for tiki freaks. Also really deep rum list which more places should take note on. Having tons of selection and depth in many countries is very impressive. I will be back next time I'm in town.
Coolest place in the city of Chicago...speakeasy vibe, good drinks, killer food-- My new fav place in the city of Chicago

Ok...come on.

We are all fairly "normal" right? Meaning we have a basic understanding of the world, what to expect from general experiences in life and so on.

If you are paying $13 for a super boozy crazy ass drink with custom swizzle sticks, flowers and citrus peel garnishes do you REALLY think the mug is free? I don't care if you are visiting from out of town or if you are kind of not aware of general costs of you know... life... or whatever. If you go to a bar and pay $13 for a super cool drink and then complain that they took away the empty mug... well come on, get a grip. You have no right to complain...  in fact you should be happy that you got good service in clearing the table.

Here are the facts:

They are super good drinks.
They are presented in super cool ways in a super cool atmosphere.
The people who make them are super talented.
If you think you have a right to take home the mug without paying for it (ie: steal it) you are a super jerk or super naive.

Three Dots remains the most fun place to get a drink in Chicago.., great drinks, great people, great mugs (that you can purchase if you like).

pics.caption: Coolest bar in the city. Try the Three Dots and the Painkiller.
Three Dots and a Dash and Painkiller!

review.des:
This is a great place to go for a special occasion - especially if you like ridiculous cocktails.  It's a little hard to find.  Its pretty much in an alley. I came in on a Wednesday night so I found the staff to be friendly and attentive.  Can you believe that they have an item on the menu that was almost $400?! In addition to being delicious,  the drinks come with fabulous garnishes. All my drinks were garnished with a fresh orchid. Seriously! The most expensive flowers in the world garnish drinks here. Also,  the banana daquiris come with little dolphins made out of bananas. Some bartenders are better than others when it comes to garnishes.

My one gripe is the beer selection.  I get that this place is a tiki themed cocktail bar but it would be nice to see something besides Red Stripe available.  Maybe something with a little flavor? I think Lagunitas or Kona beer would fit in really well with the theme and offer some variety for the non cocktail lovers.

I came here for my 21st birthday and it was so fun!

Definitely very loud and the drinks were overpriced (and not very strong). But the atmosphere was amazing!

Ambiance is great but don't understand what the hype is. It is overcrowded and had to wait way to long for a spot to sit. The drinks are to sugary, didn't feel drunk after spending a fortune on the drinks. I think there are better spots to go to in Chicago...

Tiki lounge in an urban setting.  Meaning: the prices, wait list, and crowd differentiate Three Dots from actually making you believe you're in a tiki bar on a beach somewhere.  It felt more like a tiki "club."

I've come here twice on weekdays - once right when it opened at 5 PM (no wait and pretty empty until 6 or so) and once at 9:30 PM.  At the latter time, we put our name on the list for a table.  We ordered our drinks by the bar and were halfway through until a table opened up - perhaps a 15-20 minute wait?

If you want something coconutty, get the Painkiller No. 3 or Bunny's Banana Daiquiri.  All drinks are $13 except the handful of shareable drinks (most expensive is $385!).  And order food or don't come here on an empty stomach, unless you don't mind barely able to walk out of here (don't forget there are stairs).  Beware that portions are tiny & expensive like the drinks (4 skewers for $13?!  And guacamole made from 1 avocado for $9?!)!

FYI - the entrance is in an alley next to Firecakes on Hubbard.  Look for the industrial tiki torch in front of the black door in the alley because I don't think there are signs.

My husband and I came here on Saturday night during our short yet sweet visit to Chicago. I haven't been to a tiki bar since I left LA three years ago, so I was super excited to visit Three Dots and a Dash. I actually heard about it in a Chicago guidebook that I picked up from the library the day we started our road trip from Toronto, and I'm really glad I did.

The menu had little pictures of all the drinks, including an illustration of the glass your drink would come in. Definitely helpful for a judge-a-drink-by-its-cover kind of person. I was torn between the Saturn and the signature Three Dots and a Dash, but decided to go with the bars namesake. The daiquiri was extremely tempting solely because each one came with a banana decorated to look like a dolphin, but I knew that the cuteness couldn't help the fact that I'm not a daiquiri fan. My husband got a Mai Tai. Both drinks were delicious and, of course, impeccable presented with all the tiki fixins. We did have to wait at the bar for quite a while to get the bartender's attention, but it wasn't outrageous. I'd recommend a reservation if you have the foresight, especially if you're going with a group of 3 or more.

pics.caption: The Three Dots and a Dash and a Mai Tai.

review.des: The coolest place for special drinks in downtown. I love the decor and ambience here a lot! I will try all of their drinks one by one lol. The only one drawback is the line is super long all the time if you don't have reservation here.

pics.caption: Birthday special for my friend! It is so sweet!

review.des:
The drinks are delicious, strong, and a little pricey. The décor is really impressive (it feels like a grown up version of Disney), and the concept is unique for the area and makes for a memorable and special night.

That said, it's more of a "take your out of town friends for a neat experience" place. The service is pretty split: very attentive if you have table service, the opposite if you're just drinking at the bar.

Ive been in Chicago for three years and just went for the first time a few days ago. Ive always heard its a place to go while visiting/living in Chicago. If you want a fun tiki drink, go here. Fun flavors, cups, and food if needed. While the food wasnt the greatest, they are known for their drinks.

Just recently, I started hearing about this cool hidden bar in the city, even from friends not in Illinois. I couldn't believe I still hadn't been here. When I finally did go, I was very impressed. Love a Hawaiian theme, music, and unique drinks. Definitely an awesome place to show your friends.
I've been to Three Dots and a Dash multiple times. The food and the drinks are great.

Atmosphere gets a 5/5. Slightly hard to find if using maps app, but once you get in the front door it's tiki bar all the way! Unfortunately the favorable review ends there. Our group of 4 girls and 1 guy received overall poor service (waited 15 minutes to get a first glance from the waitress and then we had to catch her for literally every step of the way thereafter...and we're overall patient people!)The first drink was terrible. 5/5 people completely rejected a $70+ drink that was supposed to serve 4 people. To her credit the waitress responded well and tried to make it right by taking the drink back to the bar. It returned with far more juice than alcohol, but at least was palatable for 3 of us to drink half of the concoction (talk about a wage!) The apps were decently tasty (though admittedly of similar caliber to what I heat up from Trader Joe's for 1/3 the price). Then again, you're paying for atmosphere, not quality. Overall, extremely disappointing for somewhere with 4 stars. (At least that's what they had at the time...)

So I finally made it to this place.  

Yes the entry is through an alley, you'll see a guy standing at the door, you'll know you're at the right spot.

The entry way is pretty cool, dark with skull sculpture/artwork above you as you walk in to the steps below.

I arrived with friends visiting from NY.  

We tried several drinks and appetizers.  My personal favorites include:

Appetizers: the hanali spring rolls, fresh with cabbage wrapped in crispy rice paper, the coconut shrimp is a perfect starter, as well as the luau chips which comes with a pineapple/avocado dip.

Drinks: The Saturn is strong but very good and comes with my favorite Luxardo cherries.

I realize it's in River North. That would normally be an immediate point docking situation. But Three Dots is heaven on earth in the midst of a weary Chicago winter. For a few hours, you get to pretend you're in Hawaii. Funky tiki glasses; solid cocktails.

Def make a reservation if trying to go during a peak time. And plan for a few minutes to find the alley entrance :)

This place so cool. It was unlike any place I have ever been to before. Like most reviews said, it looks a little sketchy since its in an alley and once you get inside it's pretty dark. Service was on point! They defiantly anticipated the guest's needs and they had plenty of staff on hand. The whole time you defiantly felt like you were at a nice tiki bar. The drinks were great and fresh. They don't offer a ton of food I would say about 10 different small plate options. I highly suggest the duck wraps and the aloha Felicia to drink. Music was a little strange as it was tiki themed. Went at 7:30 on a Saturday night and did not have to wait for a table. It was more packed when left at 9.

pics.caption: A view of the tiki bar

review.des: Love this place! The barista are awesome and knows how to artistically create your special drinks. The fresh ingredients and beautiful techniques will keep you coming back - especially after a long day at work.

Best tiki bar in Chicago! The flavor, presentation, everything is pretty nice. waiting time and noise levels can be high and parking is not easy to find around but worth the inconvenience. The bartender even made us cocktails not on the menu! fruity and fun place.
Great Drinks !! Great atmosphere !!! Totally enjoyed the experience. I have to admit one of the best places for Drinks in Chicago ! Very  unique !!!

A really nice tiki bar! great interiors and really fun place! drinks are unique and the presentation is fun!! It's a great place to visit with friends. Yes, it's packed on weekends and may be a while before you get in, but it's worth it.

pics.caption: Delicious cocktails that are beautifully presented

review.des: It was a Thursday night, they were packed and we were buzzed. Somehow we miraculously got a table- the hostess was helpful. We each got a drink in one of those cute tiki cups, one was rum based and one was whiskey based. They knocked me on my butt and I paid for it the next day haha. Hard to find the entrance but it's sort of the Appeal of the place. Cool atmosphere- just super busy. Glad to experience it.

Fun place! Great drinks, yummy appetizers, cool decor, & awesome ambiance! Ended up purchasing a tiki mug & our waitress was more than helpful. Took one star off because we had to walk around and ask someone how to get to the entrance in an alley.

The concept and atmosphere of this place are very cool.  The servers always seem to be sweet and well informed and the small plates are OK.  This would be a 4 star for me if not for the ridiculous prices.  I totally understand the up-charge for the fun/funky glasses and set-up of the cocktails BUT $35 for a "two person cocktail"?  Our server explained that there was at least 5 ounces of alcohol in this $35 cocktail but as a bartender- unless this is special reserve liquor we are talking about- that is still absurd.  The cocktail came in a cute coconut but the glass that held the actual drink inside was a standard drink size- half of which was ice.  

Fun place but please make larger drinks or lower the price!

Fun lively environment. It was full and moderately loud, but not in a bad way. Hawaiian theme done right, not at all tacky. Thoughtful, creative drinks. Don't go here if you're looking for a full dinner. While the food is pretty good, it's mostly light/appetizer style. I'd recommend the Crab Rangoon. This would be a good place for a group of 5-10 if you can get a table. The actual bar is relatively small in seating size, but there's enough room to mingle elsewhere.

I have only been here for drinks. It is a fun, creative atmosphere. If you want speciality cocktails it's a place to go. It is usually very crowded however, hard to hear one another and has a long wait.

Even though we were the first to walk in at the 5pm opening, our request for a booth was declined.  Apparently booths are only for groups of 4 or more.  Off putting because the place was empty when we arrived and after we left.  That being said...the decor reminds me of the Rain Forest Cafe, the hostesses are pretentious, the food menu is uninspired, the drinks are too sweet and the entire menu is over priced.  With so many app and drink options in the area, I won't be giving this place another chance.

pics.caption: Magic mustard, sweet thai chili, pad thai & sweet & sour dipping sauces
Crab Rangoon - blue crab, sweet chili sauce

review.des:
I came here last night with my friends and the wait to get in was about 20 minutes (on st pattys!) The entrance is behind an alley so don't get confused trying to find it!

The entire place gives off a tiki/Polynesian atmosphere. House music, casual attire, and a small dance area where people were just moving to the music (not dancing). There are also tables and booths around the walls and our party was lucky obtaining one. The single drinks are $13 a piece and the presentation is pretty cool. Even on a busy night the waitress was attentive and took and brought our orders fairly quickly. Would highly recommend!

2 stars for the drinks. A couple friends and I came out for my birthday and the service was horrible. Waited almost a hour for our sever, Rachel, to get another round of drinks ordered in and it was a Monday night and not busy. She told us to split the check on our own and just came across very rude the whole night. Bummer because I really was hoping come back here for the drinks and environment.

A fun place to stop by for one or two drinks!  Cute tiki atmosphere with a beach, umbrella-themed drink menu.  The drinks are sweet and a bit pricey for the quantity - you're definitely paying for the atmosphere...so have one or two and move on!  

P.S. The entrance is off the alley.

oh my goodness! this place! Believe the hype because it is well worth the small crowded atmosphere. the drinks were AMAZING.  I ordered the 'Three Dots and a dash' and was tipsy the entire night LOL. Lastly, I recommend reserving a table if you know that you are arriving with a big party, otherwise enjoy the tiki vibes and wear comfy shoes.

We went for one of my friend's birthday, and it was definitely a good choice. We didn't have a reservation but got there pretty early, around 8, so we didn't have to wait to get a table. The whole vibe of the place is pretty cool. It actually took us a while to find it because the entrance was in an alley.

The drinks and food were a little pricey. $13+ for drinks. The food ranged from $9-$27 and the portions were pretty small. My friends and I got the bunny's banana daiquiri and painkillers. The bunny's banana daiquiri was pretty much like a banana smoothie plus rum. The taste of rum was very noticeable in all the drinks. My friend also got the bikinis after dark, and it was a funky drink. It had a weird smoky after taste from the pineapple. The flaming shrimp was on fire, so that was pretty cool, but there were like 5 pieces of shrimp. Not really worth the money. If you're actually hungry, definitely go with the thai fried chicken, coconut shrimp, and crab rangoon. Those were pretty filling.

OMG their Cocktails!!!!! So so glad we found this gem in Chicago!!! My only suggestion..I really wish they would add a couple of Vegetarian options for their appetizers. Anyone listening???? :P Anyway this is sure gonna be a staple for every Chicago visit!

Pros: Tasty tiki drinks, enjoyable atmosphere.

Cons: A little on the expensive side. Also, it's hard to get a table there without waiting in the lobby for an hour or so. An establishment shouldn't be criticized for being enormously popular, but it sucks to have to wait every time you go. Next time I'm just going to make a Mai Thai in my basement, dim the lights and listen to Les Baxter Exotica. Come on by, I promise you won't have to wait!

Fabulous, top to bottom. Grab a reservation if you can, walk-ins are nearly impossible. The door is in an ally....we would not have found it without help from a nearby restaurant. LOVE the attention to details with these drinks, YUM!

If your in the neighbor hood and are looking for something different this is the place for you.
If you love drinks so strong they can take paint off of cars this is the place for you. If you want to be seen this could be the place for you. We somehow walked right in on a friday night after dinner nearby. In a basement no less. This is a hidden place you wouldn't know it from the outside.
Drinks are super strong with a price to match. the wait for a table was going to be 2 hours so we had our drinks and left. Lots and lots of pretty people. A younger crowd to be sure. Worth the trip once. Would sent my friends her just to watch them drinks those cocktails.

OBSESSED with tiki bars and this one did not disappoint. Luckily we had the hook up and didn't have to wait in the ridiculous line outside. Come early to avoid that. Ambience and decor is on point. Drinks are strong and delicious! Great for a group, but date night, too. Massive drinks  you can share, some on fire, you will get hammered with just one. LOVE this place and is a must on a visit to Chi-town!

Very cool vibe, very mad men-esque.  I love that its LEY so we can get points, and the drinks are really good, but it's a LITTLE overhyped. The banana drink is EXCELLENT, so be sure to get that one...but otherwise mostly of them are a little too sugary for me, and I generally dig super girly drinks.  Great place for a bachelorette night or something kitschy, but might be too much for a serious/romantic date or business meeting.  The food are small bites but they're DELISH and go really well with the cocktails. Enjoy!

This place is a great place to go with friends for cocktails. The only thing that can be a bit challenging is actually getting into the bar. On a Friday and Saturday night you will see a line forming and it can take quite a while to get in. The cocktails are a bit pricey. They have individual cocktails as well as some to share. I would recommend getting there early if you plan on going on a weekend. All the cocktails are tiki and tropical themed.

First, I rarely go to bars or lounges because I can't stomach paying so much for a drink to stand around in a loud extremely crowded place but Three Dots and a Dash was a welcome departure from that...it is absolutely amazing.

The service was impeccable and even when one of us ordered a drink that didn't come out the way we expected the waitress happily took it back and gave us a new one...and unlike other restaurants didn't resent us for the rest of the night. The bathrooms were impeccable and the place had a great vibe without too many people and music that allowed you to talk without having to yell over each other.

The one knock I would give is its attempt at food. The waitress did say they don't focus on food, but the 'chips' and mango guac were seriously disappointing.

Overall: 5/5

Smelled like vomit. We went in with a party of 12. The hostess said she'd give us a table for 8 and see what happened. We waited half an hour to give our orders in our crowded booth before deciding to take matters into it own hands and push some tables together. The manager came down and acted awkwardly confrontational, so we left.
Extremely rude and smelled like vomit. I was in town and this place let me down. My group was treated poorly and ended up leaving after 30 minutes.

Solid tiki lounge, but I wouldn't wait in that crazy line at open without an observation.  

I went to Lost Lake before this place, and it skews the experience. I know Lost Lake is the rip off, but its better done on all fronts from decor to the menu.

Service was good and make nice recommendations on drinks. The speed to get the drinks was a little slow.

The decor is too downtown trendy vibe, too modern, touristy crowd.

The drinks were very tastey and well done. But I wasn't falling over the menu to try everything.  Lots were very similar.

Fun experience but I'd go to over places over this again.

Would be a five star rating  but the drinks and appetizers are a little pricey.  Yikes.  Great atmosphere.  Cute little tiki bar in the basement, in River North.  How awesome is that?

Had a few drinks.  They are stiff!  2 or 3 should get you there.  The food is good although pricey and small in portions. This would be a place to meet up with your date or friends BEFORE you go to dinner or afterwards.  If you spend the night in there for fun, you'll pay for it. LOL

Great place to return to...

The drinks are unfortunately overrated. They are really strong but are not delicious, which is what I would expect from a place with this much hype around it. I visit speakeasies wherever I travel so I'm very familiar with the concept, the level of drinks and the atmosphere.
Service was a solid 3-4 stars. The cups in which the cocktails are served are pretty cool. This is clearly a very 'cool' and hip drinking establishment in Chicago currently but I was disappointed with the core essence of a bar claiming to be a speakeasy - fantastic cocktails.

Whoever thought you couldn't make a fun, hip and trendy tiki-bar was wrong. 3 Dots and a dash is so much fun and so cool! The entrance is hidden in a driveway/alleyway. You walk downstairs to the restaurant and the whole space is designed like an upscale tiki-bar. We only went for drinks but the drinks were delicious! If you're going with a group I'd definitely recommend getting the bowls that are shareable for 3-6 people. They're good value for your money and are a great presentation! We will definitely need to go back to try the food next time!

One of the highlights of our recent trip to Chicago. My husband is a tiki bar junky and this one did not disappoint. The drinks were amazing and inventive. Food was quite good. Staff super fun and helpful. Will definitely be back!

Love love love this place! The location makes it a bit cooler than normal. You have to go through an alley and down to the basement. Kind of like an old speakeasy The drink prices are high but totally worth it. They are delicious tropical concoctions that are very potent. Super strong and super tasty. I haven't had any of the food yet though.  
I went during the week at around 5 and it slowly got packed. I hear on weekends, there is a line before the place even opens and it is really hard to get reservations. So if you want to check it out, you have to be smart about it. We are teachers so the best time for me and my boyfriend to go here is when we are off of school so we can go on a weekday. Definitely a place to check out.

Update: Had the food, it was just as good as the drinks. Although, it was too pricey for the amount they give you. We had the Thai Fried Chicken, Crab Rangoon, Coco's Coconut Shrimp, and the Hanali Spring rolls. All delicious.

I've been a fan of three dots since they were part of a Tiki event in NYC. I was very excited to go to their home in Chicago and I wasn't disappointed!!! The space is big with plenty of tables although there is a long wait. When we got there on a Sunday before Memorial Day at 10pm there was an hour and a half wait. We went to the bar and 5 min later were able to find a seat. We ordered the spring rolls and belly sliders at the bar. Both were very tasty. The drinks were amazing. You can tell the details they put into every drink. Between my boyfriend and I we had 7 drinks. The bartender was very nice. I asked her about the drink they made on that NYC event because I wanted to order it but she said it might have been a special creation for that event. She did offer to contact the owner to ask but I told her it was no biggie. Definitely  can't wait to be back to this place again.

Love love the ambience of this place! It's underground with an entrance in an alleyway, but the space is beautifully decorated. Exactly how a classy yet relaxed tiki bar should be.

Presentation is on par here. I got the banana daiquiri, which came with its own banana dolphin in a cute little coconut glass. All of the drinks were well made and pretty strong.

While their appetizers sounded very good, I thought the food wasn't as good as the drinks. We got the thai fried chicken, coconut shrimp and pork belly buns. I was disappointed that the pork belly buns were more like pulled pork sliders then pieces of pork belly in an asian bun. The other appetizers were ok but a bit oily and overpriced. I would just come for drinks next time.

It's a fun place to visit but the wait can be crazy, so make a reservation ahead of time!

This place is an experience. Simply put. Come for the drinks and ambience, not the food but the little appetizers I had were not terrible, just not memorable. Plus they were all small portions so opt for the burger if you are really hungry. The cocktails are all exotic, looking and tasting. It is a river north bar so the prices reflect the exoticism. I was in awe staring at smoking cocktail number come around to neighboring tables, they really get creative on some of the large cocktail arrangements. And to add to the experience, it is a tiki bar to a T! The decor is amazing! Anyone you take will be impressed by the smokey ambience, wall of tiki dolls skulls, and hip background music. It feels like a luau party and yet the crowd is intimate enough for you not to have to yell at your friends at the table. Want to stray away from the classic cheers, Irish pub, or hotel bar in River North?  Then definitely look no further.

Fantastic!!! The drinks / ambience / musics / serving mugs / food and servers are all great . It might give you a dungeon like feeling while getting in but starting from the wall of skulls, once you are in, you will blown away by its tropical atmosphere.Fortunately, the wait to get in has not been much but then we visited in winters. Recommended for both business and leisure.

Great tiki bar with very good drinks! Very unique presentation and they are not stingy with the alcohol either!

The small plates were very good as well with lots of flavor and decent portions...

The ambience is very classy and the service is excellent as well.

The only reason I wouldn't give it 5 stars is that it is a tad over priced. The Zombie punch @ $65 is a little too expensive even if it is split between 3-4 people.
Oh and the wait... Don't go if you don't have a reservation... Unless you like waiting in line for hours...

pics.caption: Great presentation.. Every drink comes in a unique glass!

review.des:
What a fun bar-lounge for a birthday, bachelorette party, or post-dinner date night. Drinks are 13$, pretty typically priced considering they add in a little extra fun, infused with Polynesian/Hawaiian flair. The stronger drinks are noted clearly on the menu--and each are served in unique mugs! My friends and I scoured the picture menu, making our final selections based upon the special cup it came in. If you end up loving it a lot, these 'Souvenir Mugs' are available for purchase--inquire for prices.

DRINKS (13$ each)
Classic
* Three Dots and A Dash: Aged Rhum Agicole, Guyanese Rum, Honey, Falernum, lime, allspice, angostura bitters. If you're stumped on decisions, this is a good bet. It's fruity but not "just juice".

Modern (original recipes with a present-day twist)
* Bunny's Banana Daiquiri: Jamaican Rum, Spiced Rum, Overproof Rum, Coconut liqueur, banana, lime, nutmeg. Probably the most popular amongst all the pictures you see--and yes, that's a dolphin made out of half a banana.

* Painkiller No. 3: Virgin Islands Rum, Dark Jamaican Rum, coconut, passionfruit, pineapple, cream. Another popular character at the lounge. Stronger than the banana daiquiri.

There's special sharing drink bowls, wines, beers and champagnes, too.

Make your pick: threedotschicago.com/wp-…

Tricky entrance, here's how to find your way: head east on Hubbard, walk past Clark Ave., swing a left in the alley, and entrance on the left.
Follow the neon blue! There will be someone around checking IDs.

Have fun!

pics.caption: From left: Three Dots and a Dash, Painkiller, Banana Daquiri, Puka Punch, Luau Chips and pineapple guac.

review.des:
This Place is the Real Deal.

Well growing up my dad worked 38 years at the Mai-Kai restaurant in Fort Lauderdale Fl. Needless to say I hung out in joint since I was a kid, i worked in the bar, I asked my wife to marry me on stage and we had my mom's funeral service there too. So I am very qualified to talk about the tiki culture and the cocktails that come with it. This place you have here is incredible.

We had five drinks. The Three Dots and a Dash, Jet Pilot, Banana Daiquiri, Puka Puka Punch, and the Seyoney. My favorites were the Jet Pilot and the Three Dots and a Dash. The flavors and garnishes of these drinks were top notch. The hint of fresh nutmeg in the Three Dots and a Dash shows you the care given to each drink by the head mixologist/owner Paul. Fresh, pure, and tranquil is how I would describe what Paul and his staff are concocting. See, when you have a great tropical drink it is supposed to transport you away like a good book or a movie. Paul's cocktails do just that, one sip and looking at the beauty of the garnishes whisked me away to a beach with white sand with palm trees all around for shade.

The ambiance sets you up for your imaginary ride to utopia. The design is simple and not over done. Walking down the stairs was my only issue because I had my 76 year old dad with me. No worries I would have strapped him on my back to get him here. Lol.

Service was excellent. Paul enjoyed listening to my dad's stories of the Mai-Kai and we even suggested that he add two drinks made famous by the Mai-Kai, their Barrel of Rum and the Black Magic.

As we climbed the stairs to leave the door opened up and reality set in. It was still light out and we walked into a concrete jungle of an alleyway. Chicago is a beautiful town but I so much wanted to turn right around and go back downstairs to paradise. Remember to tell Paul that Dan and Pasefika from Ft. Lauderdale sent you and Stay Hungry!

pics.caption: Dare I say that this jet pilot is better than the Mai Kai.... It is.

review.des:
Yes it may be hard to find the entrance your first time but it's all apart of the experience.
The place has a great Tiki/Hawaiian theme that is well executed and not cheesy at all.

The drinks look really cool as they are served in tiki style cups and garnished with real flowers. They are all really good and strong! This is a great place to come with a group of friends before hitting the clubs. They also have food as well but we ate somewhere else before coming. I can't wait I come back and try more of their signature drinks!

I just moved to Chicago and had a friend in town we wanted to check this place out hearing so many things about it from friends.
We arrived on a Wednesday night around 7:30, the valet asked if we were looking for Three Dots and a Dash and then gave us directions on how to get to the blue door in the alley around the corner. Once we came in we were greeted by a nice doorman in a warm hallway, he carded us and pointed they way to the host stand where we were welcomed by a nice host. He asked if we wanted a table or the bar, since it was just my friend and myself we wanted to sit at the bar to watch the amazing talented bar staff. Unfortunately we didn't find any open seats, so we went back to the host stand where the manager took us to a table. As we were being sat we asked to grab a table in front of the bar so we could get a closer look. He promptly moved us and we were immediately greeted by a very sweet server (I didn't get her name....she kind of reminded me of Sofia Vergara). She asked us if we've ever been here before and then gave us some recommendations, the house favorites and popular items as well. My friend who loves gin ordered the Saturn (amazing gin tiki cocktail with passion fruit, Orgeat and Falernum) and I ordered the Aku Aku Lapu (it's for two people but I didn't care it looked to amazing. It had Jamaican Rum, Mezcal, Arrack....I love Batavia Arrack, and pineapple.....so good I drank the whole thing). We ordered the Crab Rangoon and the Crispy Wings (both were great, I will definitely order them again). After she took our order she came right back with plates, napkins, utensils, and dipping sauces that she explained. Right after that....like 5 minutes it seemed, the two dishes we ordered came out. About 5 minutes later our drinks came out........ITS TIKI, IT TAKES TIME PEOPLE!!!!
Everything tasted amazing! The server came to our table every 7-10 minutes checking on our drinks/food and if we needed anything (the girl was on it!). We did have other plans that night so we asked to close out. She came back and asked us if we wanted to join the "Lettuce Entertain You" rewards club.
Over all...........I wish I could have given 6 stars instead of 5. Everyone was perfect to the letter and can't wait to come back!

This hidden gem is incredible.  The tiki-themed atmosphere is top notch, only to be outdone by the fantastic beverage menu.  Page after page of unique drinks as well as old classics with new, fresh twists, not to mention the handful of drinks that serve several people.  The staff was great, checking in on us regularly making sure we had plenty of water and other drinks.  Grab your friends and get there already.

Super fun basement bar with great decor and strong drinks! Definitely instagram worthy drinks with fun glasses and fun Polynesian decor throughout the bar. It's my go-to spot for girl's night, but it's a fun spot for anyone looking for some drinking, a little dancing, and a good time in general.

This is quite possibly my favorite bar that I've been to since being able to drink. I love tiki bars...not that I've been to many. I'm just very fond of mixed cocktails and skulls.

This was on my top to-do list when I visited Chicago. But for some reason, I completely forgot about it until a few hours before I had to catch my flight. I told my friend that I wasn't leaving until I get a drink here.

I seriously regret not being able to stay much longer because I was looking to get plastered. This place is soooo fun. It's so me.

We both tried the Painkiller. So strong but so pineapple-y and delicious! I took home a skull cup as a souvenir.

I'm definitely going back when I visit Chicago again.

Fun tiki bar theme--had no trouble getting seats at the bar around 6pm, but if you want to get a table you need to plan like a week ahead and make reservations. The drinks are definitely expensive but there's enough alcohol in each one that you only need one drink.

I have been wanting to try this place for a long time.  The atmosphere was really fun and I think I enjoyed the tropical vibe even more considering how miserable Chicago weather has been.  I was there with a group of girls for a bachelorette party.  We ordered two large drinks for all of us to share.  I don't remember what they were called but they were delicious and served in pirate ships with flames.  Very cool!  The only thing I wasn't crazy about was how crowded it was.  There was no where for us to sit and we were all scrunched together trying to hold flaming pirate ships.  Guess that's what you get for going to a popular place!

Very awesome experience but must get there right when the bar opens to get a table. The environment and the drinks make you feel like you are on a tropical vacation. The waitress was very friendly and helped with picking out drinks from the menu. Drinks are a little pricey but would still highly recommend as a bar to visit while in Chicago.

Not very good Reaturant for big groups the drinks are strong but if your in big you have to get a big room, I believe the restaurant owner did not plan the restaurant very well not keeping in mind his signature chest drink is good for up too 8 people. Poor planing in my part.

Fun, upscale bar serving some of the best tiki drinks I've had. There's a big line during busy hours, so come early or make reservations. Service could've been better; the bartenders were pretty aloof. Reviews on individual drinks:

Painkiller
Possibly the most delicious tiki drink I've ever had. Flawless blend of coconut, pineapple, passion fruit, and cream.

Bunny's banana daiquiri
Made with one whole banana, as banana drinks should be! Best presentation ever, super adorable. Flavor-wise though, it could've been better -- they used a somewhat unripe banana so it was kind of bland.

Mai tai
Not as much macadamia flavor as I had hoped, but the subtle nuttiness was there and it good.

Saturn
My partner liked it, very gin-y with a very tart, grapefruit flavor. The maraschino cherries are the bomb! High quality dark ones.

Lonely island
Interesting mix of pineapple and coffee.

Best Tiki Bar in Chicago!!! Came here for my friends Birthday we had an amazing time had an amazing server I had the painkiller and many more can't remember the names but the amount of liquor on the drink is very fair definitely not water down like other places the food was on point we had the pupu platter  will be coming here again. I recommend showing up early because it gets packed very quickly
Wow! Totally different from everything I've seen so far. Coctails are served in awsome glasses, people who worked there are really nice and willing to suggest and help with choosing. I love it!

So i read the reviews already posted and so correct on shady entrance on back alley of hubbard street, all you see is 2 bouncers checking ids and then you go downstairs and this tiki bar is beyond amazing!!!!

The drinks are well worth the price and SUPER STRONGGGGGG!!! If you want a show sit at the bar and watch the bartenders do their magic... its really awesome to see.....
This awesome tiki bar is a MUST. Island vibes forever. Came at about 11:30 on a Sunday it was crowded so we stood by the bar. Got the painkiller and the missionary's downfall. AMAZING. Will be back

This place has cute and touristy drinks but they honestly let way too many people in given the small space they have. I felt claustrophobic two out of the three times I've been here. Not worth it in my opinion. Would give it two stars but adding an extra one because their drinks are strong. You might lose your buzz waiting to get in and order a drink, but it will do the job once you get it!
Awesome again.   Great server Wendy who gave great suggestions and attentive Service.  Mgr Kurt stopped by to be sure all was perfect-which it was!!

Over-run by the kind of people that are drunk AF already at 11:30pm....floor is sticky....they held up the line to create a club-type of atmosphere...BUT...no cover, and their cocktails are sinfully delicious. It's like a show, watching them make drinks! It was enjoyable, but the "club" was too packed and the bar is very short staffed. It took a good 20 minutes to find someone to put in an order. I'd be back but I suggest coming earlier, or snagging a reserved table.

Coming from Miami, we were so excited to try a place that endless people told us to try. Our server Maggie was a delight, she clearly knew what she was talking about and wanted us to get what we were actually going enjoy. I definitely recommend coming on over.
A Chicago gem. The drinks are beautiful, yummy, and fun. I love the underground tiki feel. The food menu, I'll admit, is pretty limited IMO but the drinks make up for it.

Many of my friends have been here, and I was excited to try it out when I was back in town.  We were using Google Maps to find the place, and we couldn't!  Yeesh.  I used to live in this city.  Not a good feeling to have to ask where the entrance to a place was... but we eventually found it in an alley.  

You walk down the stairs and it feels totally different than any other bar in Chicago... it is laid back, tropical, fun, and has really tasty (though of course pricey) drinks.  I was really happy to come... I want to return and sample more of their stuff!

Who in their right mind would wait in line at a bar for so long to get a drink out of a coconut?!

In fairness, I only spent a total of minutes in this place because it was overcrowded and humid. Obviously people like it otherwise it wouldn't be so busy. I just don't understand why you'd allow so many people in the door if you know there isn't enough room for them. If you don't have a table, this place isn't worth it.

Absolutely one of my favorite bars in downtown!

Atmosphere/Decor: One of the best things about this place. Everything is like a genuine Tiki bar, if not a high end bar. Being down here really makes the atmosphere awesome. Walking the stairs (which if you have more than one or two mixed drinks can be quite the death sentence) is cool- the rope, the bamboo, the lighting all perfect. The tables, candles, the booths- all complete this perfect experience.

Drinks: The drinks are stellar. I don't think the attention to detail is matched anywhere, nor the quality of the drink. The $13 prices are worth it for the detail you get: designed bananas, flower tops, other high end things make you want to stare at your drink instead of drink it. The drinks that serve more than one people look amazing as well and highly suggested for cost effectiveness.

The service: The bar can be quite busy, and tables almost require a reservation, but the servers are highly attentive, very helpful.

Food: Don't come here for the food, as it's just bites, but it is pretty good if you aren't super hungry.

Overall, one of the best bars in Chicago. I hate to rate it so well and speak so highly of it because it'll make it busier, but it's well deserved.

One of the coolest bars I've been to! Entrance is hidden away in an alley. Inside the ambiance is really cool, the drinks are varied and great, and the cups are really cool (and you can even buy them). Also a lot of cool shared drink specials

Pretty cool atmosphere and the drinks are out of this world! Little pricey in my opinion but the "group" or communal drinks are a good deal and the service is good even during peak times. I can't comment about the food as I only went here for drinks. Happy dining!

I felt like I had stepped into my wildest dreams at Three Dots and a Dash--it's that wonderful! This underground tiki bar has the most incredible atmosphere and the most beautiful (and powerful) drinks! The drinks we tried were all delicious and worth the cost. Our waitress was wonderful and the manager, Josh, made sure we were all having a great time. Definitely don't miss this on your drink tour of Chicago!

pics.caption: Banana dolphin as a drink decoration--how cute!
Frozen rum and Coke over dry ice!

review.des:
TOP LEVEL. Wow. I loved it man, they are SUUUUPER strong man, the drinks. And tasty and  they light up, what a fun place. The line is insane every night so you better become friends with someone who works here like my friend did, skipped the huge line outside, it was so cool. Felt like I was somebody, and not just some bald purveyor of electrical products.

Danced the night away, with or without women present, it didn't matter, I was somebody, not just some bespectacled hipster dad. They played funky eclectic music, some modern, some classic dance stuff. Lots of good looking people in here. When I dance, I pretend everyone is watching, that is how you end up improving based on unsanctioned critiques from those watching.

I first came here for my 21st, and it's been an amazing experience ever since then. Whenever I am in Chicago i make sure I visit three dots at least once. The jet pilot, painkiller, mai tai and Bali Bali are really well made and are super strong. A big shout out to Tim for being the best host ever!
The drinks were AH-mazing.  We could only get in at 4:00 because it was booked three days straight.  It was an absolute blast.  I'll be coming back.

pics.caption: So much fun that this little cutie went home with me.

review.des: The venue is small so I recommend that you make reservations if you want to be seated while enjoying their amazing cocktails otherwise it's standing room only, you can try to get a seat at the bar without any reservations but like I said it's a small venue. The decor is beautiful, the bartender was attentive, and the drinks are strong and delicious.

This place is hard to describe in the best way! The drinks, albeit pricey (~$15 minimum per), are unique and well-made (smoking, flaming, foaming...you get the drift). The atmosphere was one-of-a-kind as well...kind of an elevated tiki-bar meets nightclub situation.

I'll definitely be returning.
Great drinks and food. Had the banana daqueri. Was Great!

Love this "hidden gem", and it's definitely a great place to check out with people visiting the city.

I haven't had any food there, but the drinks are seriously good.

The only reason this isn't a 5-star is due to the pricing on drinks. I feel like it's a bit much, but perhaps you're paying for the atmosphere and experience.

If I liked fruity drinks, I'd probably give this place 4 stars. But I don't, so those that prefer stronger, less sugary drinks, keep that in mind.

Cool atmosphere though, tiki themed bar. Friendly bartenders/staff. Kinda hard to find, so don't be fooled! It's down some alley.

Came here on Fat Tuesday and got the Hurricane (loved the Mardi Gras beads that came draped around there glass.) There was no line whatsoever to get in (probably because it was a Tuesday evening.) The bartender was super attentive.

The Hurricane was delicious and strong (was feeling a buzz after a few sips!) Don't be fooled by the cutesy cups with garnishes galore--They do not mess around with their drinks!

I'm curious to get the Banana daiquiri next time.

Would definitely recommend especially if you're in the area on a weekday night when there's no line.
Wrigley field makes better Mai Tais then what I was served. I'm hoping it was just a terrible bartender but yuck!

The theme of this place makes you feel like you're on an exotic island! Weekends are very busy but even weeknights can get crowded. The drink menu is pages long and all of the drinks look super fun and can come virgin style. The food menu was small but delicious, the best bang for your buck is probably the thai chicken, a good shareable portion with a unique tangy sauce and 4 dipping sauces as well.
Great date night spot.  Dark/cozy with a unique cool ambiance.

We love this place! Once you figure out where it is located in the alley, it is simple to find. Then you go down some stairs and end up at a hostess table and bar. It is a tiki bar to the nines and even the glasses are in shapes of skulls, tiki heads, etc.
The drinks are a little pricey but of course they would be with the ingredients and originality that goes into the drinks. The bartenders have always been very knowledgeable and nice.
I would suggest going on a Sunday or Monday because it is no fun waiting in a line, in an alley, to get in.. especially in winter. This place has become a staple that we always go to when in Chicago.
There's a reason it's the most instagrammed bar in chicago! The drinks are delicious and so fun bring a big group and your out of Towners - not to be missed!

You know what would make this tiki bar even better, if that's possible? Drink flights!! There are just so many drinks that sound good that it was difficult for me to choose, just ONE, then another.
I want to try a lot, if not all of them. You would think with this decor it could be kitschy, bordering on tacky, but the skulls make it. It all works in here. It's like a destination bar, like you landed in Oahu or someplace in Hawaii, very touristy, with plenty of drink concoctions from average to beyond creative.
My advice, walk, cab or have a designated driver who'll miss all the fun and safely bring you home! However you choose to get here, come, it's a fun and delicious time. Oh, and don't let the drinks fool you, because for all their deliciousness, they do, indeed, have lots of alcohol in them!

Awesome Tiki Bar in Chicago located in an Alley with a secret entrance. The cocktails are ridiculously delicious, from the presentation to the taste it was all perfect. They have cocktails with Rum to gin to tequila to Whiskey. Its crazy how they came up with such ingredients to make the perfect Drinks.

Cocktails are a little pricey but worth it
They serve food (didn't try)
some cocktails are served with Dry Ice

This place was so fun! Came with a group of 4 and we were lucky enough to get a table. We ordered 3 of their bowls and they all tasted different and strong.  The environment is upbeat, dim, and crowded!!! I would say that this place is perfect for a double date night because it's the right amount to share the bowls with. Also,  there is a mini dance floor with a dj. I would give this place 5 stars if their drinks didn't cost so much.

Best atmosphere you can find Tiki related. Very friendly staff and very accommodating. My friend and sister didn't like the drinks they selected so were given new selections. Mine was ok, very strong earthy flavor...mint? I had a Mai Tai. I would go back for the atmosphere, not sure what drink I would order though as the menu is huge.

I like tiki bars, although this one felt too commercial. We had a reservation, but we were seated on a bench seat with a little end table and we were crammed next to other people. It was uncomfortable and made me want to leave after one drink. Hostess was unfriendly. Waitress was kind of snooty. Drinks were outstanding. Loved the glassware.  Although the drinks were tops, the rest of it was a disappointment.

I came here for drinks with some friends and I'm glad I went. The place is way cool. Its like a mini vacation on an island inside meanwhile its  freezing cold outside. All the staff were wearing hawaiian shirts. All the drinks were $13 and come in a super cool looking cups, some made from clay (you can buy the cup if you like it ). The environment was just really cool. I plan to go back during this chicago winter, when I'm wishing I live somewhere more tropical! GO check it out!
Ahola this place is on fire .It's a Candy shop for sweet drinks.They nailed for Bachelorette partys.Keep it lite .

It's fine. I feel like you have to go once at least. You wait awkwardly in a line outside and then you're like, in Hawaii. If Hawaii were a cramped room with over-the-top drinks and tacky decor.  Which doesn't sound altogether inaccurate. The drinks were delish!

Had sooooo much fun! The drinks were good! I got wasted, Not going to lie lol. And the prices aren't bad! Get there at least 2 hours before close if you plan to eat, we had to drink on empty stomachs because the kitchen had closed.

Sadly I didn't get to grab food but the ambiance and drinks were so creative looking and well made! The staff were super nice and the people were fun and energetic. Aka the drinks will put you on your ass! Be warned.

What a fun destination that sets itself apart from the typical lounge/River North scene.  The back alley entrance is a nice prelude to what will surely be a one of a kind experience when you visit.  

The pretty and delicious cocktails definitely take center stage here and the collection of rum-inspired libations are plentiful that even Jack Sparrow may consider island hopping at this destination instead.  

Because one can't feast on drinks alone, make sure to enjoy the small yet impressive collection of small bites on the menu.  Had I had my way; I would've ordered all 10 of the choices but since we ordered 6/10 dishes, I say I still got my way in the end.  

While the spring rolls and the luau chips were good, what really stood out was the Vietnamese grilled pork- it had a delicious blend of spices with just enough cooling sensation from the vermicelli noodles on which it was served.  

There's a collection of drinks that are big enough for a group to share with some that came with a dramatic entrance (think fire and ice!) but if I might make a recommendation, choose your own from the  plethora of fun choices--- sharing optional!

Fun times to be had here.. that's for sure. Little warm weather beach bar getaway when you are freezing in Chicago. Punch bowls are fun.. and if you and your friends aren't all coming down with the flu because Chicago is so miserably cold, you can share with the fun colorful straws! Make it a dry ice kind and it makes for even cooler effects... cheers.

5 stars just for the atmosphere!  

The wait for a table was a little over rated at prime time...I could have done without that.  This is the type of place that doesn't flip tables because the atmosphere is such that you just want to sit and drink and hang out.  It's got a fun, vibrant and classy tiki theme throughout.  I absolutely loved the drink list; the glasses the cocktails were served in were almost as fun as the drinks themselves.  However, I will say the strength of the drinks was less impressive.  Even the skull marked drinks, "impressively strong", were more like regular strength IMHO....or damn has my tolerance gone up again!?!  

Note to self, come back with enough friends I'm okay swapping spit with to order a "for sharing" fish bowl sized cocktail...or maybe I could order one myself and just swim home.

The food menu, while very short, was okay and kept in line with the tropical theme.

Highly suggest making reservations in advance. This place was super crowded when I went around 7pm on a Saturday. I didn't have a chance to try to food but the drinks are incredible and creative. The Bikinis After Dark was a pretty good choice!

This place is underground and has a speak easy feel to it. We love taking our friends from out of town here to impress them with the group drinks. I've never had bad service or a bad drink here. The group drinks are interesting blends and can be pricey, but one is enough to get a whole group ready for a fun night out in River North.

I was so excited to go to this place and try out their alcoholic beverages, but was disappointed. The decor and ambiance was good. It has an island theme. My issue was the drinks. They were way too strong to the point that they were not palatable. I would enjoy this place more if their drinks were not that strong. The only reason they looked appealing was the artistic cups they were in. Plating was beautiful and inviting. However, the taste is another story.
A perfect place to start your night with drinks.  We did split the Pu Pu platter and it was delish!  Defiantly make a reservation.

I love Three Dots! The tiki theme is just over-the-top enough to make for a super fun environment and the drinks are always excellent.

I have gone here with large groups of friends multiple times (tip: make a reservation way in advance or, if it's the weekend, you'll be stuck in an annoyingly slow-moving line!) and as a result have gotten to sample most of the drinks on their ample cocktail menu. Personally, my #1 is the Dead Reckoning.  The vanilla and bitters add incredible, complex flavor to this sweet but not-too-sweet drink.  However, I'd also definitely recommend the Cacchen Some Rays - don't get this if you don't like the taste of coffee (it's got a strong coffee flavor), but if you do, GET IT IMMEDIATELY. It's a unique and delicious cocktail.

The food, however, is pretty bad from what I have experienced.  We got the Luau chips one time - a huge serving of dried-out, bland chips with a teeny-tiny cup of pineapple-avocado dip that somehow lacked flavor. The cup was pretty much enough for four chips. Maybe. If we stretched it thin. The crap rangoon is over-fried and not very good. I'd eat before you went here (though I guess I haven't tried everything - but what I have tried has made me not want to eat anything else at Three Dots).  

Go to Three Dots. Go for the cocktails - go to share the big ones, to sample the personal ones, to get drunk and to have a really fun time with decent service (it can get busy and your server WILL forget about you) in a great atmosphere.

This place was recommended to us from a Chicago friend while we were visiting the city for the first time, and I loved it! There are so many drinks to choose from and you seriously feel like you're in a tropical place when you're actually in 13 degree weather Chicago. It was kind of weird to find since the entrance was in a back alley. We had to go through another bar to get to the place. It seemed very hidden, but I guess that's what makes the spot intriguing, kind of like a speakeasy with the blue light. It must get really crowded on the weekends and you probably need reservations, but we came on a Monday night and were seated right away. Still, there were lots of people there on a weeknight.

Food:
Luau Chips - It was chips and pineapple with guacamole. The dip was delicious, and the chips were very airy. Interesting combination.

Crab Rangoon - Delicious! There are four different sauces that come with it. The mustardy tasting sauce is the best.

My Cocktails:
Bunny's Banana Daiquiri - Cutest drink I've ever gotten. GET IT. DRINK IT. It's SO GOOD.

Dr. Funkhouser - It has a skull drawing next to it so it was strong, and I learned that quickly.

Everyone else seemed to enjoy their cocktails as well, so I'm sure most of them are really tasty!

I was so bummed that I never made it to Trader Vic's before it closed! I've been to Trader Todd's and the now defunct Uncle Fatty's, but their drunks were sickly sweet and.....just plain yuck! Not to mention, the crowds were sloppy and obnoxious. It's good to see that Chicago finally has a cool tiki bar with fun and delicious drinks! If I can't have a tropical getaway this Springter (get it?!), at least I can drink away my woes with rum laden, orchid and paper umbrella topped drinks.

A girlfriend and I stopped by for happy hour on a Friday and it was packed! We did eventually grab a spot at the bar. The drinks were strong and after two, I was done! I honestly can't remember what I had but they were amazing. They have some small plates/bar bites, but not full meals so don't come too hungry! The Luau Chips were okay, but the Thai Chicken was so good. Our favorite part of the night was overhearing all of the Match/Tinder/whatever dates occurring next to us. That will be me soon, though...

The tiki theme drink menu was outrageously fun. Some interesting drinks, make sure to ask your server what they think is best. There were both hits and misses. From what I know, the menu changes seasonally.

My new jam! LOL. So I had heard about this place and actually I wasn't really sure I needed to go here, was I wrong! Haha, we had dinner in river north one night and wanted to head somewhere for a nightcap. Enter: Three Dots and a Dash...we walked right in and got a table at about 8pm on a Wednesday, it filled up quickly after we were seated though.

This place is soo funny, I love whoever's idea it was. It's like someone's basement tiki bar, but way cooler. You go back and forth between cheesy and awesome. I am deciding on the later after our whole experience. I really wanted to pick a drink in an awesome glass as I saw the waitresses passing them around.

I went with the Dead Reckoning, even with the strong drink warning, haha. Mainly because it had pineapple and a cool glass, lol. It was delish! It had like a whole tree of mint and a marigold in it! Super cool. And my glass didn't disappoint! My friends got some really great drinks too clad with orchids, mint, flowers of all sorts. I also can't believe I am admitting this, but we all bought a souvenir glass :::hangs head in shame::: what am I a tourist?

I am now trying to think of all the times I can go here to entertain clients as I think they will have a fun time. Love it!

The drinks are super pricy but you're paying for the environment. Have fun finding the front door. It is literally in an alleyway. We went on a Monday night so there were no bouncers or employees outside so we had to basically just walk through the door hoping we were in the right place. I imagine it gets crowded on weekends and you can find it easily. This place is a tiki bar and even serves some of their drinks in coconuts and other cute cups. Definitely a special occasion kinda place to go to with a group of friends or visitors from out of town

My drink didn't taste strong. However the effect took place upon standing. We ordered the flaming shrimp. 6 shrimp set ablaze at the table. It was a great presentation as well as delicious. A bit pricey for 6 shrimp but very tasty. We also tried the Thai chicken. My favorite dish of the night.  We also tried the chicken wings but we sent them back they were chewy and the bold taste that we had grown accustomed to from the two dishes prior was not there. The atmosphere was very nice and the bathrooms were clean. I'm sure to return.

As it was date night, my husband and I wanted to try something close to work (downtown) that we hadn't been to before. I had been trying to get to Three Dots and a Dash since they opened a year ago and I'm so glad we did!

The front entrance is in the alley way, which makes for the ambiance.  Dark lighting, torches, trendy, grass skirts, Hawaiian shirts, eclectic vibrant cups - everything tiki tiki tiki!

We grabbed two seats right at the bar, (which I highly recommend) and got a first class show on mixology and how to properly garnish a drink (orchids, cinnamon sticks, palm leaves you name it) All bartenders have been properly trained by "Chicago rum guy" - Steve McGee and our Tiki Tour guide was very knowledgeable about rum and about tiki culture in general.

Fun experience, delicious drink without the douche hipster/ ass-hole bartender.
Interesting ingredients, fresh fruits and juices, beautiful presentation.  Not cheap drinks, but totally worth the price.  Bartenders were very welcoming and professional.
