A Hidden Gem or a Tourist Trap, maybe a little of both.   We decided to check this place out on a Tuesday at 5:00, as that is when they open.   Yes, this place is a bit hidden, which I'm sure was done on purpose, to make it feel even more special.    You enter off of Hubbard, down an alley, with lit torches.  Look for the blue door and small sign.   Enter the building into complete darkness, down a hall, then down a set of stairs.  

At 5 o'clock, there were about 12 people waiting outside for the door unlock.   By 5:40, there wasn't a seat left in the place.   We did not make a reservation, but were shown to a cool table in the middle, toward the back.   The place is not that big.  Booths line the wall, wooden tiki-ish tables, with comfy chairs.   The servers dressed very Polynesian like, island music playing the background.

This place is for drinks only.  Yeah, they have a small menu of about 8 appetizers, but I would tell you to save you money and eat after.  Drinks run $13 a pop and are strong.   Between the 3 of us, we tried 9 different drinks.   All served in cool glasses with lots of garnish.  All of the drinks were just okay, nothing was "OMG - so good, I must order another".    I like my tropical drinks to be strong, but I want to not realize they are strong, and just taste the fruity goodness....and then realize you are a bit f'd up when you stand and try to walk.   These drinks, you tasted the alcohol and bitters and some of the flavors did not mesh well.  

I had the Three Dots and a Dash, The Jet Pilot, and The Tropic of Thistle.   Skip the Thistle....so bitter.  

We ended up ordering the luau chips, thai fried chicken, and crab rangoon.   Save you money.  None of the food was very good or substantial.  

Crowd is upper 20's to late 30's.    You have a few drinks, pay a big tab, and then head somewhere else.   It was a fun place and cool vibe.  We dropped $70 a person for our drinks and food.  

Probably more of a place I would take someone to for a pre-drink, before heading somewhere else.

This place is so cool! It has a tricky location, It's located in an alley way right across the street from the Marriott and Hyatt place and in between a fire station. This place is like an underground tiki bar, it's dark dim-lit and has a great ambiance. I got a one of the painkillers which were really strong with Thai fried chicken and ribs to eat. The drink was strong, the food is small portions but still really good! And the bartender was so friendly and helpful since it was our first time being there. I would definitely come back, especially because of the whole environment of the place.

pics.caption: Loved the way our drinks looked

review.des: The cocktails are phenomenal and the reason to visit this establishment. The atmosphere is cozy, yet lively and the customer service is remarkable. My table of 5 ordered the Pu Pu platter to share. The food was just okay, nothing special. I would definitely come back here but only for drinks.

Who doesn't love a tasty tropical drink in a fun coconut or pineapple cup?!  The drinks are generously poured and you won't need more than 1 or 2 to have a great night.  My only reason for not giving 5 stars is because the bar is in a basement and very dark.  You would love to see a bar like this on the main street with an outdoor patio to give you that vacation feel.

Speakeasy+ tiki + great history= cool. 3dots is ranked the #27 bar IN. THE. WORLD. Sooooo......obviously the place is great. We came impromptu on a Thursday night, no line outside. The decor is just perfect, dark but bright, cool tiki things to look at everywhere. We went to the bar, the tables were full, and we were not here to eat. We only had to wait a few minutes before a couple of bar stools opened up. We each tried two drinks, they are crafty, complex, and gorgeous. I also had an IPA. The service was exceptional. I feel that the 13$ price was totally appropriate and fair. The only con....things (bar, stool) were sticky, it was gently addressed to staff and it was remedied. The manager even gave us a card to reimburse dry cleaning if necessary. That is superb service.

We have been to Aviary (13th ranked bar in the world) and we prefer 3dots hands down for the price, service, atmosphere  and quality of drink. Bring your friends here. Bring your dates here. Bring your drink lovers here.

Fun place to grab a drink and soak in the ambiance and decor.  I imagine this place is packed on the weekends...since it was like a 2 hour wait outside to get in the one time we tried on a Saturday night.  Instead we visited for happy hour after work on a random Tuesday.  No wait and pretty empty before 6pm.  

I love the menu design and the fun glasses that accompany each drink.  Since I'm pregnant, that's about all I was able to enjoy, except for the food and watching Hubby and his coworker's reactions to the strong concoctions.  Despite being seasoned drinkers, they were definitely buzzed after the first round.  We also ordered the Thai fried chicken (delicious) and the pork belly buns (also delicious).  The curry chicken skewers were just so-so.

Awesome tiki bar in the heart of River North. Drinks are expensive but strong and delicious! The presentation is amazing and the environment is badass. Really unique place, friendly staff, and clean restrooms. If your down to get some island drinks in, this is your place!

LOVE. This place is so fun! I think my first tiki bar experience and also kind of an unique find in Chicago, my fiancé and I were able to discover the entrance mostly due to other Yelp reviews. We stopped in on a slower weeknight and didn't have a problem grabbing a seat at the bar. The bartenders were incredibly nice and it was exciting to watch them make such cool cocktails. I started with a painkiller (my favorite) and my fiancé had the Western sour (huge bourbon fan). They take pride in making them and while the garnish is a little over the top, it honestly just adds to the ambiance. For my second drink, I asked the bartender his preference between the Missionary's Downfall and their signature drink; he was so honest and said he thought the Missionary's Downfall was better even though it was a pain in the ass to make. I am so glad he didn't take the easy way out because it was the MOST AMAZING cocktail I've had in recent memory. Seriously, it will go down in infamy for me. Such a cool spot and I'm glad we stopped in!

Really fun atmosphere here.  I loved the stairway with the skulls leading into the place.  There was an extensive drink list and the drink was quite delicious (thought I can't quite remember what I got as it was a few months ago).  My date and I got a drink relatively quickly and were standing at one of the ledges by the bar for about five minutes then two people got up and we were able to get a seat at the bar.  At about that time, the place started to fill up with a lot of people...we got lucky!

Great place to go for fun cocktails; didn't try the food but it did sound good!
I loved the ambience! Great place to lounge with drinks but I wouldn't recommend the food.

Cheezy Tiki bar. Very bright lighting. Ridiculous tasting drinks. Enough said. Try it out yourself, & see what I mean. It's just not authentic & is a pretentious tiki bar environment, one that I've ever witnessed. I know, I know that's a rather superlative statement. It's not just about ABV content any more! Haha.

This place is always one of the first spots i recommend to Chicago newbies or visitors. You really feel like you're at a bar on some tropical island. I give it four stars because the bartenders are always so slow. If you don't mind waiting for your drink, it will always be strong & tasty. 10/10 instagrammable spot!

Loved this place ! Even though tiki - drinks are not my type of drinks , the ambience and service made us stay for few more drinks . Really cool concept behind hidden door , would totally recommend for out of towners

IT LIVES UP TO THE HYPE.

It lives.up.to.the.hype.

I'm not a tiki fan by any measure. I find it too kitschy - especially in Chicago where winter has lasted approximately 82 weeks too long and our closest excuse for a beach is a polluted Great Lake.

But wow, Paul McGee done did it good. Not only are the drinks killer - I mean, you get quite boozy off these beauties - but the overall atmosphere is posh, hip, beach-y and speakeasy.

Three of us ponied up on a Thursday at 5 p.m. on the dot (unintended) because we read it can get packed. We were seated at a table immediately and then the place started slowly filling up. By the time we left at 7:30 p.m., it was buzzing. Not too packed, but people were standing....

Which, I don't think this is a standing bar. This is the type of place you go for a few amazingly delicious cocktails while sitting at a gorgeous leather booth or swiveling tikied-out chair, let the music take you somewhere else, and marvel at how cool the space feels without there being any windows AND it being in a basement.

From the service - attentive, fun, quick - to the drinks and decor, I was a happy happy Pearl Diver (which is a menu item.... and a lifestyle.)

Have had two good experiences here. Love the speakeasy feel, the low lights, tiki theme, and fun glassware for cocktails. Every single drink I've had here has been very much to my liking. And both servers as well as the bartender who took care of me all mastered the descriptions and were excellent guides to the menu.

I do find the $13 drinks to be a little pricey, but I know that's not outrageous for Chicago. One bummer was that I ordered one of the shared cocktails with a friend on my last visit and it (a) did not seem very boozy and (b) was not big enough. I wouldn't order one of these again, because it felt like a rip off at $26.

Came in with a group of 6. I ordered 2 drinks - what's frozen which was a pomegranate drink I was super excited for but my tongue literally burned after the first sip of how sour it was, luckily the waitress was so helpful and nice, she replaced it right away. Ordered some banana drink- wasn't impressed. The drinks are prettier than they taste in my opinion. Neither of my friends were impressed either. The ambiance is pretty quiet and chill, the tiny dance floor area was packed and whoever the staff was that was in charge of that area kept physically touching people to move them from blocking the little hall. Weird.. why are you poking people?

This place was our hang out for an over 50 wedding shower / bachelorette.   It was a great place.  Music was good. Drinks were strong. Maybe too strong. And the food was decent. I saw a huge line out back and I don't know if I would wait in line to come here.  But overall I liked it a lot.  Very good place for girls night out.

Came here on a Thursday night with a group of 5, one being my cousin from California (I had to show her that Chicago can be tropical in February!).

By the grace of the food gods, we somehow got a booth in the bar area within 15 minutes even though we were told it would be a 2 hour wait. That instantly made our night since we wouldn't have to be huddled at the corner of a bar with our massive drinks trying to fight over table space with 100 other people.

Food: The Fried Chicken was our favorite. Luau Chips were very unique and something you definitely have to try here. Spring Rolls were nothing special, we probably should have gotten the spare ribs instead. Next time!

Drinks: My favorite drink was the Painkiller No 3. That was good, but probably had a little too much ice and not enough drink... Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed eating the ice at the end. It also comes in a glass pineapple which is pretty cool, and i'm dude, so don't go judging me. Jet pilot was not my favorite either.. The Bunnys Banana Daiquiri was great too and has a cool looking Banana that is shaped like a Dolphin in it. SWEET!

But the highlight of the night?!?! When we ordered a Zombie Punch and it came out with dry ice and there was smoke everywhere pouring out our drink which was inside a glass skull! SO COOL!  Within 3 seconds, we must have had 3 instagram pictures, 4 FB posts about it, and 1 Snapchat video. You just can't buy those bragging rights...

Why not 5 stars? Service could have been a bit better... Waited forever to get forks and knifes after they took our initial ones away and we ordered more food. And getting a hold of our waitress took 10-15 minutes each time we tried.
Wow this place was fun and had great drinks and atmosphere. We will definitely be back again

This is such a fun bar to visit when in Chicago! I'd say it's a must for tourists. This is an under ground, back alley, speak easy tiki bar. Can't get much more unique than that! The entrance is enticing with a wall of skulls and blue lighting. The drinks here are fun and strong! Loved the glasses that they're served in and I found out you can actually purchase the glassware on their website. Only downside to this place is that it's going to be pretty packed, especially on a weekend night, and you really need to have reserved a table if you want your own space. Haven't tried the food but I did smell a shrimp dish that came out and it smelled amazing! Will return.

When we arrived around 11:30 the line was pretty long, our friends had waited almost 40 minutes in line. No cover. Place was a bit crowded. Took us a while to get drinks but only because each drink requires a lot of time. They each have a lot of garnishes so it does take time to make. Love the theme.

Ahhhh, the young, hip, and popular spot.... great for a fun birthday night but that's really about it.  

The entrance is located in an alley, follow the blue lights and you will see a tall guy standing there.  No, he isn't homeless.  He is the doorman.  You will also know it is the entrance from the strange stand alone red velvet rope located across the alley from the door, holding back the drones of 24 year olds standing outside in 15 degree Chicago weather without coats on.

Even with a reservation, plan on standing in a PACKED 5x20 foot space in front of a long bar for about 30 minutes.  Drinks are very good and appropriately priced.  Cute design.

Tables are small - really small.  For 8 women, we were given a booth that was clearly made for 4 people.  Asked for additional chairs and was initially told no.

Food is terrible, served cold, and not cleared very fast.

Tradervics in the bottom of the Palmer House Hilton was very similar to this restaurant.

This place is a hilarious and wonderful surprise if you're not aware it exists and your friend says "hey, I want to show you this random thing down an alley."

Hit it early on a week night for no wait, and terrifyingly sugary and strong drinks. At $13 a pop it's a pretty great deal for the experience.

Certainly not a bar you'd want to become a regular at, but definitely a great place to show off to n00bs and out of towners!

Want a fun and different night out with friends? This is your spot! Amazing festive cocktails with great music. Sit and chat or dance to fun music! Cool local with a great vibe! My girl friends and I love to kick off girls night at 3 Dots!

Drinks are good.  Rec fried chicken, wings, and ribs --which we ordered a gazillion times over the course of the night.

Pretty crowded place, even when you have your own table.
Delicious drinks, delightful design, scrumptious cuisine.
Great drinks and fun for a girls night out but I kinda felt like I was in a Rainforest Cafe so that was a bit of a turnoff. I would still recommend it for bachelorette/birthday parties
love it!! Its a little taste of Hawaii in the middle of Chicago. The drinks are yummy and the appetizers are also good. Great ambiance and fun for a girls night out.

Hard to find if you're looking on google maps, but worth it if you can find it!

It's a really cute location. Drinks are priced rather steep, but it's not somewhere I would go to drink all night. Stop in for the ambiance and experience. Grab a drink or two and then move on.

It's a great spot for a girls night or to take out of town guests.

I guess I don't get the hype.  There are many other cocktail bars that don't involve waiting in a line to get in.  Then be prepared to wait in another line for bar service.  Drinks are better then a dive bar, but nothing to write home about.  Cocktails were on tap!!!!!  The bartender only added a float and garnish.  I've never seen cocktails on tap at a cocktail bar.  The bartender kept adjusting his pants and mustache while continuing to serve drinks.  People even called him out on it.  GROSS!!!
I understand their volume is high, but I don't think the quality justifies the price.  Typical drink runs about $15 a pop.  Younger crowd, many with the 21 year old shot glass necklaces and plenty of bachelorette parties.  Unless you have a table, be prepared to stand.  Expensive, loud and like I said, plenty of better options for a well made cocktail, if that's what you're looking for.  
If you're looking for sore feet, an empty wallet and a cocktail on tap, you've found the right place.

Fancy girl day stop #2. Girls night out is sacred. I spend half the night getting ready and chatting with the gals about where we should go, how we should do our hair.... yadda yadda yadda. After dinner, we headed on over to Three Dots and a Dash. There was a small line to get in but no cover charge. we headed downstairs and heard all the great music they were playing. There was a whimsical tiki/hawiian theme happening here but nothing over-the-top. This place was more of a lounge-y type place rather than a club. I am a huge fan of lounges. It wasn't too loud where you couldn't hear your friends. It was a Saturday evening so the place was crowded but nothing we couldn't handle. We finally snagged a booth to sit in and our waitress came over and she seemed a little frazzled. She got us some beautifully crafted drinks that are served in fun tiki styles. The drinks were good for tiki drinks, a bit on the sweet side but super cute. The service wasn't 100% to my liking but I guess its all up in the air for busy weekends. I enjoyed the booths that can make you gathering intimate and enjoyable. The tiki drink can get pretty pricey for a nice buzz but hey, you are downtown for a reason, right?

Go there for drinks, stay for the ambiance but be sure to stop by the other places in the area for a more livelier crowd.

pics.caption: Bad pic but its one of those seashell drinks and a shot of the cool centerpiece.

review.des:
I loved everything about this place! From the incognito back alley entrance, to the Brady Bunch Hawaiian episode feel this cool spot had!

I ordered the Pain Killer and my SO ordered the Jet Pilot. BOTH amazing and def had a nice buzz going after just one drink. I think it's a great spot for fruity strong as hell drinks for $13 each! Really you can't beat the price point!

Didn't have any food there...honestly I don't think that's what they're known for. But maybe next time I will grab a bite!

All In all its a great themed spot without feeling too gimmicky. Drinks are smooth and reasonably priced.

P.s. Beware of the little skulls next to certain drinks. Those mean they are EXTRA potent! CHEERS!!!!!!

Weirdly, I tried to make reservations, but the restaurant was booked up for weeks in advance. Then, when we came in, it was totally empty for an hour and a half before people started trickling in. Not sure what's going on there.

You can't go wrong with any of the drinks here. I think I've had a good share of the menu and nothing disappointed. The drinking mugs are insane--you can buy them from the bar if you want some for your home.

The food here wasn't so great the last time I tried it, but that was a year ago, so it may have improved since then. You should probably eat beforehand anyway as some of the drinks are pretty strong, and this is more of a drink than food establishment.

Service can be spotty at times (we were sat in a corner and forgotten about for a while) but friendly and eventually they'll come back around to take care of you.

I wish I had one of their daiquiris right now!

Wow, I love this place. Prices are high but you're paying for the full experience, which includes a beautiful atmosphere, amazing drinks, great music... I especially love visiting in the middle of winter when I can forget about all the snow and cold and pretend I'm at a real Tiki bar somewhere exotic and warm. I've tried several of the appetizers and they were pretty decent too.

Don't think you'll get in right away on a Friday night unless you make a reservation. I've seen long lines out the door on many occasions.

If you get inside and want a table, but are told that it'll be an hour wait, put your name on the list and go to the bar. On more than one occasion that 1-2 hour wait turned into 15 minutes. I'm not sure how... but I wasn't complaining.

I have to say, this place is pure fun.  The only unfortunate thing about this place is nothing that can really be helped, I'm just too old for it.  This place attracts a lot of 20something and 30something people, and I'm, well...let's just say, a bit older (but not too much).

The atmosphere is nice, I wish it were bigger and less crowded.  After all, I remember the original Trader Vics in New York.  There's just no room to have fun.  That said, the booze is fantastic and the seating arrangement makes it very easy to interact and make new friends, or just have a fun conversation with someone new.  I'm a tequila fan, I just love tequila.  They have some fantastic drinks here that are a blast to drink, served in typical unique tiki fashion.  You won't be sorry.  

This is a very touristy place, but don't let that stop you from going.  Very easy to get completely blasted...so be careful!  

It's a "must go," and I recommend it to all my friends who do visit.  I promise you'll have a great time.
Overpriced but it's a cute experience. Food menu isn't large at all. Service isn't great. Some servers are rude. Drink was good but didn't look like the one in the picture.

I have mixed feelings about this place, I really do.

It's small, dark, speak-easy(ish) with a touch of Hawaii (I've been there so I know). The place is cute, the decor is cute, the staff are cute, the drinks are cute (and tasty; but also slightly weak and filled with way too much ice).

The problem, you ask?

When you go for a "meal" there, the portions are tiny and extremely overpriced. They also sit you in tiny tables, squeezed in way too close to your peeps. If you're on a date, and you actually like the person, that's not so bad but otherwise, I'd be irritated.

The entrance in and of itself is a huge pain in the ass to find so if this is your first time, just know... it's in an alley & the doorman will stare at your ID for a solid 5 minutes before letting you in. Not to mention, at that point, you probably would've already waited in line for about 20 minutes.

I don't know...it's just a hit or miss with this place. I guess it depends on my mood that day as to whether or not I go back. But I definitely won't go back for a meal; just drinks.

Aloha. (also means goodbye).

=)

This was my first time at Three Dots and a Dash. I'm not new to Tiki bars. This place proves why it's one of the top 10 Tiki bars in Amareica according to Food Network. Great Tiki atmosphere, amazing Pu Pu platter, and accurate Tiki drinks. Prices are normal and you get what you pay for. Stephanie, our waitress, was amazing. Highly recommended!

Stopped at this place last night. It was my daughter's  23rd birthday and we first went to PF Changs on Clark. They treated  us like absolute  crap!!!!!!  It was horrible!!!  We were so upset that we just took our food to go, we were clearly  not welcomed at that place.  Couldn't let my baby go home on a note like that for her 23rd bday. I was determined to turn the night around. We put the food in the car and started yelping nearby places. Three dots came up and we were on our way. Funny thing  is we've  been trying to get to Three  dots and a dash  for almost a year but never made it. When we arrived in the alley and approached the tiki torches I was a little  concerned. The tall, bearded, handsome, intimidating guy at the door  asked for our identification before we could enter (my daughter looks very young and they serve  licca...lol). He saw my daughter's  id and wished her a happy birthday. From that moment I knew we were in the right place. We were seated and served by friendly, welcoming, professional staff. Our lovely waitress was a joy! We had a couple of drinks and the food was tasty. We ordered  the coconut shrimp and the thai chicken  and those funny looking chips with guac. So yummy. Thank you Three Dots and a Dash for turning my daughter's  birthday around. We ended the night on a high note. Thanks to the staff, all of them were so great.

"Please enjoy our no frills, laid back themed Tiki Bar but please, no hats allowed".

Good drinks and fair prices minus the atmosphere of the OG Tiki bars of SoCal this place is trying to recreate. An air of pretension the moment you meet the staff ("Do you have reservations?") and uptight dress code (which isn't mentioned on their website) killed the vibe early on. Again, 2 Stars for drinks. They are delicious

Reviews to this place were promising but was a let down.  Almost turned around immediately after entering but decided to stay for a drink.  This place was gimmicky and did not feel like a true "Chicago" hangout.  I felt more like a tourist.  Drinks contained tons of sugar and maybe I would have enjoyed this place if I was still in high school.

Three dots and I was a little disappointed. I honestly had my hopes up for this place and thought that I would instantaneously fall in love. I love to be transported to paradise and the not the cheesy kind of tropical Hawaiian shirt kind of cheesy. Well, at least atmosphere wise, I liked it. These royal blue skulls as you walk down the basement of this alley where the actual restaurant is located, now those skulls were fun. Then they have this lounge where people wait to be seated, also kind of fun, and even where the actual restaurant is, definitely tropical but not overdone. So they get a few stars just for creating a fun kind of environment that makes me want to come back for more. Okay let's get to everything else.

When we walked in on a Saturday night around 6:30pm it was packed, and I don't like the idea that they take reservations for some nights on open table and not for others, but whatever. The hostess said you can have one table and by this point it's already like 6:45pm but we have to promise to be out by 8:15pm. I figured okay why not, otherwise we would have to wait an hour or so just to be seated. We took the nice table in a corner booth and got comfortable. Our server approached us right away and took our drink order. I have to say the cups that the drinks are served in are pretty freaking cool, definitely the best part of the place. I ordered the Mai Tai but not the one on the menu, one that is a new drink served with tequila instead of rum called the pinky gonzales or something, and I did like it. I didn't love it, but thought it was a decent drink that I would order again if I was here since I'm a tequila girl all the way. My husband got the "A lonely island lost in the middle of a foggy sea" made with rum, cold brew coffee, pineapple, lime and some other things and I have to say, we both tasted it and thought it was gross. It's only saving grace was that it's soo strong so the more you drank it, the more you started to like it...but he hated it, in fact in retrospect he should have asked the server for another drink instead of not enjoying your $13 concoction. Our friends that were with us got the Three dots and a dash drink and the Painkiller No 3 which was not served in a pineapple mug. That was disappointing.

Okay, so after having these very strong drinks, you get the munchies so we ordered a few things for the 4 of us to share and I looked at the prices and I thought, they aren't pricey, not bad. But the portions were TINY, like I never complain about small portions, but I think they need to be up'd a size or two considering they come with these huge, strong drinks. We got the pineapple guacamole with these yucky chips, they should really consider doing plantain chips, and for $9 it's like a spoon of guac. We got the coconut shrimp and you get a total of 6 shrimp and they weren't jumbo, and were more like fried shrimp instead of coconut. We also got the thai fried chicken which was my favorite dish and I def. recommend it, but once again, super small portion, enough for one person to nibble on, and not to share with 4 people. However, that kind of comfort food goes well with the drinks. Overall, the place is fun, the service was okay, the drinks were decent but strong and the food portions were too small. I don't know if I'm dying to go back, but definitely wouldn't want to wait over an hour here.

pics.caption: A few of their tasty drinks

review.des:
This place is AWESOME! My friend and I looved it here! Definitely one of the highlights of our Chicago trip!

We went around 8pm on a Thursday night and the place wasn't too crowded yet. We managed to find a seat at the bar! Let's be honest. This bar is underground, so we had some trouble finding this place since the entrance is in the back alley and nothing but a door and a couple of bouncers. haha! Once you're inside, the Hawaiian tiki themed interior is suuper nice!! I was blown away by the decorations and the beautiful lighting.

We ordered a total of 4 tiki drinks ($13 each) and the luau chips n guac ($9). I'm into stronger drinks, so I got the Dead Reckoning and Poipu Beach Boogie Board, while my friend who's into sweeter and milder drinks, got the Painkiller No. 639 and Demerara Dry Float. Our bartender was very friendly and fast! She made sure that our drinks are nicely decorated with different flowers, umbrellas, mint leaves, etc. All the drinks are SUPER pretty and pretty STRONG too, so 2 - 3 of these drinks will get the job done. I was also pretty enticed by the Zombie drink that has smoke running out of it. Cool!

tl:dr - Very reasonable priced beautiful high quality tiki drinks. Friendly and efficient staffs. Beautifully decorated interior = 5 stars in my book!!

GO HERE if you are a fan of tiki bars!

Open up one in SF pretty please...? :)

I think everyone I know who went here just over hyped this place so much that I had such higher expectations. Oh a 'hidden tiki bar that's in an alley, so cool!' So yeah, went there, small seating area on the right when you first enter, then a bigger room that's crazy crowded by 9pm already. What annoyed me is there's only 1 bar with 3 bartenders. Took like over 30 minutes just to get a drink, then they are all like specialty drinks worth 13 bucks each that comes in a nice looking cup. Granted the drinks are pretty strong, but I tried  like 5 different ones and all were pretty gross in my opinion. Luckily we put our name down for seating, and got one in the small room where you first enter.

Someone in my group ordered the 13 dollar shrimp and had like 4 pieces. Yea don't recommend getting any of that over priced food either. At the end of the night, our group ended up getting kicked out because they said we were trying to steal things twice, but partly I think that's just a little racist. One was someone I knew so I'll respect that, but there were other Asian groups there, it could have been any of those. This other small group wasn't even with us and they got kicked out too which is where the racist part comes in I think. Yea, cool place to come once for the decorations but no need to go again.

EDIT:
Manager messaged me thanking me for the feed back so I added 1 star. It's nice to see a place care about the customers.

I have heard many good things about this place and I finally got to go there tonight!

I really love this place! The drinks are a little pricey, but they make up for it with the amount of alchol you actually get and most of the drinks have a pretty neat little glass that you can buy as well!

It is a Tiki bar, but it is much more than that! It remains a bit upscale, but still remains a bit casual and fun!

I also have to say that the wait staff was phenomenal! Very attentive without being overbearing and kept it fun!

If you want to go to a nice bar that has different drinks and can show that even a fancy bar can be fun, this is your place!

If you were not intentionally looking for this place, I can see how it can be missed. When my friend led us down this little alley way where Three Dots and A Dash's entrance was located, I was uber confused. But apparently, I was the only one not in-the-know because in front of this jank little entrance in the middle of the river north alley, stood a sizable line of eager drinkers waiting to get in.

Once you get in, the bar itself is very cool: imagine if a speakeasy had a baby with a Tiki Bar. Really popping and lively with people. Down side to that is you will likely not find seats outside the bar area, and you will have to fight your way up to the bartenders and hope to make eye contact with one of them to secure yourself/your party drinks. Drinks were good--very strong. Had a good time here!

More like Three Dots and a Disaster.

It actually pains me to write this review because I absolutely adore tiki bars and their over-the-top whimsical umbrella drinks. Especially in Chicago, where escaping winter's unrelenting chill via a night of imbibing super sweet cocktails set to an island-inspired playlist is a very welcome temporary reprieve. I know, I know - I have a very big imagination.

Though only 20-something degrees outside, the scene was a hot one - good crowd, even better music, and a waiting table for our party of four. The air was crackling with magic!

And then we waited. And waited some more. Thirty minutes in, we finally received menus. Over an hour after sitting down, our drinks were delivered. Keep in mind that while we were waiting, we were tormented by witnessing tables of patrons sat after us receive their drinks many, many minutes before us.

BUZZ KILL!

Eventually, we were able to grab a manager who offered to comp our first round of drinks. Our server mentioned that we could also try one of their signature punch bowls. Okay, now we're talking!

When the bill came, our first round wasn't comped as they decided to only comp the punch bowl... you know, the one that we were invited to try?

Fail. Keep your dots and dash past this one!
Cool-looking drinks, and a fun night-time vibe. The Tiki Bar concept was really interesting and something new!

Chicago desperately needs a taste/touch of Hawaii--especially in the winter time. And Three Dots fills that void. In the narrow little alley across the street from Paris Club, you will find neon blue lights that lead you to a door, that will take you downstairs to this nice little Hawaiian getaway.

Behold the tiki/Hawaiian decor (done tastefully, not tacky)...and proceed to order a drink because as everyone else has mentioned, their cocktails are quite interesting! They are strong, so you get what you pay for. They come in a variety of interesting containers and with various props coming out of them, like a banana, smoke, etc... Hence the long wait time for a drink.

Several things I wish Three Dots would improve on: more seating, more food options (and less expensive apps), better/more attentive service. The line at the bar during happy hour can be three people deep and not a lot of space to stand around, I would suggest going during off-peak hours. Like I said food options are limited and expensive, their chips and guac and shrimp were good, but nothing to write home about. Food-wise, I would give it 3 stars. The 4 stars are for theme, ambiance, and cocktails. It's a cute little place to check out once or twice for drinks.
Love this retro tiki lounge.  Amazing themed drinks that are very strong.  On the pricey side, but you pay for the ambience.  Will go back again

I have been here several times, and had a fun and different experience every time. They recently changed their menu but if you remember some of their old drinks they can still make it for you. Every drink they make is a performance which makes it worth the price.

The only unpleasant experience I had was waiting in the rain on a Saturday night to go in. Even with an umbrella my group got drenched. Even so, we only waited about 15 minutes and it was nice to not go into a bar that was too crowded. So if you go, plan accordingly. I suggest a weeknight for the real tiki experience.

A special kudos to bartender Lisa, who was extremely pleasant and personable, and even took some time to talk to us and share some facts about the place. And she makes killer drinks.

Classy tiki bar in Chicago? Yes, please!

I had reservations on a Thursday near their opening time with my mom. We were seated as soon as we walked in. DEFINITELY recommend reservations since this place fills up quick!

Drinks - Dry Float and Boogie Board for me while my mom tried one of the Painkillers and Bunny's. They were all so tasty but I think my favorite was the Boogie Board. The banana flavor may be a bit too much in Bunny's unless you really enjoy banana! I was surprised to see all the comments about the price of the drinks. Yeah, they're about $13/each but they were very strong and much more work goes into these then your average rum and coke! I thought the prices were very reasonable for River North and especially because the drinks were strong.

Appetizers - flaming shrimp and tuna crisp. It's fun that they flambe the shrimp tableside. Both were delicious.

Service - prompt and friendly! The server found out it was my mom's birthday and offered to bring over a birthday shot :) Not my mom's cup of tea so the server replaced a shot with sorbet which was the perfect finish to drinks and appetizers here.

I've since been back with my husband and he also really enjoyed Three Dots. We already have plans to go back next week!

Very good bar, lovely atmosphere. The bartender was very attentive since it was our first time. He explained the drink menu and was able to give us a little history of the name of the bar and how it came to be.

O man, we only had drinks here but they were GOOD!  What I could see from the dining population, the dishes looked delightful and tasty, definitely going back for dinner.  My sister has dined here before and she likes the food so I'm sure it's delish!
I wanted to try the Treasure Chest but it was a bit pricey :/

Great night here at this Tiki Bar.  Our server was terrific and we loved the ambiance and the whole vibe.  Drinks start at $13 which we planned for and the small food menu was reasonable and well done.  We loved the flame shrimp and the chips.  The chips were delicious!
There was a line in the alley entrance when we arrived at the opening which was 4pm on a Friday.  We heard that several people had made reservations for tables in advance.  We did not, but because we were the 3rd or 4th party in the door we were seated immediately.  Great experience!

If you're feeling the winter blues like I am... Three Dots and a Dash will take you back to your island vacation. My two girlfriends and I made reservations via open table around 4PM on a Saturday to have drinks and an app at 7:30PM. Best part about making the reservation is that we were seated at a booth that could fit 6 girlfriends or 2 couples!

Great for drinks and an appetizer before or after dinner

The vibe was great, music was good and the service was on point. The waitress was dressed in a cute island themed dress and was very knowledgeable about all the drinks. Her recommendations made for some great drinks.

The menu was skillfully laid out with the descriptions of the cocktail and cute images of the drinks in their tiki inspired mugs/glasses/cups!

Loved my drink- Poipu Beach Boogie Board.
When the waitress said it has guava, I was hooked. The Boogie Board came in a tall ceramic container with fun garnishes. A slice of pineapple, an orchid flower, pineapple leaves and more... The drink was sweet, sour, tropical and I loved it!

They had a small appetizer list. We shared a Fried Thai Chicken - perfect portion to share with 2-3 people. It was delish...

Overall, Three Dots made for a fun night with the girls. We all raved about the decor, delicious appetizer and yummy drinks.

I went here for the first time the other night for a goodbye get together with a few friends and it was a really great experience. The drinks and appetizers are all served with flourish and unlike many other places downtown you get what you pay for! My personal favorites were the Bunny Banana Daiquiri and the Saturn, which are both a little more on the sweeter side.

We had reserved a table for 6 the day of which was a miracle in an of itself, but not everyone could come at the same time (work obligations). We were told that parties must show up together or else the late comers wait with the crowd; they have typically long lines (there were 30 people waiting outside at one point). No worries however because the host was very accommodating and understanding and allowed two sets of friends to come in later on in the evening with no problems and even gave us extra chairs to make sure we were comfortable. Overall I was very pleased with how my friends and I were treated and although the waitress may have taken a while to get to us, Lalapalooza was this weekend so I can understand the craziness they must have been dealing with. I will definitely be coming back! P.S. The earlier the better so you can get ahead of the crowd.

I've given this place a try THREE times and I'm afraid it's time to throw in the towel.

First time I went, the bartender wouldn't look at me, but she was serving everyone else. I assumed it's because it was busy, so I gave her the benefit of the doubt. I waited patiently.

After about 15-20 minutes, it was getting ridiculous, so I leaned in and tried to ask if I could order. She gave me the dirtiest look and said "Just hold on!" and proceeded to serve others, especially the men. Other women were in line with me and they also said they've been waiting forever. My friends and I decided this wasn't worth it and left for another bar.

Second time we came, we got drinks but not seats. It was so unbelievably crowded that there were people standing everywhere. However, they're really strict about clearing the aisles and not letting people block any path or entrance. The body guards continuously told people to move away and step aside. So my friends and I were basically standing in a vertical line. What a great ladies night (roll eyes).

Third time, we came early, we beat the effing crowd, got a booth, and ordered plenty of drinks to try a variety. What a disappointment. The drinks were seriously gross. All 6 of them. 3 of them even tasted similar even though they were supposed to be different drinks. My friend, who's been coming since it first opened, said that the drink sizes have also shrunk. Unfortunately, the prices have not.

Tiki bars are popping up everywhere, so I won't be back.

We visited last Saturday between my brother's wedding and his reception (which was very close at the Hubbard Inn). My good friend told me that we had to go to Three Dots and a Dash if there was time. I brought my 90 year old Grandma, her sister, a few aunts and uncles and 4 of my friends. At first I was skeptical as we had to wait for a few seconds before we could come into the Tiki Lounge. It was amazing and all had a great time. Thank you for your great experience and wonderful customer service. I will be back next time I am in Chicago!

Hint.. make reservations. We went right at 5pm and the place was already full.  Also, A+ on the customer service!!

I finally made it to this hidden tiki lounge that all my friends have been telling me about, but I only half believed existed. I mean when someone tells you how they walked down a torch-lined alleyway, ended up in a tropical basement bar and swiftly browned out on elaborate island drinks in painted skull mugs, it sounds like they were deeper in the sauce than they are letting on. But last night some of my friends and I ended up here and I realized that it's real and it's pretty awesome!

We went around 7pm and had a reservation (go early with a reservation! It was the only way this would have worked for us because even though it was the first 80+ degree day of the year, people were still flocking to hang out in this basement bar). Walking in we were kind of giddy looking around at all the cool tiki decor and that we were finally here. When we sat down we immediately decided the best tactic was to all order different things and sample and we laughed at the little skulls next to the extra strong drinks. Let's get this straight - even the drinks without the skull are strong. But it's still a cute idea. I really liked both of the drinks that I ordered: the Siboney and the Dead Wreckoning. My friends' drinks were really good as well - especially the banana daquiri. I would order that or the dead wreckoning if I return

We didn't really know the food situation here so we planned on eating dinner, which I wouldn't reccommend because they don't have a huge menu and it's mostly snacks. That said, we loved all the apetizers we shared and if you don't mind that kind of meal then it's great. We had the luau chips, spring rolls, crab rangoon, and cocomut shrimp - all nice accompaniments to the cocktails. I would try the other stuff on the menu since the people at the table next to us seemed to order one of everything and some of the other things looked awesome.

Overall, the theme is fun and the service was fine but I don't think this will be a regular hangout for me. The stuff is a little pricey, although good (average prices for normally overpriced River North but I'm too much of a lush to spend $13 per cocktail unless I'm taking it easy) and since it's in a basement, it must be a great tropical escape in the winter but I'll be sticking to more patios and rooftops once summer eventually arrives for good.

pics.caption: Dead wreckoning in the front, surrounded by other drinks

review.des:
This place is amazing.
The spring rolls are finger lickin' good and so are the drinks.
Loved the dolphin banana.
Also thought it was cool how it was hidden in a back alley and through a rednecky bar.
Very nice...cant wait to go back.

Horrid management.  @ 9:30 on a super cold Wednesday night...Tables are full, no waitress in site.  The bar is full and additional patrons waiting for a drink.  NO menu and pictured menu on site nor you can ask for one.  Some section of the venue is closed off.  All packed on one side of the room and NO service.  Only 4 competent bartenders (2 at front and 2 in back) to service 800 sq ft of patrons.

Good luck getting a drink...wait is at least 30 mins for a menu, prolly another 30 to find a person to place an order.

Very cool tiki bar in Chicago. It was underground which made it even cooler for a Miami girl like me. The art and detail in design was awesome. It was dark with blue lights. On the was down they had a wall covered in small skulls. The bar was fancy and the cocktails were beautifully presented and tasted great!! I sat at the bar but there were also tables and booths available. The bartender was very friendly and helpful.

pics.caption: My super cute and delicious cocktail!
Cool wall art on the way into three dots and a dash

review.des:
I love that the entrance to this place is in an alley on Hubbard between Clark & Dearborn...Just look for the blue light I also love that I can feel like I am in Hawaii in the winter time as they have a tiki theme going on here in reference to decoration and what the waitstaff is wearing. Setting is quite dim and it can get pretty loud between the music and the crowd.

Ahhh on to the drinks...
I have been here a handful of times, so I have tried quite a few of their drinks as I usually get 3 per visit.
My favorite is the Painkiller # 3 as it includes multiple Caribbean rums along with pineapple cream, coconut liqueur and passion fruit...very delicious to say the least.. It comes in what appears to be a pineapple mug...pretty cool

The Saturn is really good as it comes in a coconut mug with all the trimmings
Pago Pago is good, but it's not as big of a drink as it looks on the menu...it is really good though. It includes Nicaraguan rum, pineapple, lime and creme de cucao.  
I also recommend the Banana Daiquiri, Three Dots & A Dash drink, Halekulani and Tropical Itch as they are all great!

I didn't realized they served food until my 3rd visit. I opted for the Polynesian Spare Ribs as I saw another table get it and the smell was intoxicating. It comes along with a pineapple glaze and is very tender. My pals opted for the Thai Fired Chicken which was also delicious. The coconut shrimp will be next on my list to try.

You would never guess this is a Lettuce Entertain You joint...I was shocked when a friend told me. I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to try some cool drinks and good snacks. I usually get here right @ 5PM when it is empty as they are just opening as this place fills up fast. Its pretty jam packed around 5:45...FYI

What a beautiful Tiki Lounge. Great atmosphere and happy energy. It's such a fun place. I really enjoyed my drinks there and the music as well. The best part is that when I'm there, I fee like I am really in Hawaii.

Interesting bar. Entrance in alley, had to ask where it was. Decorated like a classic tiki bar. The bar and sitting areas are down in the basement. Made mistake of going on a Saturday. Bar and sitting area is very, very small. If any sort of crowd you WILL wait. Hostess told us on Saturday at 7:00P.M. wait will be 2.5 hours plus for a table. She said we could get drink at the bar. Impossible, 3-4 people deep and just no room. We left. Craving for a classic tiki drink did not leave so we went back on Sunday. No seats at the bar, several people standing and empty tables available. Made the mistake of sitting at a table where the patrons had just left and the all important busboy said we couldn't sit there without checking in with hostess. Drink was good, not great. Pricey drinks but presented very well. Atmosphere great but overall won't be going back. If you have a tiki drink craving, go on their slow times. Not worth otherwise.

Holy strong drinks, Batman.

I'm talking three different liquors and absinthe strong.

I guess you're getting what you pay for, $13 per drink in a unique-to-the-cocktail-glass and lots of flower garnishes, but I don't think I will be back.

It's not 3 D&D, it's just that I'm not huge on tiki drinks. I'm also not huge on places that tell you you can't sit somewhere that doesn't even have a reserved sign on it because "other people are coming." Is it a bar or a restaurant? Or is it VIP? We stood and enjoyed our drinks but if we would have had a table or two, we would have spent more money. Bummer. I guess that means call ahead even on Wednesdays and Thursdays.

Plus one star for the amazing banana dolphin! An actual dolphin made from a banana was coming out of my drink. Freaking.sweet.
The Bartender I had was very engaging and was well knowledgeable about the drink menu.

So fun!  Three Dots was somehow off my cocktail radar, but it's not anymore! and I just might move into the bar to take up permanent residence at this tropical destination.  

What made this even more fun for me is that I was taken here as a surprise (I was most impressed).  And so, upon seeing the lit torches in the snowy alley, my perma-grin made its first appearance of the night. My grin grew wider within sight of the huge wall of blue-light-lit skulls placed over the descending staircase.  And a full blown toothy smile replaced the grin once inside upon the realization that we were in a kick ass, low lit, bona fide tiki bar. Hell yes!

This was our pre-dinner drink spot (for 2+ hours) so we cozied into our seats for several slow sipping cocktails. And they were fabulous. Good, strong, not too sweet.
- Three Dots and a Dash
- Bunny's Banana Daiquiri
- Mai Tai

I'd order all of those again, but there are so many other equally good sounding cocktails on the menu that I'll first explore other options (like the smoking skull).  The food looked and sounded good too - so, yeah, there will definitely be a next time...

Bonus:
- drinks are served in large festive glasses (skulls, coconut shaped, tiki-themed)
- drink stirrers are equally festive - mermaids, octopuses
- beautiful garnishes: fresh flowers, pineapple chunks, big handfuls of fresh mint, *see my photo of the banana daquiri with banana-dolphin garnish - a highlight of the night
- waitresses in pretty tropical floral dresses

pics.caption: Blue skullz peepin you down the stairs
Menu with great illustrations of drinks

review.des: This secluded bar makes you feel like you're in a Hawaiian speak easy. It can be challenging to find, but that adds to the charm! The drinks are pricey, but they pack a punch and come in super cool & fun glassware. The appetizers like the Luau Chips and Coconut Shrimp are delicious but they don't give you nearly enough.

I came to Three Dots and a Dash after dinner with a group of 6 girls. We arrived in the alley, and saw the the line was half a block long. Fortunately for us, the lined moved quickly for a Saturday night. We made it to the head of the line in 15 minutes. Granted, it was still pretty early in the night, and the night owls weren't out yet.

Once you're at the head of the line, the bouncer checks IDs and lets you in. You proceed down two flights of stairs to the underground bar. I highly recommend getting reservations! At the time, there was a two-hour wait for a table. You can also sit at the bar, but the bar seats were taken and larger groups were huddling together at the bar. To get drinks, you have two options: Wait at the guard rails and the waitresses, dressed in floral print dresses, will take your order, but on a Saturday night, they're usually busy serving the bachelorette parties. Your second option is to squeeze in between the patrons at the bar. You may have to flirt/charm your way in, or be prepared to break up large groups and get dirty looks.

TDD is known for its atmosphere: Its underground, dimly-lit, and decorated with both tropical paradise-themed (think tiki bar) decorations and skulls. The drinks are just as festive: My friends and I ordered Bunny's banana daiquiri. If you like bananas, then this drink is for you. They even cut a banana in half, slit it in four places and add leaves and cloves for eyes and fins. There's a banana dolphin for you! And, a flower.

We left TDD about ten minutes after we got drinks. Its a busy place, and even though there is a DJ, there's not much to do when you don't have a table and get pushed farther and farther into the corner as more people arrive. No dancing, and you can't hear yourself over other conversations and the music. Lesson learned: Get a reservation before coming!

Thank you Three Dots and a Dash for being the perfect place to host my birthday party, especially to our lovely server Adrian (sorry if I spelled your name wrong hun!) who was very attentive to our party and orders.

If your party is in the double digits, best to make your reservation in advance. Everything on the drink menu you can't go wrong! Ordered the Zombie Punch and banana daiquiri along with the luau chips again! And tried the Thai chicken and spare ribs, NEW FAVORITE!

I really enjoyed the Bamboo Room because it was enough space for our party of 11, the music was just right & loud enough but to a point where I can still hold a conversation without yelling at the person next to me.

Had an excellent experience, definitely a loyal patron!

Loved this place!
I had wanted to go since I read about it and was not at all disappointed!
A bit hard to find the entrance, but I guess that is by design
The skulls (not real) on the way in are a great touch
The menu was perfect, the staff super nice.  I did not have any food but the drinks were AMAZING!!!
Really thoughtful recipes with fantastic execution
Exactly what we were looking for!!!

everything was good until my co-worker found dead fruit flies in his drink. Also, at the bottom of his drink was a dirty napkin.  Told our server she wasn't surprised nor apologetic.  would never go back.

the drink is a bit on the sweet side, not that great

but i guess the whole point of coming here is for the looks of those cool tropical style drinks

quite long line up on a saturday night, if it is not that cold, totally worth it

SUPER COOL hidden gem of Chicago.  Who would have thought on our visit to the Windy City we'd end up down a dark alley, through a side door, downstairs to a basement tropical paradise?  The tropical atmosphere, fresh juice cocktails in creative tiki mugs and tasty fried apps really make for a unique experience.  

Very glad we got a chance to stop here on our visit.  Thanks Yelpers!

Such a fun place with delicious cocktails. I think what I like about this place is just how different it is from other places in the city. It's a "speakeasy" tiki bar, so as long as you know that going in, it's a fun time.

I've been here a few times now, last night was the first time we actually got a table to sit at as usually we've arrived later in the night and just hang by the bar. I was with a group of 8 and we all ordered different drinks and a couple appetizers. Crab rangoons were good but tiny (not the triangular ones I was used to) but their spring rolls were bigger than I was used to so it sort of evened out on that. The drinks are always strong, but when you order the ones labelled with a skull, be prepared (not complaining, just be warned haha).

Our waitress was great and very attentive, checking in on us as needed. She was really good at keeping track of additions to our group as it started with 2 people and grew to 8 within 1.5 hours.

Drinks are really pricey, but that's what you get for River North and when the bar has been ranked one of the top bars in the nation. Also, it's a fun place to bring out of towners to, but not if you're really looking for a Chicago-vibe, more Hawaiian.

My boyfriend went here on a Monday night for a late birthday drink. It wasn't hard to find and also was not all that busy, but still busy for a Monday, rainy night. The service at the bar was great: fast, knowledgeable, and friendly. It is on the pricey side, but you pay for the atmosphere and creative drinks. Would definitely recommend!

Side note: It was also nice to go to a nicer bar and still not have to worry about a dress code. Their website states that there is one, however, most people there at this time were dressed fairly casual.

This place is beyond cool.. you enter and there are skulls on the wall as you descend down the staircase into the tiki bar! Wonderful atmosphere and great drinks! This place made me realize a love I didnt know I had for tiki bars!

Fun bar, great (and super strong) drinks, apps are all quite delicious as well.

I always take out of town clients here for cocktails and they all love it.  

Highly recommend for both atmosphere and cocktails!

So I stopped in here after the Cubs game this past Thursday. Needed a good drink after watching that mess. Anyway, Three Dots did not disappoint. Bartender with a Rollie Fingers mustache (sorry for all the baseball references), helped me pick out a drink. Great suggestion. Will be back soon.
LOVE the atmosphere! Very cool feel and great theme, loved the drinks to share and the uniforms of servers!!! Highly recommend!

Great concept, beautiful drinks, aweful system.THE ONLY WAY TO GO HERE IS ON A SLOW NIGHT OR WITH A RESERVATION. I've been before on a dead weekday evening. Our experience then was good, but not great. Service was nice enough and the drinks tasted and looked fantastic. Very original concepts and dedicated to classic tiki. Super dope. I went a second time on a busy Friday night to see how they handled busy nights. Turns out, they don't handle busy nights, they just let people sink. We didn't have a reservation, which was a mistake. We waited in line for 25 minutes, which I totally understand. We walked in and there were no tables or chairs open anywhere, okay they're packed no worries. We then spent nearly 45 minutes just trying to get a bartenders attention. There was physically no more room, but they kept letting people in. We were packed in so tight we were being pushed on all sides and literally couldn't move. We never even got a drink and eventually left. It makes no sense to me why you would keep letting people in to the point you weren't able to provide service and even more to the point it wasn't safe in there if anyone had any sort of emergency. I really wish I could say you can swing by here and have a great experience, but I can't. I have to tell you to accommodate their poor system and go on a Tuesday at 5.

This was really close to our hotel so it was a quick close bar. It was also super yelpy and tiki themed so that is always fun. It closes at 2 or something and when we got in line at 12:30, they closed it off after us because of capacity? We were lucky and able to make it in. Now it is confusing because there is a hostess and she tells you to go in and order your drinks. When asked how to get seats, they say the hostess can help you. Derp. We got a small table and ordered Pieces of Eight and Banana Daiquiri. It is a good amount if you dont want to drink much and just want to sip and chat. They ran out of bananas by the time we got there which was awks. It is like a banana smoothie and it tasted quite good. The Pieces of Eight is a bit big but hella iced and was a bit stronger. I guess it is preference. There is a DJ there on the hawt nights but with no one on the dance floor. They started to play some hip hop but then it tapered back to Hawaii tiki music.

Cool Hawaiian atmosphere, and extremely strong but well-crafted drinks. Don't drive here, because you'll be stumbling home! I highly recommend the Jet Pilot cocktail. And the Coconut Shrimp, if you're hungry.

Went here on Friday night for the start of my Bday Weekend. The wait was 45 minutes to get a table so they said we could get a drink from the bar . The bar was packed so we went back to the hostess and waited 10 minutes before we were seated . Our waitress was very nice and gave us the run down on the drinks . My BFF and I opted for The Saturn and Tiki Punch . The drinks were so good so we definitely got a second round . I would come back to Three Dots especially with a group of friends . The only negative thing I would say they don't serve you water with ice . We had to request to have ice with our water!

This place is so fun. Came here based on a recommendation from my friend. It was a little difficult to find, but we eventually did. Once inside it was quite crowded and there was a wait to get a table. We eventually landed some seats at the bar.

The drinks are very intricate and beautiful and the glasses are beautiful as well. Each drink is pretty strong and after a couple my significant other and I were tipsy. Pricey drinks but worth it since they are so strong and intricate. Also reminded me of my recent vacation to Hawaii which was a plus. Would definitely visit again.

From the entrance (door in an alley) you walk down and there's a large stone wall which we thought was the entrance. Then with 2 other couples we pushed it, pressed difference stones only to realize it wasn't the door. Hilarious. Once we entered it was a tiki bar. The ambience is low lighting, great music and intimate. Definitely recommend for a date or double date. We shared the large punch drink which had passion fruit in it. So good! Then we had the spring rolls and duck tacos. OMG they were amazing. We also had the jet pilot drink which was strong but really good. Our server was a sweet girl and really attentive. Will definitely be going back!
Tiki bar in River North. The food is fine but the drinks are worth the trip.

The theme and atmosphere in this place is awesome. Definitely did not expect it when I walked into the back alley to enter.

The drink menu is long. Will take you a good time just to go through it. I would say most of them are pretty heavy, so you might want to avoid if you are looking to avoid the calories.

An annoying part is that they have seats at the bar, and this place gets really crowded so it can be annoying to order a drink.

It's my boyfriends first time here and I wanted to show him a good time. We had reservations for 6pm on a Friday. We waited for 45 mins with 3-4 tables open with a reserved sign. Throughout our waiting period we saw groups get seated in the reserved spots and finish up with their drinks yet we had to wait even with our reservations. I am very disappointed in the customer service here. I don't think I will be back even with reservations. Hosts needed to work on communication skills with the customers. We left without getting seated. Would not recommend.

Went for after-work drinks here and it did not disappoint. It's like you're being thrown back in time to a surf movie.

I only had a glass of wine, but the people I were with ordered food and fun drinks that looked and tasted delicious.

I also had been between hotel, so was carrying all my luggage with me and both the guy at the door and the hostess had no problem storing it for me. Service was very good.
Great atmosphere, great cocktails. Slooooowwwww service. Could be fun if the service wasn't so bad and ditsy.

This place is spectacular. It is a perfect mix of old school Tiki and a modern take on Tiki. The place is gorgeous. There looks to have been a lot of money dumped in here, and it shows. My first visit was on a Monday evening. There was steady traffic, but there was time to visit a little with Paul McGee who was there that night. The man is a font of knowledge about current Tiki goings on. He was also willing to make some off the menu drinks.
I love the way he's about to bring in alcohols you just never see in Tiki. They usually really work. Although he has the more typical Tiki where the drinks are rum and fruit driven with good complexity, he's doing wonderful drier drinks. You taste the fruit, but there's bitter elements that cause to drink to taste far more dry.
On my second visit I just enjoyed watching the ladies make drinks. The place was very busy, but not so full they were in danger of having to start creating a line. Everything they make just has so many ingredients. It's like watching a ballet as they make two drinks at a time with only a couple items in common.
My only recommendation is to come Sunday-Wednesday and skip the busy days. You'll get more personal attention and have a better experience.

pics.caption: The walk in to the entrance
Paul McGee, the man himself, was in attendance and making drinks. What a treat.

review.des:
This is such a great idea for a bar!  The drinks were spectacular.  A group of 4 of us tried 8 different drinks and I must say, they were all phenomenal!

All drinks are 13 which was very reasonable for the amount of alcohol that was in each and the great garnishes.

Definitely make a reservation.  We made one and still had a 20 minute wait since the group before us didn't move from our table.  

Definitely coming back!

Ok, so this place WAS super cool before everyone discovered it. Now you must wait in a line outside and once you're in its so crowded you will most likely not even be served and will definitely not be able to make any pleasant conversation with your friends (well that is if you brought any). Super great drinks, a great space, and totally rook the NYC speakeasy concept! Was my favorite bar until maybe October...now I do not really want to go back, due to the crowds, but I suggest it 100% for happy hour, just not on weekend nights.

Sum it all up: great drinks and place FOR HAPPY HOUR avoid weekends at all costs.
This is a cool idea but the food and drinks are kinda blah.  Fun for instagram photos.

You have to love the tiki bar atmosphere of this bar - there aren't many places like it in Chicago. It will be crowded and some of the drinks will taste weird, but that's what you get with any bar. It's a fun place to go on the weekends with your friends.

Some of the best cocktails in the city. I've only been here once and had THE best time. It felt like I was on vacation and that's probably why I haven't been back. I definitely didn't make it to work the next day ;-). I'd recommend it to anyone wanting to have a good time and loves specialty cocktails.

Very fun and unique tiki bar. You enter through an alley, walk down stairs with walls covered in skulls, and enter the bar area where there is a DJ, and some really great fruity drinks.

I'm not exactly a fruity-drink kind of person, but the drinks I ordered had a good balance of sweet, bitter, and spices - they had all kinds of interesting liquors and fruits.

I really enjoyed the atmosphere and thought the drinks were excellent, if pricey.

This place is very interesting and very popular. Depending on your arrival time you may be on a wait.  This is a tiki place and the drinks are themed accordingly.  The drinks are strong so you may want to watch the intake...or not depending on your intentions.

I had the banana daiquiri which comes with a dolphin head made out of a banana.  The attention to every detail can be seen from the menu to the execution of making the drinks.

If you are looking for a shot and beer type place I don't believe that you will enjoy yourself.  If you are looking for something different, you will enjoy yourself.

Fun place to stop at but if there is a line it's not really worth the wait. The bathroom attendant isn't very nice and constantly thinks people are trying to steal cups I left mine in there on accident and she threw a huge fit.

This place is GREAT to hang out with a couple of friends and enjoy extremely delicious and tropical drinks. The service is great, they are always asking you if you need anything else. The place is really comfortable, the cocktails are great and there's a wide variety to choose from. The music is perfect because it allows you to dance and talk with friends. I haven't tried the food there but I will definitely go back soon!

Name: Three Dots and a Dash is Morse Code for V which is associated with World War II and somehow associated with tiki bars.

Location: Hidden in an ally off of Hubbard between Clark and Dearborn. There is a florescent blue light above the door and on the wall leading up to it. There is a bouncer standing at the door and a heavy rope to manage the queue of people waiting to get in.

Getting in: I'm not sure about their system but they seem to let in groups of about five people every 10-15 minutes. Once you get in, you go down a dimly lit staircase, past a wall of skulls, past the hostess station, and into the bar.

Ambiance: It is a swanky tiki bar. Compared to Hala Kahiki in River Grove, Three Dots and a Dash is the mature, refined, big brother. Three Dots and a Dash is dark, smooth, and has a serious focus on rum. It felt really intimate and private because of the dim lighting. Our table was in the middle of everything but we felt secluded. The noise level was lively but we could still hear one another.

Drinks: The drinks are sneaky devils that are incredibly delectable but manage to ease you into inebriation before you know what's what. They are served in customized glasses - a different one for each drink and inscribed with the name Three Dots and a Dash. The garnishes are rum soaked cherries, pineapple, and citrus peels.

Food: We ordered nearly their entire menu. It's short but it's refined. The crab rangoons are made with real crab meat. The sauce on the ribs were so tasty that I licked them clean. Those were my favorites. We also enjoyed the coconut shrimp, springrolls, chips (more like pork rinds) with guacamole, and tuna. The chips for the tuna were a bit too seasoned for our liking but we ate them all anyway. M said that the coconut shrimp was the best she's ever had!

Service: Our server seamlessly transitioned us from the bar to our table (the table took over an hour to secure). Food and drinks came in a timely manner. She was quick witted and suave. The general manager was also on top of lighting the candle on our table multiple times. Even the owner (with a long beard) stopped by and chatted with us for a few minutes.

Price: Considering that we bought about three or four drinks each (yeah...) and nearly their entire menu, our portion of the bill was about $200. I think the entire bill was about $300 for four of us. It was spendy but we sure as heck had a good time!

The alley entrance and stairs leading down give this place a cool, speakeasy vibe that turns a little bland once you get past the host stand and into the main room. Something about the lighting and space layout gives the main room a dingy feel even with the fun Tikki lounge decor and interesting lamps.

The bland decor fades away after several sips of their delicious and well-executed Tikki cocktails. I ordered the Demerara Dry Float and The Saturn; both drinks had a nice balance of liqueurs and juices that were not too sweet and nicely refreshing. These drinks go down easily and are definitely dangerous. The plastic stir stick with an octopus on the top adds a nice, fun touch to the presentation.

The food menu compliments the drink menu quite well with hearty Asian-style bar fare like pork belly buns and Thai-fried chicken to help soak up all that booze. We ordered the spring rolls, chicken wings and pork belly buns with cucumber kimchi. Like most bar food, all of these items were tasty but not memorable. Which is fine with me because the at least food does not overshadow the stand-out drinks. I will definitely be back when the mood for Tikki drinks strikes.
Came here late on Sunday night.. This place is awesome. Great ambiance, music, and Thai fried chicken.

Such a cool experience! I ordered the "Bikinis After Dark" and it was a pretty strong flavor to begin with, but it got a lot better tasting as I drank it. The bartenders are so fast at creating these beautiful and imaginative drinks. My friend got a drink she didn't like ("Painkiller No. 347D" -- none of us liked it) and they made her a different one free of charge.

Tip: if you want to sit, you definitely need a reservation (rumor is 4-6 weeks in advance). If you are lucky you might get a seat at the bar if there are only 2 or 3 of you, but most likely you will be standing and may have just waited in line for 45 minutes -- so be prepared to wait!

We are all going back in a month or so for my friend's Birthday, the one who ordered the drink she didn't like, and will try the food! It looked and smelled so good!

A+ for atmosphere, presentation, and service!!!

God I love this place. It's perfection.

Amazing tiki drinks make this rum-loving girl so happy. Though limited, their small-plate food selections are delectable and perfect for sharing.

The corn n oil is my go-to drink. You won't find it on the regular menu, but it's an old school tiki standby. Thick and luxurious with just the right ratio of blackstrap rum to falernum to bitters to lime. I just LOVE that the tiki revival is roaring in and this is my favorite place to enjoy it!

Definitely make reservations, though, as it gets very packed and quite loud on the weekends. I prefer to go in the later evening on a weeknight. You still get the whole ambiance while avoiding the somewhat douchey crowd that sometimes shows up here on weekends.

This place can get very, very busy and it took three tries to actually get in. First attempt, we arrived at 1AM and they were already done for the night - our bad. Second and third attempt were within an hour and half of each other. Hubbard on Friday night can be a madhouse, so when we first arrived there was a sizable line and with very few drinks in us at this point, waiting was just not going to happen. Then, after visiting Henry's (another good, reasonable priced place in the area), we tried again. Three Dots and Dash still had a line (about 20 people deep) but we decided to wait this time. The line moves pretty quick. Fifteen minutes later, we were in.

We were seated at a table (it was just two of us) around 12:30 AM. I noticed bigger groups were forced to stand around the bar. Probably something you should know if rolling with a larger crowd at that time. The bar is wonderfully themed like a tiki bar and on a Friday night was loud, but not annoyingly loud. Basically what you would expect on a Friday night, just a DJ playing trite house music and lots of people talking.

We did not eat, but we had some drinks. First, let me say the drinks are pretty. I mean painstakingly pretty. You can tell someone is prepping a lot of fruit everyday. Secondly, the drinks are strong. Both very good things since you're paying around $13 per drink. I'm a whiskey drinker, so I really liked they had a bourbon tiki drink. Definitely something you do not see often. I also had the banana daiquiri - it was heaven and came with the cutest banana dolphin.

I'd recommend making a reservation if you can. All in all, I recommend this place if you're looking for a drink with atmosphere. If not, avoid this place because you'll probably end up annoyed. In fact, avoid all bars on Hubbard. It would probably just annoy you.

Omg. The Missionary's downfall is amazing. I went here with my sister and a friend. My sister had a Painkiller which was great as well. We ordered the crab Rangoon (delicious), coconut shrimp (yum), spring rolls (also yum), and the Thai chicken (amazing!) The place is a little tricky to find but not terrible, and the ambiance is so much fun! Can't wait to come back and try out some of the group drinks!
Little secret hide away. Good fun, drinks come out in some fancy tiki cups, it's definitely a starting venue or a couples night out.

This place lives up to the hype. If I'm paying for a $13 drink they better be hand crafted, aesthetically pleasing, and strong as hell. They're friggin fruity and delicious. If you want an even stronger drink you can get one on the menu with a skull next to it to "sip delicately". The line to get in at 1230 on a Saturday night (well early Sunday) was only about 10 minutes. The ambiance is fun,  tropical and casual. The entrance is in an alley in the rear of Bub city. I shall return

Shrimp are delicious and drinks will knock you on your ass!!

I love the vibe here... Tucked away like a hidden oasis! I came here before dinner so the place was just opening and empty so I can't attest to the scene but I can't wait to go back! Hopefully an update is on the horizon. (:

Three dots and a dash. This was one of my favorite places in Chicago.

To get to this place you follow the fire-lit torches down an alleyway. Upon arriving there would be a line waiting to get in. The wait is WORTH IT.

You have to find your own table/booth once youre inside but it shouldnt be too difficult. Its a cute place, with totem pole walls, a straw roof over the bar, and tiki shaped cups. Theres also a DJ, a dance floor, and there will always be someone dancing.

The drinks were amazing about 13 dollars for one. It was delicious but beware of the skull next to the menu. My table got the punch bowl to share and it really packed a punch (pun not intended).
