LOVE, LOVE, LOVE! Three Dots and a Dash is part of the Lettuce Entertain you chain.
The place books up quick so make reservations a few weeks before if you can. My friends and I got very lucky. We did not have reservations and walked in at 5:00 p.m. on a Saturday night. There was no wait and they put us in a booth. The staff was so friendly and the bar itself is so fun and unique. The glasses the drinks come in are so adorable. Wasn't a fan of the guac...very small amount with a lack of flavor, but everything else was great! I will return! :)

So we're here Christmas Eve cool back alley entrance about half full cool music playing Tjey have a nice menu with classic and modern versions of Tiki drinks We went for the Three Dots and a dash and a painkiller no3 also Spring Rolls and pork belly buns;)
Well let me say being a lush the cocktails are great cool presentation and defiantly tasty. A little on the small side but it is downtown and there is renter okay I get it So on to the food both apps we ordered were great the spring rolls could of used a little napkin blot but were good nice sauce selection too 4 different seems a little overkill but they were good The pork belly buns also very good nice semi spicy  bbq ey with a kimchi pickle it works so have to have one more cocktail and I go for a modern Poipu beach boogie board Dam Good ! The boys RJ and Jared and if course Paul Mc gee have it going on ! Congrats! People thought I was crazy when I was doing Tiki drinks out in the burbs 2 years ago!! Oh well A bit too soon!

This place serves very strong drinks that are very flamboyant! The ambiance is unique and looks like river north crossed with hawaiian flare. It is hard to find and they make people wait in line for some reason to up the hype! It is a good girls night out place.

Awesome tiki bar with a huge selection of rums and interesting cocktails. However, it gets really hectic on weekends and you might end up waiting a good bit to sit or order another drink. I think it's worth it, but it's definitely not a place to go if you're not a rum drinker.

I have been to 3 Dots a countless number of times, and I always have fun!  The cocktails are unique and amazing, and the atmosphere will make you forget entirely that you're in freezing Chicago!  I booked my birthday party here and it was so much fun.  They accommodated our large party by bringing extra chairs when more friends arrived.  

There can be a line outside and a bit of a wait to order your drink at the bar, but it's no surprise this place is crowded, it's one of the best bars in Chicago!

Walking through an alley, down the stairs with skulls overhead, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. Once you get to the bar itself it has a dark, yet somehow tropical atmosphere.

The focus is tropical beverages, all $13. The drinks are presented very creatively - flowers, banana dolphins, umbrellas, you name it! I really enjoyed the three dots and a dash - I was concerned all the drinks would be too sweet, but this one was refreshing.

The "value" is really in the presentation of the cocktail, versus the quantity of liquid.

For me this is one of those places I only need to go to once or would bring an out of towner. Once I had one tropical beverage, I didn't really want anymore.
Classy vibe in this place, matched only by the crazy drinks that come in tiki chalices the size of Texas. Pricey, with the air of exclusivity to match.

Love it! Love the shady entrance in the back alley, and the atmosphere is very 60's, as a tiki bar should be. The drinks are big, tasty, and highly decorated. I still have my mermaid stir stick. The waitresses are all wearing the cutest tropical dresses. All I remember is laughing and feeling fancy. So, 5 stars.

My friends came to visit so we decided to try a tiki bar. It was one of the best nights!! We got the bali bali and the zombie. We all loved the bali bali. The zombi was fun too but the bali bali tasted better.

Three Dots and a Dash may be tiki themed but it is quite a classy; you definitely have to be "in-the-know" to find the place. It is a speakeasy in a sense that the entrance is unmarked and looks like a backdoor to some shop.  The ambiance is quite low-key and noise-level is quiet enough to carry conversations with friends. They are very creative with the presentation of the drinks and the mugs. I also appreciated the lighting and layout which was quite modern.

Would recommend the SATURN!

pics.caption: The Saturn and a Christmas themed centerpiece

review.des: Excellent little tiki bar. Very chill atmosphere, good people watching from the bar. It would be nice if they could slightly diversify the food options, add a bit of vegetable or something a bit more reflective of modern Hawaiian fusion. On the other hand, you can't complain about the drinks. Well balanced. Not too sweet. Strong punch. I personally favor the Painkiller section of the menu, but YMMV.

This place is really cute, we came here with a group on a Sunday based on the Yelp reviews. Let's just say the ambiance was chilled and nice but our server was a BITCH!! One of our friend ordered one of the drinks off the menu, she told the waitress if she can have a number 3 ( for instance) the waitress responded with: you know they have a name? The waitress barely came to check on our table and when we paid for the tab she never came back! I had to bring the check to the bartender to get our change! Needless to say, the place was nice but with shitty service!

-First off, if you can' find it its around the back in an alley, once you step in and make your way through you know its a cool spot

-Great Tiki bar with cool staff, crazy drinks and food was pretty damn good

-Warning: there is bathroom attendants, you don't have to tip, but just giving you a heads up

-We stayed at the Mag Mile and it was walking distance and would recommend checkin it out

Well, we're should we start?!? We were told there will be an hour wait for a table. We got there at 5:50pm and they said they will text us once there is a table available. It is now 9:33 pm and not once did they text us. I went up and asked them and was told sorry we're still working on reservations and haven't touched the waiting list. I waited forever and  left after four hours after never getting a table. Only standing room. Drinks were awesome though and the bartenders were friendly.
Very disappointed in the service...Each drink took an hour and they kicked us out cause they wanted to "close early"

I mean, I have to give Three Dots and a Dash credit... Tropical cocktails served in a skull with flowers in the middle of Chicago's miserably cold winter is extremely fulfilling. You'll enter Three Dots and a Dash from an alley and go down a flight of stairs where you magically arrive in [insert favorite tropical island here]. (In case you're wondering, I had arrived in Koh Samui, Thailand.) Since we had made a reservation a month in advance, which I highly recommend doing, we were immediately escorted to our corner booth which was surrounded by bamboo and tiki skulls.

After looking through the menu we decided to try the Zombie Punch. This is basically a fancy fishbowl which is $60 and is recommended for groups. Our group of 4 definitely enjoyed sharing the massive group cocktail with extra long straws (lean back and relax while you sip).  I also had the Poi Pou cocktail. Both drinks were delicious and had just the right amount of alcohol. Additionally, the drinks paired perfectly with some island inspired appetizers. Our favorite appetizer was the coconut shrimp which came with four different dipping sauces.

My only gripe is that the drinks were a bit pricy. Although a bit expensive, I will still return for more tropical cocktails and an island vibe when I feel the need to escape Chicago's cold winters to pretend I'm on an island in the tropics for the evening!

Really fun "hidden" spot in Chicago, in the basement and down an alley. Once you're in, take in the drinks and snacks that are incredible. Not at all what you would expect in any form for a Chicago visit, but worth a stop especially if with a fun group. Great service and dark atmosphere.

The drinks are great and pretty strong, I have been here a few times but if you want to reserve a room or both big enough for 10+ people they will tell you that there is a $600 minimum. We reserved a room for 12 people and only 9 ended up coming so now we had to meet a $600 minimum which we expected to do so until they start telling you that they can't bring more drinks because that will be over serving you and try to convince you to just let the bar bill you for the $600. Umm no, I am not going to let a bar take like $150 for free. They never have any of the tiki mugs for purchase except for the ugliest one on the menu.

Tiki drinks are $13 each and any on the menu is the same price except for the bowls and the bottles, etc...

After we argued with the waitress she finally agreed to sell us a bottle of champagne that costed $130, they don't even let you apply the remaining of the $600 to tiki mugs which is shady but her game about walking away without $150 wasn't going to work.

This bar is always busy and you need to reserve your table in advance and by advanced I mean about a month if not more in advanced because weekend get booked so quick and you do not want to stand in line for hours trying to get in. The bar itself is very well decorated and yes you need to go to the alley to access the bar, which is scketchy but makes it more interesting. The same owner opened a new location that I also visited and will write my review about that one, it's called Lost Lakes.

I really like this place. I visited last November with some friends and had a great time. We waited like 20 mins outside which isn't horrible. Once inside I instantly saw the appeal. As mentioned by others the decor is awesome. It feels like a little getaway which is really nice during the cold Chicago months. The drinks are really creative and really strong! The bartender we had was super nice and attentive. He made a drink off the menu that was A+. I can't wait to try it again and will for sure make a reservation.

4.5 stars! such an interesting speakeasy. my friend and i came on a sunday night for a couple of drinks with a side order of chips and guac. the bartender was super sweet and made his own cocktails for me since i wanted something on the fruitier side. it was quite entertaining watching the bartender make the cocktails and just people watching. we ordered the 'aloha felicia' and 'missionary downfall' for our first round and both were delicious

Had their banana daiquiri and it was okay.  I think I was more wow'ed by the fact that the drinks are decorated so intricately.  That's all fine but you gotta back it up with a tasty drink.  The place is definitely a must see so I'm glad I got to visit once to check out the place.
Amazing drinks and fun atmosphere!! It's a little oasis under the city!!

Named after a famous Don the Beachcomber rum drink, this spacious subterranean speakeasy pairs tiki drinks in colorful ceramic mugs with crab rangoon and pork belly buns. Enter through the alley, and you'll be transported into a fully realized tiki dream: Polynesian artifacts, giant clamshells, round tufted booths, colorful globe lights, and thatched grass. Most importantly, there are 165 seats and 175 kinds of rum. That's a ratio I can get behind.

Drink this: Mixologist Paul McGee's version of Three Dots and a Dash is made with aged rhum agricole (cane juice rum), Guyanese rum, honey, Falernum sweet syrup, lime, allspice, and Angostura bitters.

I am going to be going back, hopefully shortly. Love the retro tiki vibe. Such a pleasure and pleasant change of pace to the chi picture. This area was one of many stops outside with my buddies. So happy this was the first one... Drinks are powerful but Ooooo so great. I purchased the pain killer, it was served in an amazing porceline pineapple glass. Bartenders were super friendly and each glass was distinct from the next. I definitely felt like I was on holiday. This place gives off the right vibes, I am going to be going back for the enjoyment setting!!

The drinks are strong but pricey. The only reason i am giving this spot 3 stars is because it is a Tiki Bar but they treat it as a nightclub and hold the line for extended periods of time. They also allow individuals to walk up and enter even though there is a long line.

Had lots of fun! Reservations are a must. Went here with a small bachelorette party and liked that the atmosphere was fun with good music but you could still carry on a conversation with the people at your table. Service was good despite how busy it was. Drinks are on the pretty expensive side but they are made with good liquor and lots of it.

Drinks are yummy, creative and STRONG.  Very fun vibe for a girls night or just a night on the town.  The line to get in is always long (which usually is indicative of how worthwhile the place is).  Love this spot!

Cool place to go when you have tourists in town that want to be wowed by a fancy / interesting bar in Chicago. Amazing drinks and one of the only places I've found that serve pain killers in the city. Food is great but be prepared to spend a lot for not a lot of food (what place isn't like that in the city though?!). Really cool decor and a great spot if you want to Instagram a fun drink with a dolphin or crazy flower in it that most likely won't get you drunk. Still a 4 star place because if you live in the city you have to go at least once, but I would recommend only staying for one drink. I prefer the sister bar Lost Lake that is more low key in Logan and not flooded with people from the burbs on their big city night out on the town.

Great drinks, great concept and very nifty location.  Tiki is a very unique thing but this place executes it perfectly.  From the motif to the cocktails this place is spot on. Yes its difficult to get to and crowded and loud but thats what you get.  Worth it!
Very fun tiki themed bar. They serve food but are more known for their cocktails. Great presentation as well as taste.

This place is AWESOME. Make a reservation if you can. The drinks are so delicious and so strong. I love that it's still reasonably priced in terms of how much alcohol you're actually getting. It also never gets so loud that you can't hear your friends, which is absolutely something that I prioritize in a bar! Perfect spot for a date, happy hour, drinks with friends... really any occasion!

Zero stars. Service was horrible. We had to ask the bus boy to tell the server to bring the menus and then ask the bus boy again for her to come by and take our order. Never got checked on. And to end the night we had to ask the bus boy one last time for the server to bring us the check. So unacceptable

Love, love this speakeasy! The entrance is marked in the alleyway by a tiki torch, guarded by a bouncer. The space is dark, with well chosen decor keeping in the tropical tiki bar theme. No small feat accomplishing feeling like you've been transported to a tiki bar in the middle of Chicago winters. Very fun and interesting drinks, highlighted by fun and interesting glasses (I would be lying if I said 75% of my drink choice is based on the glass it comes in). Gets a bit crowded/loud after work and I sometimes have difficulty finding a spot however.

This place was great. We went at 4:30 and it was super busy by 5:30. Had an AMAZING bartender. He made us beautiful drinks and free birthday shots for us. It was a fun atmosphere. I wish I remembered our bartenders name so I could name him personally. Did not try the food.

Great place to go for a weekend trip in Chicago. We arrived very late on a Friday night, probably close to 11:00pm, and it was very crowded but luckily we did not have to wait in line outside. I ordered the Aloha Felicia and my boyfriend ordered the Painkiller. The presentation is a delight and the drinks are strong - you definitely get your money's worth! Mine was delicious but the Painkiller was a little too strong for me. My boyfriend was so skeptical on going to a tiki bar but he and I both loved it!

3-dots isn't fun to me. I've been for three birthdays now and the servers are rude, slow and it's too loud to talk to one another. If you can get a reservation, it's still difficult because the wait is so long (once you get inside after the line). Even after you're downstairs, if you don't have a reservation and try getting a spot at the bar, even on an off night, you're going to be out of luck. I always groan when I get dragged here because it isn't fun even if the decor is cool and the drinks are relatively strong.
Great bar with fantastic ambiance. Relatively strong drinks and highly enjoyed the banana daiquiri. The place attracted a variety of crowd, old to young. Fun getaway from the cold Chicago weather!
Came here for a HH after work with a few co-workers. We had a blast- great service, wonderful drinks and a really fun place to try. I really enjoyed it and will be back!

I spent the better part of last Saturday night at Three Dots and a Dash.

During the snowstorm, we paid to valet the car and spent more than twenty minutes waiting outside to get into the alley entranceway. Half of our party was about ten minutes ahead of us, by the time we reached the bouncers they had been seated and served.

The ambiance and decor is hip-tiki, a welcome shpiel in the Chicago tundra. However  seating only accommodates about a group of 6, while we were ten. We ended up taking turns in the booth and grooving to 90's tunes on the tiny dancefloor.

The bar was very busy at about 10 PM. The drinks were strong and garnished beautifully, but taste-wise I was not a fan. Everything was punch-you-in-the-face sweet or minty. For the cost, I'd prefer some more delicate liquor handiwork.
Solid drink menu, cool scene, people leave a bit to be desired. Staff is not so enthusiastic but the cocktails make up for it.

Best tiki bar I've been too.  By best I mean most creative (and decorative drinks).  Laid back atmosphere and friendly / helpful bartenders.  I had the dead reckoning.  Looking forward to next visit to try more !
Amazing place. The drinks are strong and each drink is presented as a work of art. The bartenders provided excellent service (and they are HOT). Gets really packed on weekends.

I am not the tiki fan, the husband is.  In fact when dining out our drinks are frequently mixed up by otheserver, as I'm the beer/martini type & he is the fruity, tropical-umbrella-drink type.  But the service at Three Dots was so exceptional that with their assistance in navigating the menu I found plenty to love at this shrine to the bygone tiki era.  It felt so secretive, as it was downstairs and dark with the unique atmosphere set to the perfect music for imbibing potent authentic tiki.

On vacation and yelped to find cool bars. This place also came recommended by locals. The bar is so aesthetically cool and the drinks will please even the siehard beer drinker. I love rum and tiki drinks, but the crowd this bar draws is so diverse, and the atmosphere is fun because of the bartenders and because everyone there is excited to be there and drink some amazing drinks. All the drinks are dressed with flowers, fruit, tropical leaves and look picturesque. You won't be dissapointed you came. Love this place.

Loved this place! Had a short wait but very worth it. Drinks are delicious and ambiance was very unique. Takes awhile to get drinks because they are hand crafted but it's worth it. Glasses and garnishes fit very well with the tiki theme. Would come back but would make a reservation and get a table next time. Very fun place!

I really love this place. Not only because it the most fantastically decorated tiki-themed bar I've ever been to and they have fantastic drinks, but because their staff is so nice and helpful. They apologized for our less than ten minute wait on a Friday night. If you're going to keep it minimally crowded and an enjoyable atmosphere, I say thank you!

As much as I loved my Painkiller No. 3, my favorite drink was by far Bunny's Banana Daiquiri. Awesome drinkware and great garnishes. There were two bartenders, at least that I saw, on a Friday night. I was skeptical at first, but they're quick.

Definitely a great place to bring your out-of-towner friends who already think you're so cool for living in the city!

pics.caption: Awesome drink garnishes at Three Dots and a Dash!

review.des: Such a fun tiki bar. Yes, the back alley entrance is totally pretentious, but you'll get over that when you experience the awesomeness of the drinks. I've never had a sub-par cocktail here. The signature drinks are my favorite, especially the banana daiquiri. This place is all about presentation, and all of the drinks look as awesome as they taste. The daiquiris even come with dolphin friends made out of bananas, which puts a smile on my face every time. Service is friendly and efficient, and drinks are pretty reasonably priced for a popular River North spot.

This place is so phenomenal that not even words can describe of great of an establishment Three Dots & A Dash is, which is a hidden gem in Chicago. Make sure to try the frozen special drink, as it was amazing:)
Will I be back:
HELL YES, and will recommend this place to all my friends!!

This place came highly recommended by a friend. While I visited Chicago I decided to give it a try. Initially it was cool and a great place  until after I left  And noticed the next day on my bank statement my debit card charge was wrong. Two days later ANOTHER unauthorized charge was placed on my debit card!  I believe the staff/server compromised my debit card in cahoots with a girl that sat at our table pretending to befriend us. Do not use your debit/credit card at this place unless you want to be inconvenienced. Shady staff!! New debit card for me, joke on them! Busted!

We stumbled upon this place last night. We went here to celebrate my birthday and the drinks were so much fun and creative ! We had trouble with the temperature in there we were sort of cold all night, but overall a nice place.

pics.caption: Skull on fire! Well it was! Love this place

review.des:
Yum & Fun!
Two Drinks and you're DONE!

Great place to bring friends that come in town for a visit. I wouldn't frequent this place only because it's not really my 'hood and it seems better for special occasions.

My boyfriend and I saw the awesome reviews on Yelp while we were visiting Chicago back in September but had the hardest time finding the place! It's down an alley with a man standing outside the door checking IDs :) While the entrance is a little sketchy, the bar itself is truly amazing.

We're from Boston, where I've never seen a tiki bar, so I didn't know what to expect. We thought we would just have one drink and move on to the restaurant down the street where we had dinner reservations, but instead we ended up cancelling our reservations and having 2 more drinks (each!) with a few bar bites. I highly recommend sitting at the bar so you can watch your drink being made - it's alot of fun! Delicious (and beautiful!) drinks and a cool atmosphere. Makes me want to open a tiki bar in Boston!

Whatever you've heard about this place , believe it. Places like 3 dots is why I refuse to pay for over priced drinks and bars and clubs. For $13 I'm getting an amazingly crafted cocktail that is STRONG. My only question is , has anyone bought the treasure chest and completed it

A very fancy tiki bar, the smoking cocktails are pretty fancy but the smoke (dry ice?) dint last too long :( Also, a shout out to their puffed wheat crisps! We loved it but they had only one plate left at 1 AM or so. Also, you will need to reserve a table, the line is pretty huge at about midnight.

DO NOT SIT ON ACTUAL TABLES! Try to sit on by the bar- to be honest you'll never be disappointed if you do. Lisa is such an amazing bartender and Andy doesn't fall behind. The drinks are delicious and so is their chicken. A must try!

Perfect place for a late night drink (or two...) with friends. A bit difficult to see (unassuming door in the side of an alley and small sign). Once inside, you descend a stair and you find a nice, themed Polynesian location which serves a variety of rum based concoctions. Drinks were good and just a bit pricey. Music was at the right level to allow conversation. Crowded right until closing.
As a lover of Smuggler's Cove in San Francisco this place makes me feel like I'm at home. Great drinks, service, and ambiance. Did not get a chance to try the food. Highly recommend!

Such a great atmosphere! Great place to take people when they come in from out of town and want a one of a kind experience. Walking down the alley that is lit with tiki torches to down the stairs and you suddenly end up in this crazy tiki bar.
Drinks are pricey around $14 but they are fairly large, however its kind of a hit or miss with the drinks, some taste like straight up NyQuil.

Unless you plan to go on a Sunday night, get a reservation weeks in advance! Otherwise you'll either be waiting in line outside or shoved into the bar area.

A tiki bar in Chicago? Really? Whose idea was that? Whoever it was nailed it. Shockingly I really loved it. I didn't know what to expect but I have read things about it. I really enjoyed the vibe. It wasn't too crazy or packed but just about right. The drinks were really good. The bartenders were pretty cool and took care to make all the drinks really well. It's a bit pricy but a place like this demands it and it's well worth it. Check it out if you get a chance.
The drinks are the jam!!!! I've been there a few times and i always take out of town guests. I've tried a lot of the drinks and have never been disappointed!

It's a fun, hippie, local spot to enjoy incredibly sweet, mixed drinks.

The service can be slow over the weekends, but the place is consistently drawing a rather enormous crowd.

It's a cool spot to catch up with friends. They do accommodate parties; Make reservations if you plan to go with 5+ people!

It's a very laid-back downtown spot: You'll see some dressed up, but most are dressed casual-chic (it is River North, after all).

Cheers!

I don't know what the hype is about. Let's start with the drinks. I ordered the Painkiller for a whopping $14. They put ice in it and nothing else. Literally. I was sucking air. When I took it back, they didn't apologize for the inconvenience, though they did resolve the issue. While the glass was ultra cool to make you feel all hip and trendy, it couldn't have possible held more than 2-3 oz of liquid. And the drink was not strong at all as everyone raves.

People were 4-deep at the bar and not moving out of the way even though they had been served. There was a very limited area to stand because the employees would habitually move you out of the way and direct you to the small standing area. Even when leaving, my friend was literally shoved in the back by an employee to scoot him out there.

Almost all the tables are reserved. We managed to find a table that did not have a Reserved sign. After sitting there with drinks in hand for 15-20 minutes, employees told us that we had to move because the table was reserved. I'm sorry, but you don't tell sitting, paying customers that they have to move away from their table. Not ever. I told them (truthfully) that I had a knee injury and needed to sit. The manager came and offered to put a chair somewhere for me. So my friend had to stand while I sat. 5 minutes after sitting an employee came and told me that I couldn't have the chair there.

On top of all that, the music was horrible.

My only recommendation is to avoid this place.
Terrific, eccentric Tiki lounge. Like walking into an episode of the old Hawaii 5-0.
Such a great time. Great to go with a group of friends...it's crowded, but if you plan ahead it's worth it
Had my bachelorette party there over the weekend. Tastiest drinks, yummiest food & the most terrific staff! Thank you for everything, to Caesar & his staff!!! We will definitely be back!

Recently came here for the first time and I loved it! It definitely lives up o the hype! It wasn't too hard to find it was in a dark alley wish they had a bigger sign outside especially since it is dark but not that big of a deal! The drinks were great! Strong(but not too strong that u can't even drink it) and delicious! The waitress was great, she was attentive and very knowledgable!

I love their cups/ mugs. That's what attract me to come here at first place.

But The taste of cocktail is just ok.

Tried their food during our second visit. Chicken/ ribs are wonderful. Chips are ok.

Drinks: 5
Decor: 4.5
Ambiance: 4.5
Service: 3.5
Value: 3.5

Great drinks and fun atmosphere, but beware of the sewage pipe or whatever it was causing the foul smell in the corner.

Lots of fun including the hidden entrance in the alley. Went on Saturday at 4:30pm and the place was packed definitely make reservation if you want to sit down. Nota lot of room to stand and have appetizers and all seat were reserved. Dunks were good but powerful. Had the Saturn and the painkiller and was loopy afterwards. The guacamole and chips were with house made pork rinds instead of tortilla chips. Also lots of Hawaiian shirts here.

Drinks were awesome! The service was great, the ambiance was super cool. Drinks are garnished like if you were in an exotic destination. Love the secret entrance. Definitely a place to hang out with friends and enjoy the Tiki theme!

I can't imagine a better tiki bar.  

Fun, inventive, strong drinks.  Staff that sticks with the theme but not in an ironic hipster way.  Deep house in your ears.  Somehow you feel cool despite having a giant dolphin-shaped banana in your hand.

In short, it was pretty much like this video:

youtube.com/watch?v=Flf-…
The place is unique. Love the decor inside. Drinks are too sweet, its like having a desert. Wish they had more refreshing drinks as well.

Super fun place in a basement in an alley. Totally unsuspecting it would be so fun. Every drink I've tried (been there twice) has been delicious (except for one with smoked pineapple in it which was a little too smoky for my taste... it tasted a little of ham. But I forgive them because this place is still a blast. Can't wait to go back soon!!

A local recommended this place. Since I'm from LA and know nothing about Chicago nightlife we just wanted a chill place to grab some yummy drinks and hang out. Apparently this is rated as one of the top bars in the nation and I can't agree more. We walked in and we were seated right away. The bar was very crowded but we got our drinks pretty quickly. I got their Saturn drink and it was pretty good. A little too sour for my taste. I loved the tiki-style decor of the place. It was a very casual bar and I had a  great time.

Had a great experience at Three Dots.  Went there for my bday with my wife.  Overall it's just a fun concept... not much I can add to what has already been stated here, you just have to try it for yourself.

Several tips:

- Drinks are pricey but remember you're paying for the craftmanship and presentation.  You could pay the same amount for a drink elsewhere in River North but not get the same flair.
- It was crowded by the time we left at 7pm on a Monday.  Plan/set expectations accordingly.
- It's pretty dark inside, so if you're only here to cure your wintertime S.A.D. buy a light box instead.  Or just order several of the strong drinks...
- To counteract this, sit at the well-lit bar.  It's where all the action happens and where the Tiki theme really shines
- Chat up your bartender.  Ours, Alex, was fun, engaging, and we really enjoyed learning about the drinks and tiki liquors from him.  Thanks Alex!
- The crab rangoon has mostly actual crab in it.  This shouldn't be a surprise but if you love Americanized crab rangoon with the cream cheese like me, this might not be the dish for you.  Dipping sauces were good though.

Happy drinking!

Very cool place. Little hard to find as the entrance is down an alley. the decor is very cool and the place has a great vibe. Unfortunately, I hate rum and tequila, and I discovered this that night. We were fully refunded for my drink that I didn't like, however, and the wait-staff were great.

So happy we found this place. Literally had to find it because it's hidden down an alley but so worth it. Kitschy but super cool. Drinks are little works of art. Bartender/ mixologist really knows what she's doing. Just watching the drink being made is part of the experience!
Most of our drinks were topped with an assortment of Edible garnishes including flowers!
We went for pre dinner cocktail. Would like to go back later in the evening to see how things Change when DJ arrives!
Recommendation: get a table in the bar. The bar top fills fast. Drinks are served in big glasses and they're heavy so a bit awkward to hold while just standing around
Loved this place going to go back soon!

This is a good place to go to once in a blue moon or a place to perhaps show to a friend visiting Chicago. The ambiance is a little dim but cool. The drinks are exciting but fairly expensive. Overall I enjoy coming here but it's not a regular location to hit up.

This place has great tiki drinks but the prices are high.  I think it's worth it though for a fun night out in town.  Everyone is dressed in Polynesian theme and the drinks have a good amount of alcohol.  Our server wasn't very attentive and we couldn't find her when we needed the check.  We ordered the thai wings and the middle was somewhat cold still.

Really fun and unique environment with great drinks. I love the atmosphere and the dedication to theme. From the drink ware, to the walls, to the servers' outfits, everything was special and felt like a tropical oasis, even in Chicago winter. Hard to find anything like it. Every drink I tried was great and the cute garnishes were a fun touch. The entrance is pretty well hidden in an alley off of Clark behind Rick Bayless' restaurants. Get there early if you can to grab a seat.

pics.caption: Three Dots and a Dash (the drink). Love the cherry and pineapple three dots and a dash garnish.

review.des:
The cups ! The cups are whimsical !

Two friends and I made a reservation to Three Dots one friday evening. When I arrived, the hostess seated me even though my friends were running late. I was seated at a corner table where I could see everyone, and let me say, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the place attracted all kinds of people. Older gentlemen, bachelorettes, yuppies, you name it. Many were asking servers to please take their group photos holding tiki drinks.

We ordered, I think, a good majority of the cocktails they offered. Unexpectedly strong, however very delicious. 5 stars !

We ordered the dead reckoning, poipu beach boogie board, and dr funkhouser. They were all pretty strong in alcohol content and really fruity. The bartender liked to make the drinks all at once so we were waiting awhile to get our drinks, like 30 minutes. But watching them make the drinks was very entertaining. And the garnishes make the drinks look extra special. We also orders Thai fried chicken and crab Rangoon. The crab Rangoon was really good, except that there was a lot of better and not a lot of crab on the inside. The Thai fried chicken was tender and heavy in sauce which gave it a little spicy kick. Definitely more filling than the crab Rangoon.

pics.caption: Crab Rangoon and Thai fried chicken

review.des:
Excuse me but there was a banana dolphin in my daiquiri. Enough said.

This is an expensive experience, but the cocktails are DIVINE.  The music is usually pretty terrible, but I claim the cocktails make up for it.  Other than the music, the ambiance is pretty cool.

The cocktails I recommend include: the Painkiller #3, Bunny's Banana Daiquiri, and the Three Dots and a Dash.  All were excellent.  The Puka Puka Punch tastes a little too boozy for me, but they are all very strong drinks.

The food is delicious, but comes in kid's meal-excuse me--"small plate" portions.  The prices are high if you only get a handful of food.  But the crab rangoon, coconut shrimp, and thai chicken were delicious.

If price is no object you'll be in heaven (especially if you don't mind Miley Cyrus remixes).
Love coming here.  the ambiance and decor are great and drinks aint too shabby either.  well done!
Don't judge this book by it's cover (or shall I say alley?). This is def a place to try! The ambiance is unlike anything else and the drinks, well, they speak for themselves.

Awesome spot for a quick drink.  Their is a sketchy back entrance that makes this place seem "exclusive" but it's really nothing special, just a great place for a drink and a weird tiki environment.  My bartender was Brenda and she was awesome

So Tiki is a thing again. I've been to my share of tiki bars and Three Dots and a Dash is legit. The space is great - tucked in an alley, then you head downstairs to a dimly lit and suitably tropical space. It's fairly busy, so if you have a crowd, make reservations or you may find yourself hounding people at the bar or in the standing area for a space to hang out.

The menu uses classic recipes from Tiki drink legends Donn the Beachcomber and Trader Vic's, along with other classic Tiki recipes. All of the drinks come in an appropriately cool tiki vessel, which you can buy to take home if you'd like. Because these are the classic recipes, the drinks are strong and may throw you for a loop if your expectation of a tiki drink is something you had at a luau while on vacation in Hawaii. Be forewarned.

A great place to hangout with friends. The hostesses look lovely in there floral dresses, very cordial, polite. Mai Thai is a citrus delight. The Flaming Shrimp is a great presentation leaving you awed. For a taste experience I recommend the tuna and avocado with cilantro. As for atmosphere you will feel like this hole in the wall place is one of the city's gem. Very delightful.

Fun fun place. The waitresses were incredibly beautiful and the drinks were even more beautiful. I had the Three Dots and Dash, the Jet Pilot, and something with multiple straws. The poke was great too.

Will be back next time.

Three Dots and a Dash is a cute place that provides a different experience than other River North bars... if you are willing to spend a lot of money for a little. I would suggest getting one drink with a date or a friend and going to the next place. Definitely worth experiencing the atmosphere once, but again, a bit pricey for what you get.

My wife and I love speakeasies, specialty drinks, and unique places. An underground tiki bar with a hidden entrance definitely made this a memorable experience worthy of 5 stars!

Food: Appetizers only, and they were not not very good. We ordered Luau Chips, which were just pork rinds and guac, and Spring Rolls, which were decent.

Drinks: I normally prefer stronger drinks, but in a tiki bar I don't mind fruity drinks and the wife loves them. I ordered a Jet Pilot and it was fruity but good, I tried her Painkiller No. 3 and it was way too Pina Colada-sweet for my liking, so I ordered another Jet Pilot to be on the safe side for my second drink.

We have already recommended this place to friends and will be back!
They have food? I came here for the drinks. If you are looking for a chill place with fun drives and insanely creative drinks, this is the spot.
Fantastic atmosphere, amazing service, yummy mock tails and even wonderful appetizer type food.  Will go back in a heartbeat!!

OVERRATED.  
The tiki theme is ok.   Service is mediocre.  The killing thing for me was that they charge  $13 for an over sweet beverage in a cup that they present as a souvenir but then sneak and take when you're not looking.

It's a scene-y place pure n simple. Is it average or bad-no, is it great- also no. Those big buckets of drinks are far too sweet for my taste.  The theme is so over the top and in full contrast to where it is...the back alley basement in river north LOL.  Pretty girls pre-game here before going somewhere close by.  Meanwhile the men who stalk said girls begrudgingly drop $$ here just to be close to them.  Behold the power of the V.

It's a fun atmosphere and the drinks are really unique and look really cool. Some people on here have said that they are expensive which I guess they are but for what you get out of them visually and quality wise, I'd say it's fair. I think the place is a little pretentious ESPECIALLY for a Tiki Bar but it is River North so it's almost a requirement. I go to Lost Lake over Three Dots but it is a little further out there.
The drinks are fun and soooo yummy. This is a speak easy style place where the entrance is in the alley. Such a fun place for a ladies night out.

Yes, this is a spot where the people from the suburbs will make you wait even longer in line for drinks because they are taking multiple angle pictures of their drinks before leaving the bar area. There was one women who took pictures of drinks that weren't even hers. And it wasn't even a drink all too different from hers.

But the cocktails are good and presentation is wonderful. Service is pleasant. Went on a Saturday, line is not too bad. I would actually come back and stand in line to go back, and I cannot stand weekend river north suburban infested lines of girls shrieking and screaming into their phones, "HAY CAN YOU AND ABBY GET IN THE CITYYYYY TONIGHT." Actually I am being dramatic, it is not really that kind of line at three dots and a dash, although I do recall hearing someone talk about being a pick up artist.

I was really excited to hear that we would be going here for a co-workers going away party since I heard it was a fun new hot-spot.

I was completely disappointed. We did have a big group - and couldn't make a reservation (apparently you should make one 4 -6 weeks in advance according to the hostess), but honestly we were perfectly fine with just standing around in the bar anyways... so, so far, no worries....

The drinks were gross! We all got different "modern" and "classic" drink varieties off the menu and everyone said their drinks were disgusting! I got the painkiller no 3 which was probably the best out of the five I sipped on when we all did a compare and contrast amongst each other..... They all had this bad bad bad after taste, which was so disappointing since they all sounded so appetizing when reading them off the menu.

Not only that - this place needs to hire another bartender. There were only two bartenders serving a huge crowd at the bar. You would have to wait atleast 30 minutes to order - it wasn't just us, we witnessed others going through the same bullshit. Especially since one bartender kept catering to these three weirdos at the bar the whole night and no one else, and of course, since these drinks are so "foofy" they take a little longer to make just one......

Also, for some reason, there's a long line outside to get in on top of all this. I'm not going back. I've lived in the city six years and have gone to plenty of places to know there are better places to go....

Gross drinks, not worth the money or wait. Also, looking at the food coming by, didn't look quite appealing or anything out of the ordinary. The music kept going in and out throughout the night too.

This tiki bar tickled my Polynesian Dancing fancy.  Everywhere I turned, I was haunted by the Aloha Spirit.  Mahalo!!!

Some colleagues and I headed here for post business dinner bevvies.  Naturally, this OR nurse ordered the Painkiller...  A few times over!  The perfect anesthetic after a stressful day.  :)  The other gals enjoyed a variety of drinks off the menu which seemed to help them forget the craziness of their day!

There was a decent crowd at the bar with some good people watching.  Apparently, there was a someone who looked like a girl from Hunger Games or something.  I don't watch that stuff, so it was nod, smile, and keep sucking down the drinks.

Whether you're out with friends or entertaining colleagues, this is a nice change from yet another Irish Pub (not that I don't like my Irish Pubs!).
Fun Polynesian bar with wicked drinks and cozy atmosphere! Food is o.k! Had a great time!

I always have fun at this place! The drinks are top notch, delicious, and presented beautifully. The decor and atmosphere of this bar is perfect. One of my favorite places to take out of town guests! The group-sized drinks are extra fun to share with friends!
The drinks here are amazing. It is a long wait but it's totally worth it. If you've never been there it's hidden, you have to walk through an alley.

I love Three Dots and a Dash.  We have been a couple of times now.  The drinks are so, so, so good.  And I love that you can purchase any of their glasses to take home.  The food (which we had for the first time on our last visit) was also very good.  We chose the Asian wings and the crab Rangoon.   The menu has gotten quite a bit smaller since our last visit, but all of the cocktails we tried were really good.  The difference between 4 and 5 stars for me is price.  I understand that the bar is filled, that the drinks are made with love and affection, and that they can certainly command that price, but each drink is $13.  That's a lot in a city where you can get drinks on every corner.  But, we will return!  So I guess that's a self-fulfilling prophecy.

Liked the Tiki Bar decor and feel. All the drinks are made to order. The bartender looked like he was a chemist making my drink. I really liked my gin drink called Saturn.
We went on a Wednesday night. It was busy but not a long line. We were able to be seated and didn't feel cramped. They push the pu pu platter on us. We ordered it by it was uninspiring. When we come back we won't be ordering it. Cool venue for a memorable Chicago bar experience.

How fun to find a tiki bar in the middle of Chi-town! I read about this place in a magazine so made sure to try it when I was visiting over the holidays. The ambiance is very cool and you really feel like you're in a tiki bar based on how the employees are dressed. i went with the Jet Pilot drink which was in a cute totem pole style cup and it was delicious. I think that the drinks were quite potent as, after being in two other spots before that, I don't think I could have had another one. This was also because they were quite sweet. But, I would definitely recommend coming here for one drink.

This is the best tiki bar in the country.

I've been to La Mariana in Honolulu, I've been to Tiki Ti in Los Angeles, and I've been to a dozen other so-called 'tiki bars' in this land of ours and Three Dots blows 'em all away.  

Upon entering, you descend down a concrete stairwell underneath a large display of miniature skulls as if you're about to board a boat and visit the Pirates of the Caribbean at Disney Land.  

The bar area is very well done.  It leaves no doubt it's a tiki bar.  The ambiance was great.  

Our bartender, Erin, was a master of her craft.  Definitely knows her shit.  Travels the world visiting other tiki bars to learn how to improve upon her profession.  She took her time with every drink and they were all mixed to perfection and the presentation was on point.  

While there, I downed a Painkiller No 3 (my favorite), the house Three Dots and a Dash drink, the Jet Pilot, and sampled by girl's Bunny's Banana Daquiri (which is nothing I'd ever order for myself).  They were all solid but, again, the Painkiller No 3 took the blue ribbon at my lil' carnival.  It was even recommended by the host as we entered.  Gotta say, he nailed it with that suggestion.  

I collect tiki glasses at the tiki bars I visit throughout the country and the glasses they offer here are some of the best in my collection now.  I left there with five different glasses at only twenty bucks apiece (I spent $80 or more per glass at La Mariana and bought a unique glass at Tiki Ti in L.A. as well).  

This has vaulted to the top of my list of THE places to hit when I return to Chicago.  

Standing 'O' for Three Dots.

If this is what tiki bars are supposed to be like, I guess I'm just not that into it. I enjoy the occasional sugary cocktail, but I thought the drinks, although tasty, were cloyingly sweet. My wife loves candy and would probably chose to subsist solely on sugar and she also thought the drinks were saccharine. So I can really only recommend the banana daiquiri, which was awesome. I do have to give it up to the barkeeps for the wonderfully elaborate presentations though. The food was okay, but it was definitely better at the start of the evening than at the end. If you can breeze right in, Three Dots and a Dash is a good place to come with a group, but I'm not sure I would wait in line.

What a great place! Loved everything about it and the atmosphere. Drinks are fun, strong (for those who like them that way!) and reasonably priced for everything that goes into them. The food was a surprise. A place like this screams 'mediocre food' and 'awesome drinks' but I'm happy to say both exceeded my expectations.

Really cool location for drinks!  You need to go down a side street to get in (reminds me of a speak easy...well doesn't remind me of one because I wasn't born then but you know what I mean). You walk downstairs to a very cool atmosphere. Drinks are can't miss.

pics.caption: Entrance to the bar. Thought I was getting ready to watch GoT
Dead Reckoning (high octane) and Missionary's Downfall (amazing name BTW)
Pain killer (which would kill my pain) and Aloha Felicia

review.des: If you want a table, get there early or make a reservation.  We showed up around happy hour, so there were no tables of course.  The drinks were unique and delicious.  It's a cool place to go see, but not sure that I will be back again.

I love this bar! It's down a little alley, the door has no sign, but there's usually a guy standing out in front waiting to check your ID's before letting you through. Walk down a small flight of stairs in a darkened hall with a wall of skulls...to find yourself at the hostess stand! If you put your name down you can get a table--if you're lucky and it's not crowded, you'll get seated right away. If the wait for a table is a bit too long, you can always stand around the bar area or grab a bar seat if available.

This bar serves small bites as well as tiki-themed drinks. The two times I've been here we didn't order any food but we did try a couple of different drinks--warning: almost all the drinks are rum-based, so if you don't like rum they have other drinks to choose from (beers, wines, etc.)!

WE GOT:
1) Painkiller No.3: I'm not a huge fan of rum (I prefer strong alcohol you CAN'T taste in a drink...), but since this is the most popular drink, I can see why. The presentation with flowers and leaves plopped on the top is adorable. The drink is creamy and yummy with the taste of pineapple!
2) Puka Puka punch: like the painkiller, the rum really comes out on top in this drink--it tastes strong but it's really not that bad for someone who doesn't drink too often.
3) Port Light: Mmm love the fruity/citrus-y taste of this one! This one has bourbon, passionfruit, pomegranate and lemon.
4) Siboney: Probably my favorite of all the drinks--instead of a cool mug it's served in a glass cup...I'd order 10 of these.
5) Bunny's banana daquiri: Mm!! This tastes like a banana shake, lol no joke. I feel like I could have this after a workout!! I wouldn't even know the difference except for the hint of rum you taste in the drink.
6) Ports of call: I DIDN'T TRY THIS. From the people I was with, they said it was just a good whiskey/rum/fernet mix with a slightly more citrus taste with it. They seemed to really like it.

If I lived in Chicago I would definitely meet up at this place with my friends or even have a party here! Super cool bar, really laid back. And even better--they serve "punch bowl" type of things ranging in size for the amount of people you have in your group. I saw a couple people ordering these and they looked yummy! Service is on top too--I love that they always give you waters regardless...I feel like this is unheard of anywhere in the Bay Area!

I gave Three Dots and a Dash 3 stars because while the food was good, the menu was very small. The drinks were also pretty pricy.

I don't want to take away anything from the food, but the servings were small and brought out in tapas style, which I'm not a huge fan of.  They have a poopoo player which I would recommend getting if you're with a small group and no one is really hungry.  Otherwise you'll end up order about 5 or 6 small plates that run approximately $10 a plate.  The food was really good, but if you're not a fan of coconut or pineapple the menu may be very restrictive for you. Also, I don't recommend this place if you have a peanut allergy.

The food was good, but it did all have that coconut/ pineapple flavor. The drink menu was also 3 times the size of the food menu. If your a rum fan, you'll love this place!  

Overall Three Dots and a Dash is worth taking a look at if you want that Caribbean flare, but be aware it's a bit pricy for a limited food choice.

Haven't had the pleasure of eating here yet.. So this is based strictly off of drinks. This place has a super fun vibe. It's as if you have walked into an actual tiki hut! It's very difficult to find though I must say.. My uber circled around quite a few times before I got dropped off and even once I did it took another 5 minutes to find. You go down a steep flight of stairs to the basement with pretty dim lighting. The staff dresses in typical Hawaiian gear which adds to the vibe. The drinks come in very festive glasses/cups. You can even get couples drinks. The first drink we got was for 2 and had liquid nitrogen I think, it was steaming the entire time which was really cool, and the second drink we got (also for 2) had a very smoky flavor. Both were good! I can't wait to come back and try the food!

Hard to find. It's entrance is in an alley. Worth it! Fun!! Subterranean! Tropical drinks. Order the signature three dots and a dash drink. And the tuna poki. Yum!! Drinks are super strong. Be prepared!!

Meh, ok. Not the speakeasy you thought, just a tourist trap tiki-themed bar with way overpriced drinks.  Have 1 drink here to see the decor and see the extremely well decorated drinks but dont plan on spending the night here.

Celebrated my friend's birthday here on a Friday night. It's definitely a fun venue, and the drinks are delish! Keep counts (or try to keep counts) of how much you drink tho - because the drinks taste so sweet and nice, u can easily get tipsy! We had Bali Bali, but I'm definitely down to try the treasury chest next time;)

This place was hoppin' on a Wednesday night. The atmosphere is fun - even the 10 minutes it took us to find the entrance was slightly amusing in retrospect.

I was in the mood for coconut and the waitress recommended the Painkiller No. 3. Delicious! The drink was also served in a funny cup which I dare say enhanced the experience. I wasn't looking to get drunk on a weeknight, so didn't mind too much the fact that it was not a very strong drink. I could imagine others finding this objectionable.

Ordered the Thai fried chicken to balance out the sweetness of the drink (and I was hungry, duh). It was good but it is not that hard to batter and fry pieces of chicken breast and drown it in a vaguely Asian-tasting sauce. Passes the bar for bar food.

Overall, this is a novel place to hang out once in a while but I don't see myself being a regular.

Cool tiki bar with an amazing bar. The entrance to this place is super cool coming down a staircase lined with blue colored rock walls.  It reminded me of going to an underground cavern.  The tiki bar was very tasteful and the vibe was amazing. Drinks wet strong and tasty but a little too sweet in my opinion. Overall a great bar to hang out and chill. It's not very big so it fills up easily so get there early if you can.  Would definitely come back again if in the area.

We just so happened to stumble upon this place and it was awesome! Even just sitting at the bar is so entertaining! The bartenders make so many drinks at once. They definitely have their system down. The drinks are also all super good. Some are definitely stronger than others but the menu has a nifty guide that let's you know which are stronger. The atmosphere is also amazing. Who wouldn't enjoy a speakeasy tiki bar though? Check it out!

This place came recommended by a friend, which makes me think I need to reassess our friendship.

The ambiance is neat at first. The drinks are cool. Everything is expensive. The food isn't anything special. The service is mediocre. I had high hopes for this place and was pretty disappointed.

I got the burger and frankly, it wasn't good. I'm a burger fiend and I always finish what I get. Didn't finish this one. It was so dry and overcooked. I just ate enough to sustain myself so I could drink more of the overpriced cocktails. I'd rather have a fast food burger. Not exaggerating even a little bit.

The first drink I got tasted like it came in a dirty cup. At least the cup was cool. If you want to buy the cool novelty cups, they're about $30! Umm... Seriously? Also, is it just me or does this now feel like we're at a really lame amusement park? Despite that high price for a cup, it totally cheapened the whole vibe. I get it, the cups are cool, people wanna buy them. Maybe focus less on the cups.

Being in Chicago and considering the popularity of this place, I at least expected good food. I'm pretty disappointed. I probably won't go back by choice, I won't recommend it. Worst part is I took some important people here and I'm pretty embarrassed about it.

Best tiki bar ever! The drinks are a tad expensive, but they are strong and big enough to make it worth the price.

Do yourself a favor -- make a reservation as the place gets busy!

Didn't try the food. The waiter was fun and recommended a lot of different drinks. They have one or two cute female waiters.

It's a cool hole in the wall spot. That you wouldn't think would be nice until you get inside

Went here for a work event.  Definitely a fun time with good drinks.  Don't go here if you get claustrophobic since it is dark and in the basement.  Also difficult to find if you don't know where you are going.

Went here for my birthday, and had a great time. Their food was delicious and timely, and their drinks were STRONG. It was fun to try a bunch of different things. I loved the vibe and feel of this bar!

Pricey but worth it for the experience. The drinks are creative and delicious and the decor is on point. I especially recommend going here in the winter when you want to feel like you are on a tropical island. Overall, a fun experience and a great place to go with a group of friends.

Great if this is your scene. Music is way too loud. Hardly any seating. Small menu. Douchey people. There was one drink I liked, but you're paying for the pretty looking drinks, as they're a little overpriced. I wouldn't go here unless I was a tourist. As a local, this place is terrible and there are so many better options. Good for a tiki bar I guess, just not my thing.
My neighbors took me there and it was fabulous! Drinks are really strong but that is the idea with Tiki drinks of course. So I have to plan another Tiki Bar fieldtrip ..... woohoo!

We grabbed drinks before dinner last night. The waitress pushed the "group drinks" on us when we sat down, but decided to order individual drinks and a few apps. Some drinks were very strong and just tasted like booze. The crab rangoons were good and the ginger chicken bites were tasty too. We ended up ordering the group drink, pieces of 8, after she mentioned it again and it was a RIPOFF! It was about one maybe one and a half drinks with a lot of ice. It wasn't even that good. I'd try a new place before I'd come back.

We stopped in just after it opened and it was Ok. It didn't woo us. We live in the neighborhood & we weren't like "ohhhh this is a must visit". Of course we aren't into waiting in line for slow & over priced drinks... did the bar scene & over it. I can see where it's really a really cool concept for people today (flashbacks of Bamboo Bernie's in the 90's - hello limbo contest!).

My hear places are all the rage now with the hipsters. Big in NYC and also went to one in San Fran. This place was very cool as well kinda hidden away in an alley and in a basement.

My wife and I, celebrating my birthday, got there right when it opened. Place was 75% full when we got there and 40 minutes later it was standing room only. A long bar with chairs, a few small tables and booths along the way. Place is pretty small. It's also very dark - like I almost needed a flashlight dark.

Staff was great. Very happy and cheerful as well as helpful. The drink menu is quite extensive.

We ordered a couple of apps - spring rolls and coconut shrimp. Both good and was what expected.

Drinks were very tasty.  Both of us were surprised that both of our drinks tasted sour rather than the expected sweet. Not a bad thing and I would have had another. However - and I believe someone else wrote this as well - all of the drinks are packed to the rim with small crushed ice. For $13/drink, neither of us felt that there was much value - or drink - here.

Fun place, would take someone out of town there for the experience, but probably won't be back. Again, nice place, great service, friendly staff with unique and flavorful drinks but didn't see the value.  You're paying for the experience here.

Definitely one of my favorite places. Drinks are good and strong. Appetizers are also very tasty. The environment is calm and relaxing.
I do suggest to make reservations ahead of time because it does get busy in the afternoon and every busier in the weekends. A good place to catch up with some girlfriends.
It's such a great atmosphere!! I wanted tropical drinks in Chicago and this place hit the spot! Kyla was our server and she was fantastic. Their uniforms are so cute. I wish we had these in Atlanta.

Wow, what a drink array.
They are tasty fruity and have some alcohol in them.

I really like this place. Granted, I have only been here on non- weekend nights, so I can't rate their service on those nights. Keeping that in mind, the service has been very good. Attentive at the tables and at the bar. The drinks are strong and inventive. I love the Tiki vibe, which is catching on quick across the country. One friend mentioned that they didn't like rum thus they felt that there was nothing for them to drink. Maybe if you are picky about what goes in your drink, I would suggest perusing the menu online before going. Just to avoid that situation. Although, I also recall them having beer. They did have snacks as well. Haven't tried any of those.
Great cocktails. Very crowded, so it might be better to go on weekdays. The only con was that it was so loud in there.

I went here for a birthday party of 5-6 people and we were given priority seating in a corner that we selected near the bar. We arrived by 6pm and stayed until 11, when the bar was very very busy!

All of the drinks and appetizers we ordered were absolutely wonderful. The best part of Three Dots and a Dash however is the incredibly friendly and accommodating staff. We were consistently checked on, provided immediate service, and all staff members were very professional.

I love 3 Dots! The deco is amazing but also the drinks are delicious, the island music is amazing and it's not so packed and loud that you can't have a conversation. it's a go-to spot when friends come to visit.
Drinks are a bit pricey but you get what you pay for...which means they all pack a punch! The bartenders are magicians back there. Great vibe always.

This is totally a place if you want to escape from the real world and go somewhere totally different without traveling. Super fun drink that come in crazy over the top décor. Yes it is a little on the pricey side but worth the experience on a frozen winter day.
Great lace for drinks!  We have tried almost all of them this week and all were good. Great concept! Great bartenders. Get there early!
It's kitchy and the cocktails will knock you on your ass. It's loud and bro-ey, so if that's your thing, it's great. It's a pretty fun place, although it can get crowded.
Very good drinks! Around $13 for the mixed drinks but it is really good. Sat at the bar BC we didn't have reservation but we were seated quickly.

I went there on a Saturday night with two friends and it was packed but still fairly easy to move around. It's like a tiki/Hawaiian themed place so it looks pretty cool. The line to get in moved quickly and they had a free coat check which was nice. The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because it took an hour to get our drinks. That's not an exaggeration. It literally took an hour. The bartenders were going in order but it took so long because whoever tipped them a 20 or 50 would get their drink made immediately, so it messed up the order. There was music but it wasn't obnoxiously loud like at a club, and there was a tiny dance floor next to the bar where about 2 people were dancing. They looked out of place. This place is not really for dancing but more for lounging/standing. The presentation of the drinks is amazing. They are so cute and a pretty decent size. Overall, I would say this place is great for winding down after a night of dancing, or just going to lounge and talk. It was cute but the bar situation is a huge turn off, so I don't think I'll be going again!
I loved everything about this place. Right from the ambience to the service to their interesting cocktail menu to the tiny last nite of the food.

pics.caption: Aloha Felicia. Kind of tasted like pina colada. Still good.
Dead reckoning - one of their high octane stuff. Really high octane! Still delicious.
Thai fried chicken! Omg soooo delicious!!

review.des:
Fun ambiance. The staff is attentive although if you sit at the bar the bartenders can be a little rude.
Drinks are a great value- especially in this area of Chicago. Each one looks like a piece of art.
The small bites are delicious albeit a bit expensive. This is definitely worth the happy hour trip!

My husband and I loved this place. We went early in the evening to avoid the "club vibe" and only stayed for drinks. Neither one of us are typically rum drinkers, but loved the cocktails. After only two each, our faces were warm enough to battle Chicago's wind back to the hotel. Bartenders were very friendly. Had a lot of fun and would definitely return when we're back in town.

Okay, picture this, if you will. It's a cold, blustery day in the city. The bitter wind is cutting right through your coat and scarf. Head down against the winter gale, you decide to take a shortcut through an alley, and when you look up, an entrance mysteriously appears, with flaming tiki torches beckoning the way. You decide to take a chance, and when you walk through the doorway, you are magically transported to a warm, tropical paradise, with a gaily lit tiki bar....far, far away from the brutal Chicago winter!!

Well, it COULD happen that way....OR you can just know that Three Dots & a Dash is awesome, and make your way there on purpose. The whole hidden-in-a-back-alley thing is still pretty cool, even when you're expecting it. Besides the cool location, they have stellar service, even if you aren't in the main bar...ours was provided courtesy of Claire. (Thanks for the fabulous recommendations and speedy service, Claire!) And, of course, the highlight of Three Dots and a Dash is the tiki-inspired drinks menu...each with its own signature glass. Normally, I turn my nose up at such touristy "islandy" drinks...but these are truly amazing! Unique, complicated, potent, fun...and many with an interesting back-story. What more could you want? If you have guests visiting you in Chicago, this place is sure to be a hit! If you aren't into lines, I strongly suggest getting there early, so it makes a good pre-dinner stop. Cheers!!
Trendy, gimmicky, tiki theme spot downtown. Interesting drinks but very crowded. Great if your looking for something different and fun.

Flamin' fiery tiki cocktails! It's ALIVE!  Celebrated a friends birthday here and my jaw dropped at the eloquent work of art. Of course the average bar would just throw a bunch of alcohol into a cup and call it a day...but not three dots and a dash. I felt my cocktail was concocted by Michelangelo.  The subtlety of the hawaiian flower and the striking contrast of the marigolds brought me to a place as if I was sailing in the middle of the pacific islands with a ukelele and not a care in the world.

Wonderful Tiki Bar! Locals and past visitors to Chicago recommended this bar as a "must visit" and it did not disappoint! We sampled the signature Three Dots and a Dash, Aloha Felicia, Western Sour, and a special rum beverage created by the bartender for my hubby. All were well balanced and absolutely delicious!!
The bar was dark and fun. The drinks were amazing. I felt like I was back on the island! A great visit!

I understand people being hesitant about a tiki bar.  But get over it and head over to three dots and a dash.  Its a little tough to find at first, you have to enter through the alley where you walk down into a basement.  The Atmosphere is sick. And has really cool lighting.  

It is tough to get a table, but worth it when you do.  If you dont want a table, there is plenty of standing room.  Be warned. When its busy it may be tough getting to the bartender and getting to a waitress.

All the drinks ive had were excellent. But be careful these drinks will catch up to you and whoaaaaaaa.  

Food is good too. Would recommend to anyone.

Cute tiki bar for a date or with friends. It get very crowded so either get there early or make reservations. The large featured drinks are overpriced so I recommend getting any of the pain killer drinks. The banana daiquiri is also delicious and not too sweet. The food was okay- a little too spicy for my taste- though I do have a very low tolerance. The staff was friendly and the bathrooms were clean.

Don't be thrown off by the alley you have to go through to get to the entrance!

I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 ONLY because I did not have food on this visit, but drinks were definitely 5 star. I fully intend to return with a reservation to eat and hopefully bump up the rating. After walking to 435 N Clark and seeing "Bub City," I quickly did a "wtf" search on Yelp and discovered our mistake - the entrance is actually in the back alley on Hubbard St. There was no line outside when we arrived around 7:30 on Friday night, but there was a 45 minute wait for tables inside and a packed bar. We chose to hover around the bar until a few stools opened up since we had already eaten anyhow.
Individual drinks are $13 each, which 1) is not that much more or even cheaper than what some other place is going to charge for a specialty cocktail, and 2) I guarantee they are not of this caliber. My banana daiquiri was served in a cup resembling a coconut, and garnished with an orchid AND a banana dolphin. A DOLPHIN CARVED OUT OF A BANANA! He had such cute little clove eyes and leafy flippers! I giggled to see a whole basket of banana dolphins at the bar waiting for a sea of daiquiris. Didn't taste like there was any alcohol at all in it right up until Saturday morning when I realized exactly how much alcohol WAS in it. The other drinks were garnished with swizzle sticks topped with mermaids and Krakens, and served in skulls and shells and cool glasses of all sorts, which I hear you can also purchase, though I don't know for how much. The atmosphere was cool, the bartenders were fast and knowledgeable, and the music was good. Can't wait to go back already!

PROS

-Excellent decor / service / food
-Drinks have nice themes

CONS

-Drinks are very alcoholic / sugary, so make sure to check your blood sugar before leaving

Went here on a Friday at around 7:30. My girlfriend and I had no trouble ordering a drink, but a bit more trouble finding seats; reserve a table in advance! After standing around sipping the delicious and gorgeous Zombie Punch, John, one of the employees searched for seats for us. When he was unable to do so, he brought out two stools from the back for us! Wonderful customer service. We were able to get a table about 30 minutes later.
As for the drinks, WOW. Definitely on the pricey side, but the aesthetic alone is worth it. I stuck with the Saturn, the only gin-based cocktail on the menu, and was not disappointed by the flavors (sweet & sour). Bartenders were also friendly and engaging. Only downside is the price and how crowded it gets, but it's a must-visit!

Cool bar with some awesome drinks! I'm not normally a fan of super fruity/sweet drinks, but I actually enjoyed the drinks they had here. We got the zombie punch and the pieces of eight. There were four of us and we easily shared both drinks. The presentation is really cool and I think that was what made the experience so much fun.

The only disappointing thing about this place was the food. I was hungry, so I ordered the thai fried chicken. It honestly reminded me of Panda Express, but, personally, I think Panda Express is better. It came with a bunch of different "Asian" sauces, and most were too sticky/sweet and hurt my teeth. The chicken is supposedly the most popular item, which was why I ordered it, but I'll definitely pass on the food next time.

Other than that, this place is kind of small, so I can see why it gets so crowded on weekends, but if you can get in on a weekday, it's definitely worth checking out.

LOCATION & ATMOSPHERE

Follow the glow of the blue neon lights beckoning off of Clark and Hubbard OR alternatively you can look for the line of folks waiting to get into to know that you have arrived. I had made an advance reservation (highly recommended). Our IDs were checked and we were promptly instructed to proceed downstairs where we were greeted by amicable hosts and hostesses.

The bar is (not surprisingly) decorated in a Hawaiian/Tiki theme and is a welcome departure from other bar/lounges I have visited in Chicago. If I lived here permanently, I would imagine this is a place I'd bring out-of-towners regularly for a departure from the usual.

Generally, I felt that the mostly-male (that I noticed) bouncer staff was completely overkill. We were there on a Saturday night -- yes, it was busy, but not crushingly so. Perhaps later it becomes necessary, but I thought that the visibility of these staff persons increased the level of "douchery" by one entire point.

FOOD & BEVERAGE

At $13 a pop, I guess one could say these aren't "cheap" beverages. However, when you consider the effort required to make these cocktails, the quality of the ingredients AND the garnishments alone - you're getting quite the deal. Also, you only need two of these bad boys before you start feeling their intoxicating effects. I want go into the specifics of the cocktails we tried, but I would advise that you follow your taste buds, share with the waiter/waitress and let them guide you. Sweet/sour/strong/fruity...they have something that will appeal to you.

Three Dots and a Dash does have food and what I saw coming from the kitchen looked good. I would say it is not that substantial and you probably shouldn't rely on this as a meal, but if you wanted something to soak up some of that booze you're pouring down your throat - they have something for that!

All-in-all we had a fantastic experience and I would absolutely return - there are many more beverages I wanted to try on the menu, but they'll have to wait for another night.

Came here twice with my sister and bf on our visit to Chicago-- we LOVE this place! We had a bit of difficulty finding the place since we went on a Sunday after St Patty's, and everything from the decor, to the service and drinks was just fantastical.

We were told there would be a wait for a table around 30-45 minutes so we decided to just hang around near the bar. After waiting for a couple of minutes without being able to order, my bf went up the hostess and was able to get us a table right away since a previous reservation never showed! Sweet!

At both of our visits, we managed to order the Painkiller No.3, the Port Light, the Siboney, the Puka Puka Punch, the Bunny Banana Daiquiri, and the Ports of Call. All these drinks were delicious even though all three of us are not usually fans of rum.

A plus? The cute cups/glasses the drinks are in are adorable! If you want to take one home with you, it costs $20 and they'll wrap it right up for you. WARNING: some of the glasses/mugs may sell out, so try not to be disappointed if the one you're looking for is out of stock.

Our server was very nice and accommodating (we had the same one both nights), the music was mellow and overall the experience was just very laid back and awesome. Definitely a place to re-visit and recommend!

If you're into expensive river north drinks, then this is the place for you! They are strong and delicious. The lighting is dark so it's a great intimate date spot. Get one of the drinks with a banana dolphin!

Awesome place! Super happy vibe, great cocktails, adequately potent and fantastic finger foods.

Love the decor and the theme overall. Great for a small group of friends.

The pork buns are to die for. Had the Dr. FunkHauser. Fabulously tasty and deceptively stoeng :)

This is one of my very favorite bars. It worries you at first, walking down an alley. Once you are in the basement you are in the islands. New menu is great. Love the jet pilot with a little plane and the pain killer. This place is alway fabulous.

The line outside is understandable considering the space and the amount of people inside
The wait to put in your order is understandable considering there are only 3 bartenders make these ingredient heavy concoctions.
The drinks were delicious.

Would I go back? Not unless I have to.
Its a once and done type of place for me. I enjoyed it but I don't want to wait a total of 1hr to drink by tiki mixed drink.
The crowd can get obnoxious and antsy waiting and the bartenders don't come with the friendliest of faces. I get your a "mixologist" but a smile once in a while doesn't hurt in this industry.

Atmosphere-wise, this place is pretty cool. You enter through the alley and descend the staircase decorated with a ton of backlit skulls. Definitely makes you feel like you're headed on an adventure. Part of the adventure I was not too keen on? The tables-or lack there of. There was absolutely no available tables or bar space because it was so crowded. My boyfriend and I had to kind of awkwardly stand in the middle of the place. It's great that they are doing so well, but they should really consider adding some extra places to sit-or even stand! The drinks were good-pretty expensive, but it's River North, so that's expected. Considering how crowded it gets, next time I will go to a different tiki bar.

This place is so fun! Walking in is super exciting since its hidden and there is tiki decor everywhere. This waitress wore an adorable dress (which i assume is the uniform cause they all were wearing it) and was so sweet and helpful. My group decided to get a bunch of different drinks so that we would all be able to taste them. There are some crazy options and everything seemed lovely.
