The menu indicates the level of alcohol content which is helpful. The apps are pretty good also. We got "chips and guac" but the chips were like non-pork rinds. I thought that was bizarre but overall it was a fun time. I only took away a star because it is expensive. It would be nice if there were just one or two specials to save money.

Such a cool location and concept. Four stars because I wish the bartender and server could have steered me to better cocktails, somehow I kept ending up with drinks I wasn't crazy about. We clearly weren't on the same page. Maybe she was in a rush. The place was packed so you better try and get a reservation. Loved the food! I brought friends from out of town here and it really was a great spot. They were impressed.

Make reservations so you can sit down and have some space because they have way too many people in there. Workers are a little rude. Drinks are unfortunately not worth $15 a piece.. BUT with that being said. The atmosphere and decor were pretty cool, which is why I have it a 3. I didn't have any food there, we stayed about 15-20 minutes..

Cool spot to stop off and have a drink. It's tucked in an alley way so may be hard to locate. We were a group of 40 something's who arrived on a Friday night at 10:30pm, what we didn't expect was to WAIT IN A LONG LINE behind a velvet rope to get in. Hello, I haven't done that shit in years. My husband and his friend only wanted beers so waiting in a long ass line for froo froo drinks with umbrellas just wasn't cutting it. I had to hear them bitch and complain the entire time in line (30 min). The "bouncer" only lets people in as people leave. This is not a club, it's in the basement so not a lot of room. I was determined to see what the drink hype was about.

As we finally submerge into Three Dots you go down a long stairway and greeted by a skull wall! Cool. The bar was packed as I suspected and there were tables. I should have made a reservation as others had done. DUH! I made my way up to the bar scooching past the 20 something's or maybe they let me through because I looked old and mad. I couldn't read the stinking drink menu so had to be all old lady and use my phone flashlight and my reading glasses!  I got the Painkiller No. 3 to start. Very strong! Lots of lovely flowers in my drink too. I sat right at the bar and watched the bartender make 4 different drinks a once. "Hand crafted drinks" as they call it.
My husband and his friend order BEER.  WTF.  Then bitched that it was warm! Hello it is not a beer place - surprised it is on the menu.

My second drink was Jet Fuel. That sent me to my happy place. No wonder there was a skull next to description of the drink.

Overall, nice atmosphere, strong drinks. I would come back here but not on a weekend night. Also as the guys in our party would say "this is def a girl place" lots of ladies who love froo froo strong drinks!

Overall, the unique cocktails and bar staff were great while we were waiting for a table...however once we were seated it was a different experience altogether.

What happened?
I'm writing this to be more of an awareness piece with others that may have a food allergen. I have a peanut allergy and the waitress neglected to ask if there were any dietary restrictions for the the coconut shrimp; another person brought plates and four sauces that go with the shrimp, set them down on the table and walked away without explaining what was in the sauces. Serving 101, as I understand it. Unfortunately, one was a peanut sauce that gave me a reaction.

How was it handled?
Not well. When the waitress checked to see how everything was we asked if one of the sauces had peanuts, she said "oh yeah that's our peanut sauce". I told her I have a peanut allergy and already was experiencing symptoms/discomfort. She said "well, we have a pink sheet to include if there's any dietary restrictions, I could get my manager if you want", then handed us our bill and walked away. There's a plan in place, but seems there is no system to execute...The manager did end up coming over and apologized, but then jokingly offered an EpiPen after my girlfriend explained that while my allergy is not life threatening, it causes great discomfort and swelling and that we wanted to bring the situation to their attention in the event that someone else with a life threatening allergy came to their restaurant. He was not very concerned and gave a $25 gift card redeemable on another visit Mon-Fri only. End of conversation.

Message to management:
All staff MUST be trained to check for stuff like this. While we're on the subject here's a quick lesson to bring back to your staff:

Eight foods, or "The Big 8", account for 90% of all food-allergic reactions in the U.S.:
1 peanuts
2 tree nuts (e.g., walnuts, almonds, cashews, pistachios, pecans)
3 milk
4 egg
5 wheat
6 soy
7 fish
8 shellfish

Luckily this was not a life threatening situation, but I would hate for something to happen to another customer that may have a life-threatening allergy. This appears to be something that needs to be addressed immediately with all staff, especially under such a large parent company as Lettuce Entertain You; this could be a big problem if not fixed.

*Receipt = Dec 18, 2015 9:10pm chk 7586

Came here for my 21st birthday on weekday night and the bartender hooked me up with a free first round! Despite always being busy, the bartenders are fast and friendly (clearly). Drinks are pricey but well worth it for the taste and alcholic content. Probably not the place to go to have more than 1 or 2 drinks, at least not broke college students like myself, but a fun stop nonetheless. Lines can spontaneously form in the alleyway entrance, so try to get a reservation on the weekends. Much better place to sit and talk than to dance, but both are possible. If you're looking to sit and chill come on a weekday when its less packed.

***GET THE BANANA DAQUIRI***
Amazing Ambience and drinks. Spicy thai chicken was great. Reservation recommended

1. Hard to locate the entrance. Best way to get here is google map Firecakes donut and its right on the side of it in the alley. Yes the alley.
2. When you enter, it feels like you've gone to a new world, the colors, the music, the drinks, the atmosphere. It's a very tropical theme, so its decorated with bamboo sticks, flowers and tiki like designs
3. Drinks are strong and pricey! Be wary of the price as drinks start off at $13 and can go up to $400. yes $400!! However each drink is unique in the sense that they come paired with fruits and their own type of cup.
4. They serve tapa style food, mostly Asian fusion. I've had the tiki chips with guac, chicken skewers, and shrimp. All very delicious but small portions. We had to order two of each for us 7. Good thing to know! You can ask for more chips for the guac because when it first comes out, it comes in a small bowl.

I recommend this place for a "preparty" spot. But 2-3 hours inside is enough time inside.

Also, it can get super packed in there. I went on a Saturday night and the wait was 40 minutes for 7 people. I left around 11pm and there was a long line waiting to get in. However we were able to chill by the bar and sip some drinks while waiting.

I'm not sure what it was, maybe I ordered the wrong drinks, but everything had that premixed vibe to it.  A little too sweet for me, but not in a particularly great or flavorful way.  I liked the vibe initially, with the whole we're exclusive, entrance tucked away in an alley thing, but inside it was a little darker than necessary. Overall it was just ok.  I will say the drinks were strong despite being sweet, and that's what keeps this place in solid three star territory.

I love this place! We missed the warmth and fruity drinks from a previous vacation so this place brought it back. Don't let that fool you though, they're pretty strong.

Make sure to make reservations or you'll be struck.

My company had a corporate event at Three Dots and a Dash. First the staff was absolutely amazing to work with. From the event manager, bar managers, bartenders, hostess, the doorman and waitstaff, they all were fun and extremely supportive in making sure our event was a hit.  

Once our guests arrived, they would stop us and say how amazing the venue was. They have never experienced any place like this. The drinks were unique and fun (and delicious of course).

Would highly recommend anyone to have an event here.
Drinks are great, and the atmosphere is wonderful. Skip the food though, it didn't do much for us and was a bit over-priced. Best time to go is Sunday evening, right when they open.
Awesome space and great staff.  Pretty steep drink prices by ounce...even as a tiki bar and amount of time it takes to make drink.  Drinking a were tasty and will be back for sure
Not really a drinker, so this was probably not the place for me to go.  The drinks were pretty but potent.  The decor was interesting.  The appetizers were delicious though.

Not for me, at all. This place is a lettuce entertainment place and yes they have themselves another goldmine. They took an alley entrance to a dark basement, cheapest real estate in the loop and wow.  But they missed the mark for me. You can't get a seat and you can't get a cocktail waitress to stop and take an order. There is no place to place an order at the bar. You have to stand in the isle and waive until a bartender sees you. You also so have to find a drink menu, oh ya good luck with that. Now pull out you iPhone flashlight so you can see the menu. Then you have to  say excuse me to two people at the bar and play the bump and bang game while you try your damnedest not to spill on them. Then you have to try and pay. What bullshit, we gave $65 cash for a $56 dollar bill. We expected the extra $5 for a tip and to get $4 change, we got $2 back. Now we questioned why $2, we gave you $65. He said no you gave me $60. Then the bartender talked another bartender and said oh we made a mistake here's your $3. We still don't like the result of what happened. We ended up tipping $6. Now the bartender is upset because he doesn't think he got tipped when 4 people told him we gave him $65. You can't conduct business in a dark cave, with the bartender 10' away, and having to yell to be heard. Empty tables all over the place with reserved signs for the whole 2 hours we were there. People if you have a problem walking in a dark cave don't go here. Oh ya and my sugar(corn syrup) high and hangover was terrible.

This was my second visit to Three dots and a dash and I am so pleased with their service, I am writing this review in between cocktails! My poor mother came to meet me in Chicago for my birthday after taking a tumble down the stairs and breaking both ankles, landing her in a wheelchair. I knew I wanted to visit Three dots and a dash, but did not make a reservation as I couldn't anticipate getting my mom down the stairs. We showed up on a Saturday evening and were immediately offered an elevator down. A table was made for us right away even though we didn't have reservations. As always, the cocktails were phenomenal (& very strong as usual!) and the food amazing . But more than that, the service was outstanding. A gentleman named Kurt was exceptionally accommodating to my mom and her requirements. I am so thrilled with this place, I promise to return upon every visit to the city!

The restaurant is like an adventure, traveling to an island within in city. The alley entrance makes you feel like your going to a secret location. The drinks were very good, the space was so conceptually creative. Great place for a date. Make sure you have a reservation.
This place has become my favorite bar of all time. The drinks looked amazing, tastes a bit sweet but who are we kidding here...its a tiki bar! I am totally coming back when I'm in chicago again!

This place is so cute.  I love the atmosphere.  I would recommend coming early on a Friday with some friends around 4pm before it gets crowded.  The drinks are expensive, but super strong.   The bar bites are decent.  The music is fun and upbeat.

"Tiki" does not necessarily mean "tacky." Even the hot hipster Polynesian cocktail waitresses worked.

At Three Dots and a Dash (named for the maraschino + pineapple garnish atop a classic tiki cocktail) a beautiful tribune-sized menu educated me on a whole mixology tradition I had written off due to cocktail umbrellas and overly saccharine drinks. The host was a NY-er, and treated us real nice for my birthday :)

THE RUM BOOK.

This place is great!!! Never even knew it existed until a friend suggested it one night when we were looking for something different to do. The drinks are great and reasonably priced for the types of drinks. The bartenders are very friendly and more then happy to explain all the crazy different drink to you.

Its in the ally behind Bub City and would probably miss it if you are not paying attention. the entire bar is tiki themed which is odd for Chicago but it works!!!
Came here for drinks the other day and could not find one thing I liked.  Ended up leaving after 15 mins.  I think I need to give this place another chance.  Will update my review when I go again.

I brought a friend here on a Tuesday night and three days later, he calls me to ask me to join him there again that night (Friday). That's how fantastic it is. The drinks are on point, the staff is amazing, and the ambiance is so much fun.

I will have to say that after drinking here twice in a week, I was a little tiki-ed out. But it's been a month or so since then, so I think I'm ready to step back into this world.

One of the best cocktail spots in the city! It has a speakeasy feel with a basement location and a back alley entrance.  Advice: get there early because it fills up quick and it's not a big place - and get the Jet Pilot. Delicious!

Hidden in the middle of a parking lot/alleyway, I honestly thought Boyfriend and I were totally lost until we found the door. After getting our IDs checked by the bouncer out front, we went down a flight of stairs and walked into a dimly lit, super-trendy (really walks the line of "trying too hard to be swanky") tiki bar.

I stand by my check-in comment as well - "it looks like Forbidden Island had a baby with Rickhouse and Local Edition double-teaming." My San Francisco/East Bay Yelpers from California know what I'm talking about.

The bartenders must've been in a pretty good mood (or bad, I guess, depending on where you stand) because they made by Bunny's Banana Daiquiri pretty strong. I was surprised by how much I could taste the alcohol. I don't remember what Boyfriend ordered but he said it was strong and pretty good.

A little too crowded for my tastes, personally, but I enjoyed the laidback atmosphere that they were trying to go for. We had to commandeer part of a ledge to put our drinks down on because otherwise there were no other available surfaces to use. Maybe getting here earlier would make things better because you can establish a base camp?

Went there with a girlfriend after work; we did not have a reservation and had to wait for almost an hour on a Wednesday.  The drinks were so good.  Not the biggest hard liquor fan, but the painkillers 109 and  347D were amazing.  We had the Pork Belly Buns and the Crab Ragoon which were okay, nothing to write home about.  The Pork Belly was fatty, I should have known better.  But who really goes for the food anyways.  Definitely will be back.

I have been here several times.  The cocktails are great.  My favorites are the Pain Killer and the Golden Glove.  They are beautifully presented and flavorful.  The food is only OK, with better options all throughout the neighborhood.  Ambience is a nice change from the chilly Chicago weather, with tiki decorations.  Service is not overly friendly, but the hostess desk is usually manned by a friendlier crew.

I cannot say enough good things about the staff at Three Dots and a Dash.  

I walked in with a party of 8 on a very busy Saturday night and attempted to get a table (there were no available reservations).  I knew that there would be a long wait, given the popularity of Three Dots and the time.  I waited at the bar for our table to be ready and was tremendously entertained by the Bartending staff (particularly Ian and Caleb).  They made the time fly by!

When my table was finally ready (approximately 2 hr wait) the rest of my party had not yet arrived.  I was told by the host that I would have to forfeit my spot in line if my party did not arrive.  I asked if there was anything that could be done, when Kurt overheard our conversation and made the biggest difference in our night.  Kurt understood that I had been patiently waiting for more than 2 hours and didn't want my time to be wasted.  He told me to notify him when my party arrived and he would seat us as soon as possible after that.  He personally went outside to grab the rest of my party from the line and seated us within minutes.  Our night would not have had the wonderful outcome that it did if it hadn't been for his influence.  I am extremely grateful to the staff at Three Dots for accommodating us - cannot thank them enough!

I love Three Dots and a Dash! And I didn't even know it existed until a bartender at Hale Pele in Portland, OR told us about it.

Anyway, I've now been to Three Dots about half a dozen times and it is one of my favorite spots in Chicago. Chicago SORELY needed a (good) tiki bar (don't even talk to me about Hala Kahiki) and Three Dots fills that void wonderfully.

My only negative experiences here are a result of it being SUPER popular and crazy busy all the time. Like one time a guy stole our table and then tried to rock-paper-scissors my husband for it. And another time it was sooo crowded that we almost left in disgust but then at the last moment we were able to snag two seats at the bar so everything was okay.

Anyway, all of these problems can be solved by making reservations well in advance on Open Table. They will reserve a table for you and you just walk right in, sit down and begin your island getaway.

The drinks are all good but I particularly enjoy the Painkiller No. 3, Mai Tai and Bunny's Banana Daiquiri- however, on our last visit, we were informed that the cocktail menu is completely changing (today? or tomorrow) and only 5 cocktails from the previous menu will be kept. Exciting!

This is a cute little venue and a great place to bring out of town guests.  It's in a great location and offers a different vibe than most other places in Chicago.

The food is actually pretty darn good as are the drinks.  The only thing I don't really dig is that they don't have a lot of the normal liquors.  If I drink anything besides Captain Morgan, I tend to get a little loopy really fast.  

The place gets crowded fast, though!  To get a seat at the bar, get there early and stalk it out...you will get one.

Drinks.....weird.

Weird taste, super weird. Weird flavors, maybe it's their idea to "spice" things up but not for me. Overpriced drinks!

Atmosphere wise, great place to hang out with friends.

Mama loves her a good tiki bar. Big drinks in fun glasses that get you drunk, all while ensconced in a faux tropical vibe. Who doesn't love that? And, it's underground which adds to the mysterioso vibe. And, you enter thru the back alley. So fun. Do yourself a favor, tho, and make a reservation, so you aren't one of the poor schmucks standing in line in the alley, while the rest of us are descending into the lower depths for tiki fun.

Our group was seated almost immediately, but, we were given a warning upon entering on time for our 7:15 reservation that we had to be up and out by 9:00. I understand the place is popular and they have to accommodate everyone, but, I really didn't like that. When I'm spending that kind of money to drink I'd like to enjoy myself and not have a stopwatch hanging over my head. Blah. At one point during the evening the table next to us was gently reminded it was almost time for them to be up and out, but they were having none of it. Not a great way to start the evening.

The drinks, though, they pretty much make up for the "hurry up and drink!" atmosphere. I had the Jet Pilot, the Painkiller No. 3, and, a taste of the Puka Puka Punch. All were delicious with the Jet Pilot being my favorite. Next time I'm getting the Zombie Punch, which I'll either share with people, or not. The food was just eh, and the portions are small, and I swear something we had smelled like cat food. Your best bet is to have a hearty meal before boozing it up at Three Dots. That, and, plan to cab it home.
Let's start with the drinks. There's barely any alcohol at all. The appetizers are small. Too small inside and you have to walk down an alley to find it. Most definitely not a place I would revisit.

Methinks a bouncer for a Monday night is a bit much although I should take a step back and give this place props for even being open on Monday as I hear things can get pretty raucous here on the weekends. I was not in the vanguard of people who braved the long lines upon the opening of Three Dots. I am glad that I waited for the hype to settle down. Last week was my first visit here, for a much-vaunted Birthday Eve celebration. Even for a weeknight the place can get crowded--maybe due to a Cubs game or something. I shared a traditional tiki drink with my imbibing companion. I am glad that I did, as the drinks pack a wallop. The punch came garnished with a veritable farmstand of fruit. My favorite was the cherries that tasted like they had been aged in bourbon or rum. Between this and a Bloody Mary, one could also make a meal out of their drinks...I digress. The spot is dark and the whir of a blender punctuates conversation. If you're looking for an exotic escape in a glass, come here. Imbibe carefully, though, as there are still stairs and an alleyway entrance to navigate.

Pros:
Tasty, unique drinks
Fast, friendly bartenders
Cool ambiance and decor

Cons:
Douchey bouncers/security (they told my group of friends "you can only dance on the dancefloor, so stop dancing" we were near the bar) What?
Small food portions, way overpriced

I was very excited to try this speak-easy tiki bar. It has a very cool ambiance and tasty drinks. The prices are even more expensive than the typical high Chicago prices. I would assume this is because they serve their drinks in unique glasses. However, I ordered the Surf Report which is supposed to come in this really cool wave cup and it was served to me in a basic martini type glass. I was okay with paying more because it was clearly about the experience but I was slightly disappointed when it came out. Maybe they had run out and it was a one time thing. Our server was very nice but seemed to be overloaded with tables. It took forever to get our check. I would try it again and hope for a better experience the second time around.

Fantastic Place to hang out with friends...No matter how pack the place is, all the drinks are very strong and made with tender love and care...the atmosphere is well decorated and gives off an underground rainforest theme...I already been there multiple times.... P.S. The line outside on the weekends past pretty fast, only about 20min wait on average!
Some of these drinks are really strong and you don't realize it cause they're good.  Seems like every time I'm here there's at least one person who's absolutely gone
This place is fun and the drinks are tasty and strong. Went on a weekday at 5pm and there were only a handful of customers.

Love the hidden entrance , the decor, the hall leading to the actual bar. Mysterious, great looking people. Cocktails: they are good, not great . Presentation over the top cool. I ordered a drink they say is for 2 people and costed $26.  Well, beautiful  presentation, absolutely NOT for 2 people, not worth the $26.  Go for the ambiance,but I had better cocktails else where.

I had a lot of friends visiting from out of town/the country and wanted to show them a good time for my birthday weekend, St Party's Day. I had one person over the max before having to sign a contract tract at my table so there was a minimum I needed to spend within two hours. When we were one hour in I asked our waitress if we're able to put purchasing their cups towards our total to make our minimum and came back, twice, and told me yes. She has told us when we sat down that if we needed ANYTHING to let her know-we either did not get her name or she didn't tell us. After thirty minutes being handed a total of three cups, two different times of confirming it could go towards our total,  a manager came with only 30min left to drink and eat to tell me that was false information and I need to spend $120 more ... in less than 30min to make the minimum. After speaking with him, Kurt, he told me that the waitress should have known that it was not going to be ok for us to put purchases toward the cups and it could only be towards door and drinks, 15min conversation on explaining what his waitress told us and nothing to compromise with the miscommunication they had led us to. He told and interrupted me I was getting "More upset than I needed to be" when I was simply explaining to him that what was the complete conversation. I said we would forfeit the rest and just pay for it the rest because it was poorly communicated to us when I explained that we had been drinking and eating all day so we didn't think we wanted to eat or drink anything else. When I said, there was only 15min left at this point we couldn't drink $120 more alcohol and it was unreasonable to think we  could, he said "it would be a loss for us to not spend it" and we wouldn't have a table anymore to be drinking at... so why he kept encouraging more alcohol/alcohol poison was beyond me when I already accepted the loss of the amount left for the minimum. There's absolutely no effort to compromise or apologize for his waitresses poor lack of knowledge of the contract (the only comment he as to say was "she should have known better" and when I specifically asked about adding the purchases to our total he did not say well I can put one of the three towards your total) NOTHING polite that could have been nicely handled that would have made EVERYONE'S last thirty minutes better like -this isn't our policy and I apologize for the miscommunication, I can honor it this once because my associate told you wrong-
A situation could have been handled better and my friends who travelled hundreds and thousands of miles from Canada and Ohio could have had a better first time experience in a Chicago, at a very well known bar, but instead they had that.
After speaking to the manager we ended up getting one more large drink and the waitress was not sociable or apologetic to us for her miscommunication. She gave me the check and walked away shyly. We had left disappointed in how they all left our table because they did not make that effort to make a bad situation better. As a person who is a manager myself, I know that there were definitely better ways he could have communicated with me-the tipping point was telling I was that I was "more upset than I needed to be" because a manager should never tell a customer they are any kind of emotion-especially when the customer is consuming alcohol...that was not professional and we will not be going back or telling anyone to go there. After spending $12-$15 a drink and $65-$85 on large group drinks, you would think the management would be more receptive to the miscommunication or apologize for their associate's lack of knowledge-not blame it on them and give absolutely no reason for the customer to come back...
happy birthday, to me.

Awesome fun Tiki Bar ! Drinks were amazing and the menu was so good especially the coconut shrimp. Impressive artwork on the drinks.  we four of us made a reservation through open table. We were promptly seated and the waitress was attentive. i liked the whole vibe of the place ..straw huts..cool rum drinks

My husband is a big fan of rum based drinks.He was quite impresses and everyone in our group couldnt stop raving about the place whole time !we will be def back soon with some more friends !

Ambiance - 10

Drinks -10

Food -10

BOY!!! THIS PLACE IS THE TRUTH! I'm a Miami girl so I know my clubs. lounges, and bars like the back of my hand. I was on vacation in Chicago for Valentine's day weekend. My guy and I found this place on Yelp. And I'm glad we did. It's located on an alley off a main street. Getting in was so easy, I envy Chicagoans, I want to take time to give a shout out to the bouncer at the door. The guy was so cool and nice, I am definitely not used to that in Miami! Stay gold bouncer dude at the door. As soon as you walk in there's a small entry way that leads you to a staircase that takes you underground. The place was packed at around 9PM! Again, where I come from clubs and lounges don't start getting good (filled with people) till about midnight. It was refreshing to come to a place like this. The dress code was all over, I saw girls in club attire and others in jeans and a t-shirt, again this is a plus. The drinks are a little pricey, BUT there is a good amount of alcohol in them. The attraction here are the dinks and the décor. The drinks are very elaborate and come with special effects! We ordered a "Bali Bali" that was on the menu for a limited time and it came with dry ice smoke and lights. Very beautiful and sooooo worth the 35 bucks (It's meant to be shared between two people). If you are in Chicago, go, trust me you will love it. I secretly want to go back to Chicago so that I can go to this lounge. The only weird thing for me was the music selection, the DJ was not very good at mixing music or genres. One minute you have R. Kelly with ignition then the next you hear Cuban Salsa queen Celia Cruz belting out tunes. That was the only iffy thing, but this is easily overlooked as this is more of a place to have drinks with friends and have conversations.

pics.caption: Omfg! May the gods of alcohol bless this place!
Omg take me back to this place!

review.des:
Here's all you need to know:

$13 cocktails that take 20 minutes to make by a "mixologist" (pause for laughter) whose face reflects her hatred of the world in a standing room only hole-in-the-wall (basement?) that's a more "adult" version of Disney's Polynesian Resort with lousy, overpriced food.

Also, the above description is a testament to the kind of people you'll find there. Have fun!

4 stars for a fun ambiance and strong drink menu. Minus a star because people here seem to be pushy. I get everyone needs a drink, but man people are pretty aggressive trying to get to the bar. Otherwise, three dots and a dash is a great place to hang out and grab drinks with friends. Come here if you are looking for a great theme and delicious drinks!

My friend was in town for the night and I've been wanting to check out this place for a while, so I made a reservation for 8:30 PM on a Monday night. Thank god I walked there with a friend because otherwise I would've been walking up and down Hubbard futilely searching for this place! Like other Yelpers have said, the door is in an alleyway and the blue light above it was definitely really helpful. This place probably has its fair share of reservations and people in the know because I doubt  anyone just happens to walk by it and go in. Once you go downstairs, it's like being transported to another world because the lighting was dark and blue and the atmosphere is very relaxed. Our waitress (who happened to look like Sofia Vergara) showed us to a table marked "Reserved" in the corner, which made us feel pretty special.

We all ordered different drinks so we could try a bunch and decided on the Painkiller No. 3, Siboney, Port Light, Dead Reckoning. All of them were tropical and refreshing and came in very cute mugs and glasses with pretty garnishes. My only complaint was that my drink, the Siboney, was a lot smaller than my friends' drinks and still cost the same ($13). Though thinking about it now, I don't think mine came with any ice, so that may have been why the glass was so much smaller.

The food that they serve is only small plates, so we got the Crab Rangoon and Thai Fried Chicken to share, which was really good. The Crab Rangoon was crispy and came with 4 different sauces, which were all good. The Thai Fried Chicken was my favorite and was more like boneless wings than fried chicken. It was drenched in a garlic-chili sauce that was really delicious and had a nice kick to it. All in all, I think that Three Dots and a Dash is a great place if you're looking for a fun atmosphere to pregame before a night out or catch up with some friends.  Another thumbs up for LEYE!

I had a party here for 15 people, and while it was the perfect place for a birthday party, I'm giving it three stars because this is the only place I've ever been to where I've ordered Dom Perignon, for $385, and they didn't pop the cork at the table. And I had to constantly keep asking the waitress to go around fill up water, ask people what they needed etc. But in the end for $1200, it was a fun birthday and we got smashed on their strong drinks and ate their delicious food, so I can't complain too much. Plus the ambiance is sooooo fun. Who doesn't like being transported to a tropical local in the dead of a chicago winter, to get trashed on fruity drinks?

The place has real charm, which is weird to say for a bar with a surfer dude set-up. It can get annoyingly crowded and it doesn't seem like the place is well laid out for the amount of people it will hold late nights. Despite that, I've never had an issue ordering a drink. The cocktails are fun, pricy, of course, but they don't cheat you on the alcohol. Fun place for a few people, don't have a party there.

I fell in love with this place months ago when it first opened by simply reading about it. We finally made it in on an ice cold Tuesday night. The entrance is in the alley behind Bub City, don't try to go to Bub City and look for stairs down to the basement, the poor staff members will be confused and you'll look like a dope. The entryway is cool but a little congested, maybe it's because you MUST stop and look at the skulls on the wall and at the private space off to the side, it's pretty spectacular.

The host asked if we had reservations which they do accept since they also serve food but we did not. We were able to snag some awesome seats at the corner of the bar so that we could see everything. The drink menu is cute (I folded one up and stashed in my purse, sorry!). The drinks are split into three categories: traditional, modern, and group drinks. They also have some beer and wine but why would you do that?! Since it was just the two of us, we skipped the group drinks but they did look pretty awesome. I ordered the Bunny's Banana Daiquiri and it was frozen but fabulous, they used an entire banana and it was blended to order. My bf got the Painkiller number 3 and it was also fabulous, with strong pineapple flavor. The gimmick here is that every drink has its own particular glass and design which you can purchase. I do not believe that the drinks are worth $13 each but you are paying for the ambiance and the location at best they are worth $10-11.

This place is super cute and reminded me of a few places I visited in Hawaii last year and it was warm! I'll definitely be back although the service was a little slow (it takes quite a while to make each of these drinks by hand) and the bartender told us it can get crazy on the weekends. I do want to try the food. The food and drinks aren't on the same menu so we weren't able to scope out the menu. The entire story behind three dots is also printed on the back of the menu and is worth a read.

Cute, gimmicky, and fun are the three words I would use to describe 3 dots. Although it won't be my weekly go to spot I've already told all of my friends and family about it.

I vacationed in Chicago for my 23rd birthday with a girl friend. We had never been here before so we did not know what to expect. The wait time is a little bit long to get drinks, but it was totally worth it because the drinks were very festive the waitstaff and bartenders always make sure someone had a menu or anything they needed. If I'm ever in Chicago again, I would love to go back.

Tiki bar..I really wish the bar was closer to the beach as it would truly feel like you are on vacation. I have tried the Painkiller 10 and then the Funkheiser (sp?).

If you are going to grab one of the tables to sit, I would highly reccomend having the pineapple guacamole with the chips. It is easy to secure the table by checking in with the host stand.

Shake a palm tree to dump coconuts on my head, but I must confess to loving a good Tiki bar. I don't know if it's the imaginary feel of the warm, soft air with the scent of the salty sea, or the array of bright-colored cocktails that are reminiscent of snorkeling by a reef-full of tropical fish, or perhaps it's the promise of young love on the beach...

Whatever it is, I've vacationed here on a couple weeknights already, and the next day back at work I've missed the starry nights and wished I was back on vacation. I've tried tasted the fruit of both the Classic and the Modern sides of the menu: the Tropic of Thistle, with its... The Tall as a Tree and Twice as shady, which was... The Poipu Beach Boogie Board, which was a wipe-out because... I guess the drinks are indescribable--you just have to try yours, try your friend's and get another round of something different. My vacation girlfriend and I laughed and flirted as we tried each other's and ordered more.

Back in the day, when Trader Vic's was in the basement of the Palmer House, I used to occasionally meet up with old college pals there and drink mai tai's, enjoying their deliciously unhealthy salty snacks. But this is nothing like that.

For starters, there's the legendary mixologist Paul McGee, whom I didn't realize had left the spectacular Whistler for this venture. I had hoped he would keep both. He's a genius behind the bar, in fact he looked like a mad scientist at The Whistler. He almost looked like he was using a "pipette" (remember high school chemistry?!?) to measure his infused liqueurs into his concoctions. I would never have seen him as a Tiki guy: With his big, bushy beard, he's always looked to me like he was ABD (all but dissertation) from getting his doctorate in philosophy from University of Chicago. Well, if the aloha shirt fits (and it does), wear it.

McGee's drinks are no less fantastic here (though now at downtown prices). And no low-brow salty snacks here: the luau chips with pineapple guacamole are an upscale snack delight. I would have tried others, but alas, the vacation girlfriend is vegetarian.

The first time I was there, we got there by 5:30 and actually got a table; the second was at 6:30 and it was SRO with an hour or more wait. 'Twas a pity. The next time I go, I'll go early again: I want to lounge on the beach, rather than standing on the surfboard poling around.

I love this place and come often. As it may be hard to get in on a Saturday night the line moves fairly quick. Regardless, it's worth the wait...  Every time my husband and I go we meet the best groups of people.... Mainly from out if town too!

It's the first place I love to hit because I know I'm going to get a strong drink and not have to blow money on watered down/cranberried up vodka, tequila, etc. and the bartenders are always so sweet and knowledgable.

Love this place, hands down the best tiki bar in Chi!

Here for halloween stop #1. This place
acts all hip but their restroom staff and bouncers need to calm the fck down. Just cause someone was taking long in the bathroom to change their pad doesnt mean theyre wasted. whack, come party in cali.

What's in a name?  3 Dots and a Crash?  3 Dots and a Gash?  3 Dots and a Sash?  I could go on about how bad the name is but then again, I would do you the disservice of raving about TDD's drinks.  They are quite simply the best you'll find in Chicago.  

Let's face it, every new bar that opens in Chicago is devoted to the temple of the hipster.  You know what I'm talking about -  Negroni's, Dark & Stormy's, Manhattans ad nauseum.  Chicago is awash in Whiskey & Gin joints and it's no fun anymore.  Can those guys in mustaches & tight jeans make a Zombie or a good Mai Tai?  I don't bloody think so.  They're set in their own little worlds for the worst and they'll die a slow death.  We hope!

But look here.  Along comes TDD.  Tiki drinks!  Praise the Lord!  Somebody realized that there were no Tiki bars left in Chicago after Trader Vics closed shop.  Paul McGee to the rescue!  

Tiki torches lead the way down the alley to the underground bar.  Twas a Thursday night, late summer, that my party arrived unannounced.  The place was busy but not too busy to get drinks within 15 minutes of arrival.  The bar is decorated like a Tiki bar should with plenty of Gilligan's Island pieces littered throughout.  The music was a huge turn-off though as hip-hop does not make a tiki bar.  

We ordered a gaggle of tiki drinks and I settled on a Mai Tai and the Jungle Bird.  Both were packed with flavor, nuance and enough intrigue to last a lifetime.  We sat down on one of the couches only to be told they were reserved but we could make a reservation if we so desired so we did.  Within 15 minutes, we were lounging in a booth by ourselves sucking the life out of a skull filled with Zombie punch.  Ah, the wonderful and delicious horror!  These drinks were like Manna from Heaven and I'm not even Jewish!  

My only qualms with the joint are the huge crowds, the bad music and the confined space.  If they had any sense, they'd shut down Bub City upstairs and expand the party up there too.  Only after they removed that ugly Americana and replaced it with some proper Tiki decor.  Are you listening Paul?

Tucked in a  prettier than usual Chicago alley, this tiki lounge is a  pretty nice bar. A little hard to get to but the stores close by were very nice in directing us. They have a great variety of  drinks  served with very unique mugs and dressed up with orchids. Music is very loud and we did have to wait quite long for sitting. There was another small sitting area not as crowded and less noise, I wish we could have sit there!

This place was very underwhelming.  I was excited to check it out since I have heard a lot of positive things.  I went on a weeknight with a reservation, and even though it wasn't crowded I had to wait 15 minutes past my reservation time.  When we finally got seated,  we were sitting next to this group of people that were taking pictures of their drinks non-stop with the flash on (it is a very dark restaurant).  It was extremely obnoxious and distracting.  We had asked them to stop, and they didn't.  It got so annoying that we asked for the check before we finished our drinks and left. Drinks were ok, food was overpriced.  Will most likely not be going back.

Hands down, the best bar in Chicago ... if you come early in the week. From Thursday through Saturday, like any other bar in River North, it's a jumbled madhouse, the well-seasoned bartenders and staff bravely doing their best to corral the rowdy scenesters while offering up well-crafted cocktails. Too many people, too much loud music. Don't be a fool and expect a top-notch experience on the weekends.

If you want the best experience, you can't beat Monday evenings just after they open at 5. Sit at the bar and marvel at the liquid alchemy on display. And don't be shy to strike up a conversation with your bartender, who will be happy to give a mini-lecture on rum styles and may even pour you a sample or two. You can also just sit back quietly and relax in the mellow tropical atmosphere.

The food menu, such as it is, is best viewed as a selection of snacks to tide you over until you go elsewhere for dinner. That said, the crab rangoon and thai fried chicken are truly "mai tai-roe ae," which is Tahitian for "out of this world--the best." Just like Three Dots and a Dash itself.

Make a reservation about a month or 2 in advance, otherwise if you're not there right when it opens or before, you'll be waiting. Great for big groups! Tasted strong but surprisingly didn't do much for me. The appetizers were amazing and you can't go wrong with the banana dolphin one. When you're there, you're going for the atmosphere mostly.

Oooooh I love this place.

Tip: Get here right when it opens or make a reservation. We rolled in right after 5 last Saturday and still had to wait in line for a few minutes.

I love the concept of this place. And I feel kind of like Stefon from SNL reviewing it... Located in a back alley behind bougey taco spot Xoco, this place has EVERYTHING. Tropical terrariums. Waitresses in tailored tropical maxi dresses. Smoking drinks served in shells. A WALL OF SKULLS.

This place for sure hearkens back to the tiki spots of yore (who am I kidding... I don't even remember the 80s). It makes me think of movies like Blue Hawaii or other 60s beach/surfer movies, and it's decorated and set up like a cool lounge from back in the day, without feeling kitschy or dated, which is hard to do (I just wish the tiki theme was carried into the bathrooms! Missed opportunity!).

We were seated on a banquette behind a wall of beads that hung from the ceiling and surrounded the lower booth in front of us. We loved our vantage point and felt way cooler than we actually are. We had the $65 drink served in a skull that came with a burning lime, then had the Demon I believe. Both were good and STRONG, and I love the drink stirrers that accompanied them (the one I took home is a voluptuous diving mermaid).

Service is attentive without being in your face, and the staff are all dressed in well-cut, tasteful tropical print dresses and shirts.

I'll be back for sure... This isn't an everyday spot for me, but when I've got out of town guests like I had last weekend who want to do something special, I'll take them to Three Dots and A Dash.

Went here on Saturday. There was a line to get in which was pretty annoying. We got in, the place is not a big deal as I anticipated. I ordered the Aloha Felicia. The bartender's are nice and on point!! Was fun just watching them make these crazy drinks! My drink was pretty strong and delicious. The place is crowded and We had no where to sit. Overall a nice experience.

Horrible experience.  Me and my wife have been going as regulars since they opened. We went today for the first time in 6 months and it sucked. I understand the drinks are expensive but were worth it. When we went today the bartender made our drinks( I WAS WATCHING) my wifes was made fresh but my jet pilot was premade on tap. Upon tasting both were very bitter and not up to the quality were used to. Very dissapointed  in quality of drinks since the new menu  was added.

5 stars for the tunes playing this past Saturday night.  It's not everyday you can hear 90's-early 00's rap while you pretend you're in Tahiti at the best tiki bar in Chicago!  Warren G and our flaming skull drink made for a fun time!  The flaming skull drink was delicious and we should have ordered another one- more like it's for 1-2 people instead of 2-3 as the menu states.  Or maybe it's because we raced to see who could drink the most.  Either way another fabu evening at 3 dots!

Horrible attention. Bouncer was awefully rude to us (group of almost sober mid thirties adults) And told us to get The effin hell out of there just for asking some questions about why we couldnt seat at an empty table we've been sitting in for Like an hour.

Love love LOVE this place. I've been here many times and have had nothing short of a great experience every time. The vibe is awesome with a dark tiki ambiance which is so fun and totally takes you out of the city for a bit. The drinks are tasty and come in the best tiki glasses I've ever seen. A must check out for sure!

This place was different. I came here to celebrate a friend's birthday. We got totally confused on where the location of this place was, it was in an alley behind another bar. I honestly felt like I had to knock three times and know a password to enter. Upon entrance you immediately feel like you've stepped into a whole new world. Loved the decor. The drinks were yummy but expensive. The food was awesome as well. This is definitely a place I recommend to come with a group to share the drinks and the appetizers. The place was a little dark on the inside, but besides that, I give it a Thumbs up!

Disappointed.
That's the word I've been uttering ever since I finally got to try this place.
After hearing rave reviews from friends, I was really expecting this place to be exceptional. The candle-lit alleyway to get in was alluring and creative. However, after waiting 20+ minutes to get in, I wasn't wow-ed like I was expecting. Sure, it's cute inside, but it's a lot smaller than I had anticipated. Drinks are expensive (but it's River North so what do you expect?) and strong, but not the best tasting. There was barely any room to move around. While I bet it's fun and lively when they have live music, standing around a packed tiny room didn't really make me feel like I was in "paradise."

What a wonderful treat to stumble upon. I love that it is all Tiki and retro, even the cocktails! It is well worth standing. If you don't make reservations, you won't get a table most likely. I didn't care as the atmosphere was worth it! If you like the feel of a retro bar, this place is worth searching out and attending.

The placed looked nice from what I could see in the dim light.. but the two drinks we had not only took forever to get to our table (on a Tuesday night) but also just didn't taste so great.. I would skip this one.

Cozy underground tiki bar with skulls hanging from the ceiling. Very Pirates of the Caribbean. Dishes are great for sharing with friends with strong drinks to wash them down! Plus, the waitresses uniform look las if they just came from Hawaii! Soooo cute!

What a pretentious bunch of pricks.  I came w/ 4 girlfriends on a Saturday night at 8 O'CLOCK. I know for a fact it wasn't crowded or packed in there, but the stupid bouncers still made us wait in line for 20 minutes in 5 degree weather. SERIOUSLY, IT'S 8:00 PM!!! I'll never go back again because I can't stand a-hole bouncers.

This place is a lot of fun!  The drinks are delicious and a tons of fun.  Reasonably priced for as elaborate as the drinks are.  If you want to go on a weekend, make a reservation a few weeks in advance.  During the week, you can just walk in and get a table.

The area is a little cramped and dark.  Music is loud so it's not the best place to go to chat.  Overall, a unique experience!

Fantastic drinks. At first I thought the concept was cheesy. The cocktails though definitely live up to their accolades. Menu is perfect for a light meal. If u have your doubts, try it once & you will not be disappointed. The alley entrance adds to the ambiance. Also a good use of space for Bub City!

If you want to go on a tropical vacation, but can't afford the airfare...make your way to Three Dots and a Dash.  The upscale tiki bar has a cool Hawaiian-esque decor and a very   cool looking menu. The drinks are strong and very tasty.  I did not find the drinks overly syrupy, like I've found with many tiki drinks I've had in the past.  I found the service to be friendly and laid back.  If in the area, this is a place to certainly check out.

Coming here is an adventure. The entrance is in a back alley in downtown, and while it may be obvious where it's located on a weekend when the line stretches down the block, it can be difficult to find on a weekday evening although that's the best time to go since there's no crazy line. My Chicago-native friend led me here with a group and I got to try some amazing drinks. I got a Mai Tai for myself, which was good but in retrospect I should've ordered something more creative. I had the opportunity to try The Saturn and the Tall As A Tree And Twice As Shady, which were both bomb as in crazy amazing. The Jet Pilot was also good but crazy strong. I really want to try everything on their menu eventually. I also aspire to be rich enough to order the treasure chest here one day.

One of my friends said he came here, ordered a drink, and felt duped because the menu showed a cartoon pineapple and his drink came in a ceramic pineapple, but he expected to receive a real pineapple. So realize you will not get your drink served in a real pineapple and you won't be disappointed.
Super cute tiki bar with really creative drinks.

This place has a fun atmosphere, unusual drinks and cool ambiance. You definitely need reservations. The drinks and appetizers were great. We enjoyed the chips and dip and the poopoo platter! Our server was quite attentive, we did have to ask for more water. The prices are high so come with plenty of cash or money in your account.

A tiki retreat is EXACTLY what Chicagoans need to combat this brutal winter. -14 outside? Well in here it's all sunshine and suntan oil. Tropical drinks fit for an island getaway are served in cutely kitchey tiki glasses and after sampling most of the apps they were all surprisingly tasty.

Be prepared to hunt for the door in the alley off of Hubbard. Tiki torches will guide you to the small blue sign on the left side of the alley.

I had a great time and can't wait to go back!

The atmosphere is great. The drinks are expensive, but unique. They use the freshest and most exotic fruits and ingredients. The drinks are awesome. There is not alot of selection for the food and I wouldn't waste time on the food. Stick to the drinks but be ready to pay.

The bar had a nice set up but as nice as it was there was hardly any place to sit because most of the vacant booths were reserved so the bar was crowded with people standing around it. The drinks were okay at best but I will say that the presentation was done well, my first drink was the Three Dots and a Dash Signature.

I loved the starters and the drinks were well worth it.  The music is not too loud and the service was good.  I visited on a Friday after work and it certainly can get packed.  I really liked the atmosphere and friendly patrons.

Reviewing for a weekday night- not weekend, for table service with reservations made at 6:00 p.m. My friend and I arrived and were greeted by a friendly host who took us to our booth table. At this time, it's still pretty empty. We were greeted by a cheerful waitress, who gladly explained the concept of the restaurant, talked about the owner, and her favorites of the food menu, and recommendations on the drink menu. We liked how she explained slowly- not in a rush, and answered our questions with details.

I don't remember the names of our drinks, but my advice is, because there are so many, ask about your favorite type of drink and then get recommendations. I like pina coladas and my friend likes moscow mules, so we went with similarities to those drinks. If you get any food- get the thai chicken, the sweetness melts in your mouth, and the crunch adds the perfect textures, and the 4 different sauces are the perfect pairings with the wings. And the price is decent, but please skip out on the guacamole, it's really small and not tasty. And as great as the lava chips are, they are full of sodium, and my friend couldn't even finish.

Excellent service- this was impressive. But it was because we weren't there on a crazy packed night where you have to wait in line. Our plates were being picked up, we were asked if we wanted anything else, and how everything was. We weren't pressured with anything. It was a relaxing, enjoying time. The drinks are amazing- strong and pretty. I was escaping to Hawaii with every sip I took. When I come back, I want to get the coconut shrimp.

I feel that the problem with people is that they hear of 3 dots and a dash- and make reservations on a busier evening or just wait in line and then because they are mixology type of drinks, it takes forever to get one, and then the bartenders are not in the best mood on top of wait staff.

So I'll definitely come back, but I'll be smart about when and what time I do just like I did this for this visit!

There's not many places in the city that make me feel like a million bucks, but this is definitely one of them. You find the entrance through the tiki torch lined alley off Hubbard.  Enter through the blue door and you're led down into one of the coolest, non-tacky themed bars I have ever been in.

The wait staff was phenomenal and attentive. The drinks are on the high end at $13 a piece, but what you receive is totally worth it. Food was delicious and worked well with the fruity drinks. Props on the restaurant sized bathroom in a bar, great touch.

This is Lettuce Entertain You at its finest and I love the direction they're going with their newer restaurants.

To all the complainers: this is a themed bar in the heart of downtown. It's going to be busy, it's going to be pricey, and it's going to have tourists. Welcome to Chicago!

A swanky, loungey tiki bar.  Strong drinks priced at $13 each.  Banana daiquiri is my favorite--tastes like a smoothie!  Gets crowded, even on random weekdays, so be sure to make reservations if you want a table!
This is one of our favorite places to take out-of-towners. Love the experience of entering here, and the drinks are all so delicious.

I get it. This place has a well-executed concept but the pervasive corporate atmosphere detracts from the authenticity.  They'll make a lot of money but it'll be closed in a year. Typical River North fare.
Even on a Tuesday early evening, place was packed with over an hour wait.  We chose to sit at the bar but still waited about 20 mins for drinks.  Service ended about there.  Crowd was River North yuppies and tourists.

I had no idea what to expect when I stopped by! Two of my friends loved this bar, so we agreed to stop by. Honestly, I was a little put off by the entrance to the bar--it seemed really sketchy and unassuming.

We got there relatively early for a Friday night, so we didn't have to wait in line outside the bar, and we were able to get seating within 40 minutes.

Inside, the bar is really clean and put together (can bars be put together?). The tiki bar theme was pretty clear, but it wasn't tacky.

The drinks were delicious and came in perfectly themed cups with flowers and umbrellas and even a banana dolphin. The drinks themselves were more expensive than what I normally would buy for myself, but combined with the theme and the fun atmosphere, I thought it was worth it for the experience.

I won't waste time trying to describe this place. It is an experience below the street that is totally worth your time. Whether you are visiting from out-of-town or are looking for a spot to impress a date, add this to your "must do" list. The bartenders are friendly, the drinks are strong, and this place is bustling! If you want a seat at the bar, I'd recommend coming before 7pm on a weekend (it fills up fast!!!)
Can't seem to find it? Look for the blue light coming from the alley....

One of my favorite hang out spots in the city. It's hidden away, the entrance is in an alley lit by tiki torches, which I feel adds to the allure. Though one time I was waiting in line in this alley, and a homeless man came up to the girls in line and was bothering them and even spit on the ground in their direction, and the doormen/bouncers did NOTHING. That's the only bad thing about the location of the entrance.

Just a forewarning-- food and drinks are a little pricey but high quality, and you are paying for the ambiance as well, which is unique.. it's beautiful (but DARK). Also, most of the drinks are very strong, so they're really worth the price. I recommend the Painkillers. Off the food menu, I love the coconut shrimp.

The bartenders are extremely talented and the service is usually pretty good for a bar that is often packed Thurs-Sat. I've also had a table here, and the servers here are extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the menu items. Love this place!!!

Great place to get a little saucy before going out on the town. You only need 2 drinks tops. Pro tip: Always get a reservation, especially in winter. If you don't, I do enjoy walking by seeing you freezing in your dress, makes me happy seeing dumb people out there.

Expensive drinks but they are so delicious. Plus you only really need 2 or 3 to have a nice, heavy buzz. The food is really delicious but the portion sizes are more like finger foods. I wish they had entree options but this place is still a great spot.

Fun unique bar that makes you feel like you have escaped into the tropics! The drinks are very tasty and each one has it's own special decoration. I had a banana drink that was made into a dolphin shape.  Also, recommend splurging on the treasure chest if you are with a big group. It's a massive drink made with Dom that is served in a huge treasure chest with dry ice. Quite the presentation!

My friend, Victoria, took me to this place after I came back from Hawaii. The tiki drinks really did remind me of Oahu. They are hella strong, and hella expensive. I like how hidden it is. I wouldn't come here often but I like the ambience. I prefer the sister bar, Lost Lake!

The best place. The location is private and just perfect. Gives you the best feel of paradise. Drinks are great and decently priced and I always check this place out and every time, I am always amazed. If you come on the weekends though, make sure you arrive early.

I love this place! The drinks are delicious and strong but definitely not cheap. On the plus side, you only need a couple. It does get very packed so calling ahead and reserving a table is a must for larger groups. All in all I love this place and will be back!

Not worth the wait! Stood in line for 30+ minutes only to get inside and wait another 30 minutes to just be able to order a drink. Drinks are pretty but all the extra accessories seemed to make the process longer than it needs to be on a Saturday night!
Cute atmosphere! I loved the decor and the theme. The drinks were super strong and hard to drink, they kind of tasted like perfume. Also sort of expensive for casual drinks.

I went here for my birthday and had a blast! The bartender was so nice and loved the cocktails. My roommate and I ordered the PuPu Platter (meant for 3-4 people) and almost finished it. The food on it was SO good! If you have 4 people and are very hungry, I wouldn't order only that.  Very fun and satisfied for my birthday.

Delicious drinks & yummy apps. From a secret Chicago back alley entrance you are transported downstairs to a mysterious tropical tiki wonderland. Banana dolphin in your drink - super cute!! Must try at least once!

One of the coolest bars in Chicago! If you love RUM, you're in the right place! I absolutely love this bar. I pretty much came here every weekend for a good two months when I first moved to Chicago.

Three Dots and a Dash is an underground tiki bar with a wide selection of tropical mixed drinks. All their cocktails are fairly strong and decently priced for the quality. The drinks also come in fun cups, decorated to make you feel like you're in paradise. I've tried many different of their different drinks and have never been disappointed with what I ordered. The food is great also! Small portions/tapas style so order more if you're hungry.

There are also 4 different large drinks that you can order to share with a group! The Zombie Punch, Christmas in July, Planters Punch, and the infamous Treasure Chest. It's an absolute party when the Treasure Chest is brought out - lots of clapping and cheering that can be heard across the bar. The Treasure Chest comes out with dry ice and a bottle of Dom. Order it for your next big celebration if you have $300+ to drop! :)

Disclaimer: It's hard to grab a table so call in early to make table reservations or put your name down for a table when you get there so you won't have to stand around all night with your drink in hand.
Plan ahead if you're getting ready to order another drink. It takes some time. Great drinks. Though pricey, the pours are generous.

Came here shortly after my husband and I got back from our honeymoon to hawaii- and I felt like I was right back there! You have to walk down an alley to get to the door (kind of hidden) and then walk down a stairway covered in skulls until you get to the main area which is completely island themed. A bamboo bar, tiki decor, even the waitresses are wearing hawaiian themed dress. So cute. The drinks are AWESOME, and although they seem easy going down beware- they will hit ya! I've tried a lot of em but my favorite is the Poipu Beach. (Makes sense cause that was my favorite beach in Hawaii). Will def be going back here in the winter, cause when you're inside and sipping one of the cocktails out of a coconut or tiki man you will completely forget about the weather outside.
Have not eaten here but the drinks live up to the hype. The 2 I had were super cool looking and great tasting---not too sweet. awesome place.
Well constructed tropical cocktails, with significant amounts of alcohol. Menu has wide variety of rich and savory items. Sweet, spicy, crispy, and fresh. Awesome tiki bar.

I love this place!  Get here early, or else you'll be in line for a while.  I came here recently around 5pm, when it just opened, and we were in line for 10 minutes.

I don't care for sweet drinks, but some of the less sweet options are great.  My friend went overboard and we ended up with 3 drinks and a beer between the 2 of us.  We had the Jungle Bird, Jet Pilot and a Banana Daiquiri.  The Daiquiri was our favorite -- loved the combination of banana and coconut.  And it wasn't too sweet -- just had the natural sweetness from the banana and coconut.

I love the dark tiki bar ambiance and the crowd is very eclectic. Next time I'll make a reservation to sit at a table, although the bar is pretty fun.

Banana Dolphins. That alone is five stars, but there's more. Very nice atmosphere and outstanding drinks. Each drink is well-crafted both in taste and presentation, including each drink having its own unique glass. I definitely recommend Three Dots.

review.des: Loved this place from the discreet backstreet entrance to the tiki decor and music. The Thai fried chicken was AMAZING, coconut shrimp was delicious and so was the pork buns and crab thingeys (can't remember the name). The ribs and wings weren't too bad (meh) and the spring rolls were delicious although a little too oily. Drinks were strong (great!) and fun. Decor and ambiance also fab, I'd definitely go back.
